Peter Hujars Images of a Bygone Scene
description: The photographers portraits captured a downtown New York that is largely gone now.

title: Build a Winner? Blue Jays Front Office Inherited One
description: DUNEDIN, Fla.  The Toronto Blue Jays announced at the end of August that Mark Shapiro would be their next president and chief executive. A month later they clinched the American League East, and in October they played the first postseason games in Toronto in 22 years.

title: New York Homes Under $500,000
description: Few would dispute the notion that apartments have become over-the-top expensive for many New Yorkers. But just how very far out of reach can still be surprising.

title: Peter Hujar and the Lost New York
description: I like people who think theyre going to have a better time tomorrow, the filmmaker John Waters said. Im not interested in looking backward.

title: Love and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance
description: When I walked into the mechanics shop to pick up my motorcycle, the showroom was gutted. Stray pieces of merchandise clung haphazardly to the walls, fans and dehumidifiers hummed in barren corners, and debris was strewn across the floor, evidence of flooding during the rainiest December in Portland, Ore., on record.

title: Ben Whishaw Makes Himself at Home in New York
description: In the last week of January, Ben Whishaw, the waifish and intense star of London Spy and the 2008 remake of Brideshead Revisited, arrived in New York from London for a six-month stay. Installed in the West Village, for weeks Mr. Whishaw has walked across Manhattan to a work space in the East Village, and for five hours a day rehearsed for his Broadway debut.

title: Boko Haram Falls Victim to a Food Crisis It Created
description: MORA, Cameroon  At first, the attack had all the hallmarks of a typical Boko Haram assault. Armed fighters stormed a town on the border with Nigeria, shooting every man they saw.

title: In the Same Boat
description: Ashley Swiggett and Code Sternal finally connect after traveling parallel paths for so long.

title: From Roommates to Will You Marry Me?
description: In ordinary geometry, two parallel lines on the same plane will never connect, no matter how closely their paths travel. For several years, that appeared to be the fate of Ashley Swiggett and Code Sternal.

title: Jobs Report Shows Brisk U.S. Hiring in February
description: With anxiety about the economy bubbling up on Wall Street and at campaign rallies around the country, the government reported on Friday that employers added 242,000 workers in February, a hefty increase that highlighted the labor markets steady gains.

title: Student Question | What Do You Think of Donald Trump?
description: As Nicholas Kristof writes in his Op-Ed column this week: This is the most astonishing presidential election since at least 1968, at the height of the Vietnam War. The G.O.P. front-runner is reviled not only by Democrats, but also by many prominent Republicans, and has less government experience than any president in history.

title: Q. and A. With Tina Fey: Live From Kabul, Its a Feminist Comedy
description: In her new film Whiskey Tango Foxtrot, Tina Fey plays a TV reporter named Kim Baker, on her first international assignment in Kabul. Based on the memoir The Taliban Shuffle by the journalist Kim Barker, its a MASH-style dark comedy with a rowdy feminist bent.

title: Tibetan in India Dies Days After Setting Himself on Fire to Protest China
description: NEW DELHI  A 16-year-old Tibetan student living in India has died three days after setting himself on fire to protest Chinese rule in Tibet, a hospital official said on Friday.

title: Making a Case for Eating Fat
description: For years Dr. Mark Hyman was a vegetarian who kept his intake of dietary fat to a minimum. Whole-wheat bread, grains, beans, pasta and fruits and vegetables made up the bulk of his diet, just as the federal governments dietary guidelines had long recommended.

title: Morning Agenda: AMC to Buy Carmike Cinemas in $1.1 Billion Deal
description: AMC TO BUY CARMIKE CINEMAS IN $1.1 BILLION DEAL | AMC Entertainment would create the largest movie theater chain in the United States with its purchase of Carmike Cinemas,  Michael J. de la Merced and Michael Cieply write in DealBook. AMC, whose controlling investor is Wang Jianlin of Chinas Dalian Wanda Group, said Thursday that it will pay $737 million in cash, or $30 a share, up 19 percent from Carmikes closing price on Thursday. Including the assumption of Carmikes debt, the transaction is valued at about $1.1 billion, which is the biggest deal by AMC since it returned to the public markets in a 2013 stock sale, Mr. de la Merced and Mr. Cieply report.

title: Loewe: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Jonathan Anderson presents his fall looks.

title: Annoyed by a Hands-Off Boss
description: Send your workplace conundrums to workologist@nytimes.com, including your name and contact information (even if you want it withheld for publication). The Workologist is a guy with well-intentioned opinions, not a professional career adviser. Letters may be edited.

title: Theodore Roosevelt Is Enlisted for Some Symbolic Work in Guantnamo Bay Fight
description: It did not go unnoticed among congressional Republicans that President Obama delivered his latest proposal for closing the Guantnamo Bay detention center standing before a portrait of Theodore Roosevelt in his incarnation as a Rough Rider in Cuba during the Spanish-American War.

title: Brazils Ex-Leader, Luiz Incio Lula da Silva, Is Held and His Home Raided
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The colossal graft scandal surrounding Brazils national oil company engulfed the countrys most prominent political figure on Friday, former President Luiz Incio Lula da Silva, as the police raided his home and took him into custody.

title: 2 Italian Hostages of ISIS in Libya Are Freed, but 2 Others Are Feared Dead
description: CAIRO  Two Italian hostages have been freed from Islamic State captivity in Libya, but two others, who had been captured at the same time, have most likely been killed, Italian officials said on Friday.

title: Chalayan: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Mr. Chalayan, who dissolved a dress on the runway last season, presents his fall collection.

title: As Chinas 2 Sessions Convene in Beijing, Delegates Are Wary
description: BEIJING  To many people around the world, Chinese politics can seem murky, even treacherous. To people in China, it is hardly different.

title: The 2.2.16 Issue
description: RE: N.Y.P.D.

title: How to Tell Someone Youre Terminally Ill
description: I say, The doctors told me there is nothing they can do, it is inoperable and incurable, says Wanda N., who is 50 and in hospice care at home in New York with metastasized colon cancer. When I tell people, I use the same words the doctors used to tell me. You might not have time or energy to formulate the exact right phrasing  but you are not obliged to be the town crier, spreading the news of a terminal diagnosis. Dont feel the need to announce your situation over and over again, says Wanda, who has told only a handful of people, including her father, a cousin and a few women from her Army veterans group. Some she told in person, others by phone or text.

title: That Belfast Spirit
description: Every March, as St. Patricks Day approaches and Yeats and stout and the Undertones and other Irish matters are on my mind, I recall a conversation I often have. A friend is about to go to Ireland for the first time and asks me for recommendations. Inevitably, the first thing I say is: Dont skip the North.

title: An Old Wound in Syria
description: Normally on Land Day, I would not have gone to school. In Syria, where I grew up, they usually let Syrian-Palestinians march to remember the day, March 30, 1976, when Israeli forces killed six Palestinians and wounded at least 100 who had been protesting Israels expropriation of Palestinian land. But when I was 15, the government banned the commemoration.

title: If Super Tuesday Voting Pattern Continues, Donald Trump Will Reach Delegate Target
description: Donald Trump did not amass a majority of delegates on Super Tuesday. But he could soon.

description: The music and the outfits in Dizin are louder than they were a generation ago. But the state still keeps a not-so-subtle watch over the slopes.

title: A Heated Debate Along a Growing Republican Divide
description: So thats what a civil war looks like on a debate stage. For two hours in Detroit, Donald J. Trump and the three men who want to stop him from getting the Republican nomination battled over his pronouncements on foreign policy, his business record and his past views on overseas wars.

description: Our latest roundup of articles about young people that have appeared in The Times includes news about changes to the SAT that constitute one of the most substantial redesigns of the test ever.

description: GENEVA  The top human rights official at the United Nations warned the United States authorities on Friday that their efforts to force Apple to unlock an iPhone belonging to a gunman risked helping authoritarian governments and jeopardizing the security of millions around the world.

title: Evangelists Adapt to a New Era, Preaching the Gospel to Skeptics
description: When Craig Ellis was growing up, he picked up the sort of adventure book meant for a boy looking to serve God. The book, Shadow of the Almighty, told the story of Jim Elliot, a young American evangelist killed while doing mission work in Ecuador.

title: Poor Sleep Gives You the Munchies, Study Says
description: Evidence has suggested for some time that sleep deprivation can lead to obesity, among a host of other ills. Now researchers are digging into the mechanisms that cause our sleep-deprived brains to crave food they do not need.

title: Q. and A.: How Chinas National Peoples Congress Works
description: HONG KONG  The annual session of Chinas legislature, the National Peoples Congress, is a carefully crafted pageant intended to convey the image of a transparent, responsive government. While the congress is often dismissed as a rubber stamp, it can provide important clues to the governments priorities.

title: A Once-Obscure Designer Is Now the Talk of Paris
description: PARIS  Five months ago, Vetements was in the last flush of its whisper phase, calling its crowds to a dingy Chinese restaurant in part of the Belleville neighborhood of Paris to see what the constant chatter and the infrequently glimpsed logo were all about.

title: Facebook, in Accounting Change, Could Pay Millions More in British Taxes
description: Facebook moved to change its relationship status with the British tax authorities on Friday.

title: Dior on the Red Carpet
description: Many celebrities have worn Dior creations at awards ceremonies and other high-profile events around the world.

title: Warriors, Beware: Great Teams Dont Always Win Ultimate Prize
description: As the Golden State Warriors continue to win, the conversation has shifted. It seems to be a given that they are the best team in the N.B.A.; the debate is whether they will surpass the 1995-96 Chicago Bulls, who were 72-10, as the best N.B.A. team ever.

description: ISTANBUL  Two Syrian men were sentenced to more than four years in prison on Friday for the death of a young Syrian boy whose body washed up on a beach in Turkey in September.

title: Hybrid Long-Term Care Policies Provide Cash and Leave Some Behind
description: Theres a good reason to have long-term care coverage in your wealth management plan. If you need to go to a nursing home, it can cost more than $90,000 a year for a private room, according to a survey by Genworth Financial, an insurance company. The costs, especially for longer stays because of Alzheimers disease, can deplete your estate.

description: Nature and outer space were themes on the runway at Paco Rabanne, where models wore wild but delicate earrings that looked like feathers dipped in gold.

description: For many artists, building castles in the sky would be a fair way to describe retirement planning.

title: For Several Generations, the Sports Road Trip as a Staple of Fandom
description: Michael Martocci, 54, and Barry Liben, 61, were huge New York Giants fans growing up, but had always been satisfied watching away Giants games on TV, despite being in the travel business together.

title: Inquiry Into Germanys 2006 World Cup Bid Finds No Indication of Vote Buying
description: BERLIN  A team of legal advisers investigating a suspicious payment linked to Germanys successful bid to host the 2006 World Cup found no indication that votes were bought, but it did not rule out the possibility of corruption because it could not establish who ultimately received the money, according to a report released on Friday.

title: Shinzo Abe and Okinawas Governor to Resume Talks on U.S. Base
description: TOKYO  Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan and the leader of the southern island Okinawa agreed on Friday to take a dispute over the future of a United States military base out of the courts and back to the negotiating table.

title: House of Cards: 5 Things to Remember Before Watching Season 4
description: The third season of House of Cards ended practically in midsentence, with President Frank Underwood calling after his wife, Claire, as she walked out of the White House and, seemingly, away from their marriage and political partnership.

title: The Tragedy of a Hall of Fame Coach and His Star Recruit
description: DALLAS  Word that Keith Frazier, who played on one of the best college teams you will not see this postseason, had dropped out barely registered beyond the confines of Dallas.

description: Mitt Romney on Friday put to rest speculation that he would be open to rescuing the Republican Party by wresting the presidential nomination away from Donald J. Trump at the convention this summer.

title: Outspoken, American and a Woman: Afghanistans Only Foreign Litigator Stands Out
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  HAMSTRUNG by student loans and dismayed at her meager prospects for repaying them, Kimberley Chongyon Motley left the long hours and low pay of the Milwaukee public defenders office in 2008 for the long-shot promise of Afghanistan.

title: Hulk Hogans Suit Over Sex Tape May Test Limits of Online Press Freedom
description: The details are tawdry all around: explicit video footage of Hulk Hogan having sex with the wife of a friend, taped without his knowledge and, years later, posted online by the popular website Gawker along with gleeful commentary.

title: The Mitt-Hawley Fallacy
description: There was so much wrong with Mitt Romneys Trump-is-a-disaster-whom-I-will-support-in-the-general speech that it may seem odd to call him out for bad international macroeconomics. But this is a pet peeve of mine, in an area where I really, truly know what Im talking about. So here goes.

title: How Much More Can the Labor Force Grow?
description: WASHINGTON  The immediate headlines out of the latest jobs numbers  that growth was solid and the unemployment rate unchanged in February  would seem to be not terribly exciting. But theres some great news beneath the surface: Americans are returning to the work force in the largest numbers in many years.

title: Legal Briefs Flood in to Support Apple
description: The arguments differed, but the main message was the same: We side with Apple.

title: A Spirited Bar Crawl in Belfast
description: Belfast pubs pop up from time to time in the work of Ciaran Carson, one of the citys greatest writers and chroniclers. In the taut, tense poem Last Orders, from his remarkable 1989 collection Belfast Confetti, Carson writes about a bar where you never know for sure whos who, or what/Youre walking into, and how simple it would be for someone/Like ourselves to walk in and blow the whole place, and ourselves, to Kingdom Come. Its a chilling expression of the uncertainty and fear endured by the people of Belfast during the worst of times.

title: At M.I.T., Science Embraces a New Chaos Theory: Art
description: As a graduate student at the respected M.I.T. Media Lab, Marcelo Coelho collaborated with the artist Vik Muniz to help him achieve a poetic and technical feat that teases the imagination: drawing a picture of a castle on a single grain of sand. After two years of failed experiments with various lasers, they finally began getting images of beautiful complexity using an electron microscope with a focused ion beam to etch superfine lineswhen it didnt pulverize the grains altogether. The tiny etchings could then be scanned and printed large scale.

title: What I Love | Jessica Hecht
description: A star of the Broadway revival of Fiddler on the Roof, the actress lives with her husband, Adam Bernstein and their two children in Midtown.

title: Jessica Hecht, a Star of Fiddler on the Roof, at Home
description: Jessica Hechts secret vice  although it isnt much of a vice and now, of course, it will no longer be a secret  involves standing at the kitchen window of her Midtown co-op and checking in on the strangers who live across the street.

title: Retirees Win Lengthy Pension Fight With Rencos Ira Rennert
description: A group of retirees whose pensions were cut three years ago have won a lengthy battle with the multibillionaire Ira Rennert, a mining industrialist, onetime junkbond king and owner of a Hamptons mega-mansion.

title: Krishna Devotees Look to Provide for This Life
description: For Roger Siegel, the last half-century has been the proverbial long, strange trip. It started in New York, where, as an idealistic college dropout in the early 1960s, he tutored Harlem schoolchildren. It included civil rights marches in Alabama and peyote hikes in the Nevada hills.

title: 3 Men Charged With Hate Crimes in Attack on Hispanics in California
description: Three white men accused of attacking a group of Hispanics in a Los Angeles County park on Sunday were charged with hate crimes this week, the authorities said.

title: Joshua Reeves of Gusto: Directing Without Dictating
description: This interview with Joshua Reeves, C.E.O. and co-founder of Gusto, an online payroll, benefits and workers compensation firm, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: 1966: Ghana Cuts Ties With Guinea
description: ACCRA  The new military government of Ghana today [March 4] broke diplomatic relations with Guinea, whose president has proclaimed deposed Ghanaian President Kwame Nkrumah his equal. The break came as the new regime of Gen. Joseph Ankrah gained the formal recognition of the United States, Britain and several African nations.

title: Investigation Opened Into Ford F-150 After Brake Failure Reports
description: Federal regulators are investigating reports of brake failure that may affect about 420,000 Ford F-150 pickup trucks.

title: Quantifying Aspirins Reduction in Cancer Risk
description: Many people take a daily low-dose aspirin to lower the risk of heart disease, and several studies have shown that regular aspirin use reduces the risk for some cancers. Now a long-term analysis has found that its population-wide benefits against cancer may be even greater than previously believed.

title: Paper Bank Statements May Surpass Digital for Some Customers
description: DESPITE a push by financial institutions to switch customers to digital statements from paper, the traditional hard-copy version may work better for some people, a new report finds.

title: 1941: Mrs. Roosevelts Request
description: Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt revealed yesterday that her mail at the White House has averaged 800 letters a day during the last winter. Most of these contain appeals for help or advice from persons in trouble of one kind or another, Mrs. Roosevelt told 3,000 members of the womens division of the United New York Appeal for Joint Distribution Committee and National Refugee Service, at the opening rally of their annual drive yesterday morning at the Hotel Commodore.

title: In Fledgling Exchange-Traded Fund, Striking a Blow for Women
description: State Street Global Advisors will introduce its 159th exchange-traded fund on Tuesday, the SPDR Gender Diversity Index E.T.F. Fortunately, the funds ticker symbol is catchier: SHE.

title: 36 Hours in Austin, Texas
description: Beyond the SXSW festival, theres classic barbecue, contemporary art and even a beer garden on a working ranch.

title: Conor McGregor and Holly Holm Matched With Second Choices
description: The Ultimate Fighting Championship has two of its biggest new stars in action on Saturday in Las Vegas. Unfortunately, neither will be in the fights everyone was hoping for.

title: Syrian Protesters Take to Streets as Airstrikes Ease
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Street protests erupted across insurgent-held areas of Syria on Friday, as demonstrators took advantage of the relative lull in airstrikes during a partial truce, coming out in the largest numbers in years to declare that even after five punishing years of war they still wanted political change.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: As Economy Slows, Experts Call on China to Drop Growth Target
description: BEIJING  Every March, China releases a closely watched growth target for the year, a number that looms large for the worlds economists, executives and policy makers. But a growing number of those experts are now calling for China to stop setting that goal, saying the target actually harms the economy and encourages officials to falsify data.

title: Serbia Dissolves Parliament and Calls Early Elections
description: LONDON  Serbias president dissolved Parliament and called early elections on Friday, after the government said it needed a new mandate to pursue the difficult economic changes that it deems essential for the country to join the European Union.

title: The Strong Man and the Weak Party
description: Having disagreed with him a bit earlier this week on matters Trump-related, let me recommendMatt Continettis reaction to watching Donald Trump during last nights grotesque fiasco of a debate:

title: Circus Elephants of New York, Vanishing
description: A look back at 70 years of circus elephant photographs as the Ringling Bros. elephants get set for their last New York City show this weekend.

title: House of Cards Season 4, Episode 1: Is Claire Out of the Woods?
description: The fourth season of House of Cards begins with the presidential primaries still in progress, a backdrop that could overshadow these 13 episodes or make them feel extra-relevant. As over-the-top as House of Cards can be, its still hard for it to compete with the insanity of the current primary season.

title: Home Sales Around the New York Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Shopping Guide: Lounge Chairs
description: Whether theyre striking and sculptural or merely comfortable, they influence the personality of a room. But how do you know you've found the right one?

title: Paris Fashion Week: Balmain and Vetements in Pictures
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2016 collections that were presented Thursday.

title: At Rick Owens, An Otherworldly  and Personal  Collection
description: The designer dubbed his fall/winter 2016 collection Mastodon, referencing the extinct, elephant-like species of the Ice Age.

title: Dior: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Lucie Meier and Serge Ruffieux present their first ready-to-wear collection for this house.

title: Airbnb Hires First Director of Diversity
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Airbnb hired David J. King III as its first director of diversity, part of a broader move by technology companies to build more inclusive work forces.

title: Two Studies Strengthen Links Between the Zika Virus and Serious Birth Defects
description: The Zika virus damages many fetuses carried by infected and symptomatic mothers, regardless of when in pregnancy the infection occurs, according to a small but frightening study released on Friday by Brazilian and American researchers.

title: My 10 Favorite Books: Larry Kramer
description: For his bookshop and website One Grand Books, the editor Aaron Hicklin asked people to name the 10 books theyd take with them if they were marooned on a desert island. The next in the series is the playwright, author and activist Larry Kramer, who shares his list exclusively with T. (One Grand currently has an installation at the Shinola store in Palo Alto featuring the recommendations of Alice Waters, Bret Easton Ellis, Lena Dunham and Gia Coppola.)

title: Tax Tips for Those Who Make Money in the Gig Economy
description: Since losing her job in advertising during the financial crisis, Dina Scherer has spent her days helping women cultivate their own personal styles  finding flattering color palettes, editing closets and taking customers on shopping excursions.

title: Snapshot of Brazils Web of Scandal
description: The former president of Brazil, Luiz Incio Lula da Silva, was taken into custody by the Brazilian police on Friday for questioning as part of an investigation into a colossal graft scheme. The raid on Mr. da Silvas house was the latest development in the expanding political and economic turmoil in Brazil.

title: A Touch of Europe on 14th Street
description: To find design inspiration for his new condominium building, dOrsay, the developer Matthew Adell didnt have to look far. His office is just steps from the NoMad Hotel, designed by the Parisian architect Jacques Garcia, which he found enchanting.

title: Quite a Garage Sale: 11 Highlights From the Bob Dylan Archive
description: For decades, Bob Dylan has offered up glimpses of himself with the Bootleg series of outtakes and demos. But until now, nobody knew exactly what the Bob Dylan Archive held: more than 6,000 items from Mr. Dylans personal collection, almost none of which have been seen publicly before. The material, which is still being sorted through by specialists, is being transferred to Tulsa, Okla., where it will be cataloged, digitized and displayed. The New York Times previewed the collection and identified some of the items Dylanologists will find most exciting and illuminating:

title: Silicon Valley Has Not Saved Us From a Productivity Slowdown
description: American middle class wages havent been rising as rapidly as they once were, and a slowdown in productivity growth is probably an important cause.

title: Police Test Knife Reportedly Found on Property Once Owned by O.J. Simpson
description: LOS ANGELES  The Mezzaluna restaurant where Nicole Brown Simpson had her last meal is now a Peets Coffee & Tea. The condo complex where she and her friend Ronald L. Goldman were slashed to death has been remodeled. The Brentwood mansion where O. J. Simpson lived  and where the police chased him down in his white Bronco in 1994 as the public watched on television  has been demolished.

title: Bernie Baby Died of SIDS, Family Says
description: An infant who rose to fame on social media as the Bernie Baby after his mother took him to a Bernie Sanders rally dressed up as the Democratic candidate, complete with oversize glasses and a wild white wig, died on Feb. 25 at 4 months, his family said.

title: Wangy Transforms at Dior
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall/Winter 2016 Fashion Week in Paris.

title: Accara Offers a Taste of Senegal in Fried Form
description: Not far from the Place des Vosges in Paris, on a side street called the Rue Elzvir, there is a restaurant called Le Petit Dakar. Its where I first tasted thieboudienne, the soul-warming national dish of Senegal, a rich, spicy and deeply flavored mix of rice, vegetables and fish. I loved the complexity of the dish and the atmosphere of the place. It made me want to hop the next plane to Dakar.

title: Iditarod Sled Dog Race Lacks Snow, So Alaska Ships Some In
description: As mushers and their dogs prepare for the Iditarod sled dog race, the fabled trek through Alaskas wilderness, a warm winter has once again robbed the starting line of an important ingredient: snow.

title: Rick Owens on Fast Fashion, His Physical Connection to Clothes  and More
description: The designer Rick Owens is no stranger to iconoclastic fashion shows, but his fall/winter 2016 collection, presented yesterday in Paris, made one of his biggest, most personal statements to date. For this collection, entitled Mastodon, Owens was thinking a lot about the bigger picture, specifically evolution, uneasiness with regards to the changing environment, even our own extinction  and coming to terms with it all. He spoke with T backstage before the show.

title: Rick Owens Designs for the End of Days; Dior and Lanvin Soldier On
description: PARIS  It was sheer coincidence that Rick Owens, an American in Paris, staged his Mastodon show, named for an extinct species, the same night as the Republican debate in Detroit, where Senators Marco Rubio and Ted Cruz were characterized by this newspaper as fighting for their political lives. It was a fluke of timing that Mr. Owens subtitled the show after a Salvador Dal painting (Swans Reflecting Elephants) at a moment when most observers, including those at the side of the runway, feel they are living through a surreal time. And it was just happenstance that he was looking at embracing the inevitable end of a cycle just as issues of the decline of the republic were on everyones minds.

title: Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump Circling Each Other in Michigan
description: The presidential race began to shift in earnest to the industrial Midwest on Friday, with pivotal contests looming in Michigan, Ohio and Illinois, and Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton crossing each others paths in a preview of what the general election could hold.

title: Russell Simmons Backs Hillary Clinton for President
description: The hip-hop music magnate Russell Simmons endorsed Hillary Clinton for president on Friday, saying she is a practical progressive he trusts while criticizing Senator Bernie Sanders as overstating what he can deliver to underserved communities.

title: Documents in the Garrett Phillips Case
description: Annotated depositions, search warrants and police reports give a close look at the day Garrett was murdered and how investigators built their case against Oral Nicholas Hillary.

title: A National Descent Into Trumps Pants
description: The Republican debate on Fox News on Thursday night was an argument over whose was bigger. Whose lies. Whose poll numbers. Whose ... wherever.

title: Soccer Player's Statement
description: Jacob Duff told police that he had never had a meeting scheduled with Mr. Hillary on the day of the murder.

title: Donald Trump Cancels Appearance Before Conservative Group
description: Donald J. Trump abruptly pulled out of a heavily hyped speaking slot on Saturday at the Conservative Political Action Conference in Maryland, saying he will instead visit Kansas, a caucus state in which Senator Ted Cruz is expected to perform well in voting that day.

title: Deposition of Lt. Mark Murray
description: The lead investigator explained his history with the case, and why he believed Mr. Hillary was guilty.

title: A Troubling Timeline at Valeant
description: As one surprising announcement after another has unspooled in recent months at Valeant Pharmaceuticals International, its shareholders may well have thought they were watching Abbott and Costello performing the comedy skit Whos on First?

title: Judge Says Army Cant Require Special Testing of Sikh Officer
description: The Army cannot single out a captain who is Sikh for special testing to decide whether his hair, turban and beard interfere with the fit and functioning of his helmet and gas mask, a federal judge has ruled.

title: Oakland District at Heart of Drive to Transform Urban Schools
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The 70 teachers who showed up to a school board meeting here recently in matching green and black T-shirts paraded in a circle, chanting, Charter schools are not public schools! and accusing the superintendent of doing the bidding of a corporate oligarchy.

title: Police Timeline in Garrett Phillips Case
description: A timeline of events leading up to murder of Garrett Phillips, compiled by the police.

title: The War Within the Republican Party
description: To the Editor:

title: Report From First Responder
description: An account of what the first police officer on the scene saw, and heard, when he arrived at Garrett's apartment.

title: Deposition of Ex-Police Chief
description: Edward F. Tischler, the former police chief, explained his history with the case.

title: A Plan Worth Its Salt
description: A few years ago the Los Angeles County Health Department, in conjunction with a separate initiative taken by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, issued a series of videos warning of the stealth capacities of salt, which can lurk in seemingly innocuous foods and do harm. One of the Salt Shocker videos, as they were called, examined the problem using cottage cheese, a mere half-cup of which contains 450 milligrams of sodium. What if you ate a cup of cottage cheese for breakfast? You would be consuming about 40 percent of your prescribed allotment of sodium for the day  most dietary guidelines recommend no more than 2,300 milligrams  forcing you to conduct a rigorous cost-benefit analysis of the ham sandwich you brought for lunch.

title: Louise Rennison, Who Wrote Adolescent Novels With a Personal Touch, Dies at 64
description: Louise Rennison, whose best-selling young-adult novels, starting with Angus, Thongs and Full-Frontal Snogging, explore the joys and pains of adolescence, died on Monday in Brighton, England. She was 64.

title: Search Warrant for Hillary's Home
description: A search warrant that has become the subject of a civil suit against Potsdam, N.Y., and its police force.

title: Apartment Manager's Statement to Police
description: Richard Dumas recalled discovering Garrett's body and telling his mother that her son had been hurt.

title: In Milan, Luxury With a Sophisticated Pedigree
description: From 250 euros ($275).

title: Incident Report in Garrett Phillips Case
description: The official report filed by the Potsdam police regarding the discovery of Garrett's body.

title: Hillary's Complaint Against Jones
description: Mr. Hillary filed a complaint against Deputy John Jones regarding harassment over a woman they had both dated: Garrett's mother.

title: A Miami Restaurant Where the Show Rivals the Food
description: Do you salsa or merengue? the emcee at El Tucn, a supper club in Miami, asked the dolled-up crowd one Saturday night, during its inaugural weekend last October. Me either, she said, winking. This band will get you there.

title: Search Warrant Application
description: An outline of the case against Mr. Hillary, including his relationship with the victim, a disputed meeting and an alleged limp.

title: Why Romney Asked Republicans to Vote for Rubio. And Cruz. And Kasich.
description: Mitt Romney asked Republicans to support multiple candidates in remaining primary and caucus states, an admission that a brokered convention is now the most likely route to block Donald J. Trump from the nomination.

title: The Daily Bag: Chlo
description: A 70s spirit was in the air at Chlo, but the accessories were refreshingly simple, like this bohemian-but-spare shoulder satchel in butterscotch leather.

title: Architect of Pipeline Company Merger Said to Be Its Foe
description: In late January, about 40 Wall Street financiers packed into a private dining room at III Forks Steakhouse in Houston for an update on the troubled multibillion-dollar merger of the pipeline companies Energy Transfer Equity and the Williams Companies.

title: Devising a Tax Strategy After the Paycheck Is No More
description: This tax season was the first in which Charlie Clark, 64, filed his return with his newly attained status: retiree.

title: Vegetarian Bowls Spiked With Vibrant Asian Flavors
description: Lukas Volger is a vegetarian cookbook author I have long admired, ever since he reversed my veggie burger cynicism with his 2010 cookbook, Veggie Burgers Every Which Way. He is a master at creating attractive vegetarian and vegan meals that are put together with a light hand but that fill you up.

title: Big Ticket | 240 Riverside Boulevard
description: The most expensive sale of the week in New York was a penthouse on the Upper West Side.

title: River and Park Vistas for $15.5 Million
description: A full-floor aerie on the 30th floor of the Heritage at Trump Place on the Upper West Side, with ample outdoor space and far-reaching river, park and cityscape vistas, sold for $15,500,000 and was the most expensive closed sale of the week, according to city records.

title: Storming the Court, a Cherished Rite, Can Be a Danger
description: As the storm approached, Randy Peterson, a longtime sportswriter for The Des Moines Register, packed up his gear and prepared to make his getaway.

title: Turkey Seizes Newspaper, Zaman, as Press Crackdown Continues
description: ISTANBUL  Backed by a court order, the Turkish authorities moved on Friday to seize Zaman, the countrys most widely circulated newspaper, in the latest crackdown by the government of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on freedom of the press.

title: Public Editor Margaret Sullivan on the State of Journalism; Mark Thompson on Digital Publishing
description: Over the past week, New York Times reporters, columnists and executives participated in interviews about their coverage and other top news stories. Below are highlights from television and radio.

title: For Older Borrowers, Being Thrifty Can Tarnish a Credit Score
description: John M. George, 63, the retired owner of a small oil-field service company, never had much need for credit. With assets now worth $4 million, he paid cash for his cars; bought his successive houses with small loans from relatives, the seller or a local bank; and had just one credit card, which he used for occasional airplane tickets or business needs and always paid off promptly. He paid off his most recent home loan in 2003.

title: President Erdogans Thin Skin
description: Like other authoritarian leaders, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey has made it a point to show his people whos boss. He has waged war on the Kurdish separatists, imprisoned critics, taken control of much of the media, cowed the military and convinced a preponderance of his people that he is indispensable.

title: Donald Trump on Why He Defended the Size of His Hands (and More)
description: So, just why did Donald J. Trump decide to delve into the matter of his anatomy on the debate stage Thursday night?

title: On Eve of Retirement, Savings for Medical Costs Can Fall Short
description: William Seavey, 69, does not fret about paying future medical expenses. He and his wife, Eleanor, are healthy. And they both have Medicare and Medigap policies, which can help pay many health costs. So they have not put any money aside in a medical savings account.

title: Threes a Trend: Suits With Sexy Underpinnings
description: New plays on classic suiting have been popping up all over the runways this season, in a variety of forms: Designers have patchworked different fabrics into single garments; played with volume and silhouette; and styled the items with unexpected, provocative underpinnings. Glenn Martens at Y/Project (right) sent down an oversize, mens wear-inspired tweed coat over a matching tweed cutout bustier. At center, Anthony Vaccarellos version of the trend was a roomy suit sexed up with a boudoir corset. And yesterday at Paco Rabanne (left), Julien Dossena showed a bra-baring silk top that draped around the torso under a tailored jacket.

title: Visit the Scene of the Shooting
description: Watch the virtual-reality film about the killing of a Mexican teenager by a U.S. agent firing through the border fence by downloading NYT VR, The Timess virtual-reality app for iPhone and Android.

title: Battle of Versailles Relives 1973 Win for American Fashion
description: The Battle of Versailles, the 1973 showdown between five French design houses (Yves Saint Laurent, Hubert de Givenchy, Emanuel Ungaro, Pierre Cardin and Christian Dior) and their American counterparts (Halston, Oscar de la Renta, Bill Blass, Stephen Burrows and Anne Klein), which is credited with putting American fashion on the international map, has long been a topic of fascination for the style world.

title: Review: Tennessee Williamss Late-Career Curiosities
description: Tennessee Williams had been in precarious shape for years by the time he died in February 1983: drinking too much, abusing prescription drugs, alienating those who loved him most. His career was correspondingly unwell. But he hadnt stopped writing. And since his death, at 71, every last scrap has been potential fodder for the stage. A certain skepticism might be apt, then, at news of a double bill of Williams one-acts written in 1982.

title: Davis Cup Matches on Grass Should Have Been on Hardcourts
description: As the Australians and the Americans continued their first-round Davis Cup match on grass at historic Kooyong Stadium in Melbourne, tennis officials confirmed Friday that the matches should have been played on a hardcourt surface.

title: Why Trading in Retirement Is a Bad Idea
description: You have a significant retirement portfolio, its yours to manage and you have time on your hands. Youre a smart person and youre sure you can beat the market  or at least do better than a boring basket of mutual funds and income investments.

title: The Elegance of Utilitarian Fashion
description: The new look, with abundant pockets, sporty zippers and generous silhouettes, favors both form and function.

title: Movers Who Help Their Customers Stay at Home
Marketers Take Second Look at Over-50 Consumers
description: Brent Bouchez opened Agency Five0 six years ago in New York as an advertising firm specializing in marketing to baby boomers, on the assumption that companies would need to tune their messages differently as the last of the boomers headed into their 50s.

title: Republican Debate Draws 16.9 Million Viewers to Fox News
description: Fox News drew the highest ratings for a Republican debate since December with 16.9 million viewers tuning in Thursday night.

title: Metro Bank Raises $564 Million Ahead of London Listing
description: LONDON  Metro Bank, the money-losing lender started by the American financier Vernon W. Hill II, said on Friday that it had raised 400 million pounds, or about $564 million, in a private sale of securities before going public next week.

title: Minimizing Risks of Renting Your Home
description: Try as one might to vet tenants, the sharing economy involves risks. You should ask tenants why they will be renting, who will live in your home, whether they have pets and what they do for a living. Here are some of the lessons for homeowners based on our experiences as landlords and tenants.

title: Companies Wanting to Limit Risk Are Outsourcing Pension Administration
description: The hard work and long hours you have put in for your employer may have earned you a decent pension. But it may not be your employer who owes you the money.

description: The Hulk Hogan sex tape case is one of several high-profile suits in which the line between news and privacy has been blurred.

description: Oh, yes, theyre just politicians. This is how they think, and this is who they are. And thats why Donald Trump is killing them.

title: Think Like a Doctor: Hurting All Over Solved
description: On Thursday, we challenged Well readers to figure out the case of a 36-year-old man with a 20-year history of migrating joint pains along with other strange symptoms. Nearly 300 of you offered thoughtful suggestions of what he might have had. And one out of 10 of you were spot on.

title: Jenrry Mejia Says Baseball Officials Orchestrated His Lifetime Ban
description: Jenrry Mejia, the Mets pitcher who was permanently barred from baseball after three failed doping tests, says that he was the victim of a witch hunt by Major League Baseball and that the players union did not properly advocate on his behalf.

description: In a technical move that could be viewed as a prerequisite to announcing an independent bid for the presidency, former Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs personal website was recently transferred to an independent web server  away from servers run by his company.

title: Gunmen Kill 16 at Nursing Home in Yemen Started by Mother Teresa
description: AL MUKALLA, Yemen  A nursing home founded by Mother Teresa and run by Christian nuns in the southern Yemeni city of Aden was transformed into an execution ground on Friday, when four gunmen tied up at least 16 people inside and killed them, officials said.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are in the Sutton area; Cobble Hill, Brooklyn; and on the Upper East Side.

title: NCIS at 300: The 5 Most Compelling Episodes
description: On March 15, the CBS crime procedural NCIS will air its 300th episode. As I write in my look back at 13 years of the series, reaching that number is a rare feat, and its usually a fairly circumspect type of show that does it. But while it might be easy to think of NCIS as comfort food, it is deeper and more ambitious than most people realize. Here are my nominations as the five most compelling NCIS episodes  ones that went unexpected places or showed especially deft writing and acting. (You can watch them all on CBSs subscription streaming service, CBS All Access; the shows first 12 seasons are also currently on Netflix.) Agree? Disagree? What episodes really got your attention? Offer up your choices in the comments section.

title: NCIS: Meat and Potatoes TV, but Still Popular
description: For a prime-time, scripted American television series to reach 300 episodes is a towering achievement. Fewer than 20 have done it. Yet attaining that milestone also practically guarantees a certain amount of disdain from the type of TV watcher who wants to project coolness. Lassie. Bonanza. Law & Order. My Three Sons. Square shows all, each in the 300 club.

description: To the Editor:

title: More Support for Early Exposure to Peanuts to Prevent Allergies
description: LOS ANGELES  Evidence is accumulating that food allergies in children might be prevented by feeding peanuts and other allergenic food to infants in their first year of life, researchers reported here Friday.

title: Bud Collins, Who Covered Tennis With Authority and Flash, Dies at 86
description: Bud Collins, the passionate, often irreverent face of tennis for nearly half a century in his Wimbledon broadcasts and his newspaper and magazine columns, died on Friday at his home in Brookline, Mass. He was 86.

title: A Sandals Name Has Dolce & Gabbana Under Fire Again
description: PARIS  The Italian designers of Dolce & Gabbana are no strangers to scandal. After inflammatory comments about gay adoption and accusations of racial stereotyping on the runway last year, the latest apparent misstep by the duo came this week, after the brand listed a pair of $2,395 shoes on its website as slave sandals with pompoms and set in motion a social media firestorm.

title: At Dior, Dramatic Lips and Clumpy Mascara
description: Its all about contradictions, said Diors makeup director, Peter Philips, about the look he created for the houses fall/winter 2016 show today. This seasons collection mixed prints with patterns  so Philips said he wanted the makeup to reflect a similar attitude. The look he had in mind, he said, was really sophisticated, with intense, almost dangerous lips on this beautiful, even, alabaster skin, and rebellious clumpy lashes.

description: Even President Donald J. Trump would follow the law.

title: Paying Employees to Lose Weight
description: IF your employer offered you $550 to lose weight, an amount that would be deducted from your health insurance premiums next year, would that provide the motivation to help you finally shed those pounds?

title: Woolly Mullein: The City Cactus
description: The seed-packed woody stalk of the common or woolly mullein stands out this time of year like an urban saguaro. Once covered with pale green leaves and flowers as yellow as summer, it is now leafless, coarse and bleached, anchored in the poor soil it prefers.

title: House of Cards Season 4, Episode 2: State of the Union
description: Before delving into the secret donations and the breast-cancer-clinic chess match that dominates this episode, lets take a moment and bow down before the glory that is Ellen Burstyn.

title: 2 Who Helped Expose Flint Water Crisis Win PEN Awards
description: Two women who sounded early and persistent alarms about the quality of the water in Flint, Mich., will receive the Freedom of Expression Courage Award from PEN America, the group announced on Friday.

title: T Toasts Marie-Amlie Sauv With a Dinner in Paris
description: There were plenty of reasons to celebrate last night in Paris: Were nearing the end of a fashion month thats seen lots of excitement; our spring mens style issue hits newsstands inside The Times this Sunday, March 6; and two weeks ago, T announced the appointment of Marie-Amlie Sauv as our new fashion director. Last night, Ts editor in chief, Deborah Needleman, hosted a dinner to welcome and honor her at Le Grand Vfour, the storied Beaux-Arts establishment  and oldest continually operating restaurant in Paris  where Napoleon and Josephine used to rendezvous. Friends and supporters including Charlotte Rampling, Alber Elbaz, Christian Louboutin, Shayne Oliver, Nicolas Ghesquire, Liya Kebede and many others enjoyed lobster, Champagne and conversation  well into the Parisian night.

title: T Celebrates Marie-Amlie Sauv
description: Editor in chief Deborah Needleman hosted a dinner last night at Le Grand Vfour in Paris to honor our new fashion director.

title: The Return of Joe Bataan, the Boogaloo King
description: Joe Bataan was bouncing around behind his keyboard onstage at the B. B. King Blues Club in Times Square, turning to cue his 14-piece band and clearly enjoying himself. It was a good crowd for a Wednesday night, and the dancers were getting after it, so he was mixing in a dose of mambo with his signature doo-wop-tinged Latin soul songs like Subway Joe and Ordinary Guy. Between numbers he pointed out friends in the crowd, including a man he introduced as Lindy from the Dragons, a comrade from Mr. Bataans wild days running with New York street gangs in the 1950s.

title: Big Man on a Global Campus
description: At a meet-and-greet reception for faculty members in early January, Andrew Hamilton, New York Universitys energetic new president, told a jokey story on the theme of how warmly he had been welcomed to the city.

title: Rupert Murdoch and Jerry Hall Marry in London
description: Rupert Murdoch, the executive chairman of News Corporation, and the former model Jerry Hall were married on Friday at a centuries-old mansion in central London, weeks after announcing their engagement.

title: Ben Carson Ends His Once-Promising Presidential Bid
description: Ben Carson suspended his presidential campaign on Friday, ending an upstart bid that began with promise before fizzling out.

title: A Minimalist Architects Surprisingly Vibrant Tuscan Home
description: As the architect for Pradas stores, Roberto Baciocchi created an elegant, clean-lined aesthetic. But in his own house, idiosyncrasy reigns.

title: Can Labor Still Turn Out the Vote?
description: ON Labor Day in 1960, John F. Kennedy kicked off the final push of his presidential campaign in Cadillac Square in Detroit with a rousing speech to thousands of United Auto Workers members. It was a nod to the immense clout of organized labor.

title: At Home With Roberto Baciocchi
description: As the architect for Pradas stores, Roberto Baciocchi created an elegant, clean-lined aesthetic. But at home in Tuscany, idiosyncrasy reigns.

title: An Overseas Education of Our Own
description: When our only child started college in September, my husband and I embarked on our own semester abroad.

title: The Unofficial Capital of the World
description: Luckily New York lost out to a Southern swamp in 1790 in the race to become the nations capital city, sparing it the suffocating embrace of officialdom.

title: This Is Trump Country
description: Here is a closer look at a few of the places where Donald J. Trump won big on Super Tuesday

title: Derby-Caliber Gelding Has Connections Dreaming of the Preakness Instead
description: Jason Servis watched with pride when John, his brother and fellow thoroughbred trainer, sent Smarty Jones to victories in the Kentucky Derby and the Preakness Stakes in 2004. But his joy turned to sadness when the long-shot Birdstone upset Smarty Joness Triple Crown bid by one length in the Belmont Stakes. Sadness turned to dismay when the colt never ran again.

title: 4 Overtimes; 3 Buzzer-Beaters: Minnesota High School Basketball Game Brings the Drama
description: It was the greatest game ever played.

title: AMC Move to Buy Carmike Is a Sensible One for Wang Jianlin
description: The latest deal from Chinas richest man is unexpectedly logical.

title: Marco Rubio Detests Donald Trump  but Hell Still Vote for Him
description: Senator Marco Rubio of Florida, who has called Donald J. Trump a con artist, a faux conservative and a failed businessman with an aura of success that is as phony as his tan, insisted Friday that he would vote for Mr. Trump if he became the Republican nominee.

title: Far From Ireland, a Taste of Home in the Bronx
description: Prime Cuts Irish Butchers caters to an Irish enclave in the Woodlawn section of the Bronx with boiling bacon, rashers and soda bread.

title: Rolling Brogues and Boiling Bacon at Prime Cuts Irish Butchers
description: Shamrocks, Irish flags and Kelly-green awnings line Katonah Avenue in the Woodlawn section of the Bronx. The neighborhood isnt dressed up for St. Patricks Day, though. This area has been the first stop for many Irish immigrants for decades, and many have stuck around.

title: E.U. Presses for Accord With Turkey to Ease Flow of Migrants
description: BRUSSELS  Leaders of the European Union are aiming to push Turkey closer to an agreement on Monday intended to make the flow of migrants to the Continent more orderly and relieve the fast-growing humanitarian crisis in Greece.

title: Its My Birthday! Is That O.K.?
description: Hey everybody!

title: Hot on the Trail of a Celebrity Cat
description: A reporter combs the streets of Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn, in pursuit of an almost-famous feline.

title: The Cat-Mayor of Carroll Gardens
description: Until he was 10 years old, Petro lived the life of an ordinary house cat.

title: Mets Jacob deGrom Reluctantly Accepts $607,000 Salary for 2016
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  The Mets quietly sent out a news release Friday morning regarding some financial housekeeping. Each year, teams assign salaries to players who have not played in the major leagues long enough to be eligible for arbitration; most of the time, the player and the team reach an agreement on salary, but in some instances, they do not.

title: Emanuel Ungaro: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Fausto Puglisi presents his fall collection.

title: The Future of Grizzly Bears
description: The 1973 Endangered Species Act, a landmark environmental measure much detested by developers and other commercial interests, is credited with saving the bald eagle, the peregrine falcon, the American alligator and the gray wolf, among other species.If the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service has its way, the grizzly bears in the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem will soon join that company of once-close-to-extinction creatures that no longer needed the acts protection. On Thursday, the service proposed to remove grizzlies in the Yellowstone region  meaning the national park, and the states of Idaho, Montana and Wyoming  from the endangered species list, whose protections the bears have enjoyed since 1975.

title: Man Convicted of Killing 3 Brooklyn Merchants Gets 75 Years in Prison
description: A traveling clothing salesman was sentenced on Friday to 75 years to life in prison for killing three merchants in Brooklyn in a series of attacks that had shopkeepers on alert for months, prosecutors said.

title: The Way Things Work
description: ANY MAN-MADE SYSTEM risks becoming so insular it is rendered nonsensical for those outside it. The complexities, anachronisms and demands of the current fashion system almost read like a cautionary tale. Fashion is more democratic and more popular than ever before, and yet the industrys problems can be summed up by the simple fact that you cant buy a swimsuit in summer or a heavy coat in winter.

title: Mets Longtime Drill Sergeant Keeps Everything in Line at Camp
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  As another spring training workout day came to a close, a group of Mets pitchers gathered on a remote field for one last round of pitchers fielding practice, or P.F.P.s, as they are called. The players knelt in a semicircle on the infield as instructed, and a coach began hitting hard, chopping ground balls toward their chests.

title: Review: La Otra Orilla and Its Flamenco Bizarro
description: Forget about a dress with an enchantingly long ruffle. How about a flamenco dancer who looks like she stepped out of a J. Crew catalog in a blue striped top and slim navy pants? That, apparently, signals innovation. (Or, as you may be thinking, the exact opposite.)

title: 3 Top Officials Leaving Coney Island Hospital After Patients Death
description: Gisele Soto was in agony.

title: Supreme Court Blocks Louisiana Abortion Law
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Friday temporarily blocked a Louisiana law that its opponents say would leave the state with only one abortion clinic. The court gave no reasons, though it did say that its order was consistent with one last June that blocked part of a Texas abortion law.

title: Time With the Tribe
description: For Dr. Paul Frank, the director of the Fifth Avenue Dermatology Surgery & Laser Center at 86th Street in Manhattan, weekends mean meditation, fitness and plenty of family time.

title: How Paul Jarrod Frank, a Cosmetic Dermatologist, Spends His Sundays
description: Dr. Paul Jarrod Frank is the director of the Fifth Avenue Dermatology Surgery & Laser Center at 86th Street in Manhattan. Each year he performs over 300 surgeries, including liposuction, and over 1,000 noninvasive procedures, making him somewhat of a celebrity among certain sculpted New Yorkers. Dr. Frank, a 46-year-old dermatologist, grew up on the Upper East Side of Manhattan and attended the Horace Mann School. In his youth, his favorite place to hang out on Friday nights was the steps of the Met. Its where I had my first kiss and my first drink, he said. Dr. Frank lives on East 102nd Street with his wife, Diana, 44, a photographer, and their two children, Aidan, 10, and Avery, 8. Both attend his alma mater. ALIX STRAUSS

title: Undercover: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Jun Takahashis latest designs.

title: California Gas Leak Threatens Jerry Browns Image as a Climate Change Hero
description: LOS ANGELES  In his final term as Californias governor, Jerry Brown has made the battle against climate change a signature issue: He is fighting to vastly reduce the states emissions of greenhouse gases, to accelerate the move to electric cars and to rewire the states electrical grid. In December, he had a star turn with world leaders at the United Nations climate change conference in Paris.

title: Noted Pianist Piotr Anderszewski Takes a Break From His Career
description: The superb Polish pianist Piotr Anderszewski does not want to become a 200-concert-per-year performing machine, as he said in a recent interview with the website Humans of New York. The constant pressure and high expectations make it difficult for an artist to have fun, experiment and stay in your dreams, he explained.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Pictures of the Day: Brazil and Elsewhere
description: Brazil and More  Photos of the Day

title: March 4, 2016  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Brazil, Greece, Syria and France.

title: Review: At Kishuya, Some Noodles to Go With That Drink
description: Some noodle places try to be distinctive by including sushi, tempura or yakitori selections with the featured item. Kishuya in Hartsdale has added a happy hour, with a banner in its window proclaiming ramen and izakaya, which is sort of a Japanese version of a small tavern.

title: Heres Hoping Earth Imagery Isnt Too Routine to Inspire
description: Much has been written about the remarkable achievements of NASA astronaut Scott Kelly and his Russian counterpart, cosmonaut Mikhail Kornienko, during their (340-day) Year in Space mission aboard the International Space Station.Daniel Victor hada fine overview on Tuesday and make sure to revisit Kenneth Changs fascinating package on Kelly and the long mission, in which, as he notes, Kelly and Kornienko experienced 10,880 sunrises* and sunsets in those 340 days.

title: Review: At INC, a Menu of Conversation Starters
description: After our first visit to INC American Bar & Kitchen in New Brunswick, my wife asked whether I had noticed that we had not received any bread while waiting for our appetizers.

title: Review: At Fish on Main, a World of Difference
description: Ayhan Hassan has gone upscale with his newest venture, Fish on Main. In 1980, Mr. Hassan opened his first restaurant, Ayhans Shish-Kebab, in Port Washington. He now owns five Shish-Kebabs in Nassau County.

title: The Road Not Taken to Better Jobs and Higher Pay
description: There is less to the February employment report than meets the eye.

title: Friday Night Music: Lucius, Dusty Trails
description: Theyve been getting ever more attention; on Colbert earlier this week. But this was the video I was waiting for: a lovely, acoustic version of this song. Goosebumps at 2:45:

title: U.S. Pays to Feed and Shelter Cuban Migrants Stranded in Costa Rica
description: MIAMI  The United States government has been paying to feed and shelter thousands of Cubans trying to migrate to the United States, in what critics consider another sign of the lopsided treatment provided to Cubans under American law.

title: A Dress That Moves  With a Life of Its Own
description: For the designer Hussein Chalayan, technology is an essential part of designing a collection. Its evident in the way he carefully describes his ideas for his performative runway shows  but also in the way he explains his process.For me, it always starts with the idea and the piece Im making. The way its presented comes after, he says. (Today, Chalayan showed his fall/winter 2016 collection in Paris, which was full of dresses and blouses printed with technical drawings.)

title: Review: At Vespa, Italian Authenticity With a Contemporary Vroom
description: Vespa in Italian means wasp or hornet, both of which suggest a buzz. Certainly a buzz exists at the newish Vespa restaurant in Westport, with its stylish dcor, farm-to-table cuisine and genial atmosphere. And, at least when I visited, there wasnt a single Vespa, an Italian motor scooter, parked outside.

title: Yohji Yamamoto: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Mr. Yamamoto, who just opened a retrospective in New York, debuts his fall collection.

title: Vinyl Looks (and Listens) for Authenticity in Its Tunes
description: On the most recent episode of the new HBO drama Vinyl  a Mad Men for the 1970s record industry created by Terence Winter, Martin Scorsese, Mick Jagger and Rich Cohen  the fictional proto-punk band Nasty Bits gets its big break in front of label executives eager to find a fresh sound.

title: Paris Fashion Weeks Best-Kept Secret
description: Until recently, Paris had been devoid of food delivery services, much less gluten-free and dairy-free options. But the luxury sector executive Isabella Capece Galeota has introduced a solution  which coincides with the French capitals fashion week. She and her husband, Xavier Barroux, decided to soft-launch their Maisie Caf ahead of its official May opening near Place Vendme to bring healthy snack alternatives to the show-going masses. The menu includes fresh coconut-water-based, cold-pressed juices; three types of shakes (banana, avocado and espresso); a cucumber detox; and chocolate or fruit granolas. By Capece Galeotas count, theyve already distributed several hundred M/M-branded bottles, which bodes well for such an endeavor in a gastronomic epicenter. Here, people will not eat or drink something because its good for them  you have the added pressure of making it taste good, as well, she says. This is the capital of gourmet food, so you have to make gourmet juices.

title: Ben Carson's Path to the Exit
description: Ben Carson formally announced on Friday that he was ending his Republican presidential campaign. Here are some of the most emblematic moments of his bid, from debate mishaps and interview gaffes to campaign shake-ups.

title: Bill Cunningham | Art Rules
description: Young artists challenged the status quo with their installations in the defunct post office at Moynihan Station, and the New York art establishment mingled at the Armory Show on the Hudson Piers.

title: Its Not a Reading, Its Literary Cabaret
description: When Amanda Foreman and Lucas Wittmann founded House of SpeakEasy, the organization behind their literary cabaret series, Seriously Entertaining, they wanted to break from the format of typical bookstore readings and hark back to the performative styles of authors like Dickens and Twain.

title: Migrant Crisis Alters E.U. Calculations for Greece as Its Debt Struggle Continues
description: ATHENS  When Greeces debt crisis threatened to sink the European Unions single currency last summer, the rest of Europe, led by Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, ganged up to deliver the Greek government a stern message: Overcome your domestic political problems and do what is necessary to hold the Continent together.

title: Restoring a Music Rooms Grandeur at the Rosen House
description: On Feb. 16, 1946, about 60 people witnessed the first concert with tickets at what would become the Caramoor Center for Music and the Arts in Katonah. They did so in comfort befitting the ornate setting, seated in plush velvet chairs facing the stage in the grandly appointed music room of the treasure-filled home now known as the Rosen House.

title: Review: New York Philharmonic Dives Into Brahmss German Requiem
description: The New York Philharmonics program this week could hardly be simpler or more moving. It consists of a single hourlong choral work by Brahms, Ein Deutsches Requiem (A German Requiem), exquisitely prepared and performed.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing: Donald Trump, O.J. Simpson, Syria
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: In Ropes, a High-Wire Act of Brotherly Bonding
description: Ever since Cain and Abel, many stories have been told about brothers who do not get along. A variation on this eternal theme is currently being presented by the Two River Theater in Red Bank in the United States premiere of Ropes.

title: Embracing Art to Escape the Holocausts Shadow
description: Ruth Jacobsen, 83, a collage artist, and Judith Leiber, 95, a handbag designer, built creative careers after enduring Nazi repression.

title: 2 Holocaust Survivors Turn to Art to Reclaim Lost Lives
description: The collage artist Ruth Jacobsen, 83, and the handbag designer Judith Leiber, 95, both Holocaust survivors, have relied on the creative process and a strong-willed entrepreneurial spirit to reclaim their lives and break glass ceilings for women in the United States.

title: Bill Cunningham | Art Rules
description: March 1: While the political world had everyone in a tizzy, the New York art world exploded last week with fairs, exhibitions and a new museum. One fair was the Spring/Break Art Show in the main post office on Eighth Avenue and 31st Street. The art installations had a youthful exuberance. More than 7,000 attended the opening festivities.

title: Review: 2 Sisters Navigate 100 Years of Black History in Having Our Say
description: Dont call them old maids. Dont call them African-Americans. Sadie and Bessie Delany, holding forth at Long Wharf Theater in Emily Manns Tony-nominated 1995 play, Having Our Say: The Delany Sisters First 100 Years, are very particular about things, whether the exact placement of a spotlessly white cutwork tablecloth, the precise thickness of an orange slice for ambrosia, or the careful arrangement of sparkling goblets and candlesticks. And when you have lived past the century mark, you are entitled to have things just as you want them. And husbands were not among the things they wanted. They were too smart, too independent for most men, Bessie says.

title: Bill Cunninghams Evening Hours
description: Mr. Cunningham covers events in March.

title: Review: The Minnesota Orchestras White Light and White Heat
description: A few years ago, Osmo Vanska and his Minnesota Orchestra experienced a bitter inversion of the old maxim. How do you not get to Carnegie Hall? Lockout, lockout, lockout.

title: Review: Neal Brennan 3 MICS Comes at Comedy From Several Directions
description: Neal Brennans three-cornered show at the Lynn Redgrave Theater doesnt quite add up to a play; its more like listening to a decent comedy album while eavesdropping on someones therapy sessions. Think of it as an effort to present in stage form the dichotomy that many comics have written or talked about over the years: that humor is how they deal with personal pain.

title: Regina King Has So Many Stories to Tell
description: LOS ANGELES  Regina Kings house has a cozy seat at the foot of a hill in a section of the Los Feliz neighborhood here. The house isnt far from the street but fosters an aura of secluded serenity anyway: A grapefruit tree guards the property. Off the rear patio is a small room with a vintage Pac-Man console and a signed LP of Princes Controversy on the wall.

title: Your Evening Briefing.
description: Your Evening Briefing.

title: Donald Trump Is Spending Nearly $2 Million on TV Ads
description: Donald J. Trump is dropping close to $1 million apiece in Ohio and Florida for television ads, two people tracking media spending said, in a signal that the sustained advertising assault against him is taking a toll.

title: Art Gone to Hell: A Boschian Bestiary
description: Most of Hieronymus Boschs surviving paintings are now on display in his hometown. Heres a guide to a few of them.

title: For Hieronymus Bosch, One Helluva Homecoming
description: S-HERTOGENBOSCH, the Netherlands  Hieronymus Bosch died 500 years ago, his soul dispatched to parts unknown  perhaps oblivion, perhaps heavenly peace, perhaps a hellscape of his own invention. His reputation, however, resides in earthly paradise, with two blockbuster exhibitions this year, drawing tens of thousands to admire his slavering, fluttering, waddling abominations.

title: As Olympics Near and Zika Spreads, No Talk of a Plan B
description: How confident is Scott Blackmun, the chief executive of the United States Olympic Committee, that the Zika virus will not ruin the Rio Summer Olympics or render them unsafe for athletes, workers and spectators?

title: Your Back Pages: Readers Share Dylan Memories
description: This week, we published an article about the new Bob Dylan Archive in Tulsa, Okla. The lyrics, letters, photographs and other ephemera among the more than 6,000 items in the archive represent decades of American history. Arguably just as important as Mr. Dylans items are the memories carried by generations of fans. So we asked readers to share something from their own personal Dylan archives: the vinyl copy of Blonde on Blonde that survived moves, marriages and children; the ticket stub that conjures mental images of an inspiring performance; the bootlegged recording from the show.

title: She Wanted to Do Her Research. He Wanted to Talk Feelings.
description: Honolulu  OVER the past two decades as a professor, Ive grown thousands of plants, studying how their biology shifts in response to our changing environment. Soon Ill begin to design and build my fourth laboratory; Ill teach classes and take on more staff members, as I do every year. Like all professors, I also do a lot of extra jobs for which I was never trained, such as advising former students as they navigate the wider world. Last year, after one of my most talented students left to start her next adventure, she would text me now and then: This is such a great place, I am learning so much here and I know this is where I am supposed to be.

title: Bravo Zulu: On (Representative) Ryan Zinke
description: Welcome to Social Capital, a series devoted to analyzing the social-media presences of celebrities.

title: Email Regarding Tom Donilon
description: This email, released by the State Department, was sent to Hillary Clinton's private server, which she used while she was secretary of state. The correspondence is full of tongue-in-cheek remarks concerning the overlapping trips to Israel of national security adviser, Thomas E. Donilon, and Mrs. Clinton.

title: Agency Rivalries and Satire Show Up in Latest of Hillary Clintons Emails
description: WASHINGTON  Reviewing Hillary Clintons emails for public release has strained the State Departments lawyers, set off bitter turf battles between the department and other agencies, and ignited a contentious debate over the nature and handling of classified information.

title: Steven Ballmer, Clippers Top Fan, Is Really Invested in Them (for Billions)
description: LOS ANGELES  During the first timeout, a few minutes into Wednesdays game between the Los Angeles Clippers and the Oklahoma City Thunder at Staples Center here, Steven A. Ballmer looked up from his courtside seat at the fans still filtering in. There are still some empty seats, he said.

title: Rikers Island Cases Are Focus for New Bronx District Attorney
description: The new Bronx district attorney, Darcel D. Clark, oversees the prosecution of crime in a dozen police precincts and scores of neighborhoods.

title: Fed Proposes New Rule Capping Business Between Banks
description: One of the problems with big Wall Street banks in 2008 was that they had too many of their financial eggs in one basket.

title: William & Mary Seeks an Elusive Berth
description: Russell Turner was a part of not one but two teams that became the first in their programs histories to make an N.C.A.A. tournament. As a player, he was a freshman on the Hampden-Sydney team that made its first Division III tournament in 1989. Now, as the coach of U.C. Irvine, he hopes to lead the Anteaters to a second consecutive berth in the Division I tournament after last seasons team earned the first invitation in program history.

title: Connecticut Rock Pile Known as Negro Heads May Get a New Name
description: BRANFORD, Conn.  It may be dwarfed by Denali, the 20,308-foot peak in Alaska long known as Mount McKinley. But the mussel-covered pile of rocks about a mile off shore from this briny town on the Long Island Sound is at the center of a naming debate of its own, one fueled by what many consider the ugliness of the label it carries: Negro Heads.

title: Obstacles for Global Talent in National Womens Hockey League
description: During a trip to Juniors restaurant in early February, Nana Fujimoto sat against a wall decorated with Brooklyn Dodgers memorabilia, savoring a slice of cheesecake while discussing her journey from Sapporo, Japan, to the National Womens Hockey League.

title: At RSA Conference, Unlikely Allies Address Value of Digital Security
description: SAN FRANCISCO  To Amit Yoran, a digital security veteran, the fight between Apple and the F.B.I. over access to an iPhone can be viewed in black-and-white terms: What law enforcement authorities want is so misguided, they simply boggle the mind.

title: Rev. Robert Palladino, Scribe Who Shaped Apples Fonts, Dies at 83
description: Because of a Trappist monk, Apple computer displays look the way they do today.

title: Distant, Tropical Isle Is Home Court for the French in a Davis Cup Match
description: BAIE-MAHAULT, Guadeloupe  It seems fantastic that four of the worlds best tennis players would descend upon a small Caribbean island more than 4,000 miles from home to take the first step toward their elusive Davis Cup.

title: Harvard Law to Abandon Crest Linked to Slavery
description: Harvard Law School is poised to abandon an 80-year-old shield based on the crest of a slaveholding family that helped endow the institution, as campuses across the country debate the use of historic names and symbols that some consider offensive.

title: Trumps Softened Stance on Visas Alarms Some Immigration Critics
description: Amid the sparring and free-flying insults of Thursday nights Republican presidential debate, Donald J. Trump said he wanted to expand the number of visas available for highly skilled immigrants.

title: Toxic Passaic River to Get $1.38 Billion Cleanup Over 10 Years
description: NEWARK  The Passaic River was once the backbone of an industrial corridor, snaking through this stretch of northern New Jersey and sustaining the factories and plants that cropped up alongside it. But now, the rivers banks are dotted by deserted manufacturing sites while the waterway remains scarred after decades as a dumping ground for industrial pollutants that linger in the water and have seeped into the soil.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: They need food. They need to eat. Theyre stealing everything.

title: Ted Cruz Promoted Himself and Conservative Causes as Texas Solicitor General
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  From its start in 1999, the office of the solicitor general of Texas was run by a plain-spoken Mormon, a by-the-books lawyer known for mentoring young attorneys and defending the state, whatever the political consequences.

title: Spains Socialist Leader Loses Another Vote to Become Prime Minister
description: MADRID  The leader of the Socialist party, Pedro Snchez, on Friday lost another parliamentary vote in his bid to become prime minister, prolonging the deadlock in Spanish politics.

title: Hillary Clinton to Join Bernie Sanders at Fox News Town Hall on Monday
description: Hillary Clinton will join Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont at a town hall event hosted by Fox News on Monday night in Detroit, the network announced.

title: Clinton Offers Economic Plan Focused on Jobs
description: In an election year defined by angry populism, Hillary Clinton made an optimistic economic pitch on Friday, presenting a wide-ranging plan for job growth that would provide incentives for corporations that invest in employees and strip tax benefits from companies that move jobs overseas.

title: Review: Independent Fair Is More Conventional, but Still Eye-Catching
description: The Independent art fair, which runs through Sunday, began as a more provocative alternative to the bigger art fairs. Now in its seventh year, it isnt quite so independent anymore.
