There are two iterations in New York  one in November and the one now in TriBeCa  as well as one in Brussels, which opens next month.

title: Rank and File Republicans Tell Party Elites: Were Sticking With Donald Trump
description: From Michigan to Louisiana to California on Friday, rank-and-file Republicans expressed mystification, dismissal and contempt over the instructions that their partys most high-profile leaders were urgently handing down to them: Reject and defeat Donald J. Trump.

title: Stream of Protesters Turns Donald Trump Rally Into Wild Evening
description: NEW ORLEANS  An almost constant stream of protesters interrupted Donald J. Trumps nighttime rally here Friday, often resisting removal and dropping to the ground as security personnel tried to hustle them from the event.

title: The Right to Sue the Gun Industry
description: The world recoiled in horror in 2012 when 20 Connecticut schoolchildren and six adults were killed at Sandy Hook Elementary School by a deranged teenager using a military-style assault rifle to fire 154 rounds in less than five minutes. The weapon was a Bushmaster AR-15 semiautomatic rifle adapted from its original role as a battlefield weapon. The AR-15, which is designed to inflict maximum casualties with rapid bursts, should never have been available for purchase by civilians.

title: Breuer Building Expands the Imagination, and the Budget, of the Met
description: Taking on the Breuer building is a big deal even for a behemoth like the Metropolitan Museum of Art, with an annual operating budget of $370 million.

title: A $15 Minimum Wage for New York
description: The lowest-wage workers in New York could soon get a much-needed raise  if the stingy Republicans who control the State Senate dont block it.

title: Three More Judges Said to Be Vetted for Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama is vetting Merrick B. Garland and Sri Srinivasan, federal appellate judges who have enjoyed substantial support from Republicans in the past, as potential nominees for a Supreme Court vacancy that has set off a brutal election-year fight.

title: Syrias Shaky Respite
description: Syrians desperate for normalcy after nearly five blood-soaked years of war have slowly begun testing the cease-fire that took effect a week ago. They are planting potatoes in the garden, going to the market and playing in the street, resuming cherished everyday routines that have been cruelly disrupted.

title: Scott Kelly Says a Year in Orbit Felt Like Forever
description: After nearly a year in space, Scott Kelly, the NASA astronaut who returned to Earth this week, is clear on one thing: It was a long trip.

title: Phil Mickelson Loses Grip on His Game, and Then the Lead
description: DORAL, Fla.  Phil Mickelson was his vintage self on Friday, a thrill ride filled with imagination and anticipation that anything was still possible. At 45, he is the oldest player in the Cadillac Championship field. He was leading by two strokes at midround when he inexplicably lost his momentum and golfs next generation of stars blew past him like a rogue wind.

title: Ralph Baruch, Who Shaped Viacoms Rise, Dies at 92
description: Ralph M. Baruch, a refugee from Nazi Germany who turned Viacom, a small cable and syndication company that CBS spun off in 1971, into a communications and entertainment giant, died on Thursday at his home in Manhattan. He was 92.

title: Pale Yellow
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Roland Huget is back, and he says below that he might have filled his puzzle differently these days, compared with how he filled it when it was submitted. Thats reasonable. We all evolve over time. And at least Mr. Huget can claim to be the guy who first introduced BARE IT ALL in The New York Times crossword.

title: Judge Reduces Mans Wrongful Conviction Award to $12 Million
description: A judge who had previously thrown out a jurys award to a New York City man who was wrongly convicted of rape and imprisoned for over 20 years ruled on Friday that the judgment should be reduced by more than $6 million.

title: Blame HUD for Americas Lead Epidemic
description: Chicago  SINCE news first emerged last year about dangerously high levels of lead in the drinking water in Flint, Mich., it has become shockingly clear that that city is far from alone. Reports of lead poisoning are on the rise across the country, from New York to Ohio and Iowa, particularly among low-income and minority children.

title: Chinese Premiers Annual Work Report
description: Prime Minister Li Keqiang of China delivered his government's annual work report to the National Peoples Congress, the national legislature, on Saturday. Here is a transcript of his speech.

title: Abortion Witch Hunt
description: LAST month, Representative Marsha Blackburn, Republican of Tennessee, in her capacity as chairwoman of the newly created House Select Investigative Panel on Infant Lives, issued subpoenas to three organizations: StemExpress, a company that supplies biological specimens for research; the University of New Mexico, where scientists conduct medical research using fetal tissue; and Southwestern Womens Options, an abortion clinic in Albuquerque.

title: How Irans Reformists Found Their Center
description: FOR decades, Irans politics have centered on a contest of visions that pitted democratic reformists against hard-line theocrats. Under President Hassan Rouhani, that binary has begun to give way. Last weeks elections showcased a coordinated movement toward the center of Irans political spectrum.

title: Chinas National Peoples Congress: Key Points
description: BEIJING  The Chinese government laid out its priorities for the year on Saturday, when Prime Minister Li Keqiang gave his annual state-of-the-nation report to the legislature, the National Peoples Congress. Here are highlights from that report and other government documents released at the legislative meeting in the Great Hall of the People.

title: Judge Seals Harper Lees Will From Publics Scrutiny
description: MONROEVILLE, Ala.  In death, as in life, Harper Lee appears to have opted for privacy, as a lawyer for the estate of the To Kill a Mockingbird author asked this week that her will be sealed from the public.

title: Carmelo Anthony Misses, and a Bad Week Continues for Knicks
description: BOSTON  Carmelo Anthony was already having a difficult week before he showed up Friday at TD Garden with the rest of the Knicks. Where to begin?

title: Pat Conroy, Author of The Prince of Tides and The Great Santini, Dies at 70
description: Pat Conroy, who used his tortured family life and the scenic marshlands of coastal South Carolina as unending sources of inspiration for his fiction, notably the novels The Great Santini, The Lords of Discipline and The Prince of Tides, died on Friday. He was 70.

title: Tom Knight, Brooklyns Baseball Sage, Dies at 89
description: As decades pass, fans of the Brooklyn Dodgers, perhaps the most fervidly nostalgic partisans in the history of sports, are growing fewer and fewer. The 2016 baseball season, now getting underway, is the 59th since the team decamped to Los Angeles, leaving Brooklyns baseball die-hards with pangs of heartsickness for the loss of Gil Hodges, Duke Snider and Pee Wee Reese and venomous animosity for the never-to-be-forgiven betrayal of the team owner, Walter OMalley, who took them away.

title: Tony Dyson, Who Brought R2-D2 to Rolling, Beeping Life, Dies at 68
description: Tony Dyson, the special-effects designer who built R2-D2, the squat robot sidekick that beeped and whirred its way through seven Star Wars films, died on Friday at his home on the Maltese island of Gozo. He was 68.

title: What to Watch Saturday
description: Need a laugh? Melissa McCarthy spoofs Miss Moneypenny in Spy and Jonah Hill hosts Saturday Night Live. Feel like a cry? Amy Adams portrays Margaret Keane, the unheralded artist behind those popular 1960s waifs with sad faces and enormous peepers, in Big Eyes.

title: Paris Fashion Week: The Weekend
description: PARIS  Rise and shine, fashion week folk: The weekend begins with the Japanese designer Junya Watanabe, a former protg of Rei Kawakubo at Comme des Garons, who shows (mercifully, with coffee) at 9:30 at La Cantine, on the far side of the Seine.

title: Corrections: March 5, 2016
description: NATIONAL

title: No Grace in Defeat: Our Best Comments of the Week
description: In this new feature, we list the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment.

title: Networking in the Girls Lounge
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif.  Serious, successful businesswomen banding together as girlie girls to help end gender inequality in the workplace?

title: After the Broadway Show, a Trip to Hamiltons Grave
description: The tranquil graveyard at Trinity Church is tucked into an otherwise bustling commercial corner of Lower Manhattan. Inside its gates, weatherworn headstones  some dating from the 1680s  stand in the shadows of skyscrapers.

title: Millennial Reporters Grab the Campaign-Trail Spotlight
description: When the last presidential race was in its early stages, Katie Glueck was a senior at Northwestern University. Now covering the Ted Cruz campaign for Politico, Ms. Glueck, 26, belongs to a select group of millennial reporters who have a front-row seat to the greatest political show on earth.

title: Causes of Blindness Vary for Older Adults
description: Q. Whats the No. 1 cause of blindness in older adults in the United States?

title: A One-Man Quest for Answers in Malaysian Jets Disappearance
description: HONG KONG  The search for the Malaysia Airlines jet that vanished almost two years ago has involved ships scanning thousands of square miles of the Indian Ocean seabed. But what could be the most promising development in months was the result of a lone mans search, one that took him to an uninhabited sandbank along the coast of Mozambique.

title: The Intrexon Menagerie
description: Randal Kirks ventures range from gene therapies and cancer research, to a collection of genetically engineered animals, fruits and insects.

title: A Biotech Evangelist Seeks a Zika Dividend
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.  In the expanding realm ruled by Randal J. Kirk, sliced apples dont brown. Salmon grow twice as fast without swimming upriver to spawn. Beloved cats are reborn.

title: In New Economic Plan, China Bets That Hard Choices Can Be Avoided
description: BEIJING  As economic growth has fallen while debts and excess industrial output have risen, Chinese leaders have faced growing questions about whether they will carry out the painful policy surgery many experts say is needed to cut away the financial dead weight on the economy.

title: Haider Ackermann: Fall 2016
description: The Colombian designer, Mr. Ackermann, debuts his fall collection.

title: Junya Watanabe: Fall 2016
description: Mr. Watanabe presents his fall looks.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took Instagram followers from the Academy Awards to Cadaqus, Spain.

title: Ava McAvoy Transforms at Yohji Yamamoto
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall/Winter 2016 Fashion Week in Paris.

title: Bernie Sanders to Run 5-Minute Documentary Ad on Univision to Court Hispanics
description: In an effort to reach millions of Hispanic voters, Bernie Sanderss campaign is running a five-minute Spanish-language ad on Univision that calls attention to the plight of a female farm worker in Florida.

title: Tensions Simmer as a Small Town Seeks Answers in a Boys Killing
description: POTSDAM, N.Y.  At the southern edge of this village near the Canadian border, a small billboard slowly comes into focus. On the left is a black-and-white photo of a boy, reminiscent of so many missing-children posters; to the right are the words Unsolved Murder.

title: A Little Variety
description: A LITTLE VARIETY PUZZLES  This weeks puzzles include:

title: The Daily Shoe: Loewe
description: Jonathan Andersons pointed Loewe heels are art for the feet  and as covetable as the clothes.

title: The Daily Jewel: Dior
description: The edge at the Dior show came out not in the clothes but in the jewelry, as seen in this fistful of rings dangling charms and beads.

title: The Daily Bag: Loewe
description: The hobo bag gets an update courtesy of Loewe: The soft, laid-back shape was complete with braided straps and gold hardware, making for one of the best bags weve seen this week.

title: Farhad and Joe Examine Silicon Valleys Pull in Washington
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry. Mr. Isaac is out this week, so Joe Plambeck, deputy technology editor, is filling in.

title: Ad Calls Trump a Fraud, and Unfit for the White House
description: For 60 seconds, the accusations fly: Massive Scam. Operating a phony university. Habitual liar. Seizing on one of his more questionable business ventures, this ad  helpfully titled Scam  assaults Donald J. Trumps character and fitness for the presidency. The commercial was produced by Our Principles PAC, a group that is not aligned with any of his rivals but that sees Mr. Trump as calamitous to the Republican Party if he becomes its nominee.

title: Buying a Co-op with Dummy Money
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: If Its March, It Must Be Miami: When Home Changes With the Season
description: Oren Alexander, the Miami-based real estate agent to the rich, no longer thinks of his clients as second-home buyers. Todays ultrawealthy, he says, are often looking for the four-pack  a pied--terre in New York, a beach house in the Hamptons, a ski villa in Aspen and a winter condo in Miami.

title: Ted Cruz Keeps Up Pressure on Donald Trump; Bernie Sanders Takes 2 on Super Saturday
description: Senator Ted Cruz scored decisive wins in the Kansas and Maine caucuses on Saturday, demonstrating his enduring appeal among conservatives as he tried to reel in Donald J. Trumps significant lead in the Republican presidential race.

title: The Kasich Con
description: At this point, according to Predictwise, John Kasich has the fourth-best chance of getting the Republican nomination. Its not a big chance  5 percent  but you can imagine a scenario in which the stop Trump forces produce a hung convention, and Kasich emerges as the supposedly reasonable candidate. So an advance warning: hes a con artist too.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Dior, Loewe and Olympia Le-Tan in Pictures
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2016 collections that were presented Friday.

title: At Haider Ackermann, an Otherworldly Beauty  With Sculptural Hair
description: Its an otherworldly beauty. Its about very blank faces with beautiful skin, the makeup artist Lynsey Alexander said of the beauty look at the Haider Ackermann show earlier today. To achieve it, she smoothed and illuminated models faces with MACs Face and Body Foundation  and mixed it with Face and Body White and Silver Strobe Cream to give a slight iridescent finish to the skin.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Ivy League Coaches Choice on Full Contact Will Aid Athletes

title: House of Cards Season 4, Episode 3: The Trump-Underwood Connection
description: Sometimes art imitates life. Sometimes life imitates art. And sometimes, life imitates art before that art has even shown up on Netflix.

title: Variety: A Beautiful Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  For me, maps are all about possibilities. Looking at the highways and byways, the cities and towns, the land masses, all I can think of is the possibility of seeing places Ive never visited and how I will get there. Maps are about adventure.

title: Red Bulls Bradley Wright-Phillips Wins Greater Regard by Scoring Less
description: HARRISON, N.J.  It is hard to argue with the results, even if the cold, spare statistics of soccer suggest otherwise. Bradley Wright-Phillips and his teammates insist that Wright-Phillips, their high-scoring, heel-clicking striker, has been a more efficient player, and the Red Bulls a better team, since he avoided the net-bending feats he accomplished in 2014.

title: New York Governor Race Analysis and Trump
description: An October 2013 memo sent to senior New York State Republicans urged them to consider Donald J. Trump as the party's nominee for governor.

title: 'Springboards to the Presidency' Memo
description: A memo sent to Donald J. Trump in December 2013 detailed how he could increase his chances of winning the White House if he first ran for governor of New York.

title: Donald Trump Considered Path to Presidency Starting at Governors Mansion in New York
description: In late December 2013, after Donald J. Trump had met with a number of Republicans to discuss a possible run for governor of New York, he received a memo from an attendee, a freshman assemblyman from upstate.

title: After Heartbreak, Twins Slugger Miguel Sano Looks Ahead
description: FORT MYERS, Fla.  The memorial stretches nearly from the wrist to the elbow on the right forearm of the major leagues next slugging star. Miguel Sano, the Minnesota Twins 22-year-old power hitter, is never far from his daughter.

title: Italian Cuisine Worth Going to Prison For
description: MILAN  The waiters glided through the crowded dining room of InGalera, a restaurant that opened recently to rave reviews. Dinner reservations are almost fully booked for March, and the Milanese elite have taken note. A former bank president came a few weeks ago. So did a former Miss Italy. Families come on weekends.

title: Airbnb Pits Neighbor Against Neighbor in Tourist-Friendly New Orleans
description: Talk to the locals in certain New Orleans neighborhoods  from the historic and genteel Garden District uptown to the dense and increasingly trendy Bywater downriver  and you can be pretty sure that one topic will come up eventually: Airbnb.

title: Comme des Garons: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Rei Kawakubo debuts her fall collection.

title: Counseling Organ Donors to Make the Perfect Match
description: Patricia McDonough, 59, is a clinical transplant coordinator at Montefiore Health System in the Bronx.

title: In the Bizarro World of Negative Interest Rates, Saving Will Cost You
description: Heres a proposition for you: Hand over your money. Ill skim some off the top, hold it for a while and return whatever is left in a year or two.

title: New Yankee Had a Sweet Swing as a Child, but in Golf
description: TAMPA, Fla.  When Aaron Hicks was 10, already busy collecting golf trophies on some of the same courses that Tiger Woods had grown up on, his friends asked him to play Little League with them. So Hicks asked his father for permission.

title: As Book Opens on M.L.S.s 21st Season, the Subplots Abound
description: The M.L.S. season that opens Sunday will be the leagues 21st, a fitting number for a year that will feature the debut of the 21-year-old striker Jordan Morris.

title: Competing Interests on Encryption Divide Top Obama Officials
description: WASHINGTON  The intensifying legal battle over encryption between Apple and the Justice Department has all but obscured another more subtle division, the one inside the Obama administration itself.

title: Canadiens Fast Start Gives Way to Long Skid
description: On the day the Montreal Canadiens completed a winless three-game trip through California, the biggest news for the franchise came almost 3,000 miles away. Hours before the Canadiens lost, 3-2, to the Los Angeles Kings on Thursday, their star goaltender Carey Price, the reigning Hart Trophy winner as the N.H.L.s most valuable player, spoke at the teams practice complex in Montreal.

title: Money Given to Kenya, Since Stolen, Puts Nike in Spotlight
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  When a Chinese clothing company swooped in and offered to sponsor Kenyas famed runners, Nike panicked, Kenyan officials say.

title: Brad Weston of Petco: A Haven for Frogs, Snakes, Lizards and Plenty of Dogs
description: 1. Letting the light in

title: Donald the Dangerous
description: IS there any scarier nightmare than President Donald J. Trump in a tense international crisis, indignant and impatient, with his sweaty finger on the nuclear trigger?

title: When the Tide of Islamophobia Reached My Hometown Mosque
description: THE Islamic Society of North Americas headquarters sit atop a grassy hill overlooking Plainfield, Ind. The complex includes a prayer hall, a space for community events and a field house with a basketball court and playground. It is surrounded by cornfields. As the largest mosque in the Indianapolis area, it draws hundreds of families, especially during Ramadan and on holidays.

title: Waiter, Wheres Our (Political) Spinach?
description: ASKED what we prefer to eat for dinner, many of us will virtuously claim a diet of salads and whole grains, never mentioning lifeboat-size portions of penne alla vodka or our addiction to flourless chocolate cake. Asked what we serve the kids, we will nod dutifully to lean proteins and green vegetables, while double-cheese pizza and tater tots will go unmentioned.

title: The Elements of Trumpism
description: MAYBE Donald Trump is doing us a favor.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: A Judges Message to the Xenophobes
description: More than two dozen Republican governors were in a virtual stampede last fall to be first to bar the resettlement of federally approved Syrian refugees in their states. The shameless display of jingoism was prompted by the Paris shooting massacre in November and fears  wildly driven by the Republican presidential rivals  that terrorists could infiltrate the United States as refugees despite a resettlement process that is one of the strictest in the world.

title: Chickens, Home to Roost
description: WASHINGTON  HERES why the Trump campaign is wicked fun:

title: Raise the Legal Age for Cigarette Sales to 21
description: California could soon raise the legal age for buying cigarettes and other tobacco products to 21, from 18. That change could help prevent many young people from becoming addicted and reduce premature deaths from lung cancer and other tobacco-related diseases.

title: Hidden Gold in College Applications
description: IF the gatekeepers at Davidson College had judged the teenager by her ACT score, she probably wouldnt have gotten in. It was 25 out of a possible 36, and more than three-quarters of the students at Davidson, a liberal-arts school in North Carolina with about 1,800 undergraduates and an acceptance rate of just over 20 percent, do better than that.

title: An All-American Family Portrait, in White
description: I walked through the door of Vincent Valdezs studio, in a renovated firehouse near downtown San Antonio, the other day. I stopped dead, my eyes widened, my mouth made a silent O.

title: Two-Man Race for Top Rookie Should Be a Rout
description: One rookie-of-the-year contender was called a unicorn by Kevin Durant, has two nicknames that incorporate the word god and has single-handedly given hope to New York basketball fans. The other, known simply by his initials, has been honing his game far more quietly in Minnesota.

title: Pencil Pushes Way Into Daytona Lore
description: When two cars flashed across the finish line together at the Daytona 500 two weeks ago, modern camera technology captured the moment, leaving no doubt that Denny Hamlin had won by a nose.

title: How Marco Rubio's Grandfather Was Nearly Deported
description: Excerpts from an immigration hearing in 1962 where Marco Rubio's grandfather, Pedro Garcia, discussed his expired green card and pleaded his case to stay in the U.S. as a permanent resident.

title: Marco Rubios Policies Might Shut the Door to People Like His Grandfather
description: MIAMI  Marco Rubios grandfather was a man without a country.

title: Donald Trump Broke Debate Rule About Huddling With Staff, Rivals Say
description: Donald J. Trump flouted a rule set by Fox News during Thursday nights debate by conversing with his campaign manager during a commercial break, according to two rival campaign officials.

title: John Kasich Sides With Harry Potter on Strategy
description: Gov. John Kasich of Ohio, speaking to reporters on Saturday in Traverse City, Mich.

title: The World Has a Problem: Too Many Young People
description: AT no point in recorded history has our world been so demographically lopsided, with old people concentrated in rich countries and the young in not-so-rich countries.

title: Nina Ricci: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Guillaume Henry presents his latest fall looks.

title: Taliban Say They Wont Attend Peace Talks, but Officials Arent Convinced
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Taliban said on Saturday that they would not participate in international peace talks, citing what they claimed were increased American airstrikes and Afghan government military operations.

title: The Return of the D.I.Y. Abortion
description: DURING oral arguments last week before the Supreme Court in Whole Womans Health v. Hellerstedt, Justice Elena Kagan noted that she was struck by the clear relationship between abortion restrictions in Texas and the closing of abortion clinics. Its almost like the perfect controlled experiment as to the effect of the law, isnt it? she said. Its like you put the law into effect, 12 clinics closed. You take the law out of effect, they reopen.

title: The Eviction Economy
description: I FIRST met Larraine when we both lived in a trailer park on the far South Side of Milwaukee. Fifty-four, with silvering brown hair, Larraine loved mystery novels, So You Think You Can Dance and doting on her grandson. Even though she lived in a mobile home park with so many code violations that city inspectors called it an environmental biohazard, she kept a tidy trailer and used a hand steamer on the curtains. But Larraine spent more than 70 percent of her income on housing  just as one in four of all renting families who live below the poverty line do. After paying the rent, she was left with $5 a day.

title: The Rise of Antipolitics
description: Readers discuss a David Brooks column about trends leading to Donald Trumps candidacy.

title: Can Nicotine Be Good for You?
description: THERE was something odd about my new patient. She was elegantly dressed and self-possessed, and yet she was slowly, rhythmically chewing gum, something I rarely see in my psychiatry sessions. Was she trying to cover up anxiety about this first encounter, I wondered, or was she perhaps hoping to project a kind of cool, laid-back style?

title: The Art of Failing Upward
description: IN the start-up world, failure is in. No sooner has an entrepreneur failed at a venture in Silicon Valley than he takes to the web  frequently to blogging sites like Medium, which hosts a continuous stream of essays on the topic  or to the stage at industry conferences like FailCon to narrate the failure and the growth he experienced as a result.

title: In Character
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  April of this year marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare, and David J. Kahn is back with a puzzle about some of the Bards characters.

title: Votes Being Counted in 5 States
description: Voters turned out for primaries and caucuses in Kansas, Louisiana, Maine, Kentucky and Nebraska.

title: South Korea Government Accused of Using Defamation Laws to Silence Critics
description: SEOUL, South Korea  In late 2014, months after 304 people died in the sinking of a South Korean ferry, a leaflet began circulating with a scurrilous rumor about President Park Geun-hye: that she had failed to respond swiftly to the disaster that day because she was having a romantic encounter with a former aide.

title: Maryland House Race a Caldron of Power Couples and Washington, D.C., Politics
description: CHEVY CHASE, Md.  What happens when a coveted House seat opens up a quick subway ride from the Capitol? A hugely expensive free-for-all, studded with celebrities (or what passes for celebrities in Washington)  with a whiff of dirty tricks.

title: Crosswords Seemingly Copied From The New York Times Questioned
description: In the world of crossword enthusiasts, a new puzzle presents a fresh challenge each day. But what if the puzzle was plagiarized from one that appeared years ago?

title: Dr. Myron G. Schultz, Who Helped Identify AIDS Crisis, Dies at 81
description: Dr. Myron G. Schultz, whose detection of a cluster of pneumonia cases in the early 1980s helped public health officials identify the AIDS epidemic, died on Feb. 19 in Atlanta. He was 81.

title: Britains Exclusive Schools Try to Be a Little Less So
description: RUGBY, England  Patrick Derham remembers the moment in October 1973 when, age 14, from a troubled home and planning to join the navy, he saw the course of his life changed, rather miraculously, for the better.

title: Alumni of Britains Elite Schools
description: LONDON  Graduates of Britains famous private schools are still overrepresented in the upper tiers of British life, from government to the arts.

title: Donald Trump Again Alters Course on Torture
description: Donald J. Trump said he would seek to broaden laws regarding the torture of terrorism suspects, a day after he said that as president he would be bound by laws and treaties that he would not order the military to violate.

title: Forging a 3-Shot Lead, McIlroy Can See Augusta From Doral
description: DORAL, Fla.  Rory McIlroy has captured three of golfs four major championships, and with his game kicking into another gear as he methodically took apart the Blue Monster course at Trump National Resort on Saturday, talk will soon shift to the major title he covets most.

title: With Porzingis Out on Short Notice, Knicks Unite for a Victory
description: With just over an hour remaining before the Knicks tipped off against the Detroit Pistons at Madison Square Garden on Saturday night, Coach Kurt Rambis made a rare appearance in the locker room. He called out for Derrick Williams, who could not hear his name over the music pumping through his headphones.

title: Yale Finally Has an Ivy Title to Call Its Own
description: After Yales players had celebrated with bearhugs and a scrum at center court, the Ivy Leagues executive director, Robin Harris, told them, I want to congratulate you on being outright champion.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Your Weekend Briefing

title: Emmarie Huetteman, Christopher Trepky
description: Emmarie Huetteman and Christopher Thomas Trepky were married Feb. 29 under the District of Columbias self-uniting marriage statute. The ceremony was at the Tidal Basin next to the National Mall in Washington.

title: Laura Keane, Eric Ayers
description: Laura Mackenzie Noerr Keane and Eric Matthew Ayers were married March 4 at the London Plane, a restaurant in Seattle. Laura C. Inveen, a Superior Court judge in King County, Wash., officiated.

title: Rachel Meislin, Marc Ohringer
description: Rachel Julie Meislin, a daughter of Andrea Popowich Meislin and Dr. Robert J. Meislin of New York, was married March 5 to Marc Lee Ohringer, a son of Sheryl Bloom Ohringer and Barry H. Ohringer of Woodland Park, N.J. Rabbi Jeremy Kalmanofsky officiated at Capitale, an event space in New York.

title: Stephanie Lake and Adam Kool: Love Me, Love My City
description: Stephanie Lindsay Lake, a daughter of Katharine Lindsay Lake and Stephen Randall Lake of Norwalk, Conn., was married March 1 to Adam Michael Kool, a son of Tammy J. Kool and the Rev. Ronald G. Kool of Grand Rapids, Mich. Robert D. Sack, a judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, officiated, with Lewis A. Kaplan, a judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, taking part at the Thurgood Marshall United States Court House in New York.

title: Rachel Pea, Michael Blake
description: Rachel Virginia Pea and Michael Thomas Blake were married March 5 at the Rickhouse, an event space in Durham, N.C. The Rev. Katie Crowe, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

title: Jillian Kotler, Adam Fox
description: Jillian Lauren Kotler, the daughter of Anita Paoli Kotler and Dr. Jon A. Kotler of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., was married March 5 to Adam Jordan Fox, a son of Laurie M. Fox and George Fox of Tenafly, N.J. Rabbi Moishe Meir Lipszyc officiated at the Ritz-Carlton in Fort Lauderdale.

title: James Leider, Todd Scher
description: James Gabriel Leider and Todd Gerald Scher are to be married March 6 at the Diplomat Golf & Tennis Club in Hallandale Beach, Fla. Rabbi Allan C. Tuff is to officiate.

title: Shanshan Li, Sean Sheehy
description: Shanshan Li and Sean Paul Sheehy were married Feb. 29 at City Hall in Cambridge, Mass. Donna P. Lopez, the Cambridge city clerk, officiated.

title: Jamie Rosen, David Manning
description: Jamie Melissa Rosen, a daughter of Dr. Debra J. Wattenberg and Brett N. Rosen of New York, was married March 5 to David Charles Manning, the son of Gail P. Manning and Frederick J. Manning of Chicago. Rabbi Michael Stanger officiated at the Plaza in New York.

title: Caitrin McKiernan, Andrew Hicks
description: Caitrin Una McKiernan and Andrew Stephen Hicks were married March 5 at El Presidio Chapel in Santa Barbara, Calif. Dr. Michael Carl Brabeck, the brides godfather, who became a Universal Life minister for the event, performed the ceremony.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Everyone expects a deal on the web. Nobody wants to pay retail. Some sellers are now willing to deceive consumers to make the sale.

title: Corrections: March 6, 2016
description: NATIONAL

title: Dont Write Us Off, Bernie Sanders Says After Caucus Wins on Saturday
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont, energized by victories Saturday in Kansas and Nebraska, declared that people should not write off his campaign and that the caucus wins show that he has the momentum to gain the Democratic presidential nomination.

title: John Kasich Releases Tax Records Showing $5 Million in Income Over Seven Years
description: BIRCH RUN, Mich.  Gov. John Kasich of Ohio released partial tax returns on Saturday showing that he and his wife earned more than $5 million from 2008 through 2014.

title: Its Discounted, but Is It a Deal? How List Prices Lost Their Meaning
description: SAN FRANCISCO  As traditional retailing falters, shutting stores and shedding workers, online merchants are reaping the rewards. People like the convenience of e-commerce, and they love the feeling that they are getting a deal.

title: As Aid Floods Into Flint, a Fix Remains Far Off
description: FLINT, Mich.  For months, almost no one would listen to residents fears about their odd-looking drinking water. Now, it seems, everyone is listening  and sending truckloads of bottled water, water filters and baby wipes, and cash donations and television news crews that set up along Saginaw Street downtown.

title: Lewis Hamilton at Vivienne Westwood
description: The crowd that assembles at the Vivienne Westwood show during Paris Fashion Week is typically an eclectic bunch. So it was something of a surprise on Saturday afternoon to see Lewis Hamilton, the clean-cut reigning Formula One world champion, speeding through the drag queens, goth rockers and the more avant garde of the fashion elite on his way to his spot on the front row. But Mr. Hamilton, who became an official ambassador for British mens fashion in June, is becoming a seasoned circuit fixture. In Paris for the weekend before the 2016 championship season kicksoff in Melbourne, Australia on March 20, he took five minutes to talkto Styles after the show was over.

title: Philippines Will Impound Ship Linked to North Korea
description: MANILA  The Philippines will become the first country to enforce tough new United Nations sanctions on North Korea when it begins formal procedures on Monday to impound a cargo vessel linked to the reclusive nation, a government spokesman said on Sunday.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: Your Weekend Briefing: Donald Trump, China, Scott Kelly
description: Here are the weeks top stories.

title: 1941: Yugoslavia Weighs Closer Ties With Axis Bloc
description: ROME  Axis hopes of creating a solid European continent ranged against England were never higher than they are in Rome today [Mar. 6], with apparently well authenticated reports that Yugoslavia is to follow Bulgaria into the German camp.

title: Slovakias Governing Party Loses Majority as Far Right Makes Gains
description: BRATISLAVA, Slovakia  Slovakias governing party lost its majority in parliamentary elections, and far-right extremists made striking gains, according to results announced on Sunday.

title: Time to Cuddle with Cruz?
description: Just when you think it cant get any worse for the sober-minded, cool-headed traditionalists in the Republican Party, it does. They see their gold-plated gate crasher taken down a peg, only to find themselves faced with the prospect of kissing up to Ted Cruz.

title: Balenciaga: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Demna Gvasalias debut collection for Balenciaga.

title: The Family Footsteps We Follow
description: My father is one of three brothers who thrived in their respective professions, lifting themselves above the economic station of their Italian-immigrant parents. Theyre archetypal American success stories. Buoyed by their good fortune, my siblings, my cousins and I racked up athletic trophies, won scholarships, gained admission to competitive schools, built enviable careers.

title: Balenciagas New Balance
description: PARIS  The most anticipated debut of Paris Fashion Week took place in a white box of a padded sound stage in the far reaches of the 15th Arrondissement as a cold wind blew in from the Seine. Guests trooped down a staircase covered in industrial gray carpet against the soundtrack of air raid sirens, to see Demna Gvasalia, the Georgian fox in the iconoclastic Vetements henhouse of fashion, unveil his Balenciaga. A hush of expectation settled over the crowd.

title: The Daily Jewel: Mugler
description: The oversize sculptural earrings at Mugler were a nod to the houses 80s heyday  simultaneously modern and just a little bit decadent.

title: New Yorks Sounds of Silence
description: Dear Diary:

title: 1966: Russia Says Venus Probes Failed
description: MOSCOW  The Soviet Union acknowledged last night [March 5] that though the group flight of Venus-2 and Venus-3 was a great technological achievement, it was a scientific failure. Neither of the two spaceships  each weighing more than a ton  returned any information about the cloud-covered planet.

title: The Daily Bag: Nina Ricci
description: At Nina Ricci, a small, tulip-red bag bloomed like a flower on the runway.

title: Cline: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Phoebe Philos latest designs.

title: Peyton Manning Expected to Say Hes Leaving the N.F.L.
description: Peyton Manning, the Denver Broncos quarterback and Super Bowl 50 victor who amassed a passel of records and was among the N.F.L.s most popular players in his 18 seasons in the league, will retire, hobbled by several career-threatening injuries.

title: A Food Order Ends in a Flurry of Fists, Hurled Sodas and Flying White Sauce
description: What turned out to be the last order of the night  before an attack left a police officer with injuries, a suspect in custody and a Halal Paradise food truck in shambles  came from a man with $4 in his hand and a $5 lamb gyro on his brain.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Comme des Garons and Junya Watanabe in Pictures
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2016 collections that were presented yesterday.

title: A Sentimental Education From Comme des Garons, Cline and Undercover
description: PARIS  On Saturday, in the bowels of Le Centorial, the 19th-century building that is the headquarters of the bank formerly known as Crdit Lyonnais, two floors below the soaring central hall, so far underground that cellphones go dark, Rei Kawakubo of Comme des Garons held a history lesson.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Nancy Reagan, an Influential and Protective First Lady, Dies at 94
description: Nancy Reagan, the influential and stylish wife of the 40th president of the United States who unabashedly put Ronald Reagan at the center of her life but became a political figure in her own right, died on Sunday at her home in Los Angeles. She was 94.

title: In Sunset Park, a Call for Innovation Leads to Fears of Gentrification
description: For decades, the industrial waterfront of Sunset Park, on the western edge of Brooklyn, was an urban flyover country of sorts, as commuters heading to Manhattan or Staten Island zipped past on the elevated Gowanus Expressway, catching glimpses of auto repair shops, huge warehouses and billboards.

title: Club for Growth to Spend $2 Million on Anti-Trump Ads
description: Club for Growth Action, the super PAC arm of the influential anti-tax group, is going on television with $2 million in ads against Donald J. Trump in Illinois, where Republicans will hold a primary on March 15.

title: House of Cards Season 4, Episode 4: Well That Was Surprising
description: Just when this episode threatens to get bogged down in political strategy  Claire and Franks continued quid pro quo, the execution of Operation Intimidate Russian President Petrov  Frank Underwood gets shot. The effect is a little like bringing a gun to a chess match. It immediately adds a sense of urgency and danger to this initially dull episode. The way the incident is initially telegraphed, with Claire put on lockdown by the Secret Service in a way that suggests Frank is again attempting to assert his dominance, works quite effectively. Narratively, though, the introduction of an assassination attempt also feels a little desperate and, potentially, like a bad omen for anyone waiting to witness the fall of Frank Underwood.

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: Dust off your bugle and sound the Last Post: Downton Abbey closes its doors after six seasons. Kevin Spacey of House of Cards joins the political debate on Meet the Press. And Caitlyn Jenner discusses her conservative views and sexual orientation on I Am Cait.

title: Hillary Clinton Is Riding High  Thats the Problem
description: Hillary Clinton could be in for some political peril.

title: Nancy Reagan Dies at 94
description: Mrs. Reagan died on Sunday at her home in Los Angeles.

title: Review: Carnegie Halls West Side Story at the Knockdown Center
description: The headlong energy of youth was on ample  no, make that spectacular  display over the weekend in Maspeth, Queens, at the Knockdown Center, a former factory where a wonderfully energized, energizing production of West Side Story was presented for just three performances, under the auspices of Carnegie Hall and the Weill Music Institute.

title: A Call for College Students to Help Shape Their States Clean Power Plans
description: Back in January, Eban Goodstein, the director of the Bard College Center for Environmental Policy, distributed an invitation to college students and faculty across the United States to participate in Power Dialog, an exciting effort to mesh learning and civic engagement around the nations efforts to curtail power plant emissions of carbon dioxide, the main human-generated gas contributing to global warming.*

title: Republicans and Trade Wars
description: Im not sure whether anyone but me cares about the Romney-Trump spat over trade policy; its much more interesting, for normal human beings anyway, to talk about the size of Trumps, er, hands. For that matter, even Romneys past relationship with Trump is notable mainly because racism and birtherism didnt bother him back in the good old days. Still, the trade dispute is a revealing fight, on both sides.

title: Nancy Reagan Dies
description: Mrs. Reagan died at 94 on Sunday at her home in Los Angeles.

title: A Big Night for Ted Cruz and Bernie Sanders
description: The most interesting developments in Saturdays primary contests centered on Ted Cruz, Marco Rubio and Bernie Sanders, in that order.

title: Billie Jean King Campaigns for Women's Soccer
description: Forty-three years after its creation, the Womens Tennis Association still bills itself as the global leader in womens professional sport.

title: Nancy Reagans Style
description: Some memorable looks from the former first lady.

title: In a Note, Bob Dylan Told Barbra Streisand, You Are My Favorite Star
description: Of the thousands of lyrics, tapes and correspondence in the Bob Dylan Archive, one of the more intriguing items is a handwritten card from Barbra Streisand, postmarked November 1978, in which she thanks Mr. Dylan for sending flowers and suggests that they make a record together.

title: Candidates React to Nancy Reagans Death
description: The presidential candidates reacted quickly to the death Sunday of Nancy Reagan, who died at age 94.

title: Mets Revamp Sign System After Daniel Murphys Departure
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  At some point near the end of spring training, Tim Teufel, the Mets third-base coach, will gather the team for a meeting to demonstrate and decode the hand signs they will use this season. One sequence of signs may tell a batter to bunt, or tell a runner to steal, or tell them both that the hit-and-run is on. Teufel has about 10 signs, and he uses his own elaborate system to relay them, just to make the enterprise that much harder for an opponent to pick up on.

title: How to Watch the Democratic Debate
description: Heres how we analyzed the Democratic debate.

title: Zootopia Tops the Box Office
description: Zootopia, which delighted critics with its low-high approach to topics like racism (err, speciesism), drew moviegoer hooves in droves over the weekend. But Tina Feys war dramedy Whiskey Tango Foxtrot was a dud, taking in roughly 25 percent less than even the weakest of prerelease analyst projections.

title: Akris: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Albert Kriemler presents his latest looks.

title: Louis C.K. Condemns Trump in Email
description: The comedian Louis C.K. condemned the Republican presidential front-runner, Donald J. Trump, in an email to his fans on Saturday. The guy is Hitler. And by that I mean that we are being Germany in the 30s, he writes. Hitler was just some hilarious and refreshing dude with a weird comb over who would say anything at all.

title: Nikolaus Harnoncourt, Conductor and Early-Music Specialist, Dies at 86
description: Nikolaus Harnoncourt, a pioneering and influential early-music specialist and respected mainstream maestro, died on Saturday in the village of St. Georgen im Attergau, east of Salzburg, Austria. He was 86.

title: BET Honors Pay Tribute to Patti LaBelle, Lee Daniels, Eric Holder and Others
description: WASHINGTON  Black excellence, the running theme of the BET Honors, was on full display Saturday evening at the Warner Theater here, where the network filmed its annual homage to African-American luminaries in art, music, theater, technology and business.

title: The Daily Shoe: Haider Ackermann
description: Velvet is proving to be a big trend for fall. Haider Ackermann put his best foot forward with these high-heeled boots in a palette of jewel-tone colors.

title: Joe Biden Jokingly Suggests Ted Cruz for Supreme Court Pick
description: WASHINGTON  Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. had some tongue-in-cheek advice for President Obama on Saturday about whom he should nominate to fill the Supreme Court vacancy that has preoccupied the White House and incited an election-year fight.

title: Not Everyone Says Headgear Is Right Fit for Girls Lacrosse
description: One of the countrys most popular, fastest-growing girls sports is nearing a move that might seem obvious to outsiders but has instead engendered rigorous debate: offering players protective headgear.

title: Nuance Was Never the Plan
description: The Veterans Room at the Park Avenue Armory, restored to all its Gilded Age swagger, opens on Monday.

title: Law Graduate Gets Her Day in Court, Suing Law School
description: Nearly a decade has passed since an aspiring young lawyer in California, Anna Alaburda, graduated in the top tier of her class, passed the state bar exam and set out to use the law degree she had spent about $150,000 to acquire.

title: Arnold Schwarzenegger Endorses John Kasich
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  Arnold Schwarzenegger endorsed Gov. John Kasich on Sunday as Mr. Kasich rallied voters in his home state of Ohio, whose primary has emerged as a critical moment in the Republican race.

title: Review: Don Pasquale Returns to the Met, With a Bravura Aria and More
description: Two years ago at the Metropolitan Opera, the Mexican tenor Javier Camarena absolutely nailed a bravura aria in Rossinis La Cenerentola, setting off an ovation that would not stop until he repeated its flashy final section  a rare occurrence of an aria encore at the Met.

title: Review: Elisa Monte Dance Moves On, but Aesthetic Doesnt Stray
description: After 35 years at the helm of her company, the choreographer Elisa Monte, who began her career as a dancer with Agnes de Mille and Martha Graham, is stepping down. Her troupes season at Aaron Davis Hall, which closed on Saturday, warmly ushered in a new artistic director, Tiffany Rea-Fisher, who joined Elisa Monte Dance in 2004.

title: Givenchy: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Riccardo Tisci is back in Paris to present his fall designs.

title: The Gilded Age Glows Again at the Park Avenue Armorys Veterans Room
description: In his story The Secret Room, the French novelist Alain Robbe-Grillet describes an interior so ornate as to defy description, whose very dimensions are shadowy but whose considerable space must in reality extend all around, right and left, as it does toward the faraway browns and blues among the columns standing in line, in every direction.

title: Marco Rubio Wins Puerto Rico Primary; Bernie Sanders Takes Maine Caucuses
description: Senator Marco Rubio of Florida won the Puerto Rico primary on Sunday, giving him a much-needed victory after a string of losses that threatened to push the Republican presidential nomination further out of his reach.

title: Egypt Says Muslim Brotherhood, Backed by Hamas, Killed Top Prosecutor
description: CAIRO  Egypt said Sunday that members of the banned Muslim Brotherhood, trained by the Palestinian militant group Hamas, carried out the bombing in Cairo that killed Egypts top prosecutor last summer.

title: Michigan Primary Puts Donald Trumps Rust Belt Strategy to a Test
description: WARREN, Mich.  Neil Mortensen remembers how neighbors lost factory jobs in this suburb north of Detroit, and then, inexorably and sadly, their homes.

title: Review: Adam Cohens Imbeciles, on the Supreme Court and Justice Not for All
description: Of all the disgraceful rulings the Supreme Court has made in its 227-year history  and the lowlight reel is fairly lengthy  the decision in Buck v. Bell still stands out as one of the ugliest. The case may not be as well known as, for instance, Dred Scott v. Sandford, which denied African-Americans citizenship. But in just five paragraphs, the court upheld a statute that enabled the State of Virginia to sterilize mental defectives  specifically one Carrie Buck, a young resident of the Virginia Colony for Epileptics and Feeble-Minded.

title: For a Young Donald J. Trump, Broadway Held Sway
description: The Broadway producer David Black was sitting in his office, above the Palace Theater, when a young Donald J. Trump walked in, unannounced, and asked him to lunch.

title: Snowboarding, Once a High-Flying Sport, Crashes to Earth
description: As the Swiss snowboarder Iouri Podladtchikov twisted, flipped and spun above the halfpipe at X Games Oslo last week on his way to a silver medal, the bottom of his board  one of the more valuable pieces of advertising real estate in the sport  displayed no corporate logo. Instead, it was adorned with an artistic design he had created for a college class assignment.

title: Review: In Damien, a Photojournalist Resists His More Devilish Side
description: Damien Thorn, the title character of A&Es new horror series Damien, is subject to a particularly onerous punishment. Throughout the early episodes, whenever he has flashbacks to his childhood, he sees clips from The Omen. Talk about hell on earth!

title: Nancy Reagans Style
description: Some memorable looks from the former First Lady Nancy Reagan.

title: Kendrick Lamar and Lil Wayne Each Sidestep the Traditional Album Cycle
description: Back in the mid-late 2000s, when Lil Wayne used to refer to himself as the greatest rapper alive, music flowed forth from him like a geyser. Each year brought several dozen new songs, a sign of an artist obsessed with sound, and also with his own freedom to create.

title: Emitt Rhodes, a New Album Out, Emerges From His Slumber
description: When the Bangles formed in the 1980s, the band sought out an ace melodist to produce its music: Emitt Rhodes.

title: G.O.P. Goes Astray on Guantnamo. So Does Obama.
description: WASHINGTON  Even by the standards of an epically polarized Washington, the political talk about President Obamas effort to close the Guant namo Bay prison is starkly divorced from facts. On both sides of the debate, many claims collapse under scrutiny.

title: Review: Hungry Portrays a Mourning Clan in Election Year 2016
description: As befits a work with the title Hungry, food is prepared  ardently and aromatically  in the wonderful new play written and directed by Richard Nelson, which opened on Friday night at the Public Theater. Yet it is unlikely that the ratatouille and apple crumble on offer will satisfy the appetites of the five women and one man assembled in a snug kitchen in Rhinebeck, N.Y.

title: Back in The Day
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  The main challenge I faced while solving this nicely symmetrical Monday puzzle was swallowing the emotions that surfaced, a tasty mix of fondness and revulsion for the cute little decade sandwiched between the Awesome 80s and the terrifying era we live in now. Im Generation X, though. Eating our feelings is one of our specialties.

title: Nancy Reagans Love of Fashion Recalled at Givenchy Show
description: PARIS  Apart from Jackie Kennedy, Michelle Obama and I guess Dolley Madison, Mrs. Reagan was the only presidents wife who had an interest in American fashion, said Valerie Steele, the director of the Museum at FIT, on Sunday night at the Givenchy show here, and was actually good at it.

title: N.J. Transit Plans Park-and-Ride Locations
description: In the event of a strike, the agency said it would add five park-and-ride locations throughout New Jersey.

title: Robert Del Tufo, Former New Jersey Attorney General, Dies at 82
description: Robert J. Del Tufo, a former New Jersey attorney general and federal prosecutor who offered a lonely dissent in the Federal Bureau of Investigations corruption investigation known as Abscam, died on Wednesday in Princeton, N.J. He was 82.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of March 7
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Greta Varlese Transforms at Givenchy
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall/Winter 2016 Fashion Week in Paris.

title: Europes Antitrust Enforcer on Google, Apple and the Year Ahead
description: BRUSSELS  Margrethe Vestager is already having a busy 2016.

title: Queens Man in Custody After Stabbings and Burn Attacks, Police Say
description: A 23-year-old man slashed a woman in the face on Sunday morning in Queens, the police said, before fatally stabbing a shopkeeper and setting another man on fire several hours later at a nearby liquor store, leading to a wild manhunt that ended with officers shooting the suspect as he threw a chemical at them.

title: Leaving the E.U. Would Hurt Britains Economy
description: Would Britain be better off economically outside the European Union? The answer is most likely no, which is why Britons need to weigh the evidence carefully when they go to the polls in June to vote on leaving the E.U.

title: Iraq Suicide Bomber Kills Dozens at Checkpoint Near Babylonian Ruins
description: BAGHDAD  At least 33 people were killed and 115 wounded in the Iraqi city of Hilla on Sunday when a fuel truck driven by a suicide bomber exploded at a checkpoint not far from the ruins of ancient Babylon.

title: Torontos Counterattack Breaks Down the Red Bulls
description: HARRISON, N.J.  Before a disheartening home opener Sunday, Red Bulls Coach Jesse Marsch had spoken about a possible Plan B for this season, if opponents adjusted too effectively to his clubs high-press tactics.

title: New York Legislators Plan to Introduce Measure on Carried Interest Tax
description: A coalition of progressive groups is starting a state-level campaign to close the so-called carried interest loophole, which allows fund managers to pay a substantially reduced federal tax rate on much of their income.

title: Nancy Reagan Dies at 94
description: Mrs. Reagan was a trusted adviser to her husband, President Ronald Reagan, and a fierce guardian of his image. She championed efforts to fight drug abuse and Alzheimers disease.

title: Migrants Remain Stranded in Greece
description: More than 10,000 migrants have been waiting in Idomeni, Greece, to cross the border into Macedonia.

title: NATO to Expand Patrols in Aegean Sea to Stop Human Traffickers
description: BRUSSELS  The day before a European conference designed to persuade Turkey to curb the uncontrolled flow of migrants making perilous journeys across the Aegean Sea, NATO announced on Sunday that it would expand its maritime efforts to stop the smugglers who make many of those journeys possible.

title: Democratic Debate in Flint, Mich.: Analysis
What You Missed in the Debate
description: Heres how we analyzed the Democratic debate.

title: New Proposal to Divide Jerusalem Unites People Against It
description: JERUSALEM  A new plan on how to divide Jerusalems Jewish and Arab neighborhoods has had the peculiar distinction of uniting people against it.

title: As Alaska Warms, the Iditarod Adapts
description: ANCHORAGE  The Iditarod dog-sled race has gripped the imagination here for a long time, partly because it captures the idea, cherished by Alaskans, that a true-north wildness lies just over the horizon, and anyone getting there must first face a harsh gantlet of ice and cold.

title: White House and Cuba Maneuver Over Obamas Visit
description: WASHINGTON  When Major League Baseball completed a deal with the Cuban government last week to hold an exhibition game in Havana during President Obamas planned visit this month, White House officials quietly rejoiced that a pivotal piece of their plan had fallen into place after weeks of intensive negotiations.

title: Health Law Insurance Plans to be Rated by Network Size
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration, responding to consumer complaints, says it will begin rating health insurance plans based on how many doctors and hospitals they include in their networks.

title: Tech Companies, New and Old, Clamor to Entice Cloud Computing Experts
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Amazon Web Services, a globe-spanning cloud computing network that is part of the online retailing giant Amazon, has rapidly become one of the most powerful forces in technology. It has also become a target for poachers.

title: Tripoli, a Tense and Listless City With Gunmen and a Well-Stocked Hugo Boss Outlet
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  Cracking open the giant church door, the Nigerian watchman cast a wary eye over the deserted street.

title: Women Try to Make Italys Shoe-Shining as Chic as Its Shoes
description: VERONA, Italy  In a country famed for its fine leather products and fashion sense, shining shoes was never a particularly exalted profession.

title: Masahiro Tanaka Returns to Mound for Yankees After Off-Season Surgery
description: CLEARWATER, Fla.  On Sunday, for the first time since the wild-card playoff game against the Houston Astros, Masahiro Tanaka pitched in a game.

title: Heroin Epidemic Increasingly Seeps Into Public View
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  In Philadelphia last spring, a man riding a city bus at rush hour injected heroin into his hand, in full view of other passengers, including one who captured the scene on video.

title: Suspension of Chase Utley Is Rescinded, Reports Say
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  The Los Angeles Dodgers Chase Utley, who was barred for two games after his aggressive slide in a playoff game last year broke the leg of Mets shortstop Ruben Tejada, had his suspension lifted by Major League Baseball, according to multiple news media reports.

title: Wary of Digital Guests, Brooklyn House Tour Closes Its Doors
description: Strolling past the brownstones of Brooklyn Heights is an exercise in envy suppression. What homey perfection hides behind each cornice and gable, bay window and ornate lintel? How much more resplendent are the lives inside those buildings than in our own apartments? For 31 years the Brooklyn Heights Association has provided some answers by offering a tour of private residences in the neighborhood that, for one day, allowed the curious up the stoops and into the living rooms that are often every bit as palatial as imagined.

title: Earnings From Urban Outfitters and Square, and an E.C.B. Meeting
description: Heres what to look for this week:

title: U.S. Conferred With Iran Before Iraq Invasion, Book Says
description: WASHINGTON  Senior American officials held confidential talks with Iran about Iraqs future in advance of the United States-led invasion to topple Saddam Hussein, and secured a promise that the Iranian military would not fire at United States warplanes that strayed into Iranian airspace, according to a new book by a ranking Bush administration official.

title: Being Paid to Play Basketball, Pat Connaughton Is Dreaming of Diamonds
description: Downtime for N.B.A. players is a study in relaxation techniques. After a practice or before a game, many indulge in video games, a movie, a book or the ever-popular nap. A day off might include all of the above.

title: Obama Pays Tribute to Charlie Brown, Snoopy and the Peanuts Gang
description: Like millions of Americans, I grew up with Peanuts. But I never outgrew it.

title: Trial of Veteran Accused of Trying to Join ISIS May Hinge on Unsent Letter
description: The most conclusive piece of evidence against Tairod Pugh, a 48-year old U.S. Air Force veteran accused of trying to join the Islamic State, is the letter he addressed to his wife. In it, Mr. Pugh, wrote of his plan to become a martyr.

title: To Reinvigorate Sales, Mondelez Reimagines the Snack
description: Mondelez International, the large snacks and confections business that used to be part of Kraft, is introducing its first new product line in years.

title: As Stephen Curry and Kobe Bryant Converge, Basketball Universe Tilts on Its Side
description: LOS ANGELES  The nature of the spectacle on Sunday afternoon at Staples Center changed drastically about halfway through the second quarter of the game.

title: Adam Scott Wins at Doral as Rory McIlroy Falters After a Handshake From Donald Trump
description: DORAL, Fla.  Twenty minutes before he took aim at his 12th PGA Tour victory, Rory McIlroy sensed a fast-approaching atmospheric storm and glanced up from his spot on the range. Donald J. Trump, trailed by Secret Service agents, police officers, employees, photographers and golf reporters, was making his way toward him.

title: Picture This: Marketers Let Emojis Do the Talking
description: The condom brand Durex has used World AIDS Day as a marketing hook for years, but for the most recent edition it tried something different: a condom emoji.

title: Former Michigan Senator Donald Riegle Endorses Bernie Sanders
description: FLINT, Mich.  Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont, in an impromptu news conference before the Democratic debate here, announced that he had acquired the endorsement of Donald W. Riegle Jr., a former Michigan senator, and then got a head start on attacking Hillary Clinton.

title: Taking Baby Steps Toward Software That Reasons Like Humans
description: Richard Socher appeared nervous as he waited for his artificial intelligence program to answer a simple question: Is the tennis player wearing a cap?

title: Islanders Withstand Rally by Rangers And Gain Ground in the Playoff Race
description: Antti Raanta stood alone in his crease as his Rangers teammates huddled at the bench during a timeout less than five minutes into Sundays game at Madison Square Garden. By that point, the Islanders had already raced to a stunning 3-0 lead.

title: Trade Group Lobbying for Plant-Based Foods Takes a Seat in Washington
description: The trade associations representing the beef, pork and poultry industries are among the most powerful lobbies in Washington. And they are about to get some company.

title: Money Pours In as Move to Stop Donald Trump Expands
description: Republicans hoping to halt Donald J. Trumps march to their partys presidential nomination emerged from the weekends voting contests newly emboldened by Mr. Trumps uneven electoral performance and by some nascent signs that he may be peaking with voters.

title: Vincent Lecavalier Relishes New Role on Kings Third Line
description: EL SEGUNDO, Calif.  For the Los Angeles Kings Vincent Lecavalier, two months removed from the first trade of his 17-year N.H.L. career, everything seems new. And for Lecavalier, that is a very good thing.

title: N.J. Transit and Unions to Continue Negotiations as Strike Looms
description: New Jersey Transit and its rail workers unions will continue negotiations on Monday in Newark, as both sides try to reach an agreement over wages and benefits before a threatened  strike on March 13.

title: The Right Wings Casting Agency, and Its Agent
description: WASHINGTON  Over the last year, the Lynde and Harry Bradley Foundation, a Milwaukee group that has financed decades of research into curbing the power of public sector unions, hired three new staff members: a fund-raiser, an administrative aide and a program officer.

title: On the Bubble for Making N.C.A.A. Tournament, but Still Living the Dream
description: LAS VEGAS  At some point, most young basketball players come to realize that success is measured by more than what prestigious conference they play in or what big-time program they suit up for. There is a lot to be said for happiness.

title: The Walking Dead Season 6, Episode 12: Cookies, Zombie Heads and a Misguided Maggie
description: Are you happy now, Maggie?

title: Vinyl Season 1, Episode 4: Its Not a Womans World
description: In the real world of 1973, female musicians were outnumbered by their male counterparts  but they have it even harder on Vinyl. While the show has featured some fleeting impressions of distaff singers to liven up the soundtrack, the action is focused on manly men singing manly songs. This episode has a rare reference to a female artist on the American Century label: Dusty Springfield, the great British soul singer most revered for the 1969 album Dusty in Memphis. Richie dismisses her as a loon, adding an obscene gerund for emphasis.

title: Review: In Eclipsed, a Captive Lupita Nyongo Is Captivating
description: The women depicted in Danai Guriras soul-searing Eclipsed, which opened on Broadway at the Golden Theater on Sunday, have lost just about everything. Their dignity, their freedom, their families, their hope. Perhaps most disturbingly, they have lost their own names, or rather tried to forget them.

title: Al Wistert, a Tenacious All-Pro Tackle for Champion Eagles Teams, Dies at 95
description: Al Wistert, a star tackle for Philadelphia Eagles teams that won two consecutive N.F.L. championship games by shutouts in the late 1940s and the last survivor of the three Wistert brothers inducted into the College Football Hall of Fame, died on Thursday in Grants Pass, Ore. He was 95.

title: The Terminator and the Washing Machine
description: What the legendary matches between supercomputer Deep Blue and chess grandmaster Garry Kasparov reveal about todays artificial intelligence and machine learning fears.

title: Smart Robots Make Strides, but Theres No Need to Flee Just Yet
description: It may not strike everyone as the loftiest ambition: creating machines that are smarter than people. Not setting the bar terribly high, is it? So the more cynical might say. All the same, an array of scientists and futurists are convinced that the advent of devices with superhuman intelligence looms in the not-distant future. The prospect fills some of our planets brainiest specimens with dread.

title: The Creator of Downton Abbey on a Finale With Room to Grow
description: As Lady Violet, the acid-tongued Dowager Countess, said of two soon-to-be married characters on Sundays finale of Downton Abbey: Theres a lot at risk, but with any luck, theyll be happy enough. Which is the English version of a happy ending.

title: Downton Abbey Finale: A Grand British Story With an American Finish
description: This recap contains spoilers for Sundays episode of Downton Abbey.

title: In Democratic Debate, Bernie Sanders Pushes Hillary Clinton on Trade and Jobs
description: FLINT, Mich.  Senator Bernie Sanders, anxious that the Democratic nomination is slipping away from him, launched a series of cutting and sarcastic attacks against Hillary Clinton over trade, welfare reform and Wall Street in a debate Sunday night that often felt like a war over Bill Clintons legacy and the moderate Democratic policies of the 1990s.

title: Transcript of the Democratic Presidential Debate in Flint, Mich.
description: Following is a transcript of the Democratic debate, as transcribed by the Federal News Service.

title: North Korea Threatens Nuclear Attack as U.S. and South Korea Begin Drills
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea on Monday threatened to launch nuclear strikes at the United States and its military bases in Northeast Asia as the United States and South Korea began one of their annual large-scale joint military exercises.

title: In The Studio | Nicolas Ghesquire of Louis Vuitton

title: Billions Season 1, Episode 7: What Makes a Bad Partnership?
description: Chuck and Wendy retire to the bedroom after a long night. Its the first time theyve seen each other since earlier that morning, and theyre dutifully exchanging Whats up? questions. Chuck casually lies about how he spent his evening; Wendy casually lies about how she spent her evening. At this point in their marriage, the lies are as routine as slipping on their pajamas  so routine that it isnt immediately obvious to the viewer that theyre lying to each other at all. Theres no hitch in their voices or calculated hitch in their strides. Theyre keeping secrets from each other betraying each other, in fact  but theres no indication this is an uncommon night. This is their marriage.

title: When Fallacies Collide

Even the most hardened cynics couldnt have imagined that the candidates would sink so low, and stay so focused on personal insults. Yet last week, offstage, there was in effect a real debate about economic policy between Donald Trump and Mitt Romney, who is trying to block his nomination.

title: Pushing the Boundaries of Free Speech in Cuba

title: Indian Point: Past Its Expiration Date

LAST month, samples showed a spike in the amount of radioactive tritium being discharged from Indian Point Energy Center into the groundwater near our homes along the Hudson River. Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo ordered several state agencies to carry out an inspection of the nuclear plant just 45 miles north of midtown Manhattan; the Nuclear Regulatory Commission also sent inspectors.

title: Philosophys True Home
description: Weve all heard the argument that philosophy is isolated, an ivory tower discipline cut off from virtually every other progress-making pursuit of knowledge, including math and the sciences, as well as from the actual concerns of daily life. The reasons given for this are many. In a widely read essay in this series, When Philosophy Lost Its Way, Robert Frodeman and Adam Briggle claim that it was philosophys institutionalization in the university in the late 19th century that separated it from the study of humanity and nature, now the province of social and natural sciences.

title: Old Mutual Says It Hasnt Decided on Strategic Review

title: British Lender Metro Bank Rises 4 Percent in London Debut

title: Gangster Warlords and Narconomics
description: In January, at least nine people were shot to death in Mexicos Guerrero state during a traditional coming-out party for a 15-year-old girl. Many victims of drug-related violence in Mexico ceased a long time ago to have any apparent connection with the trade. In 2014, members of a drug cartel along with local police abducted and presumably killed 43 student teachers for no discernible reason other than they were preparing to demonstrate against the lamentable state of education in their region.

title: The Ancient Minstrel, by Jim Harrison
description: Katherine Anne Porter argued (or at least asserted) that novella is a slack, boneless, affected word that we do not need to describe anything; her stern yet vague taxonomy recognized only short stories, long stories, short novels, novels. But writers who work in that Venn diagrammatic long story/short novel zone can find reassurance, if not absolute definitional clarity, in this term for something thats neither a malnourished novel nor an overstuffed story: a genre of its own, distinguished less by length, perhaps, than by the scope or complexity of the narrative. (Id call Melvilles 14,000-plus-word Bartleby a novella  he called it a tale  and Joyces The Dead, some 1,500 words longer, a story.) Certainly Jim Harrison isnt sniffy about the word  in fact, Jim Harrison isnt sniffy about much  and since his first collection of novellas, the 1979 Legends of the Fall, he has done as much as any living writer to demonstrate the validity and vitality of the form.

A large proportion of the club and the student left in Oxford more generally have some kind of problem with Jews, he said in a statement.

title: Morning Agenda: Court to Hear Law Graduates Suit Against Her School
description: COURT TO HEAR LAW GRADUATES SUIT AGAINST HER SCHOOL | Five years after suing the Thomas Jefferson School of Law in San Diego over the accuracy of its employment data, Anna Alaburda, one of the schools former students, will get her day in court,  Elizabeth Olson writes in DealBook. This is not the first time a disgruntled student has sued a law school over publicly listed alumni employment rates, claiming that law schools were counting part-time waitress and other full-time jobs outside the legal field as employment. Those cases often were dismissed because judges contended that law school students should have known that a job as a lawyer was not guaranteed. Only Ms. Alaburda has been successful in getting her case to a trial, thanks to Californias strong consumer protection laws.

title: The Always Hungry Teenage Boy

Those always hungry growing boys who eat standing up, drain the quart containers of milk or juice, and are fully capable of finishing off as an after-school snack the whole lasagna or pot of stew or cold roast beef that was supposed to serve as dinner for the family. I have come home to this myself: the teenager who greets his parents in the evening with an empty refrigerator, a sink full of dirty dishes, and the hopeful question, Whats for dinner?

As with many series, a house visual style was established early on, with specific guidelines on what Michael Engler  who directed the series finale  described as tonal sensibilities. Mr. Engler, who has worked on Sex and the City, The West Wing Six Feet Under and 30 Rock, spoke about working on the final season in an interview in May at Highclere Castle, where much of Downton Abbey was shot, then more recently on the phone. These are edited excerpts from the conversations.

description: Is it time for new costumes in the long-running improv act featuring doctor and patient? The white coat and the cotton gown are tattered, under continual assault for their practical deficiencies and outmoded symbolism.

title: Ali Babas Cave
description: This weeks puzzle was suggested by Kenneth Kong, a TV personality in Singapore. Kenneth had a moment of global fame about a year ago after sharing the Cheryls Birthday problem, a simple challenge that went wildly viral (covered in Numberplay here). The problem generated quite a storm on Twitter, including suggestions for more puzzles. I asked Kenneth if he had a favorite, and he pointed to a suggestion by Igor Diev, who introduces his puzzlethis way: Frankly speaking, the task of #cherylsbirthday youve showed the world is rather easy and its a shame to be unable to solve it. Let me give you a task that Russian 14-year-old students solve. Thats what should really blow your mind.

title: If Britain Leaves E.U., Some Fear France Would Stop Blocking Migrants at Calais

title: Ten Celebrated Chefs Contributions to a Brand-New Kitchen
description: When chef Timothy Hollingsworth was conceptualizing Otium, the new restaurant that is part of the Broad Museum in downtown Los Angeles, the former chef de cuisine of French Laundry made a request of colleagues and friends who have been influential in his career  in order to create a sense of soul and bring my past into Otium, as he puts it. He sent out a letter before the restaurant opened last fall: I would like you to send in any pots or pans, a serving vessel of sorts, to Otium for display and possibly use, it read.
