In this culinary minuet, France has always led by bestowing its food and wines on an island it deems gastronomically benighted, and Britain has shown its gratitude by revering French cooking more than any European country aside from Belgium and maybe Switzerland.

title: In Old Town Key West, a Hotel with Artsy Aspirations
description: Standard rooms start at $399.

title: The Classic Pilot's Watch, Updated
description: These four modern timepieces feature conveniently oversize numbers and crowns.

title: Lamb Stew Offers a Glimpse of Spring
description: All around the Mediterranean, lamb is the meat of choice, prepared in lots of ways: roasted on the bone, threaded on skewers and grilled, turned over a spit, stewed with wine and herbs, or turned into tantalizing soups or spicy sausages.

title: The Fashion News to Know This Week
description: Que sera, Bouchra?

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn and Manhattan
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in New York City:

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are on the Upper East Side, in Murray Hill, and in Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn.

title: Anthology TV Can Draw Higher-Level Actors, FX Executive Says
description: Last week, FX announced that it had picked up Trust, a new limited series from Danny Boyle, the acclaimed director of Slumdog Millionaire and Steve Jobs. The 10-episode season will be about the kidnapping of the oil fortune heir John Paul Getty III.

title: Bernie Sanders Hones Anti-Trade Message for Illinois and Ohio
description: The Bernie Sanders campaign is bringing the anti-trade message that helped score an upset win in Michigan to the airwaves in two crucial states in the industrial Midwest that vote on Tuesday.

title: The Rams Can Go Home Again, to the 93-Year-Old Los Angeles Coliseum
description: LOS ANGELES  On a hazy afternoon last week at Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum, the grass was being mowed, as it is every two or three days. A location scout was studying the long staircases for use in a commercial. A guide led a tour along the tunnel that Olympians, Rams, Chargers, Raiders, Dodgers, U.C.L.A. Bruins and U.S.C. Trojans have passed through to enter the field.

title: Marco Rubio Aide Urges Supporters to Back John Kasich in Ohio
description: A top aide to Senator Marco Rubio on Friday urged his supporters in Ohio to back Gov. John Kasich in that states primary on Tuesday, giving fresh momentum to efforts to stop Donald J. Trump a day after a debate in which his rivals declined to take a swing at the leading Republican presidential candidate.

title: Tom Sachss Workshop: Willy Wonka Would Approve
description: A visitor entering the Tom Sachs Studio is asked to pose for an instant photo, which is then laminated into a fake Swiss passport. The ritual is only one reason a newcomer feels he has entered a foreign country  or a teenage boys clubhouse.

title: Shari Redstone Prepares for Battle to Control a Media Empire
description: Shari Redstone pulls her iPhone out of her purse to show off just one picture of her grandchildren. She laughs then apologizes when she sees that the back of the phone is covered with heart-shaped stickers  the result of a craft session with the two youngsters.

title: Test of Zika-Fighting Genetically Engineered Mosquitoes Gets Tentative F.D.A. Approval
description: The federal government on Friday moved to clear the way for the release of genetically engineered mosquitoes into the wild for the first time in the United States, tentatively approving a field test that might help slow the spread of the Zika virus.

title: Starving Public Education
description: While most of us are focused on presidential politics  with good reason, to be sure  much of the work of government, for good and for ill, is done at the state and local level. In most cases, these days, that means Republican politicians are calling the shots; but there are some big states where Democrats still hold sway, and its really important for progressive values that these Democrats set a positive example about what good government can do.

title: My 10 Favorite Books: Miranda July
description: For his bookshop and website One Grand Books, the editor Aaron Hicklin asked people to name the 10 books theyd take with them if they were marooned on a desert island. The next in the series is the writer and T contributor Miranda July, who shares her list exclusively with T.

title: Daylight Saving Time: Why Does It Exist? (Its Not for Farming)
description: (This article has been updated.)

title: Inside Charles Finchs BAFTA Party
description: The British businessman throws an annual star-studded dinner. Now, hes compiled highlights into a new book, out this month.

title: How to Throw a Party You Wont Want to Leave
description: When the businessman Charles Finch threw his first BAFTA party at Lolas in Greater London in 1999, people showed up, he recalls, because nobody really had anywhere else to go. But in the years since, his annual dinner  now held at Annabels on the eve of the BAFTAs, with a crew of regulars that includes Cate Blanchett, Harvey Weinstein and Mick Jagger  has come to be regarded as one of the most intimate, cozy and fun parties of the year.

title: A Smaller Down Payment, and No Mortgage Insurance Required
description: It was a year of firsts: In 2015, Kristian and Michele Klein welcomed their first child, a daughter, and bought their first home  a freshly renovated four-bedroom Cape Cod in Glen Head, N.Y.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: The Profiteers
description: This week, Sally Denton talks about The Profiteers; Alexandra Alter has news from the literary world; Jack Viertel discusses The Secret Life of the American Musical; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

title: South by Southwest, by the Numbers
description: Since its humble beginnings as a showcase for local musicians in 1987, South by Southwest (or South by, to its attendees) has exploded into a multigenre behemoth, encompassing not only music performances but film screenings and technology panels. For 10 days each March, hundreds of thousands of pass-holders descend upon downtown Austin, hoping to share patio space with their favorite indie rockers or drink third wave coffee with Silicon Valley entrepreneurs. In the process, theyve transformed the capital of Texas from a quirky college town into a tech mecca with soaring property values and an eye on the future. (Naturally, as the festival has ballooned in size and prominence, the experience can skew a little corporate.) As SXSW kicks off its 29th incarnation this Friday, we look back at the bands, brands and barbecue that have helped shape Americas biggest networking spectacle.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review Podcast: The Profiteers
description: Listen to this weeks podcast | Subscribe: iTunes | Stitcher

title: Two Donald Trumps Emerge, the Public One and the Private One
description: PALM BEACH, Fla.  I think there are two Donald Trumps, said the first version of Donald J. Trump, addressing reporters at a news conference at Mar-a-Lago, his club where he was endorsed by his former Republican presidential rival Ben Carson on Friday.

title: Cleveland Browns Release Johnny Manziel After Two Troubled Seasons
description: Two years after drafting him in the first round, the Cleveland Browns cut Johnny Manziel on Friday, in the wake of his many problems both on and off the field.

title: In South Sudan, City of Hope Is Now City of Fear
description: JUBA, South Sudan  Diu Tut glanced up at the gates of the displaced persons camp where he lives and shook his head.

title: Condos on a West Village Triangle
description: The first design for the building was too industrial-looking. The second was too glassy. But the third was just right.

title: On Selection Day, There Are Metrics, and Then There Are Advanced Metrics
description: The Rating Percentage Index, an official N.C.A.A. statistic, is the most prominent metric that the mens basketball selection committee uses to fill out the annual N.C.A.A. tournament bracket, which will be released Sunday. Entering the weekend, Wichita State was a lukewarm 46th in the index.

title: Is It Really A.D.H.D. or Just Immaturity?
description: New research shows that the youngest students in a classroom are more likely to be given a diagnosis of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder than the oldest. The findings raise questions about how we regard those wiggly children who just cant seem to sit still  and who also happen to be the youngest in their class.

title: With Black Ops Laser Tag, Going to War (and Off the iPad)
description: Years had passed since Edgard El Chaars retirement from the United States Army, but on a recent Sunday the former major, now a dentist, found himself back on the battlefield. Sweat trickled down his brow as Dr. El Chaar, 46, wove through barrels of radioactive waste and into enemy territory. Then, sensing his combatants vulnerability, he raised his firearm and pulled the trigger.

title: Committee to Draft Paul Ryan for President Shuts Down
description: That was a quick draft effort.

title: Cecil Beaton Is Back in a Big Way
description: Among defunct tastemakers, few rival Cecil Beaton, who died in 1980 at 76, as a continuing commercial franchise.

title: Obama, at South by Southwest, Calls for Law Enforcement Access in Encryption Fight
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  President Obama said Friday that law enforcement must be legally able to collect information from smartphones and other electronic devices, making clear, despite disagreement within his administration, that he opposes the stance on encryption taken by technology companies like Apple.

title: Murdered for Activism in Honduras
description: Oakland, Calif.  It was always a relief to see my aunt Berta, whom we affectionately called Bertita. Not just because of the constant threats to her life, but because she was a rayo de luna  a ray of moonlight  in any situation.

title: When Gene Tests for Breast Cancer Reveal Grim Data but No Guidance
description: At a time when genetic testing and genetically personalized treatments for cancer are proliferating, buoyed by new resources like President Obamas $215 million personalized medicine initiative, women with breast cancer are facing a frustrating reality: The genetic data is there, but in many cases, doctors do not know what to do with it.

title: House of Cards Season 4, Episode 11: An Odd Threesome
description: After the energetic, momentous back-to-back episodes that focused on the intrigue of the Democratic National Convention, this chapter of House of Cards feels as if its treading water. Without the will Claire get the vice-presidential nomination or wont she? suspense that has fueled much of the season, things suddenly feel less focused. During a conversation with Cathy Durant and the Joint Chiefs in this episode, Frank refers to the advance of the terrorist group ICO as a serpents path, which is an apt description for the plots and subplots in this episode.

title: Donald Trumps Greatest Hits Against Ben Carson
description: Donald J. Trump and Ben Carson buried the hatchet on Friday as Mr. Carson endorsed the Manhattan businessman, proclaiming him the best person to be Americas next president. Mr. Trump said that the tough attacks he once leveled at Mr. Carson were just politics, and Mr. Carson agreed that forgiveness was the way forward.

title: At Nancy Reagans Funeral, Honoring the Queen of a Republican Camelot
description: SIMI VALLEY, Calif.  Nancy Reagan was celebrated at her funeral at the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library on Friday, closing a chapter of history revered by conservatives as the Republican Camelot.

title: Inventgenuity Festival: A Design and Engineering Fair for Children
description: No matter how creative or powerful the technology, nature can often get the better of it. That happened about two months ago, when the Jan. 23 blizzard forced the cancellation of the Inventgenuity Festival, the seventh annual Brooklyn design and engineering fair for artistic and tech-minded children 7 and older.

title: An Upper East Side Penthouse for $31 Million
description: A triplex penthouse atop a new condominium conversion on the Upper East Side, just a block from Central Park, with three terraces and a private roof deck, sold for $31,000,000 and was the most expensive closed sale of the week, according to city records.

title: BP to End Sponsorship of Tate Museums
description: LONDON  BP has decided to end its 26-year sponsorship of the Tate group of art museums, one of Britains most high-profile cultural institutions, the energy giant and Tate said on Friday.

title: A Ted Cruz-Carly Fiorina Ticket? Not So Fast
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  How would Ted Cruz feel about Vice President Carly Fiorina?

title: Death in Texas: An Officers Odyssey
description: Euless, Tex., a suburb of Fort Worth, is a town of about 54,000 people, with a low rate of poverty, an average home-to-work travel time of 23 minutes, Italian restaurants and Thai restaurants and 18 parks. A few years ago it attracted the interest of David Hofer, a young police officer in Manhattans Ninth Precinct, in the East Village, who was researching places where he might live and begin a family that werent quite as noisy as New York, or as expensive, or as alienated from the natural world. Early in 2014, he joined the Euless Police Department; his girlfriend moved to Texas with him. They got engaged and bought a house.

title: Nancy Reagans Abiding Role in her Husbands Career
description: In retrospect, it seems clear that Ronald and Nancy Reagan were not only one of the great married couples of American history, but also one of its great career partnerships. By the time she became first lady, Nancy Reagan had grown immensely from the new wife of March 1952 who was trying to help her 41-year-old bridegroom onto his feet as he reeled from professional setbacks.

title: Chinas Censors Denounced in Online Attack
description: BEIJING  Chinas formidable propaganda apparatus came under renewed attack on Friday, when a denunciation spread online in the name of an employee of Xinhua, the main state-run news agency. The letter accused censors of using tactics reminiscent of Maoist times to silence and smear critics.

title: A Dance Project With Fashion, Literary and Indie-Rock Cred
description: Forget whirling and twirling  theres nothing dainty about Repercussion, the first full-length dance work by Boomerang, a burgeoning dance and performance project that since its inception in 2012 has garnered attention from all corners of the industry. Repercussion was developed by Boomerangs co-directors Kora Radella and Matty Davis in a slew of residencies, and final tweaks took place at the Watermill Center this past summer; its celebrated director, Robert Wilson, called the piece brilliant and exceptionally strong.

title: A Push for Less Expensive Hearing Aids
description: I know my television is too loud.

title: A Powerful Collective Rooting for You: On Vin Diesels Facebook
description: Welcome to Social Capital, a series devoted to analyzing the social-media presences of celebrities.

title: A Student of History, Jerry Dipoto Hopes to Make Some of His Own in Seattle
description: PEORIA, Ariz.  When Jerry Dipoto pitched in the major leagues, as a reliever for three teams from 1993 to 2000, he was widely known among players for his vast memorabilia collection.

title: Possible Gas Pipeline Deal Could Spur Others
description: A possible deal with a gas pipeline company is signaling a thaw in mergers and acquisitions in the energy market.

title: Bernie Sanders Sees Michigan Win as a Springboard to the Nomination
description: MIAMI  Convinced that his surprising victory in Michigan represented a turning point, Senator Bernie Sanders and his advisers are maneuvering and spending aggressively to pull off a huge upset on Tuesday  a victory in the Ohio primary  by focusing on Hillary Clintons past support for trade deals that are deeply unpopular in the Midwest and other key states in his updated battle plans.

title: Met Operas Credit Rating Left Unchanged by Moodys
description: The Metropolitan Opera is seeing some softness in box office revenue this year compared to what it had budgeted, but continues to benefit from uncommonly high donor support, Moodys Investors Service said in a report issued Friday.

title: At Brooklyn Navy Yard, the Quiet Before the Hum
description: In an article about the Brooklyn Navy Yard last fall, Chris Terrell, a wine importer, described what it was like to run a business inside the 300-acre walled industrial park. Its literally like working in a federal prison, he said, referring to the security checkpoints. If thats your fetish, get there quickly, because the rusted old shipyard, which New York City bought from the federal government in 1966, is rapidly going the way of the rest of Brooklyn, with a small-batch distillery and rooftop farm already in place and a cavernous food hall featuring an outpost of Russ & Daughters, a purveyor of smoked fish and Jewish delicacies, on the way. The yard, which has long been closed to everyone but employees and their guests, is in the process of opening up, with more than 300 industrial tenants currently humming and promises of wider public access in the near future. If you hand-slice Nova, they will come.

title: Jack Gibbs Shines Brightly in Stephen Currys Shadow
description: This week, Jack Gibbs engaged in a heated argument with his teammates about the propercolor of fire hydrants. Gibbs, a junior guard at Davidson, was so certain of his stance that he posted a poll on Twitter. In a near landslide, voters sided with him.

title: Home Sales Around the New York Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Revisiting St. Patricks Day 1869 at the Tenement Museum
description: Q. Id like to do something more the week of St. Patricks Day than watch a parade. Would you know of any Manhattan tour focusing on Irish-American history?

title: How Did Siri Respond?
description: Researchers asked Siri a series of questions to see how it responded.

title: The Actress Patti Murin Takes On Broadway Chat Board
description: A Broadway actress has taken the rare step of publicly challenging the tone of anonymous online comment boards where theater lovers exchange news, gossip and opinions, often with a heavy dose of snark.

title: Pictures of the Day: The United States and Elsewhere
description: The United States and More  Photos of the Day

title: The Falafel King of Astoria
description: Once upon a time there was a big, jovial king in Queens whose subjects lined up at his falafel cart in Astoria.

title: March 11, 2016  Photos of the Day
description: Photos from the United States, Syria, Spain and Greece.

title: Jeff McCarthy: Actor, Artist, Beast, Beauty
description: The sounds of suburbia are music to the actor Jeff McCarthys ears.

title: What I Love | Jeff McCarthy
description: The actor, who plays a transgender woman in the musical Southern Comfort at the Public Theater, lives in West Orange, N.J.

title: For the Expat or the Local
description: Books, manga and Japanese ephemera abound at Kinokuniya.

title: Turning Japanese at Kinokuniya in Midtown Manhattan
description: Cleo Fleming was spending her lunch hour on a recent Tuesday browsing the fiction section at Kinokuniya, a bookstore opposite Bryant Park. You can find the latest in American pop culture on its display tables: Lena Dunhams Not That Kind of Girl, Aziz Ansaris Modern Romance, Allie Broshs Hyperbole and a Half. But while Kinokuniya has the bright design of a chic New York bookstore, it also feels very much apart from Midtown Manhattan.

title: How Barry Rohrssen, a Basketball Coach, Spends His Sundays
description: If Barry Rohrssen, 55, the associate head coach for mens basketball at St. Johns University in Queens, seems a bit preoccupied this weekend, its probably because hes following the news of who will be invited to the big dance, as the N.C.A.A. tournament is called. (St. Johns will be sitting this one out.) You might also spot him at church or grocery shopping in the Riverdale section of the Bronx, where he lives with his fiance, Kerry Parker, 33. Mr. Rohrssen, who is nicknamed Slice, had a minor acting role in the 1992 film Glengarry Glen Ross. He said New York is one of the few towns where you can do something like that; where else do you have opportunities to be a coach and be in a film?

title: General Motors to Buy Cruise Automation in Push for Self-Driving Cars
description: DETROIT  General Motors on Friday said that it was acquiring the software firm Cruise Automation as part of its larger effort to develop fully autonomous vehicles.

title: For Donald Trump, Friends in Few Places
description: Last month Donald J. Trump  told a crowd in New Hampshire that he would happily annoy his wealthy friends if it meant getting big money out of politics. I have no friends, as far as Im concerned, he said. You know who my friends are? Youre my friends.

title: The Superior Social Skills of Bilinguals
description: BEING bilingual has some obvious advantages. Learning more than one language enables new conversations and new experiences. But in recent years, psychology researchers have demonstrated some less obvious advantages of bilingualism, too. For instance, bilingual children may enjoy certain cognitive benefits, such as improved executive function  which is critical for problem solving and other mentally demanding activities.

title: How Broadway Actors Stay Healthy
description: Broadway actors share details on how they keep their bodies  and voices  in shape.

title: Cancer Drug Dosing
description: To the Editor:

title: A Few Ways Around Mortgage Insurance
description: Here are several mortgage options for borrowers with smaller down payments, some with and some without mortgage insurance.

title: David M. Gates Dies at 94; Sounded Early Alarm on Environmental Perils
description: David M. Gates, an ecologist who sounded early warnings that fossil fuels, fertilizers and pesticides posed a potentially fatal threat to the global environment, died on March 4 in Ann Arbor, Mich. He was 94.

title: How Toothless Regulation Makes Raising Secret Campaign Money Easier
description: Considering the torrent of political money flowing through Washington, fundraisers from both parties must be rejoicing as the campaign finance industry feasts on the presidential contests. Particularly since two supposed watchdog agencies, the Federal Election Commission and Internal Revenue Service, have just presented fresh evidence of how feeble their oversight has become.

title: Anti-Gay-Rights Legislation
description: To the Editor:

title: On the Waterfront
description: The Brooklyn Navy Yard, which has long been closed to everyone but employees and their guests, is in the process of opening up.

title: Friday Not Music: President Benson, From Hot Shots
description: Seems appropriate given the times. If I recall correctly, all female characters in Part Deux had the middle name Rodham.

title: On the Couch, or Off: Candidates and Therapists
description: To the Editor:

title: The Tone and the Content of the Republican Debate
description: To the Editor:

title: Raise the Minimum Wage to $15?
description: To the Editor:

title: Michelle Fields Police Report
description: Earlier this week, a reporter for the website Breitbart News said that she had been dragged down by the arm as she was asking Donald Trump a question at a campaign event at the Trump National Golf Club in Jupiter, Fla.

title: Breitbart Journalist Files Police Report Alleging Battery at Trump Event
description: Earlier this week, a reporter for the website Breitbart News said that she had been dragged down by the arm as she was asking Donald Trump a question at a campaign event at the Trump National Golf Club in Jupiter, Fla.

title: War Horse Closes in Britain, but Its Influence Gallops On
description: LONDON  After seven years in the West End here, War Horse is onto its final furlong. Just after 10 p.m. on Saturday, its equine star, Joey  that magnificent puppet  will gallop offstage at the New London Theater for the last time. Some 2.7 million people will have cheered him on there, but War Horse has been a global success, seen by nearly seven million worldwide. It has changed the National Theater, which opened it in 2007  and arguably British theater as a whole  dramatically.

title: Sterling Rubys Clothing (Yes, Clothing) Designs Go on Display
description: Though some may think that Sterling Rubys relationship to clothing design hinges entirely on Raf Simons, his ongoing collaborator, it actually all began when the L.A.-based multidisciplinary artist (whose output spans painting, ceramics and video) was just 12 or 13  when his mother gave him a sewing machine. I remember her being upset with me because I kept bending her bobbin and needle clamp, Ruby says. I was always trying to run thick upholstery-like material through her machine. He liked to deconstruct clothes, cutting off the sleeves and collars, patching them back together, then adding hand-painted and stenciled materials, and pulled inspiration from the punk scene. (Although Ruby grew up on a farm in Pennsylvania, his parents allowed him to slip off to Baltimore and Washington, D.C. for concerts, as long as he made it to school in the mornings.) He mentions seeing H.R. from Bad Brains in denim and Black Flags Greg Ginn, who favored Oxford shirts, and Henry Rollins, in only his running shorts. Ruby says he was really just a kid, thinking that there was power in the way people dressed.

title: Angolan President, in Power Nearly Four Decades, Says Hell Step Down
description: DAKAR, Senegal  The president of Angola, Jos Eduardo dos Santos, one of Africas longest-ruling leaders, announced on Friday that he would step down from office in 2018.

title: Review: Philharmonic Takes on the Turangalla-Symphonie
description: Before conducting the New York Philharmonic in Messiaens Turangalla-Symphonie on Thursday night, Esa-Pekka Salonen assured the audience that he did not want to tell anyone how to listen to this sprawling, ecstatic madness, as he described this stunning piece, completed in 1948. Instead, he just wanted to explain how he heard it. Then later, he added, We can compare notes.

title: The Times on the Air: Brazil, Trump, Ad Blockers and More
description: Over the past week, New York Times reporters, columnists and executives participated in interviews about their coverage and other top news stories. Below are some radio highlights.

title: Review: Echoes of Flamenco From Orchestra of St. Lukes
description: The Andalusian composer Manuel de Falla was inspired by Gypsy music when he wrote his ballet El Amor Brujo (The Bewitched Love), although today the flamenco vocal line is usually rendered by a classically-trained mezzo-soprano. Pablo Heras-Casado, principal conductor of the Orchestra of St. Lukes, also from Spains Andalusian region, prefers hewing to the composers original vision, and so, in a concert on Thursday at Carnegie Hall, he paired the gritty voice of the flamenco singer Marina Heredia  with the polished, smoothly-sensual sound of the orchestra.

title: Review: In Brodsky/Baryshnikov, One Friend Recalls Another
description: I have never felt a particular desire to learn Russian, wonderful though it would be to read, say, Chekhov in the original language. But Im sure it would have enhanced my enjoyment of Brodsky/Baryshnikov, a theater piece that, as the title makes clear, features the former ballet star Mikhail Baryshnikov reciting, in Russian, selections from the poetry of Joseph Brodsky.

title: Ben H. Bagdikian, Reporter of Broad Range and Conscience, Dies at 96
description: Ben H. Bagdikian, a journalist and news media critic who became a celebrated voice of conscience for his profession, calling for tougher standards of integrity and public service in an era of changing tastes and technology, died on Friday at his home in Berkeley, Calif. He was 96.

title: Review: New Order, Still a Clockworks of Suppressed Emotion
description: New Order got started in 1980 amid personal and political turmoil, reacting thoroughly against both.

title: Review: Farruquito, Flamenco From a Soaring Eagle
description: The flamenco dancer Farruquito returned to New York on Thursday, after an absence of 13 years, like a king reclaiming his realm. Within moments, he proved that he is one of todays superlative dance artists. Hes slender, handsome, taut; he transfixed attention just by standing, walking, raising an arm. In simple passages, he demonstrated stunning effects of contrast. Taking the City Center stage three times during a 90-minute program shared with the guest dancer Gema Moneo and seven musicians, he built each solo to peaks of rich rhythmic brilliance.

title: The Ensembles of Miles Davis Epitomized Cool
description: Midway through Miles Ahead, the soon-to-be-released movie about Miles Davis, directed by and starring Don Cheadle, the famously irascible musician tells a freelance writer (played by Ewan McGregor) in a dowdy corduroy blazer, Youre not driving me around looking like that no more.

title: My Fathers Killers Funeral
description: ON Feb. 29  a bad day for anniversaries  Pakistan executed my fathers killer.

title: Review: And Then There Were None, a Classic Murder Case Revived
description: And Then There Were None  the alternate name of the 1939 Agatha Christie novel Ten Little _____  stands out among her work for more than its startlingly racist original title. Its a mystery without a detective, no Hercule Poirot or Miss Marple to make sense of things  just 10 people trapped on an island, being murdered one by one per the instructions of a macabre nursery rhyme.

title: Autodesk Chooses Peace With Activist Investors
description: SAN FRANCISCO  While activist battles at other technology companies appear to be heating up, what looked like a potential fight brewing at Autodesk has instead ended quietly.

title: Jenrry Mejias Lawyer and M.L.B. Trade Charges Over Doping Ban
description: A lawyer representing Jenrry Mejia, the Mets pitcher who was permanently barred from Major League Baseball for failing three drug tests, said Friday that baseball used unscrupulous tactics in its handling of his doping offenses.

title: Unearthing an Old Reptilian Relative of Dinosaurs
description: A quarter of a billion years ago nearly all life on Earth vanished in a cataclysmic event known today as the Great Dying.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week.

title: Rita Wilson Takes Over a Record Store
description: Rita Wilson walked into Bleecker Street Records and headed for the counter.

title: Jets, Lacking Fitzpatrick, Meet With Robert Griffin III
description: The Jets want to re-sign Ryan Fitzpatrick, who has said he wants to re-sign with them. But with negotiations at an impasse, the Jets are not waiting around for him.

title: Antique Dealers Protest New 1stdibs Rules
description: On Tuesday evening, a sign was placed in the window of Lost City Arts, a high-end vintage design store in Lower Manhattan, saying the shop was closing early. Inside, 30 of the citys top antiques dealers had gathered for a tense, hastily arranged meeting. Other dealers dialed in from Texas and California to hear the proceedings.

title: Review: In The Perfect Match, Weddings, Babies and One Bachelor Holdout
description: While its title suggests a narrower focus, The Perfect Match is largely an ensemble rom-com, and a pretty enjoyable one. Set in a youngish, upscale circle of Los Angeles, the movie sees five old friends negotiating standard life and lifestyle challenges. The scenarios and their attendant psychologies are utterly conventional, but the characters and cast are appealing in equal measure.

title: Hillary Clinton Lauds Reagans on AIDS. A Backlash Erupts.
description: In the days since her death on Sunday, Nancy Reagan has been praised for her work on a range of causes, from preventing drug abuse to supporting research into Alzheimers.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing: Donald Trump, Nancy Reagan, Barack Obama
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Artists Grapple With Americas Prison System
description: For several weeks in February and March, the Whitney Museums fifth-floor gallery has been drenched in the slamming of gates, the rattling of keys and the bellowing of prisoners and guards. The artist Andrea Fraser recorded the sounds at Sing Sing, the infamous prison 34 miles up the Hudson River, then fed them into a gallery thats roughly the same size as the prisons A Block.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: With Optimism Waning, Marco Rubios Campaign Labors On in Florida
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.  This is what the political equivalent of hospice care looks like.

title: As Americans Take Up Populism, the Supreme Court Embraces Business
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court vacancy created by the death of Justice Antonin Scalia highlights a growing rift between the country and the nations highest court on questions of economic power and support for big business.

title: Europe Tries to Shut Down Routes as Migrant Flow Intensifies
description: European leaders announced an agreement this week aimed at stopping the flow of migrants trying to reach Europe through the Balkans. In January and February, more than 123,000 migrants landed in Greece, compared with about 4,600 in the same period last year.

title: Federal Agents Raid Christies, Seizing 2 Ancient Sculptures
description: The calendar for Asia Week in New York City, an observance dedicated to art from the region, included events on Friday at the Japan Society, the Metropolitan Museum of Art and Tibet House. But one unscheduled incident occurred in the morning: Federal agents raided Christies to seize what they said were stolen antiquities that were to have been sold as part of the festivities.

title: Stalin, Russias New Hero
description: Penza, Russia  AT School No. 58 in Penza, a regional capital that is an eight and a half hour drive southeast of Moscow, the jury is still out on Joseph Stalin.

title: Emoji Feminism
description: RECENTLY, upon notice that shed received tenure, I texted a close friend to offer my congratulations. Later, I knew, wed meet for drinks and celebration, but the day was early and I was thrilled, imagining her pleasure in her hard-won achievement.

title: N.J. Transit Reaches Tentative Deal With Rail Workers, Averting a Strike
description: NEWARK  New Jersey Transit reached a tentative agreement with its rail workers on Friday night to avoid a strike that could have paralyzed commuting into New York City, officials said.

title: Nan Vasconcelos, Daring Brazilian Percussionist, Dies at 71
description: Nan Vasconcelos, a Brazilian percussionist whose stylistic daring and freewheeling experimentalism made him a sought-after collaborator with artists as varied as the Argentine jazz saxophonist Gato Barbieri and the Talking Heads, died on Wednesday in Recife, Brazil. He was 71.

title: Bernie Sanders Praises Ruling Allowing 17-Year-Olds to Vote in Ohio
description: A group of 17-year-olds in Ohio has successfully persuaded a state judge to allow them to vote in the states primary on Tuesday.

title: Mass Market Edition of To Kill a Mockingbird to End
description: For decades, Harper Lees To Kill a Mockingbird has been a staple in schools across the country, sparking countless classroom discussions about complex issues like race and social justice. But its long legacy in classrooms could be threatened by a recent decision to discontinue a popular paperback edition.

title: Bill Cunningham | Cure for the Cold
description: New York City experienced the magic of a drastic weather change last week. From Monday to Thursday, New Yorkers had their first break from winters grip as the city took on a springlike appearance. By the fourth day, it was more like summer. Women and men came out of their winter cocoons like butterflies in light, colorful clothes. Legs were bared. Some men were nattily dressed, but the majority just stripped down to open-neck shirts. The parks were a magnet for lunchtime throngs.

title: Evening Hours | A Flower Show and Fundraisers
description: Mr. Cunningham covers events in March.

title: U.S. Finds More Possible Victims in Hacking of Celebrities Email Accounts
description: A federal prosecutor in Manhattan said on Friday that investigators were continuing to learn of possible new victims in the case of a Bahamian man accused of hacking into the email accounts of celebrities and others to obtain and sell stolen scripts of unreleased movies, sexually explicit videos and personal information like passport and Social Security numbers.

title: Are as Many Civilians Dying in South Sudan as in Syria?
description: The answer is we dont know, because the data arent reliable, especially for South Sudan. But as I write in my column, its possible  and thats staggering considering how little attention South Sudan has received. The Tyndall Report says that television network evening news programs provided zero coverage of South Sudans civil war in 2015.

title: U.S. Rebukes Iran Over Missile Tests, Calling Them Provocative
description: The United States rebuked Iran on Friday over a series of provocative and destabilizing ballistic missile tests this week and all but accused the Iranians of having violated a United Nations Security Council resolution that calls on them to refrain from such acts.

title: Donald Trumps Rally in Chicago Canceled After Violent Scuffles
description: CHICAGO  With thousands of people already packed into stands and music blaring to warm up the crowd, Donald J. Trumps campaign abruptly canceled his rally here on Friday night over security concerns as protesters clashed with his supporters inside an arena where he was to speak.

title: States Move to Control How Painkillers Are Prescribed
description: A growing number of states, alarmed by the rising death toll from prescription painkillers and frustrated by a lack of federal action, are moving to limit how these drugs are prescribed.

title: In It to Win It, Says Phil Jackson, Vowing Knicks Revival
description: LOS ANGELES  As questions about the direction of the struggling Knicks continued to hound the organization, Phil Jackson, the teams president, held a rare discussion with the news media on Friday morning to address a host of festering concerns.

title: Man Accused in Anti-Islam Cartoon Attack Awaits Verdict
description: PHOENIX  Jurors on Friday began deliberating the fate of a Muslim convert accused of financing, training and motivating the two men who tried to attack an exhibit of anti-Islam cartoons last year in Texas. The assault was thwarted, leaving the gunmen dead after a shootout with the police.

title: Peace Event Hosts Wives of South Sudan Leaders Tied to Rape
description: UNITED NATIONS  Two rivals for power in South Sudan are accused by the United Nations of not only drawing their people into one of the worlds most gruesome wars, but also subjecting the countrys women and girls to unspeakable horrors.

title: After Diatribe by Goose Gossage, He and Yankees Clear the Air
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Goose Gossage still wears his fearsome mustache  it is just white now  and carries himself around the Yankees clubhouse during spring training with the same body language that made him one of baseballs more intimidating presences during the late 1970s and early 80s.

title: White House Backs Off From Obamas Critique of Cameron
description: WASHINGTON  In his much-discussed interview with The Atlantic magazine, President Obama unloaded on a number of American allies: Britain, France, Turkey, Saudi Arabia, and other Persian Gulf countries. On Friday, a White House official walked back Mr. Obamas comments about the closest of the allies, Britain, and its prime minister, David Cameron.

title: Newark School Officials Knew of Lead Risks, 2014 Memo Shows
description: In August 2014, as 35,000 students prepared to return to Newarks public schools, Keith Barton, the managing director of operations for the district, sent a memo with an urgent message to all principals, custodians and building managers: Before anyone drank from the water fountains, they should run the water for at least 30 seconds.

title: A Reluctant Barkeep, Mourned on the Brooklyn Streets That Called Him Home
description: The thing about Sunny Balzano was you couldnt stop him from talking, but you didnt ever want to. He just had stories to tell and stories to tell and stories to tell. And you listened, mesmerized, chuckling along while quaffing your second or third or 13th drink in his bar, Sunnys Bar, wedged in at the foot of the harbor in Red Hook, Brooklyn. It was a motley joint, decorated with just about everything, but so what, you felt good there.

title: Asdrubal Cabrera May Not Be Healed in Time for Opening Day
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Asdrubal Cabrera walked without a limp on Friday but had mixed feelings as he headed from the Mets clubhouse to his car.

title: After Complaints on Wounded Warrior Project, Pressure From Donors
description: When the Wounded Warrior Project was hit in January with multiple accusations in the news media of lavish spending on travel, conferences and public relations, and a toxic corporate culture, Fred Kane, one of its major fund-raisers, was stunned by the organizations response.

title: Alex Carpenters Last Chance to Add a National Title to Her Rsum
description: Boston College center Alex Carpenter is at the pinnacle of womens hockey.

title: Trump Clarifies, and Its Worse
description: Admit it, people, you miss the Republicans screaming at one another.

title: Im Not Evil. Im a Landlord.
description: Cleveland Heights, Ohio  MATTHEW DESMOND, a Harvard sociology professor, moved into poor Milwaukee neighborhoods and wrote this years hottest ethnographic tome about it: Evicted: Poverty and Profit in the American City. While working on the book, he kept a journal. He wrote, I feel dirty, collecting these stories and hardships like so many trophies.

title: Gary Jeter, 61, Giants Draftee Who Starred as Rams Lineman
description: Gary Jeter, a former defensive lineman and a highly touted draft pick by the Giants whose best playing years came after he was traded to the Los Angeles Rams in 1983, died on Wednesday at his home in Plainsboro, N.J. He was 61.

title: Supreme Court Contenders and Their Views on Big Business
description: Here are the leading contenders, with a snapshot of what we know about their views on business-related legal issues.

title: Saving a Mixed-Income New York
description: Could it be that the fate of New York City is being decided right now? Mayor Bill de Blasio thinks so.

title: Protecting the Privacy of Internet Users
description: The chairman of the Federal Communications Commission proposed common-sense privacy rules this week that would limit what broadband companies are allowed to do with the Internet browsing history and other personal information of consumers.

title: When the College Degree Is Useless and the Debt Is Due
description: For-profit colleges that saddle students with crushing debt and useless degrees  while getting as much as 90 percent of their revenue from the federal student aid program  represent an especially destructive form of corporate welfare. The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit recognized exactly that on Tuesday when it upheld Obama administration rules that would deny federal aid to career training programs that bury students in debt that is beyond their capacity to repay.

title: Hague Appeals Panel Voids Conviction of Lebanese TV Executive
description: PARIS  Appeals judges at an international tribunal in The Hague have overturned the conviction of a Lebanese television executive and cleared her and her station of charges of contempt of court.

title: Get Down
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE I didnt struggle mightily with this Josh Knapp production, but that could be because Im a hipster. I mean, I liked the Roots from way back when, yo  long before QUESTLOVE sold out to big television. And did I visit the worlds largest IKEA when I took my ironic vacation to Seoul? You betcha  THATS WHATS UP. I cant stop saying that phrase now. It works in every situation.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: If, technologically, it is possible to make an impenetrable device or system, where the encryption is so strong that there is no key, there is no door at all, then how do we apprehend the child pornographer? How do we disrupt a terrorist plot?

title: Keith Emerson, 70s Rock Showman With a Taste for Spectacle, Dies at 71
description: Keith Emerson, the keyboardist of the English supergroup Emerson, Lake & Palmer and one of the key figures of the progressive-rock era in the 1970s, was found dead on Friday at his home in Santa Monica, Calif. He was 71.

title: Worlds Oldest Man, a Confectioner From Poland, Survived Auschwitz
description: Israel Kristal lived through the tumult of two world wars, lost his family in the Holocaust and escaped death in the Auschwitz concentration camp. He then built a new life in Israel. On Friday, at the age of 112 years and 178 days, he was declared the oldest man in the world.

title: Donald Trump Urges Party to Unite, but Resistance Remains
description: PALM BEACH, Fla.  Donald J. Trump sought to move past the primary fight and toward the Republican nomination on Friday, saying that there had been enough debates and that the party needed to come together behind him. But as he cast his eye forward, he raised fresh questions about his porous understanding of intricate policy matters that all presidents face.

title: Venus Williams Returns to Indian Wells, in the Form of a Shooting Star
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  For a change, it was the trailblazing Venus Williamss turn tofollow her younger sister Serenas lead.

title: Ted Cruz Says Donald Trump Is to Blame for Violence at His Rallies
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas said on Friday that Donald J. Trump bore responsibility for creating an environment that encourages violence at his events.

title: Ben Simmons, a Top Big Man, May Find an N.C.A.A. Berth Is Out of Reach
description: NASHVILLE  College basketballs most talented player stood near the free-throw line with his mouthguard sticking out. He appeared listless as his Louisiana State teammates passed the ball around the perimeter. Then, in a single fluid motion, he shoved the mouthpiece into position and rolled off his defender to the basket and soared for a powerful alley-oop dunk.

title: Thomas Greiss Calmly Comes to the Islanders Rescue
description: SYOSSET, N.Y.  Islanders goaltender Thomas Greiss and his wife, Brittney, were running errands in his enormous truck during a late January snowstorm that ultimately canceled the teams home game that night against Philadelphia.

title: State Assembly Plan Would Limit New York Lawmakers Outside Income
description: ALBANY  An ethics proposal from the Democrat-dominated New York State Assembly would set a much higher limit on outside income than one suggested by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, allowing the states part-time legislators to earn tens of thousands of dollars in addition to their $79,500 base salary.

title: What to Watch Saturday
description: F. Gary Gray chronicles the rise of the gangster rappers N.W.A in Straight Outta Compton. Audra McDonald channels Billie Holiday in Lady Day at Emersons Bar & Grill. And Ariana Grande hosts and performs on Saturday Night Live.

title: Corrections: March 12, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Raise the Smoking Age to 21?
description: Proponents raise health arguments, while opponents discuss the age of adulthood.

title: Stephen Curry vs. Damian Lillard Has the Makings of an Epic Rivalry
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Damian Lillard tried to insulate himself from any potential distractions before the Portland Trail Blazers faced the Golden State Warriors on Friday night. Lillard, who grew up in Oakland, remained with his teammates in San Francisco before they made the trip over the bridge for the game.

title: Our Best Comments of the Week
description: In this new feature, we list the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment.

title: After Rockets Fired From Gaza, Israelis Strike Hamas Bases
description: GAZA CITY  Israel struck at Hamas military bases in the Gaza Strip overnight, killing a 10-year-old boy and his 6-year-old sister, a Palestinian official said on Saturday. The airstrikes came after Palestinian militants fired rockets toward Israeli border communities late Friday.

title: Valley of the Dolls, Pitched to a New Generation
description: It is very Tumblr-friendly, said Whitney Robinson of Valley of the Dolls, the novel by his stepgrandmother Jacqueline Susann that celebrates its 50th anniversary this year.

title: A Certain Word Is Really Getting on My Nerves
description: A specific adverb has become superpopular in the last few decades, its spoken and written use rising at such a superfast clip that, if youre inclined to verbal curmudgeonliness, it can be superirritating.

title: How Did You Manage Your Breakup on Facebook?
description: We asked our readers to share their experiences dealing with a breakup on the social network. Here are 10 of their stories.

title: The Facebook Breakup
description: For Kate Sokoloff, a brand strategist in Portland, Ore., the Facebook mirror of her breakup with her boyfriend of three years was like an emotional sucker punch, she said. Not 15 minutes after we broke up four years ago, and probably while he was still parked outside of my house, he changed his status to single.

title: A Texas Candidate Pushes the Boundary of the Far Right
description: MINEOLA, Tex.  On Super Tuesday, Dale Clark voted for a local Republican who claimed on social media that President Obama had worked as a gay prostitute in his youth, that the United States should ban Islam, that the Democratic Party had John F. Kennedy killed and that the United Nations had hatched a plot to depopulate the world.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took our Instagram followers from the White House to a concert in Havana.

title: The Geography of Trumpism
description: When the Census Bureau asks Americans about their ancestors, some respondents dont give a standard answer like English or German. Instead, they simply answer American.

title: China Weighs Letting Banks Sell Bad Debt to Investors
description: BEIJING  China is exploring a new way to grapple with its mounting pile of bad corporate debt, though its top central banker sought on Saturday to dispel worries that the plan would simply shift the burden to other parts of the countrys vast economy.

title: To Maintain Supply of Sex Slaves, ISIS Pushes Birth Control
description: DOHUK, Iraq  Locked inside a room where the only furniture was a bed, the 16-year-old learned to fear the sunset, because nightfall started the countdown to her next rape.

title: A Little Variety
description: A LITTLE VARIETY PUZZLES  This weeks puzzles include:

title: Farhad and Mike Discuss the Apple Case and a Go-Playing Computer Program
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry. This week, they needed extra help and roped in veteran tech reporter John Markoff.

title: When an Apartment Contains Lead Paint
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: 'House of Cards Season 4, Episode 12: White House and Chill
description: Episode 12 is not a bottle episode. But having the Conways and the Underwoods cohabitate, briefly, under the White House roof makes this chapter of House of Cards occasionally feel like one.

title: One Dead and Two Missing After Tugboat Hits Barge Near Tappan Zee Bridge
description: A tugboat with three crew members aboard struck a construction barge moored beneath the Tappan Zee Bridge and sank into the Hudson River before dawn on Saturday, killing one crew member and leaving the other two missing, officials said.

title: A Monkey With a Typewriter
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE Please tell me this has happened to you  I solved this whole puzzle, cogitated, doodled, napped, did yoga and otherwise digested it, and never got the theme. I dare say I would never have gotten it  I needed professional help  even though it makes perfect sense and is in no way obscure, cheap, overly intellectual or otherwise flawed. For whatever reason, the commonality in the answers was just squarely in my blind spot, and now I dont understand how I missed it  the title also should have helped.

title: Variety: Cryptic Crossword
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  I love a good cryptic, and this one did not disappoint. I have binged on this type of puzzle over the years, mainly solving from Harpers and Atlantic Monthly (those were magnificent puzzles, for years, by Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon). Rosalie Moscovitch, who passed away last November, constructed four other excellent cryptics for the Sunday Magazine, and this one was also a treat.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Ivy League Makes Tradition the Servant of Commerce

title: WhatsApp Encryption Said to Stymie Wiretap Order
description: WASHINGTON  While the Justice Department wages a public fight with Apple over access to a locked iPhone, government officials are privately debating how to resolve a prolonged standoff with another technology company, WhatsApp, over access to its popular instant messaging application, officials and others involved in the case said.

title: John Kasich Says Donald Trump Has Created a Toxic Environment
description: SHARONVILLE, Ohio  Gov. John Kasich of Ohio, drawing a contrast between the tone of Donald J. Trumps campaign and his own, chastised Mr. Trump on Saturday for having created a toxic environment.

title: Remote Utah Enclave Becomes New Battleground Over Reach of U.S. Control
description: SAN JUAN COUNTY, Utah  The juniper mesas and sunset-red canyons in this corner of southern Utah are so remote that even the governor says he has probably only seen them from the window of a plane. They are a paradise for hikers and campers, a revered retreat where generations of American Indian tribes have hunted, gathered ceremonial herbs and carved their stories onto the sandstone walls.

title: Off the Mound, Sean Doolittle Brings Relief to the Ostracized
description: MESA, Ariz.  Sean Doolittle, the ace reliever for the Oakland Athletics, would rather not be known that way. He has a charming impulse to ridicule anything that sounds absurd and self-righteous, even if it is accurate. His Twitter handle  @whatwouldDOOdo  is a pun and a question, a vessel for jokes, but also for good will.

title: Marco Rubio, Nearing Reckoning in Florida Primary, Likens Donald Trump to Third-World Strongmen
description: LARGO, Fla.  Senator Marco Rubio, in his strongest and most emotional condemnation yet of Donald J. Trumps incendiary brand of politics, likened Mr. Trump to a third-world dictator who was leading the country dangerously close to a boiling point. And for the first time Mr. Rubio questioned whether he could support Mr. Trump as the Republican nominee.

title: Running the Car Rental Agreement Gantlet
description: Ah, the car rental counter at the airport. Its like a heptathlon that you compete in against your will. Events include the Refill Roulette, which is the Hagglers term for the niggling gas question  do you want to bring the vehicle back full, or near empty and buy from the company? Then theres the Half Meter Upsell, the attempt to lure you into a slightly bigger vehicle for just a bit more money.

title: Donald Trumps Presidential Run Began in an Effort to Gain Stature
description: Get live updates about the Florida primary.

title: Security Forms Ring Around Donald Trump After Disruption at Ohio Rally
description: A man jumped a security barrier and rushed the stage at Donald J. Trumps rally in Dayton, Ohio on Saturday morning, leading to a brief moment of panic when Secret Service briefly surrounded the candidate.

title: Signs of Hope Five Years After Start of Syrias War
description: The partial cease-fire in Syria, which began Feb. 27, has proved more effective and durable than expected, significantly reducing the level of violence.

title: There Will Never Be Another Yogi Berra, and Alex Rodriguez Is It
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The day after he arrived for spring training, Alex Rodriguez sat at an interview table and waxed about how free he felt compared with his arrival last year. No questions about whether the Yankees wanted him, about how he would perform after a yearlong drug suspension or how the fans would react to his return.

title: My Candidate, Right or Wrong: Ted Cruz on Possible Trump Nomination
description: BALLWIN, Mo.  A brief accounting of Senator Ted Cruzs arguments against Donald J. Trump on Friday evening:

title: Lawrence Van Gelder, Critic and Editor at The Times, Dies at 83
description: Lawrence Van Gelder, who worked in the newsrooms of five New York City newspapers over 55 years, most of them as a critic, columnist and editor at The New York Times, died on Friday at his home in Manhattan. He was 83.

title: Attacking Poverty to Foster Creativity in Entrepreneurs
description: Laura Doering was at a rest stop in Panama about five years ago, waiting for her bus to refuel, when she saw six vendors clustered together selling almost exactly the same snacks. She wondered: Why doesnt anyone sell something different?

title: Hillary Clinton on Trump Rallies: Thats Political Arson
description: ST. LOUIS  The morning after Donald J. Trump canceled his rally in Chicago amid unruly protests, Hillary Clinton delivered her most extensive remarks to date denouncing the leading Republican candidate and the clashes that have erupted at his campaigns, accusing Mr. Trump of committing political arson.

title: Pfizers Eager to Go, but the Market Has Doubts
description: The stock market isnt convinced that the biggest tax inversion merger on the horizon  Pfizers pending blockbuster deal with Allergan  will be concluded without major problems.

title: Tough Words From Bernie Sanders on Rahm Emanuel
description: CHICAGO  A day after many of his supporters protested at a rally for Donald J. Trump here, Bernie Sanders defended the demonstrators and pointedly attacked the citys mayor, Rahm Emanuel, for closing schools and firing teachers.

title: Toronto Blue Jays Take a Big Step: All-Dirt Basepaths
description: DUNEDIN, Fla.  When the Toronto Blue Jays play the Boston Red Sox on April 8 at Rogers Centre, history will be made.

title: In Hail of Bullets and Fire, North Korea Killed Official Who Wanted Reform
description: SEOUL, South Korea  In late 2013, Jang Song-thaek, an uncle of Kim Jong-un, the North Korean leader, was taken to the Gang Gun Military Academy in a Pyongyang suburb.

title: Jessica Mendozas Calling Began With a Camera
description: MOORPARK, Calif.  Well before Jessica Mendoza was analyzing the batting performances of major leaguers on Sunday nights for ESPN, her father was using videotape to break down her at-bats in softball.

title: For a Child Actor, the Tears Didnt Come Until It Was Too Late
description: I had been a child actress for two years when my talent agent, Jean, called to say that Columbia Pictures wanted me to screen-test for a movie called My Stepmother Is an Alien, directed by Richard Benjamin. The role was Jessie, daughter of Dan Aykroyds character and stepdaughter of Kim Basingers. Jessie begins to suspect that her stepmother is an alien after she sees her drink battery juice from a Honda, a definite tell.

title: Say, Who Was That Mysterious Man Behind Hillary Clinton?
description: ST. LOUIS  An energized Hillary Clinton took aim at Donald J. Trump and Bernie Sanders on Saturday. But at least one shot backfired.

title: Edward Bayntun-Coward
description: Edward Bayntun-Coward runs George Bayntun, a venerable bookbindery and rare books seller in Bath, England, that was founded by his great-grandfather in 1894.

title: Putting Lincoln Online Is No Easy Political Task
description: One of the most ambitious research projects on Abraham Lincoln ever attempted  giving scholars, history buffs and students online access to every document Lincoln ever wrote or read  is being threatened by an absurd and intractable political and budget morass in the Illinois statehouse.

title: The Party Still Decides
description: POLITICAL parties are mentioned nowhere in the Constitution, and the party nominating process offers few of the protections associated with the ideal of one man one vote. Voters in early states have far more influence than voters in later ones. Votes in hard-to-attend caucuses effectively count more than votes in high-turnout primaries. Some primaries are open to party loyalists; others to all comers. The rules that assign convention delegates are byzantine, the delegate selection process is various, and a few states rely on conventions and cut the voters out entirely.

title: Congress Needs to Throw Puerto Rico a Lifeline
description: Members of Congress finally appear to be getting serious about helping Puerto Rico to reduce its mountain of debt and revive its economy. They need to act soon because the financial situation is deteriorating rapidly.

title: The Neuroscientist Who Lost Her Mind
description: AS the director of the human brain bank at the National Institute of Mental Health, I am surrounded by brains, some floating in jars of formalin and others icebound in freezers. As part of my work, I cut these brains into tiny pieces and study their molecular and genetic structure. My specialty is schizophrenia, a devastating disease that often makes it difficult for the patient to discern what is real and what is not. I examine the brains of people with schizophrenia whose suffering was so acute that they committed suicide. I had always done my work with great passion, but I dont think I really understood what was at stake until my own brain stopped working.

title: How Saudi Arabia Turned Its Greatest Weapon on Itself
description: FOR the past half-century, the world economy has been held hostage by just one country: the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. Vast petroleum reserves and untapped production allowed the kingdom to play an outsize role as swing producer, filling or draining the global system at will.

title: The Sultan and the Salad
description: I USED to love going to the Beverly Hills Hotel on Sunset Boulevard, wandering its banana-leaf-patterned halls and communing with its glamorous ghosts and legends.

title: Donald Trumps Epic Neediness
description: AFTER Donald Trump asked voters at a recent rally to raise their hands heavenward in a pledge of fealty to him, a few commentators frothed at the gestures supposed evocation of a Nazi salute.

title: Just a Few Things I Have to Do Before I Start My Taxes
description: WHOOP! Gotta warm my tea.

title: The Bernie Sanders Revolution
description: You say you want a revolution? Well.

title: Which Side Are You On, Hillary?
description: Weve got to stand up for unions, Hillary Clinton declared in her closing statement during the Democratic debate in Milwaukee last month. The line offered the labor-friendly audience a comforting rebuke to Gov. Scott Walkers relentless attacks on Wisconsins unions. It generated passionate applause.

title: The Global Solution to Extinction
description: DURING the summer of 1940, I was an 11-year-old living with my family in a low-income apartment in Washington, D.C. We were within easy walking distance of the National Zoo and an adjacent strip of woodland in Rock Creek Park. I lived most of my days there, visiting exotic animals and collecting butterflies and other insects with a net that I had fashioned from a broom handle, coat hanger and cheesecloth. I read nature books, field guides and past volumes of National Geographic. I had already conceived then of a world of life awaiting me, bottomless in variety.

title: Should All Research Papers Be Free?
description: DRAWING comparisons to Edward Snowden, a graduate student from Kazakhstan named Alexandra Elbakyan  is believed to be hiding out in Russia after illegally leaking millions of documents. While she didnt reveal state secrets, she took a stand for the publics right to know by providing free online access to just about every scientific paper ever published, on topics ranging from acoustics to zymology.

title: Ethnic Cleansing in South Sudan
description: The swamps where villagers try to escape the atrocities of the civil war offer a glimpse at the catastrophe unfolding in the world's newest country.

title: South Sudan: Where the Soldiers Are Scarier Than the Crocodiles
description: UNITY STATE, South Sudan  THERE are cobras and vipers here, and hungry crocodiles and belligerent hippos. But thousands of South Sudanese are hiding in these swamps because they have even greater fear of their own government  which the United States helped install.

title: Interest With a Minus Sign
description: To the Editor:

title: Capturing Technologys Impact
description: To the Editor:

title: Kasich Backers Knock Trump Ad Off Air in Ohio
description: Television stations across Ohio are refusing to run advertisements from the Trump campaign that are critical of Gov. John Kasich because of a technical election law violation in the ad.

title: Taking Their Game to the Highest Level
description: When Chris Flemmings was choosing a college in May 2012, there werent many programs interested in a 6-foot-5, 160-pound swingman. It wasnt that Flemmings was a nobody  he had scored nearly 500 points during his senior season  but both his high school and A.A.U. teams were too far off the radar to attract attention.

title: Chris Boshs Return Presents the Heat With an Enviable Puzzle
description: It was easy to underestimate Chris Bosh when he joined the Miami Heat at the dawn of the Big Three era. LeBron James was considered the best player in the game, and Dwyane Wade was the Heats incumbent superstar, with one title already under his belt. Bosh seemed like a somewhat lower-grade star.

title: Covering Donald Trump, and Witnessing the Danger Up Close
description: Get live updates about voting in the March 15 primaries.

title: In Home Opener, New York City F.C. Focuses on Its Defense
description: The French coach, the Spanish striker, the Italian playmaker and the American goalkeeper all agree on this: New York City F.C. will get better at communication, and defending, and everything else, as the season goes on.

title: A Different Stanley Gets Her Cup
description: The Boston Pride defeated the Buffalo Beauts this weekend in a best-of-three series in Newark for the first National Womens Hockey League championship. As the winners, they received the Isobel Cup, which, in time, may become as coveted and cherished as the N.H.L.s Stanley Cup.

title: Arizona State Takes Baby Steps to Establish a Footing in Collegiate Hockey
description: TEMPE, Ariz.  The last few seconds ran off the clock in the final game of Arizona States hockey season in disheartening surroundings two weeks ago.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Donald Trumps Heated Words Were Destined to Stir Violence, Opponents Say
description: In foreboding conversations across the political world this past year, a bipartisan chorus warned that the 2016 presidential campaign was teetering on the edge of violence.

title: Trump Supporter Who Made Nazi Salute Explains Why She Made the Gesture
description: The photo, taken outside the arena where Donald J. Trumps appearance had just been canceled on Friday in Chicago, circulated far and wide: A woman in a Donald Trump T-shirt, eyes locked with a protester, her right arm raised skyward, her palm faced down.

title: Culture Gap Impedes U.S. Business Efforts for Trade With Cuba
description: MEXICO CITY  They have gone to Cuba with plans to build houses. To assemble tractors. To buy apps from young programmers. Even to import charcoal made from the sicklebush that grows in vast stretches across the island.

title: Mars Mission Set to Launch to Study Gases and Storms
description: The ExoMars 2016 mission  a collaboration between the European and Russian space agencies  is scheduled to blast off from Kazakhstan on Monday.

title: After a Rocky Start, DAngelo Russell Dares His Critics to Reconsider
description: EL SEGUNDO, Calif.  People talked about DAngelo Russell of the Los Angeles Lakers as if his two main interests in life, having fun and being good at basketball, were diametrically opposite pursuits.

title: Seton Hall Wins Big East by Downing Villanova
description: A hooded figure approached Seton Hall Coach Kevin Willard and offered quick congratulations as Willard stood outside the locker room on Saturday.

title: Ralph S. Larsen, Builder of Giant Johnson & Johnson, Dies at 77
description: Ralph S. Larsen, who as chief executive of Johnson & Johnson oversaw a series of acquisitions that turned the company into a multinational giant, died on Wednesday at his home in Naples, Fla. He was 77.

title: How the Governor Responded to Flint
description: A look at how Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan publicly acknowledged the health emergency in Flint and the missteps that followed, as efforts for a recall intensify.

title: Recall Effort in Michigan Intensifies Pressure on Gov. Rick Snyder
description: DETROIT  Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan hired a law firm using up to $800,000 in taxpayer money to help his administration navigate through a throng of civil and criminal investigations. Both candidates for the Democratic presidential nomination have called for him to resign.

title: Ted Cruz Scours Overlooked States, Eyeing a Long Delegate Fight
description: Much of the political universe is focused on the results this Tuesday in Ohio and Florida, the delegate-rich states that could determine whether Donald J. Trump can clinch the Republican nomination soon or if the race is bound to remain unsettled until the convention in July.

title: A Rare Encore at the Met for Mexican Tenor
description: Oops, he did it again. The dazzling Mexican bel canto tenor Javier Camarena earned another rare encore at the Metropolitan Opera during Saturday afternoons performance of Donizettis Don Pasquale, which was broadcast live on the radio.

title: Ken Adam, Who Dreamed Up the Lairs of Movie Villains, Dies at 95
description: Ken Adam, a production designer whose work on dozens of famous films included the fantasy sets that established the look of the James Bond series, the car in Chitty Chitty Bang Bang and, for Stanley Kubricks Dr. Strangelove, the sinister war room beneath the Pentagon, died on Thursday at his home in London. He was 95.

title: Javier Camarena Sings a Rare Encore
description: A reprise of the aria Povero Ernesto...Cercher lontana terra from Donizettis Don Pasquale.

title: William Daley of Chicago Political Clan Wonders About Donald Trumps Choice of Venues
description: William M. Daley, a scion of the storied Daley political clan of Illinois, said he was not surprised that protests against Donald J. Trump before his Chicago rally got so out of hand that Mr. Trump canceled it before even taking the stage.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Your Weekend Briefing

title: Has a Black President Changed America?
description: African-Americans speak about Barack Obamas legacy, racism and how they feel about the departure of the countrys first family from the White House.

title: Proud of Obamas Presidency, Blacks Are Sad to See Him Go
description: CHICAGO  Get live updates about voting in the March 15 primaries.

title: Cruz Takes Delegates in Wyoming, and Rubio Wins in Washington, D.C.
description: Senator Ted Cruz won the most delegates awarded in the Wyoming Republican conventions on Saturday, while Senator Marco Rubio narrowly beat Gov. John Kasich in Washington, D.C., on the last day of voting before Tuesdays make-or-break primaries in five large states.

title: Donald Trump Accuses Protester of ISIS Ties Based on Dubious Video
description: Donald J. Trump announced from the stage at a rally in Kansas City, Mo., that a man who had charged him at an event earlier Saturday was probably linked to the Islamic State, appearing to base his statement on an Internet video that has been described as a hoax.

title: Staten Island Woman Arrested After Infant Is Found Dead
description: A Staten Island woman was arrested on Saturday after an infant was found dead at her home, the Police Department said.

title: Police Use Pepper Spray to Disperse Protesters Outside Trump Rally in Kansas City
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  The police used pepper spray twice to disperse protesters outside Donald J. Trumps rally here Saturday night, just 24 hours after confrontations between his supporters and demonstrators led to the cancellation of a Chicago event.

title: 2016 Campaign in Photos: Week of March 6
description: The 2016 presidential campaign moved through Florida and the Midwest.

title: Juntos con Marco: Rubio Ads Appeal to Florida Latinos in Spanish
description: Spanish has seldom been spoken by Republican presidential candidates in the past, but with two Cuban-American candidates in contention  Senators Marco Rubio and Ted Cruz  this years primary contests have been an exception. It hasnt gone as well for Mr. Rubio as he had hoped. But at home in Miami, with his back against the wall heading into Tuesdays vote in Florida, he has campaigned in Latino neighborhoods, and a super PAC supporting him is now running this ad, aptly titled Orgullo, as an expression of unmitigated, untranslated ethnic pride.

title: Randi Bernheim, Jeremy Kay
description: Randi Rose Bernheim, a daughter of Susan R. Bernheim and Daniel S. Bernheim 3rd of Penn Valley, Pa., was married March 12 to Dr. Jeremy David Kay, the son of Lynn Jalens Kay and Dr. William Kay of Boca Raton, Fla. Rabbi Amy Rader officiated at the Miami Beach Edition hotel.

title: Caroline Porter, Sean Hayes
description: Caroline Van Cleve Porter, a daughter of Prudence L. Porter of Summit, N.J., and the late Michael T. Porter, was married March 12 to Sean Michael Hayes, a son of Mary Elliot Hayes and Brian J. Hayes of Clearwater, Fla. The Rev. Nestor Rodriguez, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Ann Catholic Church in West Palm Beach, Fla.

title: Brooke Sabghir, Isaac Glassman
description: Brooke Elissa Sabghir, a daughter of Nadene N. Sabghir and Jonathan M. Sabghir of Coral Springs, Fla., is to be married March 13 to Isaac Seth Glassman, the son of Beverly R. Shapero and Dr. A. Daniel Glassman of Cincinnati. Rabbi Gershom Barnard is to perform the ceremony at Congregation Bnai Israel in Boca Raton, Fla.

title: Andrea Goldberg, David Slutsky
description: Andrea Kristal Goldberg and David Mark Slutsky were married March 12 at the Fairmont hotel in Washington. Rabbi Gary S. Fink officiated.

title: Chandler Rough, Derek Ramsey
description: Chandler Lilian Rough, the daughter of Lori Hiratani Rough and Robert M. Rough of Plano, Tex., was married March 12 to Derek Scott Ramsey, the son of Dr. Katrin L. Ramsey and Greg J. Ramsey of Franklin Lakes, N.J. The Rev. Dr. Moriyoshi Hiratani, a retired Baptist minister and the brides maternal grandfather, officiated at the Brooklyn Winery.

title: Jessica Reis, Anthony DeAngelo
description: Jessica Lynn Reis and Anthony Philip DeAngelo are to be married March 13 in Washington. Brett Franklin Clements, a friend of the couple who received temporary officiant status from the District of Columbia, is to officiate at the Josephine Butler Parks Center.

title: Sarah Efronson, Matteo Spera
description: Sarah Dawn Efronson, a daughter of Lise L. Efronson and Lee D. Efronson of Miami, was married March 12 to Dr. Matteo Arsenio Spera, the son of Silvia C. Spera and Dr. Dominic Spera of Lawrence, N.Y. Rabbi Andrew Paley officiated in Matheson Hammock Park in Miami.

title: Katherine Powell and Patrick Albertson: Lets Hang Out Together, Forever
description: Katherine Elizabeth Powell and Patrick Francis Albertson were married March 11 at the Montauk Club in Brooklyn. Charles M. Lewis, a Universal Life minister and the brides brother-in-law, officiated.

title: Naomi Eskin, Thomas Heckroth
description: Naomi Ariel Eskin, a daughter of Sandra B. Eskin and Andrew D. Eskin of Washington, was married March 12 to Thomas William Heckroth, a son of Janis L. Heckroth and William M. Heckroth of Des Moines. Rabbi Jessica Minnen officiated at the National Museum of Women in the Arts in Washington.

title: Lisa Manley, Christina Mitchell
description: Shannon Elisabeth Manley and Christina Hartford Mitchell were married March 11 at the Emmanuel Episcopal Church in Boston. The Rev. Pamela L. Werntz, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Karli Provost, Eric Goldstein
description: Dr. Karli Anne Provost and Eric Michael Goldstein were married March 12 in the library of the Brooklyn Historical Society. Harris Bloom, a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Valerie Garagiola, Benjamin Redmond
description: Valerie Francesca Garagiola, a daughter of Noel Mikita Garagiola and Joseph H. Garagiola Jr. of Scottsdale, Ariz., was married March 11 to Benjamin Michael Redmond, a son of Heather A. Redmond and Calvin D. Redmond of Louisville, Ky. The Rev. Richard Sunwoo, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Mission Basilica Catholic Church in San Juan Capistrano, Calif.

title: Corrections: March 13, 2016
description: NEW YORK

title: My Dinosaurs Jet Lag Helps Explain Why a Time Change Is Hard
description: Update: Since this article was published in 2016, the company that made the dinosaur has gone out of business.

title: Your Weekend Briefing: Donald Trump, Nancy Reagan, Daylight Saving Time
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Politics Invades Hollywood
description: LOS ANGELES  In a presidential election year, the only real October surprise from Hollywood would be a complete absence of films with political tinges. But dont worry. It wont happen. Already, release schedules for the months preceding Nov. 8, Election Day, are peppered with movies that have partisan potential, whether overt or covert.

title: 1891: The Death of a Poet
description: The well-known poet, Thodore de Banville, who since the death of Victor Hugo has been regarded as heading the list of contemporary French poets, died suddenly of apoplexy shortly before midnight on Thursday [March 12].

title: England Avenges World Cup Loss to Wales With Six Nations Win
description: England is the 2016 European Six Nations champion, but must win again in Paris next Saturday to take the biggest prize: the Grand Slam.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
