title: Ohio to Choose Among 15 Potential Successors to John Boehner
description: The second most important primary in Ohio on Tuesday might be the race to replace former Speaker John A. Boehner.

title: Too Sick for School, or Just Doesnt Want to Go?
description: Sometimes, figuring out whether a child is too sick for school is an easy call. A vomiting child, or one with a fever or a raging case of pink eye, is clearly taking the day off. Some schools are even kind enough to spell out the parameters for a return to the classroom, asking that children stay home for 24 hours after the last symptoms or after starting a course of antibiotics.

title: New York Today: Must-See Shows
description: Updated, 9:09 a.m.

title: Morning Agenda: Unpacking a Chinese Companys Spree on U.S. Hotels
description: UNPACKING A CHINESE COMPANYS SPREE ON U.S. HOTELS | Marriott Internationals deal to buy Starwood Hotels & Resorts Worldwide may be derailed by a Chinese insurer expanding its hotel empire,

title: Donald Trumps Florida Effort Relied on Veteran of Gov. Rick Scotts Campaign
description: If the polls showing Donald J. Trump well ahead in Florida are accurate, one of those he will have to thank in victory will be Susie Wiles, the campaign manager in 2010 for the states governor, Rick Scott.

title: Socit Gnrale to Buy British Units of Kleinwort Benson
description: LONDON  Socit Gnrale said on Tuesday that it had agreed to acquire the British and Channel Islands wealth management businesses of the BHF Kleinwort Benson Group from the French financial services company Oddo & Cie.

title: Robert Horton, Handsome Wagon Train Star Who Wanted More, Dies at 91
description: Robert Horton, a ruggedly handsome actor who found television stardom in 1957 as the scout Flint McCullough on Wagon Train but who resisted being typecast in westerns as he pursued a parallel career as a singer, died on Wednesday in Los Angeles. He was 91.

title: Which Books Have Been Unfairly Maligned?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Benjamin Moser and Charles McGrath discuss books with undeserved bad reputations.

title: A City-Size Cruise, With 4,200 Friends
description: To travel on Norwegian Cruise Lines Norwegian Escape, the fifth-largest cruise ship in the world, is to become a master of the tall tale. Except that the tales are all true.

title: How Delegate Rules Explain Your Political Party
description: The remaining Republican presidential candidates are entering the Darwinian phase of the campaign  if they lose in certain states, they get nothing. Democrats are continuing with their proportional allocation of delegates  if they lose, they  probably still get a trophy.

title: A Day of Potential Clarity Amid a Long Slog
description: For the current leaders of the long march toward the 2016 presidential nominations, Tuesday will be either the beginning of the end, or the end of the beginning.

title: Weekly News Quiz | March 8-14, 2016
description: Have you been following the news?

title: U.S. and Britain Mark Anniversary of Toast That Built Intelligence Ties
description: BLETCHLEY, England  After a journey almost ended by a German aircraft attack, four American intelligence officers arrived late one night in February 1941 at the large, gloomy mansion in the English countryside that was home to British spy chiefs and code breakers.

title: Campari Agrees to Buy Maker of Grand Marnier
description: LONDON  Gruppo Campari said on Tuesday that it had agreed to buy the French maker of the liqueur Grand Marnier in a deal that values the company at 684 million euros, or about $761 million.

title: Battered Valeant Stock Drops a Further 50% After Weak Guidance
description: Shares of the embattled drug maker Valeant Pharmaceuticals dropped more than 50 percent on Tuesday after the company issued weak earnings guidance and warned of a possible default on some of its debt.

title: Q. and A.: Lau Ming-wai on Why Disaffected Hong Kong Youth Should Vote, Not Riot
description: Hong Kong politics has not traditionally been an arena for teenagers. But in 2012, students as young as 15 turned out to protest a plan for a national education curriculum, calling it an attempt at brainwashing by Beijing in the semiautonomous Chinese territory. Then, in 2014, student-led demonstrators occupied large parts of central Hong Kong to press for greater popular participation in the election of the territorys leader. This year, teenagers as young as 14 were among those detained when a protest against what they said was the authorities crackdown on street hawkers  seen as emblematic of local culture  escalated into the worst rioting in Hong Kong in half a century.

title: Anita Brookner, Whose Bleak Fiction Won the Booker Prize, Dies at 87
description: LONDON  Anita Brookner, a British author of lean, elegiac and stylistically polished novels who was once labeled the mistress of gloom for her depiction of bleak and disappointed lives, usually of women, died on Thursday. She was 87.

title: Google Introduces Products That Will Sharpen Its Ad Focus
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Googles skills in tracking people, figuring out desires, and placing ads revolutionized the world of marketing. Now it is adding even more technology muscle to its ad business.

title: Close but Not Quite
description: We think we know what these words mean. We almost know what they mean. But we dont, not quite. Instead, we mix them up in our minds with words that sound similar and have related meanings. Be wary! Make a list! Look them up  each time if necessary.

title: On Trade, Angry Voters Have a Point
description: Were the experts wrong about the benefits of trade for the American economy?

description: Dear Diary:

title: Putins Syria Tactics Keep Him at the Fore and Leave Everyone Else Guessing
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putins typically theatrical order to withdraw the bulk of Russian forces from Syria, a process that the Defense Ministry said it began on Tuesday, seemingly caught Washington, Damascus and everybody in between off guard  just the way the Russian leader likes it.

title: Out of the Navy, and in Business
description: Quonset Point in Rhode Island, where Navy installations once stood, is now home to a bustling business park.

title: Quonset Makes a New Name for Itself in Business
description: NORTH KINGSTOWN, R.I.  Decades after it was decommissioned as a Navy base, Quonset Point is having a rebirth, becoming a small city of its own.

title: U.S. Eases Restrictions on Travel to Cuba and Bank Transactions
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration announced Tuesday that it would allow individuals to travel to Cuba for people to people educational trips and lift limits on the use of American dollars in transactions with Cuba, wiping away stiff restrictions on travel and commerce as President Obama prepares to make a trip to Havana next week.

title: Donald Trump Veers From Paying Legal Fees for Roughing Up Protesters
description: Donald J. Trump wavered on Tuesday about whether he would actually pay the legal fees of a supporter who punched a protester in the face at one of his rallies last week, saying that he does not condone violence.

title: Julia Child Marathon to Stream on Twitch as Gaming Site Widens Focus

title: 1941: British Arrive in the Balkans
description: BELGRADE  British and German troops are rapidly taking up positions in preparation for the Battle of the Balkans, which may begin in a few hours or a few days. In Greece nearly 100,000 British Empire troops already have landed, and double that number will follow as rapidly as they can be brought there, organized and sent to their posts. This correspondent talked tonight [March 15] with a diplomat who had just arrived here from Athens. He described how ships from Alexandria and Haifa were arriving daily in Greek ports. The vessels are filled with men and all kinds of war materials.  New York Herald Tribune, March 16, 1941

title: Anders Behring Breivik, Killer in 2011 Norway Massacre, Says Prison Conditions Violate His Rights
description: OSLO  He lives in a three-room suite with windows, about 340 square feet, that includes a treadmill, a fridge, a DVD player, a Sony PlayStation and a desk with a typewriter. He has been taking distance-learning courses at his countrys main university. He has access to television, radio and newspapers. He prepares his own food, and he entered the Christmas gingerbread-house baking contest at his prison.

title: 5 Ways to Sample Americana in Havana

title: 1966: U.S. to Hatch Tadpoles in Space
description: COCOA BEACH, FLA.  Frogs, which normally spawn their young in bucolic ponds, now will get a chance to try it out in space. Some 400 fertilized eggs of the leopard frog  a small spotted creature  will take to the skies this week, along with two human astronauts, if Gemini-8 gets off the ground. Scientists designed the experiment to test the effects of zero gravity on the development of the frogs. At the end of the flight, the scientists believe, some of the live tadpoles may come down out of orbit with two heads. The astronauts, it is known, survive space flight with one.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, March 16, 1941

title: The Segregation of India
description: Each time I visit Mumbai, I make a pilgrimage to an old five-story building with crumbling balconies on Nepean Sea Road. Its where I lived during the 60s and 70s  the first two decades of my life. I went back a few weeks ago. Standing outside, I thought about the diverse, cosmopolitan city I knew, and how it has changed.

title: Angela Merkel, Down but not Out
description: Berlin  ON Sunday, roughly nine million Germans cast their votes in three state elections. On the surface, the far right did well: The populist Alternative for Germany Party, the most outspoken opponent of Chancellor Angela Merkels course in the refugee and migration crisis, made significant gains in all three states. In Saxony-Anhalt, in the East, the party came in second, just 5 percentage points behind Ms. Merkels Christian Democrats and 14 points ahead of her coalition partner, the Social Democrats. Even in the West, traditionally more immune to all things that reek of radicalism, the party came in third.

title: Fearing the Tide in West Point, a Slum Already Swamped With Worry

title: Where is the E.U.s Moral and Political Courage?

Already drained by overwhelming debt, austerity and recession, the country is rushing to provide shelter and care for a surging number of stranded refugees and migrants who want nothing more than to keep moving, indifferent to the fact that their pursuit of freedom, stability and prosperity has thrown the European Union into its greatest crisis since its founding.

What was going on?

title: Guadalajara, Mexicos Party City
description: A former 16th-century trade outpost some 285 miles northwest of Mexico City in Jalisco state, Guadalajara is one of Mexicos most traditional cities, a place where leafy boulevards are patchworked with French Baroque colonial mansions. Until recently, the art in Guadalajara has tended toward the folkloric: The town is primarily known for earthen ceramics, as well as for mariachi bands (the genre originated in the region). It used to be that creative people got out of here as soon as possible, says the artist Eduardo Sarabia, who moved to Guadalajara from Los Angeles and co-founded an art laboratory called PAOS that hosts residencies and exhibits in the stark studio that once belonged to the great Modernist muralist Jos Clemente Orozco. But thats changed. Sarabia is part of a wave of young artists and gallerists whore remaking the town into a sort of mellow, sunny-skies utopia. Hes joined by the young Spaniards Silvia Ortiz and Ins Lpez-Quesada, who opened a branch of their Madrid gallery, Travesa Cuatro, in the upscale Colonia Lafayette neighborhood a few years ago in order to be closer to some of their key artists  local talent who have seen their stars rise on the contemporary scene, including Jose Dvila, Gonzalo Lebrija and Jorge Mndez Blake.

title: Teisui Gives Yakitori Top Billing in NoMad
description: Teisui Yakitori, or chicken grilled on skewers, has yet to attract the kind of following that other types of Japanese cooking, like ramen and sushi, have acquired in New York. But at this handsome new restaurant, it is given top billing and an elegance rarely associated with what in Japan is usually a quick meal of grilled chicken bits. Yakitori is changing in Japan, said Yuko Hagiwara, the manager of the restaurant, which is owned by a Japanese company. Its becoming more high-end because chicken is very expensive. Here, several yakitori dishes, made with chicken from Bo Bo Poultry in Brooklyn, include chicken breast with beets and chicken tenders with mushrooms. They are part of a $150 10-course kaiseki menu served at a U-shaped stone counter facing the open kitchen and at tables around the room. The chef is Nobutaka Watanabe, working alongside Yuichiro Yoshimura, a yakitori expert. The room is designed to suggest the ryokan, a type of traditional country inn, that the parent company owns in northern Japan. Layers of wavy maple meant to resemble the sea cover one wall. (Opens Friday): 246 Fifth Avenue (entrance on 28th Street), 917-388-3596, teisui.nyc.

As part of his final push for Floridas 99 G.O.P. delegates, the candidate held a big rally in Boca Raton on Sunday night. Several thousand people attended, and beforehand expressed concerns over the loss of manufacturing jobs, heroin abuse, Medicare, terrorism, and the difficulty of building a small business. An hour late, Mr. Trump appeared.

title: A Bygone Time Captured Through the Lens of Walker Evans

While the photographers work has been exhibited widely and often, the South has not been exposed to an Evans show of this scope and caliber, said Brett Abbott, the Highs curator of photography. The High will be the shows only stop in the United States  something of a coup for a regional museum.

A vast trove of imagery, it included everything from publicity snapshots of Russian czars in rowboats to promotional pieces that Bauhaus artists designed to advertise a 1923 exhibition.

title: The Pacific Standard Time Initiative Seeks to Rescue Fugitive Art

She was researching the performance history of an experimental 1967 text by Ferrari, who died in 2013, called Palabras Ajenas (The Words of Others).

title: C.D.C. Painkiller Guidelines Aim to Reduce Addiction Risk

title: A Marriage of Tastes  and of Two Furniture-Designing Artists
description: It was a literal lightbulb moment that inspired the husband-and-wife Belgian artists Hannes Van Severen and Fien Muller to start making furniture. In 2010, the couple moved into an old house in a village outside Ghent and, unable to find electric wiring in the ceiling, decided to build a metal-framed table with a long-necked lamp growing from one of its legs. The result became the prototype for their first collection; soon they were working on more pieces, like a conjoined steel-and-leather chair and a white lacquered rack with colorful marble shelves.

title: The Most Magical Moments of Texass Remotest Music Festival
description: Its a blustery Saturday afternoon in Marfa, Texas, and hundreds are gathered inside a former Army hangar, much of the crowd lying prone on the red gravel floor or sitting cross-legged with their eyes closed. A few people stand, some staring dreamily up at a high row of windows that split the sky into perfect squares of indigo blue. The experimental music artist William Basinski is at the center of the hangar, his mirrored sunglasses focused on a table topped with computers, volume knobs, a thick knot of electrical cords. From the speakers flanking him comes a sweet, synthesized drone  complex tones that fill the massive space, lulling the audience into a kind of midday trance. Wind blasts at the cavernous arch of corrugated steel roofing, creating an aching, eerie, metallic rhythm, creaks and pops that seem somehow syncopated to Basinkis improvised soundscape.

title: Review: In The Travelers, Danger at Every Destination
description: There are two kinds of spy-hopping in The Travelers, Chris Pavones third and most furiously peripatetic novel. The first is what an inquisitive whale does when it shoots its head above water. The second is what this espionage novel does when it jumps from Paris to London; the Gulf of Maine to Husavik, Iceland, in the space of three pages; then back to Paris, Husavik and New York City shortly thereafter. Mr. Pavone keeps his readers heads spinning and his main character, the travel writer Will Rhodes, on the run.

title: Dr. Barbara Almond, Who Examined Maternal Ambivalence, Dies at 77
description: Dr. Barbara Almond, a psychiatrist who lifted the veil on the ambivalence some women feel about childbearing and on societys expectations about motherhood, died on March 6 in Palo Alto, Calif. She was 77.

title: Instagram May Change Your Feed, Personalizing It With an Algorithm
description: For years, we have been trained to view web postings from our friends in a certain order. Refresh the top of your various feeds  the running column of content on some versions of Facebook, Twitter and Instagram  and you will see the latest news at the top. The further back you scroll, the older the material gets.

title: Chappatte on Putins Syria Withdrawal
description: Mission accomplished?

title: Review: In Elijah Green, Archetypes in Search of Meaning
description: For the better part of an hour, a woman sits at a cutting board at the edge of the audience, gutting fish. Far upstage, a man in what looks like bunny ears paints a fluted column white. One woman dances, wearing a tunic made of net; another does little but iron.

title: Review: Los Angeles Philharmonic Makes the Familiar Feel Fresh
description: It is possible to hear even a chestnut like the Appalachian Spring Suite with fresh ears. Sometimes context alone can do it. Played by the Los Angeles Philharmonic on Monday evening, during the second of a two-concert stand at David Geffen Hall, this Copland piece of soaring, stirring Americana was preceded by a 1961 piano concerto by Alberto Ginastera and a 2013 symphonic detonation by Andrew Norman.

title: In Happy Valley, the Bodies Pile Up
description: The excellent British cop show Happy Valley built toward a grim and brutally violent resolution in its first season, and as Season 2 opens  the six episodes will be available on Netflix on Wednesday  the mood is reassuring, almost comic. Sgt. Catherine Cawood (Sarah Lancashire) is 18 months removed from her battle to near death with the murderous Tommy Lee Royce (James Norton) and finds herself chasing a band of young, stoned sheep rustlers. Its just the latest reminder of her humble status as a uniformed police officer.

title: Review: Criminal Minds: Beyond Borders Tracks Gruesome Assaults on Traveling Americans
description: Like some presidential campaigns, the Criminal Minds television franchise is built on fear. In the original show (now in its 11th season), murderous psychos are everywhere in America, waiting to turn your home into an abattoir or torture chamber. In the new spinoff, Criminal Minds: Beyond Borders (starting on Wednesday on CBS), murderous psychos are everywhere Americans travel around the world, waiting to sell them into slavery or steal their kidneys.

title: Dozens Killed in Airstrikes on Market in Yemen
description: SANA, Yemen  Dozens of people were killed when warplanes from a military coalition led by Saudi Arabia bombed a restaurant and crowded market in northern Yemen shortly before noon on Tuesday, medical workers said.

title: Karen Hall Alters Dark Debts in a New Edition
description: When Karen Hall published her debut novel, Dark Debts, 20 years ago, it seemed like the start of a blockbuster literary career. Ms. Hall, a veteran TV writer who had worked on hits like M*A*S*H and Hill Street Blues, had the commercial storytelling chops. She spent five years working on the novel, a pulpy theological thriller about a Roman Catholic priest who becomes mixed up with demonic forces.

title: S.E.C. Opens Door to Investment Banking for Steven Rattner, Barred Financier
description: If Steven Rattner wants to return to investment banking, the Securities and Exchange Commission has cleared the way for him.

title: Seton Halls Big-Time Player
description: Guard Isaiah Whitehead chose Seton Hall because it was close to home, and the Pirates are glad he did.

title: In Seton Halls Late Run, Praise for a Most Valuable Parent
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J.  Isaiah Whitehead, the sophomore point guard from Coney Island who led Seton Hall to its first Big East mens basketball championship in 23 years last weekend, is still saying, politely, that he does not know if he will jump to the N.B.A. after this season.

title: At New Directors/New Films, a Glimpse of the Otherworldly
description: As it does every year, New Directors/New Films is offering a globe-trotting sampler of more than two dozen features as well as miscellaneous short takes aimed at highlighting the work of emerging artists. This years package, which begins on Wednesday and includes 27 features  selected by programmers from the Film Society of Lincoln Center and the Museum of Modern Art  leans toward the somber and includes assorted spirits, a number of slaughtered animals and a variety of environmental disasters, along with an occasional welcome flicker of joy. The following are our favorites from Week 1, in the order in which they are first screened.

title: Review: Fireworks Wednesday, a Domestic Drama From Iran
description: If you didnt know that the continual explosions heard in Asghar Farhadis film Fireworks Wednesday were the sounds of firecrackers and cherry bombs celebrating the Persian New Year in the streets of Tehran, they could easily be mistaken for deadly wartime explosions in a city under siege. And in a way they are.

title: Review: Jim Black Trio at Le Poisson Rouge
description: The Jim Black Trio closed its show at Le Poisson Rouge late Monday night with a transfixing burst of turbulence called Beariere. Elias Stemeseder, the bands pianist, whipped up a low-end fury out of which a melody surprisingly emerged, like a sparrow from a bramble. Thomas Morgans bass was a movable pivot, holding the center of the churn. Mr. Black, on drums, struck an elusive truce between bombast and finesse, driving his agenda along with the pulse of the tune.

title: Sony PlayStation VR Will Cost $399 When It Arrives in October
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Sony Computer Entertainment is hoping to ride the coattails of its top-selling game console, the PlayStation 4, to gain traction in a new market: virtual reality.

title: Inspections Will Close Washington, D.C., Metro on Wednesday
description: WASHINGTON  The subway system here will shut down all day on Wednesday to allow for wide-scale safety inspections prompted by a fire earlier this week, officials said Tuesday. It will be the first time that the system, the nations second busiest, has closed for any reason other than bad weather in its four decades.

title: Beyond Swipe Right: The Pickup Line Gets a Makeover
description: Whither the pickup line?

title: Statues in Torlonia Collection, Long Out of Sight, Will Soon Be on Public Display
description: ROME  The Torlonia familys collection of ancient marble sculptures has long been the stuff of legend for art historians and archaeologists.

title: Pictures of the Day: The United States and Elsewhere
description: The United States and More  Photos of the Day

title: March 15, 2016  Photos of the Day
description: Photos from the United States, Germany, Greece and Afghanistan.

title: Review: Miracles From Heaven, Starring Jennifer Garner as the Mother of a Sick Child
description: Until it delivers an eye-rolling scene near the end, Miracles From Heaven is an unexpectedly effective tear-jerker. More surprising still, that late diversion doesnt negate much of the movies early sincerity.

title: N.Y.S.E. Names Former Regulator as Chief Regulatory Officer
description: The New York Stock Exchange has completed an overhaul of its regulatory functions, naming Anthony J. Albanese, the former acting New York state financial industry regulator, as its chief regulatory officer.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing: Donald Trump, Hillary Clinton, Vladimir Putin
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Senate to Vote on GMO Food Labeling Bill
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate will grapple this week with perhaps the most contentious issue in the food industry: whether the government should require mandatory labeling on foods containing genetically engineered ingredients.

title: Apple and Justice Dept. Trade Barbs in iPhone Privacy Case
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Apple on Tuesday emphasized its opposition to a court order requiring it to help unlock an iPhone for law enforcement purposes, saying in a new legal brief that the governments methods for achieving its objectives are contrary to the rule of law, the democratic process and the rights of the American people.

title: Study of Zika Outbreak Estimates 1 in 100 Risk of Microcephaly
description: During a recent outbreak of the Zika virus in French Polynesia, roughly one in 100 women infected in the first trimester of pregnancy developed a fetus with an abnormally small head and brain damage, researchers reported on Tuesday.

title: Grand Jury Findings Against Franciscan Order in Pennsylvania
description: Three members of the Franciscan Friars are being charged with one count each of endangering the welfare of children and criminal conspiracy.

title: Welcome to...
description: Ellen Barry traveled to Mela Thiruvenkatanathapuram  or MAY-la THEE-roo VEN-ka-ta NA-tha POO-ram, as a resident of the southeast state of Tamil Nadu might pronounce it.

title: FleetCor Technologies in Deal for Brazilian Toll Payments Company
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  FleetCor Technologies has agreed to acquire the Brazilian electronic toll payments company Servios e Tecnologia de Pagamentos for $1.05 billion.

title: Figuring Out What Valeant Is Really Worth
description: As investors dumped shares of the beleaguered Valeant Pharmaceuticals International on Tuesday, erasing more than $11 billion from its market value, the companys previously large crowd of believers was becoming vanishingly thin.

title: Alabama Prison Uprisings Come as State Grapples With How to Fix System
description: ATMORE, Ala.  When the video appeared on Facebook, it was as compelling as it was shaky and shocking: Using a contraband device, a state prisoner recorded and narrated nearly a minute of a prison riot here that had already led to a fire and the stabbings of two officials, including the warden.

title: The Financial Alchemy Thats Choking SunEdison
description: If SunEdison enters into bankruptcy, the autopsy will no doubt reveal a suicide, finding the solar energy company done in by financial engineering that was too clever and by a failure of its executives and investment bankers to remember the lessons of the financial crisis.

title: Canada: Man Charged in Attack at Recruiting Center
description: A Canadian man was charged with seven offenses on Tuesday after he injured two soldiers with a knife at a military recruiting center in Toronto. The man, Ayanle Hassan Ali, 27, entered the center on Monday with a very large knife and attacked a soldier stationed near the door, said Torontos police chief, Mark Saunders. A second soldier was wounded trying to subdue Mr. Ali. Neither soldier was seriously injured. The police chief said that during the attack, Mr. Ali said, Allah told me to come here and kill people. Chief Saunders said the police did not know whether Mr. Ali, who was born in Montreal, was an Islamist radical.

title: Live Model: Republican Primary Results
description: Live estimates of the March 15 Republican primary results.

title: Live Model: Democratic Primary Results
description: Live estimates of the March 15 Democratic primary results.

title: Paul McCartneys Tip to Michael Jackson Pays Off
description: It is one of the twice-told tales of the music business: Decades ago, Michael Jackson received some sound investment advice from Paul McCartney.

title: A Canadian Provinces Rocky Symbol Collapses Into Rubble
description: OTTAWA  Viewed at just the right angle, and maybe with a bit of squinting  and perhaps a little imagination  the natural stone formation resembled a charging elephant, about 100 feet high and up to eight feet wide.

title: The Opening to Cuba Widens
description: Americans are still barred by law from traveling to Cuba as tourists, despite the Obama administrations opening with that country. But  new rules  announced by the administration on Tuesday will make traveling there easier and cheaper.

title: A Conversation With Michael S. Dana
description: Mr. Dana, 56, is the president and chief executive of Onex Real Estate Partners, the real estate arm of Onex, one of Canadas largest private equity firms.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $2.85 million

title: Giants Jason Pierre-Paul Says His Hand Is Improving
description: Giants defensive end Jason Pierre-Paul said Tuesday that recent off-season surgery had improved the function of his damaged right hand and that he did not plan to use the mittlike wrapping he needed last season.

title: Ex-President Lula Could Avoid Prison by Joining Brazilian Cabinet
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Will Brazils besieged former president avoid going to prison by joining the government of his protg, President Dilma Rousseff, as a cabinet minister with unrivaled influence?

title: G.O.P. Path Recalls Democrats Convention Disaster, in 1924
description: A presidential candidate who banked on support from the Ku Klux Klan. Blunt demands to ban certain religions and races from playing a full role in society. Violence and disorder at campaign rallies.

title: Ohio Exit Polls
description: Surveys of Republican voters exiting voting locations throughout Ohio on Tuesday.

title: Ohio Exit Polls
description: Surveys of Democratic voters exiting voting locations throughout Ohio on Tuesday.

title: Florida Exit Polls
description: Surveys of Republican voters exiting voting locations throughout Florida on Tuesday.

title: Florida Exit Polls
description: Surveys of Democratic voters exiting voting locations throughout Florida on Tuesday.

title: New Work Rules Reshape M.L.B.s Relationship With Cuban Prospects
description: The Obama administration announced Tuesday that it would allow Cuban citizens to work in the United States and receive salaries from American companies, a decision that could have a profound effect on the way major league teams sign Cuban baseball players.

title: Pressure on Valeant Puts William Ackmans Image as Moneymaker at Risk
description: As an investor, William A. Ackman lives or dies by his big bets. When he is right, the hedge fund titan earns billions of dollars and plenty of accolades.

title: A Distant Second at Home, Marco Rubio Ends a Disappointing Campaign
description: MIAMI  Marco Rubio tried everything to project experience and statesmanship. He held forth on the intricacies of Middle East geopolitics. He rattled off the dangers of a nuclear-armed North Korean dictator.

title: With Sri Srinivasan, Indian Town Prays for a Son on Supreme Court
description: MELA THIRUVENKATANATHAPURAM, India  A bare-chested priest sat cross-legged in the temple of this farming village on a recent morning and recited all 1,008 names of Vishnu, the Hindu god, in the hope of soon receiving good news from the White House.

title: Nick Denton, on Stand, Justifies Posting of Hulk Hogan Sex Video
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  Saying that a sex video featuring the former professional wrestler Hulk Hogan was newsworthy, Nick Denton, the founder and chief executive of Gawker Media, defended his websites decision to publish it as he testified in a $100 million invasion-of-privacy lawsuit here on Tuesday.

title: Student of Irish Language Brings to Life a Patriot of the Easter Rising
description: Ed Shevlin is hardly a typical academic.

title: Bounty Hunter Tracks Chinese Companies That Dupe Investors
description: Robert W. Seiden is a Wall Street bounty hunter. He tracks down executives of Chinese companies that listed on stock exchanges in the United States and then blew up.

title: Rubios Exit and the G.O.P.s Spoiled Buffet
description: As he exited the race for the Republican presidential nomination on Tuesday night, Marco Rubio told a crowd of dispirited supporters that this may not have been the year for a hopeful and optimistic message.

title: Ferguson Approves a Federal Plan to Overhaul Police and Courts
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  The City Council here voted on Tuesday to approve a settlement with the Justice Department to overhaul the citys police and courts, capping a tense few weeks of indecision over how to push forward a community at the center of more than a year and a half of racial upheaval in America.

title: Review: LElisir dAmore, With Vittorio Griglo
description: In Donizettis LElisir dAmore, the shy country lad Nemorino, in love with the beautiful, rich Adina, bemoans his poverty, lack of education and timidity. But when the tenor Vittorio Griglo sang the role on Monday evening at the Metropolitan Opera, it felt like the subtitles should have read I am somebody rather than the librettos I am nobody.

title: Ryans Budget Proposal Runs Into Opposition From Some Hard-Line Republicans
description: WASHINGTON  Paul D. Ryan made his name as a master of budgets, putting forward sweeping documents that epitomized the Republican Partys preference for slashing taxes, curtailing spending and shrinking government. But his first chance to pass a fiscal blueprint as speaker of the House is at risk of being derailed by the conservatives who forced a government shutdown in 2013 and ousted his predecessor last fall.

title: Federal Agents Seize What They Called an Illicit Antiquity Headed for Asia Week
description: For the second time in a matter of days, federal agents on Tuesday seized what they described as an illicit antiquity, valued at several hundred thousand dollars, and scheduled to be sold during New Yorks Asia Week, a celebration of Asian art that includes museum exhibitions and sales by dealers and auction houses.

title: Cornerstone of Cubs Quest Plays First Base
description: MESA, Ariz.  There is no hiding it now. The Chicago Cubs, the most optimistic bunch of perennial losers you will ever meet, have built their foundation on Anthony Rizzo. He is their pillar, the player who holds up the party tent for a celebration 108 years in the making.

title: Can Rubio's Exit Stop Trump?
Whats Next for Both Parties
description: After losing the presidential election in 2012, the Republican Party leadership put together an autopsy report that examined the causes of the defeat. It said that if the party was to win in 2016, it needed to diversify its appeal, reach out to minorities, help everyone make it in America and attack corporate malfeasance and even chief executives bonuses. With Donald Trumps victories, those leaders face a difficult choice.

title: With No Room in Infield, Mets Cut Ties With Ruben Tejada
description: Ruben Tejadas role on the 2016 Mets always seemed a little tenuous. Now it appears there will be no role for him at all.

title: Hillary Clinton Wins 4 Races, Rebounding From Michigan Loss
description: Hillary Clinton swept major primaries in Florida, North Carolina and Ohio on Tuesday, rebounding from her upset loss to Bernie Sanders in Michigan a week earlier and securing a political and psychological victory for her campaign.

title: Five States Go to Polls
description: Voters in Florida, Illinois, Missouri, North Carolina and Ohio decided on Tuesday which Democrat and Republican would win their state.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The answer to that is certainly, yes.

title: Rangers Chris Kreider Keeps His Nose to the Scholarly Grindstone
description: The 140th commencement at Boston College is scheduled for 10 a.m. May 23 at Alumni Stadium in Chestnut Hill, Mass., but Christopher James Kreider has no plans to walk with his class to pick up his long-pursued and long-promised bachelors degree.

title: Rubios Rise and Fall
description: Key moments in the presidential run of Senator Marco Rubio, who suspended his campaign on Tuesday after failing to win Florida, his home state.

title: As Mexican Families Leave U.S. for Home, Film Focuses on the Children
description: For 10 years, Alberta Ojera bounced around the United States, from Poughkeepsie, N.Y., to Chicago to New York City. But without legal status, she could not go home to Mexico to visit her aging parents. So in 2012, Ms. Ojera and her three children, all born in Chicago, moved back to the small town of Cinega de Zimatln.

title: New York Assembly Moves to Cap Legislators Outside Income at $69,600
description: ALBANY  Twenty thousand times the average cost of a pound of shredded cheese. Roughly 27 percent of the estimated price of a 2016 Ferrari. Or $4,600 more than Yogi Berras salary in 1957.

title: Splash Another Add of Wine
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  I did a fair amount of cooking and baking this weekend, while I worked on this puzzle. I often solve puzzles in the kitchen, filling in the grid while things roast and simmer, thinking of answers while I stir and measure, so this theme was a cute coincidence for me. It also made me think of Julia Child, not because I match her chef chops in the slightest, but because my random memories of her shows are of her good-humored, loopy patter and her unbridled enthusiasm for all of the good stuff. A favorite quote: The only time to eat diet food is while youre waiting for the steak to cook.

title: What Quagmire? Even in Withdrawal, Russia Stays a Step Ahead
description: WASHINGTON  For five years, President Obama has steadfastly rejected the argument that the United States could intervene in Syria, alter the equation on the battlefield and avoid being sucked into a quagmire. Now, it appears that President Vladimir V. Putin has done exactly that.

title: Donald Trump Takes 3 States; John Kasich Wins Ohio
description: Donald J. Trump rolled to victory in the Republican presidential primaries in Florida, Illinois and North Carolina on Tuesday, driving Senator Marco Rubio from the race and amassing a formidable delegate advantage that will be exceedingly difficult for any rival to overcome.

title: Brooklyn Mother Is Charged in Drowning of Daughter, 2
description: A 24-year-old woman was arrested on Tuesday on suspicion of killing her 2-year-old daughter in the familys Brooklyn apartment, the police said.

title: Court Filing Seeks Removal of One of Bill Cosbys Lawyers
description: A lawyer for a number of women suing Bill Cosby for defamation filed papers in a civil case in Massachusetts federal court on Tuesday asking to have Monique Pressley removed as one of Mr. Cosbys lawyers in the case.

title: Fingernail Scrapings Lead to an Arrest in a Girls 1989 Murder
description: The 17-year-old victim struggled with her attacker, scratching him before he pushed her off a five-story building in the Bronx after trying to rape her.

title: Kasich, the Boulder Between the G.O.P. and Trump
description: Wow, John Kasich.

title: U.S. Troubleshooter Meets North Korea Diplomats on Detained American
description: Former Gov. Bill Richardson of New Mexico, a veteran diplomat and North Korea troubleshooter, met with two North Korean diplomats from the United Nations on Tuesday to press for the release of an American college student arrested in the North more than two months ago.

title: The People vs. O.J. Simpson Season 1, Episode 7: The Glove
description: Its finally happening: Robert Kardashian is full of doubts about who really killed Nicole Brown Simpson and Ron Goldman.

title: Hillary Clintons Excellent Night, and a Peek Ahead to the Fall
description: Tuesday night could not have gone much better for Hillary Clinton. The results on the Democratic side moved her closer to winning the nomination. The results on the Republican side pushed the G.O.P. even closer toward nominating a candidate who would be at a serious disadvantage in the general election.

title: Will the Democrats Ever Face an African-American Revolt?
description: An insurrection now threatens the future of the Republican Party  an insurrection of white working class voters who have been among the partys most loyal supporters since the civil rights movement of the 1960s. These men and women felt that they lacked an effective political voice, until they heard the siren call of Donald J. Trump.

title: Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump Are Winning Votes, but Not Hearts
description: The victories were lopsided. The celebrations were effusive. The delegates were piling up by the hundreds.

title: Liking the Look of Watches
description: You might not expect a heavy metal hard rocker like Eric Singer to be a serious student of watches. But the drummer of Kiss, and before that Lita Ford, Black Sabbath and Alice Cooper, is extremely knowledgeable about the watches he collects.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | disperse
description: disperse  \di-sprs\  verb

title: Prosecutor Criticized Over Laquan McDonald Case Is Defeated in Primary
description: CHICAGO  Cook Countys top prosecutor, who was derided for taking more than a year to charge a white Chicago police officer in the death of a black teenager here, was soundly defeated by a primary challenger on Tuesday.

title: Ernestine Anderson, Grammy Nominated Jazz Singer, Dies at 87
description: Ernestine Anderson, a versatile jazz singer who recorded her most acclaimed albums after a self-imposed hiatus, died on Thursday at her home in Seattle. She was 87.

title: Gogi Grant, Who Knocked Elvis Off Top of Chart, Dies at 91
description: Gogi Grant, whose rendition of The Wayward Wind replaced Elvis Presleys Heartbreak Hotel on top of the Billboard singles chart in 1956, died on Thursday at her home in Los Angeles. She was 91.

title: Goodbye, Bushism
description: Even in the last limping years of his deeply unpopular administration, George W. Bush was still popular with Republican voters. After Barack Obama took office, Bushs image popped up in anti-Obama iconography, with a cheeky miss me yet? attached. And as his presidency receded, Bushs favorable ratings floated upward, rising above President Obamas and Hillary Clintons as the 2016 campaign got underway.

title: Bernies Dead-End Math  and Why He Should Stay In
description: Yes, its inevitable. Try to shrug off that Clinton fatigue. Hold your nose, if you have to. The only thing standing between a thuggish narcissist and the White House is the almost-certain Democratic nominee  Hillary Clinton.

title: Let Trump Make Our Trans-Pacific Trade Deal
description: What if the United States had had a truly savvy deal maker like Donald Trump negotiate the Trans-Pacific Partnership free-trade accord instead of the wimpy Obama team? I mean, be honest, folks, would you let Barack Obama sell your house? Ive researched the deal and concluded Trump would have gotten us this:

title: Academy Chiefs Apology for Jokes at Oscars Riles Asian Members
description: LOS ANGELES  Another day in Hollywood, another awkward response to complaints of racial insensitivity by the academy.

title: Anterra Capital Closes Investment Fund at $125 Million
description: Anterra Capital, a venture capital firm focused on food and farming start-ups, plans to announce on Wednesday that it has closed its investment fund at $125 million.

title: North Korea Sentences Otto Warmbier, U.S. Student, to 15 Years Labor
description: SEOUL, South Korea  An American college student who tearfully apologized for trying to steal a political propaganda poster from his hotel in Pyongyang, the North Korean capital, was sentenced on Wednesday to 15 years of prison and hard labor.

title: What to Watch Wednesday
description: Keri Russell and Matthew Rhys are back at it as Soviet spies posing as suburbanites in the premiere of the fourth season of The Americans. And The Big Short, Adam McKays Oscar-nominated comedy about the 2008 financial crisis, is available for digital rental.

title: Results Show How Donald Trump Can Win Majority of Delegates
description: Donald Trumps near sweep of states on Tuesday  with the notable exception of Ohio  set up a true three-way race for the second half of the primary season.

title: Covering Zika in Hushed-Up Venezuela
description: When Manu Quintero decided to document the Zika virus in Caracas, he had to jump thick bureaucratic walls because the Venezuelan government has been tight-lipped about it.

title: Corrections: March 16, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Covering Zika in Hushed-Up Venezuela
description: The Zika virus has hit Venezuela at the worst possible time. The country needs anything and everything people require to live, including food, water and medicine. Hospitals are dangerously short of basic supplies, including gauze and needles.

title: A Federal Judges New Model for Forgiveness
description: Should a judge care what happens, years down the road, to the defendants convicted in his courtroom?

title: What Trump and Sanders Get Wrong About Free Trade
description: HARDLY a Democratic or Republican debate passes without claims that international trade is responsible for the countrys growing economic insecurity and inequality.

title: Where Computers Defeat Humans, and Where They Cant
description: ALPHAGO, the artificial intelligence system built by the Google subsidiary DeepMind, has just defeated the human champion, Lee Se-dol, four games to one in the tournament of the strategy game of Go. Why does this matter? After all, computers surpassed humans in chess in 1997, when IBMs Deep Blue beat Garry Kasparov. So why is AlphaGos victory significant?

title: Clintons Growing Delegate Lead Is Nearly Unbeatable
description: An interactive delegate calculator that lets you simulate how the 2016 Republican nomination could unfold.

title: Rubios Exit Leaves Trump With an Open Path to 1,237 Delegates
description: An interactive delegate calculator that lets you simulate how the 2016 Republican nomination could unfold.

title: London Stock Exchange and Deutsche Brse Agree on Merger
description: LONDON  The London Stock Exchange Group and the Deutsche Brse said on Wednesday that they had agreed to merge in an all-stock deal that they hoped would create a European champion in a rapidly consolidating industry.

title: $950 Million Police Academy Simulates the Mean Streets
description: A branch bank had just been robbed in College Point, Queens. Inspector Michael S. McGrath of the New York Police Department ushered me into a small grocers next door. A few boxes were arrayed haphazardly on nearly empty shelves. This place was almost surely a front.

title: Traveling Alone? How to Find a Local Guide
description: When it comes to traveling solo, some people want to take a break and sightsee with a group. But what about those who prefer something more intimate, like a private guided tour?

title: Roslyn, N.Y.: A Hint of New England
description: As the mother of four boys, then ages 3 to 17, Malini Wang was ready for a little serenity in her life when she and her husband, John, were house-hunting on Long Islands North Shore in 2013.

title: Student Question | What Songs Are on Your Favorite Playlist?
description: Note to teachers: You might not consider all of the songs on the playlist appropriate for your students. Please preview first.

title: Chinese Premiers Annual Work Report
description: Prime Minister Li Keqiang of China delivered his government's annual work report to the National Peoples Congress, the Communist Party-controlled legislature, on March 5. Here is a searchable transcript of his speech.

title: Critics Assail Potential New York Move on Regulating Online Colleges
description: Consumer advocates, legal aid organizations and labor unions are urging New York States education commissioner not to sign an interstate agreement that they say would expose students to harm at the hands of online colleges and universities.

title: The Black Calhouns, by Gail Lumet Buckley
description: THE BLACK CALHOUNSFrom Civil War to Civil Rights With One African American FamilyBy Gail Lumet BuckleyIllustrated. 353 pp. Atlantic Monthly Press. $26.

title: Meditation Plus Running as a Treatment for Depression
description: Meditating before running could change the brain in ways that are more beneficial for mental health than practicing either of those activities alone, according to an interesting study of a new treatment program for people with depression.

title: Resort and Tour News: Jewels in Russia; Hotels in Bermuda
description: A NEW DESTINATION IN BERMUDA

title: The Best Way to Fight With a Teenager
description: When raising teenagers, conflict usually comes with the territory. A growing body of research suggests that this can actually be a good thing. How disagreements are handled at home shapes both adolescent mental health and the overall quality of the parent-teenager relationship. Not only that, the nature of family quarrels can also drive how adolescents manage their relationships with people beyond the home.

title: Election Takeaways: Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump Roll On, at Different Speeds
description: Tuesdays elections, with more than 14 million votes cast in five states, marked the more-than-halfway point in both parties presidential primary campaigns.

title: George Osborne Warns of Brexit Risks and Cuts Growth Forecasts
description: LONDON  In a budget meant to appeal to voters before a looming referendum, Britains chancellor of the Exchequer, George Osborne, on Wednesday mainly offered tax breaks, while warning the public against the risks of opting to quit the European Union.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Wedesday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start the day.

title: Meeting My DNA
description: I was adopted when I was 6 months old, so I dont know much about my family medical history. I dont know, for example, whether Im at increased risk for breast cancer, heart disease, mental illness. But home DNA testing is changing all that.

title: Harry Reid to Open Formal Anti-Trump Attacks on Congressional Republicans
description: Senator Harry Reid of Nevada, the Democratic leader, has been trying to yoke congressional Republicans with Donald J. Trump for weeks. In the aftermath of Tuesday nights voting, he intends to make his campaign official on Wednesday in a speech to the Center for American Progress, a liberal think tank, blaming Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, the majority leader, and the House speaker, Paul D. Ryan, for some of Mr. Trumps rise.

title: New York Today: Dogs Can Eat Out
description: Updated, 9:55 a.m.

title: Florence Tackles Duomo Defacement With a New Tool: Virtual Graffiti
description: FLORENCE, Italy  Do not write on the walls, reads the message on a Renaissance stone wall in the cathedral on this citys central square.

title: Pakistan Bus Bombing Kills at Least 14 in Peshawar
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  At least 14 people were killed and 53 others wounded on Wednesday when a bomb destroyed a bus carrying government employees to work in the city of Peshawar, officials said.

title: China Seeks to Avoid Mass Layoffs While Cutting Production
description: BEIJING  China must avoid mass unemployment from failing mines and factories even as it cuts back on its vast production of unwanted coal and steel, Premier Li Keqiang said Wednesday.

title: Morning Agenda: Ackmans Reputation at Risk
description: ACKMANS REPUTATION AT RISK | Pressure is growing on William A. Ackman after the stock price of the drug company Valeant plummeted more than 50 percent on Tuesday, Alexandra Stevenson writes in DealBook. Mr. Ackman, a hedge fund titan, has already lost investors 19.3 percent this year, with much of the decline driven by Valeant.

title: At SXSW, a Shift From Apps to a Tech Lifestyle
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  I got to South by Southwest late over the weekend, well after President Obama addressed the throngs of bearded engineers and other enthusiasts who flock to this annual festival of tech, music, film, barbecue and tacos.

title: Obama Chooses Merrick Garland for Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday nominated Merrick B. Garland to be the nations 113th Supreme Court justice, choosing a centrist appellate judge who could reshape the court for a generation and become the face of a bitter election-year confirmation struggle.

title: Should Parents Reveal That a Father at Their Childs School Is a Sex Offender?
description: My daughter goes to a public elementary school. Recently, one of the parents in our class discovered that a fellow parent, the father of a girl in my daughters class, was arrested in an undercover police operation for soliciting an underage female prostitute. Details of the undercover operation were posted online. He agreed to pay for sex with the underage prostitute, who would come to his house while his young children were asleep and his wife was away at work. He confessed to the crime but is not on the countys searchable online database of sex offenders. While the principal of our school was alerted by another parent and met with the man and his wife (they are still married), information was not passed on to other parents because he is considered at low risk to reoffend. He does not volunteer at the school, at the request of the principal.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Asking What You Pay in Rent
description: Julia writes: My boyfriend, Mike, and I just moved into a house thats fancier than what were both used to. When friends come over, they often ask what we pay in rent. Mike thinks we should just tell them, because theyre probably asking to see whats attainable for themselves. I disagree.

title: The Indian Spy Who Fell for Tibet
description: If it hadnt been for a bout of malaria, Sarat Chandra Das might never have become a spy. As a civil engineer, he might have worked in Calcutta forever. But in 1874, upon recovering from his illness, he was offered a position as headmaster of the Bhutia Boarding School in Darjeeling. The mountain air would do him good, he thought, so he accepted. This was how, at 25, Das came to run a school for spies, training agents to work along the India-Tibet border, growing so besotted with Tibet himself that he made two surreptitious journeys to the kingdom.

title: Review: When the Digital World Is Judging Your Every Thought
description: In the movie Machete, theres a scene in which Danny Trejo rips out an opponents intestines and, leaping from a window, uses them like rope to rappel down the side of a building. As action scenes go, this one has extra habanero.

title: Footballs Power Lurks Behind the Mens Basketball Tournament
description: In a talk at the University of South Carolina last month, the president of the N.C.A.A., Mark Emmert, discussed how colleges outside the so-called Power 5 conferences were adjusting to a new competitive landscape.

title: Dancing Away From the Bleak Life With Fast Car
description: The song starts with unmistakable flourishes from the dance-music playbook: a throbbing beat and four piano chords. Then the fast-spoken vocals come in, a husky voice singing, You got a fast car/I want a ticket to anywhere. Theyre familiar for a reason: Theyre the opening lines to Fast Car, Tracy Chapmans bittersweet 1988 folk-pop ballad.

title: FIFA, Embracing Role as Victim, Seeks to Collect Millions in U.S. Case
description: Organizations reeling from scandal rarely ask the government to reimburse them for their employees crimes. More often, they pay penalties.

title: The Fugitive
description: The young soldier was frightened and freezing. Hed just swum 70 yards through frigid water, fleeing the burning wreckage of an exploded boat. Climbing ashore, he heard gunfire, glanced backward and saw his friend on the ground, blood rushing from his head. Farther away, others in his unit were being rounded up or killed by the Germans. He was sure he would be next.

title: Video: 7 Trends From the Fall Runways
description: Plus: armor looks, capes, and 80s shoulders are making a comeback.

title: News Qs | Donald Trump Takes 3 States; John Kasich Wins Ohio
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article Donald Trump Takes 3 States; John Kasich Wins Ohio.

title: 2 Female Suicide Bombers Attack Mosque Near Maiduguri, Nigeria, Killing Over 20
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Two female suicide bombers detonated explosives on Wednesday morning in an attack on a mosque in northeastern Nigeria, killing 24 people and wounding 18.

title: Delegates Endorse Chinas 5-Year Plan but Resist Saying Much Else
description: BEIJING  Not long after 8 a.m. on Wednesday, a line of buses roared onto cordoned-off Tiananmen Square in the heart of Beijing to drop off hundreds of delegates to the National Peoples Congress. They walked quickly to the granite-pillared Great Hall of the People on the west side of the square for the final meeting of this years session.

title: 1941: Nazis Forces Occupy Balkans
description: BELGRADE  With large-scale operations in the Balkans apparently imminent, there was speculation in diplomatic circles here today [March 16] about Fuehrer Adolf Hitlers motives in moving south through the Balkans and running the risk of opening up a major front here. The Nazis have always been the first to argue that they wanted peace in southeastern Europe. They have said that they did not want war on two fronts and that they did not want to disturb the Reichs economic hinterland. Yet the Germans have jeopardized the economic stability of one Balkan country after another by their military march to the south.  New York Herald Tribune, March 17, 1941

title: Belgium Says Algerian Killed in Raid May Have Had Links to Radical Islam
description: PARIS  The man who was killed during a counterterrorism raid was an Algerian with potential links to radical Islam, Belgian prosecutors said on Wednesday. Two other suspects from Tuesdays raid, which left four police officers wounded, remain on the run, the prosecutors said.

title: Another Fashion Brand Loses a Designer
description: Adding to the disarray in the current fashion world, Ennio Capasa, creative director of Costume National, and his brother, Carlo Capasa, its chief executive, announced on Tuesday that they were leaving the brand they founded 30 years ago.

title: Live Updates: Merrick Garland Is Obamas Choice for Supreme Court
David Tennant, a Former Doctor Who, Dons a Monarchs Crown
description: There are probably young actors today who look back a short distance to a performance by David Tennant  playing the Doctor in Doctor Who, or Alec Hardy in Broadchurch, or Kilgrave in Jessica Jones  as a formative influence on their work and career. Mr. Tennant, 44, looks back a bit further, to the late 1980s, when the Royal Shakespeare Company brought Hamlet to Glasgow with Mark Rylance in the title role.

title: Fashions Return to the Age of Innocence
description: A romantic cascade of billowy blouses, buttoned collars and flowing hair summons the purifying spirit of a new spring.

title: Britain, Dont Leave the E.U., Only You Can Save It.
description: Hamburg, Germany  DEAR Britons: I feel your pain. As a former Brussels correspondent still traumatized by the posting, I have no illusions left about the European Unions shortcomings and overreaches. I wont play the Good German, begging you to stay. If you feel you have to leave, of course you must. But theres this: A Brexit isnt in your national interest. And I believe that, in leaving, you would betray your nations heritage.

title: Unofficial Poll on Legislative Proposals Hints at Chinese Priorities
description: BEIJING  Ban eating cats and dogs. Raise teachers pay. Make the college entrance exam the same for everyone throughout China.

title: The New York Dog Carry
description: Dear Diary:

title: Pakistans Supreme Court Lifts Travel Ban on Pervez Musharraf
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The Pakistani Supreme Court on Wednesday withdrew a travel ban imposed on the former military ruler Pervez Musharraf, paving the way for him to seek medical treatment abroad even as he awaits trial on treason charges.

title: How Muslim Governments Impose Ignorance
description: ISTANBUL  I recently spent a few days in Malaysia, where I was promoting the publication of the Malay edition of my book, Islam Without Extremes: A Muslim Case for Liberty. The publisher, a progressive Muslim organization called the Islamic Renaissance Front, had set up several talks for me in Kuala Lumpur. As any author would be, I was happy to learn that the team was enthusiastic about my book and had been getting good feedback from audiences and readers. But I was troubled by something else that I suspect many Muslim authors have experienced: My publisher was worried about censorship.

title: Inside Yann Martels Backyard Writing Studio
description: The novelists latest, The High Mountains of Portugal, was written in a shed in Saskatoon, Canada.

title: A Writers Room: Yann Martel
description: The Man Booker Prize winner on his backyard studio in Saskatoon, Canada, where he wrote his just-published novel, The High Mountains of Portugal.

title: Reconsider a Refugee Deal With Turkey
description: When European leaders, who are under pressure to find solutions to the refugee crisis, meet this week to finalize a deal with Turkey, they should weigh the serious legal and moral questions it raises.

title: 4 Workers Beaten in Robbery at Upper West Side Hotel
description: Patrick Thomas was pushing carts filled with breakfast for guests at the Rodeway Inn  on the Upper West Side of Manhattan on Wednesday when the buildings electricity began to falter. The lights flickered and the elevator hesitated as Mr. Thomas, a housekeeper, made his way to a basement room to examine the electricity panel.

description: CLEVELAND  Energized by his first primary victory, Gov. John Kasich of Ohio argued on Wednesday that he was the only candidate in the Republican field who could actually defeat the Democratic nominee in November.

title: Supreme Court Showdown Could Shape Fall Elections
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas nomination of Judge Merrick B. Garland to the Supreme Court has set off a series of head-spinning political calculations extreme even for a capital that feasts on political intrigue.

title: Apple Invokes Rights of the American People in Its Fight
description: Apple is either a noble crusader in its fight with the Federal Bureau of Investigation over access to a locked iPhone or it is a miscreant that believes it is above the law.

title: Speaking Your Mind to Google Docs
description: Q. I want to use the online dictation command in Google Docs, but my laptops built-in microphone doesnt work very well and Im getting a message about the program not being able to hear me. My computer also seems to be lacking a microphone port on the side for an external mike. What do I do?

title: Merger of London Stock Exchange and Deutsche Brse Has Skeptics
description: Investors buy only half of the logic of splicing together the London Stock Exchange and the Deutsche Brse.

title: Moishes, an East Village Mainstay
description: Moishes Bake Shop hasnt changed the challah, hamantaschen cookies and other goods it serves, even as the neighborhood has undergone dramatic shifts.

title: The East Village May Change, but the Strudel at Moishes Stays the Same
description: The neighborhood around Second Avenue and East Seventh Street has changed a good deal in the last four decades or so, since Moishe Perl opened his kosher bakery on a block that could be described as dicey, when he would often need to scatter a few drunks sleeping it off on the sidewalk when he opened up in the morning. Certainly the local streets never teemed with restaurantgoers, shoppers and multilingual tourists the way they do now on an ordinary Sunday afternoon.

title: Metro Shutdown Sends D.C. Commuters to the Streets (and Twitter)
description: After officials announced that Metro, Washingtons subway system, would be shut down for 29 hours, riders began preparations for another problematic travel day in a city already well known for its cramped and sometimes dangerous train commutes.

title: Donald Trump Warns of Riots if Party Blocks Him at Convention
description: Donald J. Trump warned of riots around the Republican National Convention should he fall slightly short of the 1,237 delegates he needs to clinch the nomination and the party moves to select another candidate.

title: Why Obama Nominated Merrick Garland for the Supreme Court
description: Merrick B. Garland is a candidate who had support from Republicans in the past but would still move the court in a progressive direction.

title: South Africas Cricketers Battle Image as Chokers
description: South Africa would again seem to be a strong contender for the World Twenty20 cricket tournament. The team is fourth in the world rankings and filled with star players.

title: Denmark Ranks as Happiest Country; Burundi, Not So Much
description: LONDON  Denmark has reclaimed its place as the worlds happiest country, while Burundi ranks as the least happy nation, according to the fourth World Happiness Report, released on Wednesday.

title: 1966: Watts Rioting Erupts Again
description: LOS ANGELES  Hundreds of Negroes rampaged for six hours last night [March 15], leaving at least two persons dead and 26 injured in the Watts district of Los Angeles. A massive force of several hundred police swiftly sealed off a 36-square-block section in the predominantly Negro district, scene of last Augusts blood riot. Then police with shotguns moved in to clear the streets of mobs firing guns, hurling bottles, looting stores and burning cars. Gov. Edmund G. Brown flew to Los Angeles, but decided against calling out the alerted National Guard.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, March 17, 1966

title: Bookshelf: Holy Days
description: New picture books for spring holidays include a Passover story, the life of Jesus, and answers to kids' question from Pope Francis.

title: French Student Who Took Some Breaks Earns Doctorate at 90
description: LONDON  Doctoral students the world over have long despaired about the grueling hours required to obtain a Ph.D. Just ask Colette Bourlier, age 90.

title: Living in Roslyn, N.Y.
description: The picturesque village of Roslyn, on Long Islands North Shore, has a varied housing stock.
