description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: 1966: U.S. to Allow Wives Return To Vietnam
description: SAIGON  Despite the threat of terrorist activity against Americans here, the State Department has made a quiet decision to allow some governmental wives to join their husbands in Saigon. Most U.S. officials here, even those in the military who apparently will not be able to bring over wives, give their approval.

title: At Site of Gay Mans Murder, a Street Corner Acknowledges Its Past
description: There is little about the intersection of 78th Street and 37th Avenue to distinguish it from any other corner in Jackson Heights. Every day, dozens of parents  from dozens of countries  waiting for their children to be dismissed from school stand beneath a sign declaring the intersection Julio Rivera Corner. Many of them probably do not even notice it, yet with those three words, the sign acknowledges a tragic  and ultimately transforming  moment in Queens.

title: Donald Trump Courts Wary Jewish Voters
description: On paper, Donald J. Trump is the last candidate one would expect to raise eyebrows within the Jewish community.

title: Geoffrey H. Hartman, Scholar Who Saw Literary Criticism as Art, Dies at 86
description: Geoffrey H. Hartman, a literary critic whose work took in the Romantic poets, Judaic sacred texts, Holocaust studies, deconstruction and the workings of memory  and took on the very function of criticism itself  died on March 14 at his home in Hamden, Conn. He was 86.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: Tyler Perrys Easter season extravaganza, The Passion, is the latest entry in the growing genre of live TV musicals. And Americas favorite gal pals, Tina Fey and Amy Poehler, are back together in Sisters, streaming online.

title: Turkish Member of ISIS Carried Out Istanbul Bombing, Official Says
description: ISTANBUL  A Turkish member of the Islamic State was the perpetrator of a suicide bombing that killed four foreigners in Istanbul over the weekend, the Turkish interior minister said on Sunday.

title: Zootopia Is Still the Top Film, While Allegiant Falters
description: No amount of slick marketing can sell a terrible movie.

title: Why the Republicans May Do Little in Congress
description: Remember the first branch of American government? With all the attention to the presidential race and the partisan fight over President Obamas nomination of Judge Merrick B. Garland to the Supreme Court, Congress seems an afterthought.

title: Donald Trump Faults Protesters Over Violence, Not Their Assailants
description: After his rallies in Arizona this weekend were marked by protests and violence, Donald J. Trump on Sunday complained of a double standard in coverage of those incidents and defended his campaign manager after video showed the manager grabbing a demonstrator by the collar and yanking him backward during a rally in Tucson.

title: As Obama Arrives, Cuba Tightens Grip on Dissent
description: HAVANA  President Obama touched down in Cuba on Sunday, pledging to interact directly with the Cuban people and accelerate engagement between the United States and Cuba after more than a half-century of hostility.

title: Ip Man 3 Distributor Is Punished Over Box-Office Fraud
description: Chinese film regulators have cracked down on the film distributor Beijing Max Screen over inflation of ticket sales for the movie Ip Man 3. Max Screen has admitted to inflating box-office figures by more than $8.6 million, and has been barred from releasing movies for a month, according to Xinhua News Agency.

title: Sherwin-Williams to Buy Valspar for $9.3 Billion
description: Sherwin-Williamss famous logo shows a can of red paint pouring over a globe with the slogan Cover the Earth.

title: A Signature ISIS Explosive in Europe
description: Triacetone triperoxide, which was used in the Paris attacks in November, has become the Islamic State's explosive of choice in Europe. Specialists in bomb detection explain why.

title: Seeking Access to Facebook in China, Zuckerberg Courts Risks
description: HONG KONG  In terms of publicity, it was a great weekend for Mark Zuckerberg in China.

title: Bus Crash in Spain Kills at Least 13, Officials Say
description: At least 13 students died on Sunday when a bus crashed on a highway in eastern Spain while on its way back to Barcelona from a day of festivities in Valencia, Spanish officials said.

title: Garland Shouldnt Be Considered After Election, McConnell Says
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate majority leader, Mitch McConnell, on Sunday dismissed the possibility of Republicans considering President Obamas Supreme Court nominee after the November election, even if a Democrat were elected president or Republicans lost their majority.

title: College Sharpshooters Add Theatrics to Their Quivers
description: Cupid. Artemis. Robin Hood. Katniss Everdeen. Jamal Murray. Great archers, all of them.

title: Villanova Routs Iowa to Advance to Round of 16
description: Since Villanova arrived in Brooklyn last week, the Wildcats have been shadowed by questions about their recent inability to advance past the round of 32 at the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament.

title: Majority Threshold Unfair in G.O.P. Nomination Process, Donald Trump Complains
description: With the prospect of a contested convention looming over the Republican presidential primary, Donald J. Trump on Sunday complained about the partys rules requiring a candidate to have a majority of delegates to clinch the nomination outright.

title: After Loss, Warriors Are Bullish as Ever in Pursuit of a Record
description: SAN ANTONIO  Draymond Green of the Golden State Warriors was minutes removed from a rare loss when he fielded a question about the teams pursuit of the 1995-96 Chicago Bulls for the best record in N.B.A. history. Green asked for clarification: What sort of work did the Warriors have ahead of them? Eleven wins in their final 13 games?

title: John Kasich Says G.O.P. Senators Should Meet With Supreme Court Nominee
description: Gov. John Kasich of Ohio expressed openness this weekend to considering Judge Merrick B. Garland for the Supreme Court, only to later clarify that he was just being polite and would not, in fact, choose him for the court.

title: Shukhov Tower in Moscow Placed on Monuments Watch List
description: The Shukhov Tower, a 1920s broadcast transmission tower in Moscow that is a landmark of modernist structural engineering, has been placed on the 2016 World Monuments Fund Watch list of endangered global cultural heritage sites.

title: Cubans Pack the Streets for a Glimpse of President Obama
description: HAVANA  Shouts of U.S.A.! and Obama! echoed over the stone plazas as President Obama and his family made their way around rain-slicked courtyards in Old Havana on Sunday evening, savoring the adulation of Cubans welcoming him warmly despite a driving rain as he began a history-making visit.

title: Hillary Clinton Campaign Has Raised Millions Toward Beating Bernie Sanders
description: Hillary Clintons campaign raised more than $30.1 million in February to be used toward defeating Senator Bernie Sanders in the Democratic primary and began March with $30.8 million on hand, according to the campaigns Federal Election Commission report released on Sunday.

title: Amazon Leans on Government in Its Quest to Be a Delivery Powerhouse
description: WASHINGTON  Ever since Jeff Bezos started the website Amazon to sell books, he has wrestled with how to deliver its products as quickly and cheaply as possible. Today, Amazon, now a retail giant, remains obsessed with this issue, building its own fleet of drones, buying trailers for trucks and signing up drivers for on-demand deliveries.

title: Julie Kent on Her Plans for Showcasing Washington Dancers
description: Julie Kent told her Instagram followers about her new job earlier this month with a link to an article and a single word: Surprise!

title: Review: Witchcraft: The Jazz Magic of Cy Coleman Summons a Bygone Era
description: By the end of Saturdays opening-night performance of Witchcraft: The Jazz Magic of Cy Coleman at the 92nd Street Y, anyone present could be forgiven for imagining that the clock had magically been turned back to 1965 or thereabouts. In a shimmering musical mirage, the bygone Manhattan night life of 50 years ago came into view.

title: Review: Orpheuss Shifting Glimmers From Angled Glass
description: To New Yorkers whose daily commute takes them along the West Side Highway, Jean Nouvels building at 100 West 11th Avenue, which its architect describes as a vision machine, is a familiar sight, a curved structure set with thousands of angled glass panes that make a kaleidoscope of the blues, grays and greens of the sky and river.

title: Classical Playlist: Brouwer, Cantate Domino and More
description: Pedro Chamorro, bandurria; Pedro Mateo Gonzlez, guitar (Naxos)

title: Review: Trinity Wall Street Presents Ginasteras Raging Cantata Para Amrica Mgica
description: In 1961, two works by Alberto Ginastera  his Piano Concerto No. 1 and Cantata Para Amrica Mgica  were given their premieres in Washington as part of the second Inter-American Music Festival. Have they ever been played in such proximity since?

title: War of the Worlds Shape-Shifts Onto the London Stage
description: LONDON  For Americans, War of the Worlds evokes images of panic and devastation in New Jersey set to the voice of Orson Welles crackling over the radio in 1938. But in Britain, a 1978 prog-rock album that dramatized H. G. Wellss tale of Martian takeover is far better known.

title: Review: Kapoor & Sons Centers on an Indian Familys Flaws
description: Kapoor & Sons  Since 1921 isnt about the dynastic family of Hindi movie directors, actors and producers. But it does star one of them, Rishi Kapoor (son of Raj, father of Ranbir), who heavily (and skillfully) made up plays Dadu, the about-to-be-90 paterfamilias of a clan made unhappy by the usual secrets and lies and long-cherished grudges.

title: Flinging Emojis, Twitch Chatters Revel as Julia Child Cooks
description: When I was a teenager, my friends and I had a blast watching television together  often really bad television  and mocking it ceaselessly. We became the entertainment, not whatever clumsy dialogue or plot twist we derided.

title: Last-Second Tip-In Shines Spotlight on a Notre Dame Guard
description: Entering Notre Dames matchup with Stephen F. Austin, Rex Pflueger was a sparingly used, little-known freshman guard for the Irish who had not scored a field goal since March 5.

title: Review: Balanchine and Shakespeare Catch Some Waves in Miami
description: MIAMI  As if to illustrate the effects of climate change, Miami City Ballet has set its new production of George Balanchines two-act A Midsummer Nights Dream underwater. Transposing the action to the waterways of South Florida, the production is a peak of this companys 30th-anniversary season. Although the staging does not makes much sense on its own terms and in no way improves the ballet, its daftness is agreeably harmless: You can vaguely enjoy some of its fantasies while seriously loving the choreography. And the Miamians dancing has all the wonderful immediacy that makes this company valuable.

title: Review: In Switched On, John Elder Robisons Aspergers Brain Is Changed
description: From an early age, it was clear that John Elder Robison had been wired with extra fibers for appreciating music. He could easily hear the difference between one kind of Fender bass and another. He could recognize which of 100 speakers in a sound system was groaning in distress. He could take any musical gizmo and, as Nigel Tufnel might say, make it go to 11. (His talent for creating fire-breathing guitars earned him a gig with Kiss as a young man.)

title: Anger After Official Says WTA Players Ride on Coattails of Men
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  The final Sunday of the BNP Paribas Open, one of the biggest joint ATP-WTA events outside the Grand Slam tournaments, is often a showcase for tenniss superstars, with the womens and mens finals played back to back.

title: SXSW 2016
description: Scenes from concerts by Iggy Pop, Drake and other performers at South by Southwest in Austin, Tex.

title: SXSW: From Exclusive Performances to Cellphone Souvenirs
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  I want everybody to download that song, and I want all of you singing that anthem. Sentiments like that were heard all over South by Southwest music festival, which brought more than 2,000 acts to perform here over five frenetic days and nights. But that request came from Michelle Obama as she promoted This Is for My Girls, a single that benefits Let Girls Learn, a project encouraging girls education worldwide that was written by Diane Warren and is performed by Missy Elliott, Janelle Mone, Kelly Rowland, Kelly Clarkson and others. The first lady shared a panel with Ms. Warren and Ms. Elliott along with Queen Latifah and Sophia Bush, extolling the cultural and economic benefits of girls education as well as diversity in every field. (Responding to an audience question, Ms. Obama also ruled out the possibility of her running for president.)

title: Top-Secret
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Molweni, sawubona and hallo! Those are greetings in Xhosa, Zulu and Afrikaans, respectively.

title: Angela Merkels Trust in Turkey and Greece on Migrants Comes With Risks
description: BERLIN  Chancellor Angela Merkel, alternately lauded for courage and reviled for recklessness in admitting more than one million migrants into Germany, finally has what she wanted: a European Union accord with Turkey to reduce and manage the influx.

title: Jessica Lang Dance to Put Down Roots in Long Island City
description: Jessica Lang Dance, after several nomadic years of renting studio space around New York, is putting down roots in the culture-rich neighborhood of Long Island City, Queens.

title: Paris Suspect Salah Abdeslam Said to Envision a Restart, Officials Say
description: BRUSSELS  Salah Abdeslam, the man believed to be a direct participant in the November attacks in Paris who was arrested on Friday, was planning to restart something in Brussels, Belgiums foreign minister said on Sunday.

title: Tensions Rise in David Camerons Government Over E.U. Vote
description: LONDON  With a referendum on Britains membership in the European Union fewer than 100 days away, Prime Minister David Cameron faced deepening fissures within his government on Sunday, underscoring the risk that his Conservative Party could be torn apart over the countrys relationship with the Continent.

title: Greece Struggles to Enforce Migrant Accord on First Day
description: ATHENS  Greece and the European Union scrambled on Sunday to put in place the people and the facilities needed to carry out a new deal intended to address the migrant crisis that is roiling Europe, as hundreds of migrants in rubber dinghies continued to land on the Greek islands from Turkey.

title: U.S. Casts Wary Eye on Australian Port Leased by Chinese
description: DARWIN, Australia  The port in this remote northern Australian outpost is little more than a graying old wharf jutting into crocodile-infested waters. On a recent day, there was stifling heat but not a ship in sight. Our pissy little port, as John Robinson, a flamboyant local tycoon, calls it.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of March 21
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: N.C.A.A. Favorites End a Few Charmed Runs
description: Cinderella almost looked like a Lumberjack.

title: Kraft Reveals Revamped Mac and Cheese, 50 Million Boxes Later
description: USUALLY when companies come out with a new and improved formula, they want the public to know. But when the item in question is an iconic food product, the calculus gets tougher. Every marketer remembers with a shudder the cautionary tale of New Coke.

title: Manhattan Incompatibility: A Poem
description: Dear Diary:

title: Hollywood Divided Over Movie Streaming Service
description: LOS ANGELES  Tech entrepreneurs are always rolling into Hollywood with new services that are supposed to modernize the movie business. If only the dusty, old, dimwitted studios and theater companies would stop dragging their feet and sign up, all of the entertainment industrys problems would be solved.

title: Billy Eppler Is Rebuilding the Angels, but on a Fast Track
description: TEMPE, Ariz.  Everybody wears red around the Los Angeles Angels. It has been their primary color since 2002, when they won their only World Series. They often wear red jerseys with red numerals. Their executives wear red golf shirts. Their players wear red undershirts, sweatshirts and shorts. The 3-foot Darth Vader figurine in the middle of the locker room? He wears a red jersey, too.

title: Hawaii Struggles to Keep Rail Project From Becoming a Boondoggle
description: KAPOLEI, Hawaii  From the start  when Honolulu officials began talking about building a 20-mile elevated train line near the southern coast of Oahu  there were concerns. How much would it cost? What would it do to the character of a state that has long celebrated its natural beauty and isolation? Can an island in the middle of the Pacific Ocean handle the kind of ambitious public works project one would associate with urban centers like Boston and New York?

title: Cash (From Cans) Is King
description: The Thrifty Redemption Center in Borough Park, Brooklyn, where individuals can get paid for empty bottles and cans. The city has tried to limit the practice.

title: New York City Fights Scavengers Over a Treasure: Trash
description: The video begins with ominous notes from a piano and an image of crime scene tape. The camera pans to men hunched over garbage pails, sifting for bottles, and a stoop-shouldered woman towing a shopping cart full of cans. Some might feel sympathy for these collectors, but the video makes clear that the New York City Sanitation Department, which made the video and posted it online, wanted them to be seen as something else: common criminals.

title: Donald Trump Is a Punch Line for Obama, Who Is Getting More Jokes Ready
description: WASHINGTON  Donald J. Trumps transformation from reality TV star to presidential candidate threatening to tear apart the Republican Party is eliciting a mixture of disbelief, outrage and laughter among Democrats, and none more so than President Obama.

title: Russian Town Says Bleak Film Depiction Went Heavy on the Vodka
description: TERIBERKA, Russia  Tatyana Trubilina, the head of the local council in this desolate Russian outpost on the Barents Sea, wanted to make a few things absolutely clear: Not all 1,000 residents are alcoholics; not everyone is depressed; and nobody has committed suicide, at least not recently.

title: A Manchester Derby With an Unfamiliar Focus: The Future
description: MANCHESTER, England  The 171st game between Manchester City and Manchester United was, much like the previous 170, emotional. There were fans in blue (City) and fans in red (United). There was chanting (some of it encouraging) and singing (some of it crude). There was, it seemed, a fair bit of prematch drinking. All pretty standard.

title: As Coals Future Grows Murkier, Banks Pull Financing
description: Tens of thousands of miners were on strike and coal prices were skyrocketing in October 1902. Afraid of unrest, President Theodore Roosevelt sought the help of John Pierpont Morgan.

title: Obama Begins Visit to Cuba
description: President Obama on Sunday became the first sitting United States president to visit the island since 1928.

title: Older Voters May Be Hillary Clintons Answer to Bernie Sanderss Youth Appeal
description: LAKE WORTH, Fla.  The afternoon of the Florida primaries last week, Sylvia Wolfson, 87, and more than a dozen other retirees scurried around an office set up with trays of cookies from Costco and large-print instructions on how to unlock the restroom door.

title: Queens Bouncer With Imposing Physique Is Remembered as a Peacemaker
description: He had the look of an enforcer, a tough man with 22-inch biceps. But the bouncer known by almost everyone as Dale had a reputation around Johnnys, a hopping Caribbean restaurant and bar in the South Ozone Park neighborhood of Queens, for his ability to ease alcohol-inflamed tensions without having to get physical.

title: Apple iPhone Hearing, VW Diesel Update and Luxury Cars
description: More than two dozen European countries will ask the Supreme Court on Monday to let them sue in an American court. They said R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company participated in an international money laundering scheme, using drug money to buy tobacco, in violation of the federal Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act, or RICO.

title: A Change of Heart
description: The artificial heart became a media sensation in the 1980s as it both raised hopes and spread controversy. Today, its impact on medical science is still playing out in surprising ways.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The government of Cuba is like a father. Strong, but worried about the family.

title: Imagine the Big East, Coast to Coast
description: DENVER  Mark Few stood outside the Gonzaga locker room Saturday after his Bulldogs had mopped the court with yet another opponent from a supposedly stronger conference.

title: The Mutual Dependence of Donald Trump and the News Media
description: Did you catch the Trump-Kelly bout Friday night? What a show.

title: Making Bracket Wasnt a Given, but Syracuse Looks as if It Belongs
description: ST. LOUIS  Few expected to see either team playing in the N.C.A.A. tournament on Sunday. Syracuse had needed the equivalent of a favorable roll in the mens basketball selection committee room one week earlier even to be in the bracket. And Middle Tennessee State had to accomplish probably the biggest upset of the tournament to advance to the round of 32.

title: Oregon Slips Past St. Josephs; Texas A&M Needs Two Overtimes
description: SPOKANE, Wash.  With about 90 seconds remaining, trailing by 1 point, Oregon zipped the ball around until it found Dillon Brooks, its best shooter, open on the wing. St. Josephs players kept swiveling their heads, trying to keep up and stay in position, but with this Oregon team, no matter where the ball landed, it would not have been ideal.

title: Self-Correcting Beyond a Web Era Marked by Sensationalism
description: The trial involving Gawker and Terry Bollea, better known as Hulk Hogan, over the publication of a sex video raised timeless legal questions about privacy and freedom of the press. The result, with the jury awarding Mr. Bollea $115 million in compensatory damages, could threaten Gawkers existence.

title: For Potvins, a Chance to Reflect on a Shared Islanders Legacy
description: Jean Potvin made his entrance at Patsys Pizzeria just across Flatbush Avenue from Barclays Center, where he was greeted by his younger brother Denis, still one of the best known figures in New York sports almost three decades after retiring.

title: Artificial Hearts Ticking Along Decades After Jarvik-7 Debate
description: In the beginning, meaning 1982, there was the Jarvik-7, an artificial heart made of plastic and metal and intended for permanent implantation in a human being.

title: Jason Day Leads All the Way at Arnold Palmer Invitational
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Jason Day was hitting out of the sand to a green sloping toward a water hazard. If he got up and down for par, Day would win the Arnold Palmer Invitational by one stroke. The shot was not easy, and the circumstances made it harder. The crowd ringing the 18th green at Bay Hill Golf Club included the tournament host, Palmer, who was seated in a cart a few yards away with an unimpeded view of Days sandy soliloquy.

title: Four Candidates Seek Westchester County District Attorney Post
description: WHITE PLAINS  On its face, the job of Westchester County district attorney seems like a fairly staid one. An affluent bedroom community of New York City, with pockets of poverty, the county is rife with neither violent crime nor corporate malfeasance.

title: Affymetrix Rejects $1.5 Billion Takeover Bid
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Affymetrix, a maker of advanced genetic analysis technology, on Sunday rejected an 11th-hour takeover bid meant to derail its planned sale to Thermo Fisher Scientific for $1.3 billion.

title: For Transgender New Yorkers, a Center of Their Own in the Bronx
description: Eli Berry cannot go to stores or restaurants without being asked if he is a man or a woman. A mall security guard once demanded that he show identification to use a public mens room.

title: First Step in Conservatives Supreme Court Fight: Agreeing on a Message
description: WASHINGTON  The live shot on MSNBC was less than an hour away, so Curt A. Levey, executive director of the FreedomWorks Foundation, a conservative group determined to block President Obamas Supreme Court nominee, sat with his communications director for a quick review of what his message to the American public should be.

title: When M.L.B. Broke the Ice With a Game in Havana
description: On Tuesday afternoon, the Tampa Bay Rays will play an exhibition game against the Cuban national baseball team in Havana. The moment will surely stand out, but it will not be nearly as groundbreaking as the game the Baltimore Orioles played there 17 years ago.

title: Marylands First 3-Pointer, on 16th Try, Goes a Long Way
description: SPOKANE, Wash.  The Hawaii guards had been harassing Maryland guard Melo Trimble all game long, pressing him, bumping him, chasing him. The Rainbow Warriors had set the tone with their aggressive play, getting in the Terrapins faces, trying to intimidate the higher seed, and it seemed to be working, as Maryland missed its first 15 3-point attempts.

title: Vinyl Season 1, Episode 6: The Adventures of Richie and Ernst
description: This weeks Vinyl is an hour of Richie and Devon revisiting their pasts. For Devon, that means staying with her friend Ingrid at the Chelsea Hotel, talking about how lonely she is in Connecticut and posing nude for Ingrids artist boyfriend. For Richie, that means snorting cocaine and then snorting more cocaine.

title: Q. and A.: Noah Bean on Portraying David Bowie
description: Portraying David Bowie at his 1970s peak was a tall enough order for an actor while the rock icon was still alive. But to be the first in those platform shoes and that red mullet since Mr. Bowies death in January, at the age of 69, added another layer of anxieties.

title: The Walking Dead Season 6, Episode 14: Tennessee Waterfalls, Strategic Bites and a Tragic Loss
description: If you dont wake up and face your what? The suspense is killing me!

title: Review: The Effect, About Falling in Love While Taking Antidepressants
description: How much do you love me? Do you love me as much as I love you? Are you happy that you love me? How happy?

title: Minnesotas Amanda Kessel Tops Off Return With a National Title
description: DURHAM, N.H.  As she savored the moment  an unexpected joy, if one was to believe the N.C.A.A. seeding committee  Amanda Kessel had one overriding thought: This was why she had come back.

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: San Antonio at Oklahoma City
description: The San Antonio Spurs defeated the Golden State Warriors, 87-79, on Saturday. The loss was the Warriors first to a team in the N.B.A.s top tier. Previously, they had been 1-0 against the Spurs, 3-0 against the Oklahoma City Thunder and 2-0 against the Cleveland Cavaliers.

title: Billions Season 1, Episode 9: Bobby the Profiteer
description: Axelrod Hall will not be named Axelrod Hall forever, I predicted in the recap to the second episode of Billions, when Bobby moved to buy the naming rights to a symphony hall and etch his name in the firmament. But who could have guessed the request to remove the Axelrod name would come this soon?

title: Donald Trump Is Finally Uniting Top Republican Donors  Against Him
description: The prospect of a Donald J. Trump nomination is accomplishing what a diverse and talented field of Republican presidential contenders could not: uniting the partys big-money donor establishment.

title: Thomas Walkup Sheds Tears Over What Might Have Been
description: The Lumberjack was trying not to cry.

title: Tired and Depleted, Knicks Stumble to Defeat
description: A game between two of the worst teams in the N.B.A. unfolded appropriately enough on Sunday evening.

title: Donald Trump Says Hell List His Top Supreme Court Picks
description: Donald J. Trump on Sunday promised to make public this week a list of five to 10 judges he would nominate to the Supreme Court, seeking to ease concerns among conservatives that he would appoint liberal justices if he is elected president.

title: Roger Agnelli, Iron Man Who Led a Global Mining Giant, Dies at 56
description: Roger Agnelli, a former banking executive who helped turn the Brazilian company Vale into a global mining giant, died on Saturday when his private plane crashed in So Paulo, Brazil. He was 56.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | curmudgeon
description: curmudgeon \()kr-m-jn\ noun

title: Wisconsin Upsets Xavier With (What Else?) a 3 at the Buzzer
description: ST. LOUIS  Four Wisconsin players ran in a circle as if around an invisible maypole on Sunday night. A fifth, the freshman Ethan Happ, prepared to pass the ball inbounds from near halfcourt. There were exactly two seconds left.

title: The Abundance, by Annie Dillard
description: THE ABUNDANCENarrative Essays Old and NewBy Annie Dillard271 pp. Ecco/HarperCollins Publishers. $25.99.

title: The Passion: Jesus Final Hours as a Halftime Show
description: On the seventh day, Fox didnt rest. It took the greatest story ever told and turned it into a halftime show.

title: A Murder Over a Girl, by Ken Corbett
description: A MURDER OVER A GIRLJustice, Gender, Junior HighBy Ken CorbettIllustrated. 273 pp. Henry Holt & Company. $27.

title: What to Watch Monday
description: If you want to see for yourself what went on between Leo and the bear in The Revenant, the Oscar-winning film has made its way to iTunes. And Dancing With the Stars returns for a 22nd season of feel-good ballroom battles. For reality TV with more sass, there is always RuPauls Drag Race.

title: The Pressure of the Sierra Madre
description: In northern Mexico, the indigenous Rarmuri have reached an uneasy accommodation with the cartel that controls the opium trade.

title: Corrections: March 21, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: The Pressure of the Sierra Madre
description: Christian Rodriguez knew he had to stop taking pictures in a small indigenous village in Mexicos Sierra Madre once he saw the enforcers with AK-47s chatting on two-way radios. If he needed any further confirmation, there was always the men he spotted higher up looking at them through binoculars.

title: Lost Years for Liberias Children
description: To the Editor:

title: Women in Science
description: To the Editor:

title: Weeding Out Unsafe Buses: The Industrys View
description: To the Editor:

title: Sharing Knowledge, for a Price
description: To the Editor:

title: Christian Health Care
description: To the Editor:

title: On Invincible Ignorance
description: Remember Paul Ryan? The speaker of the House used to be a media darling, lionized as the epitome of the Serious, Honest Conservative  never mind those of us who actually looked at the numbers in his budgets and concluded that he was a con man. These days, of course, he is overshadowed by the looming Trumpocalypse.

title: Chinese Problems on Americas Shores
description: In recent months, there has been a sharp drop in Chinas foreign reserves, with lots of families and companies sending dollars overseas as the government cracks down on corruption and the economy weakens. Those fears have not let up, though this month the Chinese central bank did report an abrupt, puzzling slowdown in the outflows in February.

title: A Presidential Rebuke to the Saudis
description: It is rare for an American president to skewer a friendly government publicly. But thats what President Obama did last week in presenting a well-considered analysis of troubles in the relationship with Saudi Arabia.

title: Will a Liberal Supreme Court Limit Money in Politics?
description: The words Citizens United, especially when amplified by a vigorous Democratic presidential nomination fight, have become a potent shorthand for the influence of great wealth over American democracy. With the death of Justice Antonin Scalia, the possibility of reversing the 2010 decision in Citizens United v. Federal Election Committee quickly became a live issue in the election and in the shadowboxing over Justice Scalias replacement.

title: What Mexico Thinks About Trump
description: MEXICO CITY  IN 2011, when the Republican presidential hopeful Herman Cain proposed building an electric fence on the Mexican border, it predictably caused shock waves south of the Rio Grande. Priests, the press and a former president expressed outrage. Mr. Cain quickly pulled back, saying he was just kidding. That is not a serious plan, he said. America needs to get a sense of humor. That is a joke, O.K.?

title: Learning Lessons From Outrage
description: There is so much we have learned from this painful election season and the rise of a demagogic real estate developer.

title: Religion and Birth Control at the Supreme Court
description: If the harm that Senate Republicans are inflicting on the nation by refusing to consider filling the Supreme Court vacancy were not already self-evident, a case that the remaining eight justices are hearing on Wednesday drives the point home.

title: The Prison-Commercial Complex
description: ORANGE, Conn.  LAST week, an order from the Federal Communications Commission that caps rates for United States prison telephone calls went into effect. A late stay by a federal appeals court, sought by phone companies suing the F.C.C., had threatened to delay the orders implementation. The stay affects several portions of the F.C.C.s regulation, but key rate caps and restrictions on charges now apply  to the delight of advocates for prisoners and their families who have long criticized the call rates as a form of price gouging.

title: Exposure: Chernobyl
description: I am on a sleeper train, traveling from Moscow to Anapa, a town in Southern Russia, on the shore of the Black Sea. It is April 26, 1986, a week before my sixth birthday. We have been en route for nearly two days and the provisions we brought from home are running down. The train has stopped at the station in Rostov-on-Don, 700 miles away from our home on the outskirts of Moscow.

title: Q. and A.: The Artist Zhang Hongtu on Appropriating Maos Image
description: Zhang Hongtu, a Chinese-born artist who came to the United States in 1982 and is now based in New York, won early attention for his political pop works appropriating the ubiquitous image of Mao Zedong, notably his portrait of Mao superimposed on a Quaker Oats carton and his reimagining of da Vincis Last Supper with Mao occupying the position of Jesus Christ and his 12 disciples.

title: North Korea Launches Short-Range Projectiles, Seoul Says
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea launched several short-range projectiles off its east coast on Monday, the South Korean military said.

title: Obama in Cuba: An Activist Awaits
description: Amid the euphoria of President Obamas visit is a darker reality for the artist Danilo Maldonado Machado, who has been jailed for his work. He hopes this week will spotlight Cubas repression.

title: News Qs | Obama Becomes First U.S. President to Visit Cuba in Nearly 90 Years
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article Obama Arrives in Cuba, Heralding New Era After Decades of Hostility.

title: John Roberts Criticized Supreme Court Confirmation Process, Before There Was a Vacancy
description: WASHINGTON  Last month, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. delivered some blunt remarks about the Supreme Court confirmation process. The Senate should ensure that nominees are qualified, he said, and leave politics out of it.

title: Stay or Go? Cuban Entrepreneurs Divided on Where to Stake Futures
description: HAVANA  As an inside joke about all the cookies they scorched on the road to establishing a successful bakery, Antonio and Sandra Camacho Rodrguez named their Havana sweets shop the Burner Brothers.

title: Student Question | What Old, Worn Out Thing Can You Just Not Part With?
description: Most of the time, people look forward to replacing old, worn things with newer, better models. But this isnt always true.

title: After Funeral and Cremation, a Shock: The Woman in the Coffin Wasnt Mom
description: After a long battle with cancer, Val-Jean McDonald, mother of eight sons, with more than 20 grandchildren, almost as many great-grandchildren and three great-great-grandchildren, died on Dec. 18 at the age of 81.

title: E.L.L. Practice + Prompt | Basketball Superstar Stephen Curry
description: Note: We invite any English-language-learner student 13 years or older to post comments in response to the writing prompts in this post.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | March 21, 2016
description: Updated: March 25, 2016

title: Cruise and Rail News: Shackleton Tour; Pets on Amtrak
description: RETRACING SHACKLETONS ROUTE

title: A New View of Appendicitis
description: Gwen Deelys story is an example of how not to deal with a health crisis when traveling abroad. She realizes shes lucky to be alive.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Cuba, Salah Abdeslam, iPhone
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Today: Springtime Snow
description: Updated, 9:14 a.m.

title: Empathy May Be Overrated in an Election, and in a Leader
description: Is empathy an essential virtue for a presidential candidate?

title: Amid a Graying Fleet of Nuclear Plants, a Hunt for Solutions
description: The H.B. Robinson nuclear power plant, about 70 miles from Columbia, S.C., has been producing electricity with few interruptions since the Nixon administration. But as of now, its fate is clear: The plant will have to shut down by 2030, when it will be six decades old.

title: Lamb for Easter, Grass Fed and Antibiotic Free
description: After three years, Stefan Oellinger, who is in charge of meat for FreshDirect, has secured a consistent supply of grass-fed, hormone- and antibiotic-free lamb from a local farm and has it in time for Easter. Drew Lewis, the fourth-generation owner of Brothers Ridge Farm in Newark Valley, N.Y., is raising the lambs on 310 rolling acres of meadow. The meat, mainly from crossbreeds, is mild, tender and rimmed with fat. Cuts include racks, roasts with or without the bone, stew meat, chops, shanks, cutlets and a boneless cut called the loin chump, which is popular in England and is like a thick steak: Grass-fed local lamb, $7.49 to $39.99 a pound, freshdirect.com.

title: Better Than Drugstore Chocolates
description: Take a break from tinfoil-wrapped eggs and pastel Peeps with these old-fashioned chocolate bars for modern tastes. Showing rabbit scenes in relief, they are made of dark chocolate dusted with sea salt, milk chocolate with cocoa nibs, and white chocolate streaked with raspberry. The Los Angeles chocolatier who makes them also fashions delicate petits fours iced in white chocolate, filled with lemon or cassis and adorned with crystallized pansy petals: Easter bars, $10, and petits fours, $50 for a dozen, from Valerie Confections, 888-706-1408, valerieconfections.com; or petits fours, $65, at Dean & DeLuca stores, deandeluca.com.

title: Coffee and Cocktails Served at the Bar
description: Kobricks has been roasting and selling coffee wholesale since 1920, first in Lower Manhattan and now in Hoboken, N.J. But in todays coffee culture, the familys fourth generation, Scott Kobrick and his sister, Nikole Kobrick, thought the company should also have a retail presence. With the approval of their mother and uncle, who are still involved in the company, the siblings have opened a cafe in the meatpacking district where baristas do double duty as mixologists, pouring Negronis as easily as macchiatos after 4:30. And not just any Negronis. Using a Japanese cold-brew drip contraption, they infuse the drink with coffee, adding a dimension of earth-driven bitterness. Other drinks, made with and without the coffee component, include a Bloody Mary that relies on a Chemex carafe to produce. They are working with Tobin Ludwig of Hella Bitters to create cocktails. Wines and light food are also served: Kobrick Coffee Company, 24 Ninth Avenue (13th Street), 212-255-5588, kobrickcoffee.com.

title: A Coloring Book From the Garden
description: Images of produce from the garden and the market in this coloring book by Jessie Kanelos Weiner are as intricate as French tapestries, presenting an artistic challenge for adult and accomplished child alike. Why not make it a shared activity? Be Henri Rousseau and take a realistic approach, coloring strawberries red, or let your inner Vlaminck emerge as you create bright yellow asparagus, turquoise turnips and green honeybees: Edible Paradise: A Coloring Book of Seasonal Fruits and Vegetables by Jessie Kanelos Weiner (Universe Publishing, $16.95 paper).

title: Gelato Flavors Leaning Into Spring
description: Anticipating spring, Antonio Biagi, a gelato maker in NoLIta, has started churning out lighter, brighter flavors. High on the list is the innocent-looking caipirinha sorbet, white as a lily but lip-smacking with lime and reinforced with cachaa. Mr. Biagi, who is from Brazil, also offers a creamy new unflavored flavor he calls bossa nova milk, which gets its richness from its texture and does wonders for an affogato made with intense Brazilian coffee: A. B. Biagi, 235 Elizabeth Street (Prince Street), 212-219-8094, abbiagi.com.

title: Serving Sardines With the Proper Fork
description: They probably used small, multi-tined sardine forks in Downton Abbey; they also have them at the new Suprema Provisions in the West Village, where one of the owners, Stephen Werther, is a collector and happy to share his passion with customers. Alas, the forks are for service only and not for sale. So order sardines, the high-quality, tinned kind that this market and wine bar carries, and snack on them with the proper vintage fork: Suprema Provisions, 305 Bleecker Street and 88 Seventh Avenue South, 646-964-4994, supremaprovisions.com.

title: A Smaller iPhone and Other Highlights From Apples Product Event
Sharing Everyday Cooking Through a New Food52 App
description: An interactive and addictive app for the iPhone and iPad that allows cooks to share images of everyday dishes and tell how they made them is coming from Food52 on Tuesday. The app, (Not)Recipes, has the look and feel of Instagram; you can favorite posts as well as comment on them. Filters help that roast chicken that didnt quite brown the way you wanted it to look as if it did: Free at the iTunes App Store.

title: Morning Agenda: Banks Pull Financing From Coal Industry
description: BANKS PULL FINANCING FROM COAL INDUSTRY | Wall Streets retreat from the coal industry is an ominous sign for a sector already in decline,Michael Corkery writes in DealBook. JPMorgan Chase said it would no longer finance new coal-fired power plants in the United States or other wealthy nations. Bank of America, Citigroup and Morgan Stanley have made similar decisions.

title: China Says It Found Ring Said to Sell Improperly Stored Vaccines
description: HONG KONG  The police in China say they have uncovered a criminal ring suspected of selling improperly stored vaccines in dozens of provinces.

title: Twitter at 10: A Window Into Other Lives
description: Twitter has become a cultural phenomenon, though not one without growing pains. Neil deGrasse Tyson, Margaret Cho and others reflected on their experiences.

title: Belgian Police Name Man Suspected of Being Salah Abdeslams Accomplice
description: PARIS  The Belgian authorities on Monday identified a man suspected of being an accomplice of Salah Abdeslam, who was captured on Friday and charged with terrorist murder in the Paris attacks of Nov. 13. They had asked for the publics help in finding him.

title: A Reconsideration of Children and Screen Time
description: The digital world is changing around us at a dizzying pace; parents want guidance, and pediatricians want to answer their questions with helpful and scientifically valid advice. The American Academy of Pediatrics policy on children and media is probably best known for two recommendations: to discourage any screen time for children under 2, and to limit screen time to two hours a day for older children.

title: Donald Trump Isnt Alone in Exploiting the Word University
description: Eleven years ago, Donald J. Trump linked his name to one of the older get-rich-quick ventures in the book: the real estate seminar. Enticed by the promise of their own quick riches in a then-hot real estate market, students gathered in hotel conference rooms for free introductory classes where instructors offered special knowledge and financing  but only if students signed up for additional, increasingly expensive classes.

title: Mr. Trump Goes to Washington, to Meet the Establishment
description: Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump will be in Washington on Monday, addressing the conference of the American Israel Public Affairs Committee, or Aipac. Thats about where the similarities in their days will end.

title: In One-Party Vietnam, Independents Vie for Assembly Seats
description: HO CHI MINH CITY, Vietnam  Taking the stage here on Friday, the singer-songwriter Mai Khoi launched into her hit song Vietnam, an optimistic ode to the countrys landscape and people. But the rest of her set list included songs, such as one called Cuffed in Freedom, that addressed hot-button social issues like corruption, gender inequality and official restrictions on artistic expression.

title: Cuba Heads for Miami
description: HO CHI MINH CITY, Vietnam  So Havana is 20 years behind Ho Chi Minh City on the development cycle that brings you bulldozed historical districts; traffic-clogged streets; a skyline of cranes; fancy golf courses for expats and the local elite; lattes galore; burger joints; smartphones everywhere; a middle class with disposable income; the seductions of credit; fragrant shopping malls; brand heaven (or hell); the end of virgin beaches; massive real estate developments with names like Central Park; offshore fortunes for the political architects of capitalist communism; resorts with their manicured lawns; casinos; mass tourism; social media; 6 percent annual growth; mom-and-pop entrepreneurship; suburbia and sprinklers; private schools for kids with Ivy League colleges already in their sights; Asian and Latin American versions of the American dream; and a population fired up and sort of freed by the opportunity to make a buck for the first time in generations.

title: James Patterson Has a Big Plan for Small Books
description: People already read James Pattersons books  and in staggering numbers. Last year, he and his team of writers had 36 books land on the New York Times best-seller list. To date, he has published 156 books that have sold more than 325 million copies worldwide.

title: IHS and Markit, Providers of Data and Analytics, Agree to Merge
description: The data and analytics providers IHS and Markit have agreed to combine in an all-stock transaction that will take IHS, which is based in Colorado, to London.

title: Marriott Raises Bid for Starwood
description: Marriott International sweetened its bid for Starwood Hotels and Resorts Worldwide with more cash, greater synergies and a higher breakup fee. That still may not be enough to deter the Anbang Insurance Group of China and its co-investors from making a counteroffer  yet again.

title: Cuba Meeting Between Obama and Castro Exposes Old Grievances
description: HAVANA  President Obama stood beside President Ral Castro on Monday and declared a new day of openness between the United States and Cuba, but old grievances and disputes over human rights marred a groundbreaking meeting and underscored lingering impediments to a historic thaw.

title: Chinas Coast Guard Rams Fishing Boat to Free It From Indonesian Authorities
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Chinas Coast Guard rammed one of the countrys fishing boats to pry it free from the Indonesian authorities who had seized it over the weekend, angering the Indonesian government and heightening yet another diplomatic dispute over the South China Sea.

title: The Long Shadow of Argentinas Dictatorship
description: BUENOS AIRES  When President Obama lands in Buenos Aires this week, he will be arriving on the eve of one of the most traumatic dates in our history. On March 24, Argentina commemorates the 40th anniversary of a military coup that disappeared thousands of people, a deep trauma in Argentinas national psyche.

title: A Shake-Up at Valeant Signals the End of an Era
description: As recently as last summer, J. Michael Pearson styled himself as a brash and bold executive with a new way of thriving in pharmaceuticals: buying other companies, slashing costs and sharply raising prices on undervalued drugs.

title: Breathing Life Into Spaces Well Beyond 6 Feet Under Beijings Streets
description: BEIJING  The Digua Shequ community center in Beijing is painted in cheery pastel tones and festooned with colorful paper dragons hung from the ceiling. Inside are a hair salon, a cafe and a gym  normal shops for a typical neighborhood  except that they are underground.

title: Florida Town Curbs Debauchery, and Pays the Price
description: PANAMA CITY BEACH, Fla.  The sun was sublime, the flour-soft sand could scarcely have been more tempting and the D.J. music thumped loudly enough to jiggle the beer cups resting on nearby tables. All that was missing were the throngs of booze-soaked, sunburned spring breakers who usually swarm this beach town during March.

title: 19 Yemeni Jews Arrive in Israel, Ending Secret Rescue Operation
description: JERUSALEM  They landed in Israel late at night  a man in a dark suit and traditional headdress, wheeling a suitcase; a mother, veiled, in a long black robe and holding a sleeping toddler; and a rabbi carrying a Torah scroll believed to be more than 500 years old.

title: Supreme Court to Hear Samsung Appeal on Apple Patent Award
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear an appeal from Samsung on what it must pay Apple for infringing on part of the design of the iPhone. In a brief supporting Samsung, companies including Google and Facebook said the legal framework governing the design patents at issue was out of step with modern technology.

title: The Times on the Air: ISISs Sex Slavery, Trump and More
description: Over the past week, New York Times reporters, columnists and executives participated in interviews about their coverage and other top news stories. Below are highlights from radio and television.

title: 1966: Court Lifts Fanny Hill Ban
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court refused today [March 21] to modify or discard its nine-year-old obscenity yardstick. But it held that Massachusetts went too far in banning the sale of Fanny Hill, the 18th-century novel about a prostitute.

title: Supreme Court Declines to Hear Challenge to Colorados Marijuana Laws
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday declined to hear an unusual lawsuit challenging Colorados legalization of recreational marijuana and told a Massachusetts court to take a new look at a Second Amendment case involving stun guns.

title: Hillary Clinton, Faulting Donald Trump, Calls Israels Security Nonnegotiable
description: Hillary Clinton pledged on Monday that she would stand unyieldingly with Israel and warned that her potential Republican rival, Donald J. Trump, would be an unreliable partner for one of Americas closest allies.

title: Cleanse Creep
description: A peculiar thing about humans is that were persistently disturbed by reminders that we are, in fact, mammals who sweat, shed, bleed and expel foul matter on a daily basis. Entire industries exist to subdue the horror of having a body. Plentiful aisles in the drugstore are devoted to it. Youd think humans would have gotten used to the beastlier realities of existence by now. Weve had millions of years to get used to it.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Apple and Justice Dept. Prepare to Face Off in Court
description: When it comes to the behavior of the federal government, Apple may want to revive its old slogan, Think Different.

title: Putting Your Twitter Feed Back in Chronological Order
description: Q. Why is my Twitter feed suddenly out of chronological order?

title: This Weeks Most Sensible Comment by a Republican
description: You know things are going badly when Rick Perry, the former governor of Texas and failed presidential candidate, sounds more sensible than anyone else in the Republican Party.

title: Where Republican Senators Stand on the Supreme Court Nomination
description: Fourteen Republicans and all Democrats are needed to break a filibuster and confirm the nominee.

title: Learning How to Deal With the Haters
description: We all like to act as if were immune to the vitriol of haters. Its almost cool to pretend that it doesnt affect us, like were all bulletproof and have some kind of armor against it.

title: Drakes Very Own: On Dennis Grahams Instagram
description: Welcome to Social Capital, a series devoted to analyzing the social media presences of celebrities.

title: Apple May Be Willing to Risk Contempt Charge
description: Parents are known at times to deliver an ultimatum to a recalcitrant child by saying, Do this, or else! The question is what that the frequently undelivered punishment may actually be.

title: At Microhotels, the Price Is Right and the Space Is Tight
description: On a recent business trip to New York, Kelly Buck went small for her hotel room  as in 100 square feet.

title: What Spring (and Fall) Looks Like From Space
description: [This article has been updated for 2020s autumnal equinox. Sync your calendar with the solar system.]

title: France Takes a Back Seat to Germany in E.U. Migrant Crisis
description: PARIS  The French-German couple has always been assumed to be the engine of the European Union, the crucial team at the heart of a sprawling, unruly family of 28 nations.

title: Certainty Despite Randomness
description: Cheers! This week we toast the arrival of spring with three beverage-glass challenges. Well start with Laura Feiveson, anM.I.T.-trained economist at the Federal Reserve Board and regular Numberplay contributor. Heres Laura with two problems that may surpriseeven the most experienced puzzle-solver:

title: Congolese Politician, Jean-Pierre Bemba, Is Convicted of War Crimes
description: PARIS  The International Criminal Court convicted a Congolese politician, Jean-Pierre Bemba, of war crimes and crimes against humanity on Monday, finding him culpable for a devastating campaign of rape, murder and torture in the Central African Republic in 2002 and 2003.

title: No Regrets After Double Mastectomy, but Questions Remain
description: Vivien Foldes says she does not regret having her breasts removed five years ago after she was found to have an early-stage cancer.

title: Boaty McBoatface: What You Get When You Let the Internet Decide
description: A proposal by a British government agency to let the Internet suggest a name for a $287 million polar research ship probably seemed like a good idea at the time.

title: Mezzaluna, the Little Restaurant That Started a Revolution
description: An urbane, soft-spoken former auto executive, Aldo Bozzi does not fit the mold of a driven Manhattan restaurateur  much less one who almost single-handedly, if inadvertently, set off a restaurant revolution in the United States and beyond.

title: The Last Thaw: U.S.-Cuban Relations in Pictures
description: President Obamas visit to Cuba heralds the end of decades of enmity and hostility between that country and the United States.

title: Why the Republican Establishment Doesnt Like John Kasich
description: Improbable as it seemed just two months ago, the one remaining establishment Republican presidential candidate in the race is John Kasich, whose last name many voters still cant pronounce. (Try remembering it this way: Kasich rhymes with basic.) After winning Ohio last Tuesday, Kasich has potentially denied Donald Trump the 1,237 delegates needed to clinch the nomination outright. And he goes into tomorrows primaries (in Arizona and Utah) as an antagonist to Ted Cruz, whose quest to close the gap between him and Trump is complicated by Kasichs continued presence.

title: A Wise Move on Marijuana by the Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court has sensibly decided not to take a casebrought by Nebraska and Oklahoma challenging the way in which Colorado legalized marijuana. The plaintiff states had a weak case backed up with little in the way of evidence.

title: 1941: Search for German Battleships
description: LONDON  Powerful British naval units are searching the Atlantic for two 26,000-ton German battleships, the Scharnhorst and Gneisenau, which, it was learned here today [March 21], are at large in Western waters, threatening British commerce. The two are the most powerful ships yet used by the Nazis for commerce raiding. The fact that two 26,000-ton ships should be detached from the German fleet indicates that the Germans realize the hopelessness of ever meeting the British Navy in a fleet action and are willing to gamble some of their finest units in the Battle of the Atlantic.  New York Herald Tribune, March 22, 1941

title: Like a Green Juice, but Boozy
description: In simpler times, a great barman was associated with a place  sleek or divey, he was always there. But this is the age of the pop-up, and like many great chefs, Matthew Biancaniello takes his cocktail craft on the road. Since he left his post at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotels Library Bar over three years ago, the L.A.-based mixologist has been mostly consulting, traveling and writing  and making his farm-to-glass drinks on occasion, at special events.

title: Fantasy Sites DraftKings and FanDuel Stop Taking Bets in New York
description: Two of the largest daily fantasy sports operators, DraftKings and FanDuel, stopped taking bets in New York on Monday as part of an agreement with the state attorney generals office, which had accused them of illegal gambling.

title: New York State Regents Elect Betty Rosa as Chancellor
description: The members of the State Board of Regents on Monday elected Betty A. Rosa, a former New York City principal and superintendent, as the new chancellor, signaling a sharp shift in the states education policies after dramatic protests by parents.

title: New York City Bill to Call for Free Tampons in Public School Restrooms, Shelters and Jails
description: New York City Council members are joining a growing national movement to improve access to feminine hygiene products, and on Tuesday will introduce proposals for free tampons and pads in city public school restrooms and homeless shelters, and easier access at correctional facilities.

title: Campaign 2016: Whats Next?
description: Times Political Editor Carolyn Ryan chats with political reporters Maggie Haberman and Michael Barbaro about the Presidential campaign and what to expect next.

title: Chris Rock to Talk With J.J. Abrams at Tribeca Film Festival
description: At the Oscars, bits by the host, Chris Rock, in which he was inserted into nominated films like The Martian were among the highlights of a much-criticized ceremony. The director J.J. Abramss company Bad Robot had a hand in those spoofs. And now Mr. Rock and Mr. Abrams will sit down for a conversation at the Tribeca Film Festival next month, one of several talks that organizers announced on Monday.

title: Fidel Castro Is Out of Sight as Obama Visits Cuba
description: This is not how they imagined it.

title: Experimental Vaccine Shows Promise Against a Form of Dengue
description: An experimental dengue vaccine worked almost perfectly in a small trial in which volunteers were deliberately given a mild form of the disease, scientists said last week.

title: Moqueca Offers Flavors of Brazil in a Tropical Fish Stew
description: I visited Brazil late last year expecting to sample moqueca (moe-KAY-cuh), a tropical fish stew, on its home turf and to bring back a recipe.

title: Judge in Apple Case Seen as Unfazed by Stress, Even a Plane Crash
description: RIVERSIDE, Calif.  Just before Christmas in 2003, a twin-engine Cessna plane crashed into the Claremont, Calif., home of Sheri N. Pym. The house was destroyed and the pilot was killed.

title: Apples Modest Product Upgrades Take Back Seat to Worries on iPhone Encryption
description: CUPERTINO, Calif.  Apple held one of its regular product showcases on Monday, but this time the products did not take center stage.

title: Valeants Struggles Could Lead It to Crumble
description: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International is running the risk of an Enron or WorldCom endgame.

title: Hunting the Genetic Signs of Postpartum Depression With an iPhone App
description: With mothers and medical providers clamoring for answers about postpartum depression, scientists are beginning a major effort to understand the genetic underpinnings of mood disorders that afflict millions of women during and after pregnancy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Campaign 2016: Whats Next?
description: Campaign 2016. Its settling down. Sort of. Marco Rubio is out. Bernie Sanders says hes in until the end. Donald Trump promises riots in Cleveland if the Republican Party tinkers with the rules and tries to nominate another candidate. President Obama suggests authenticity is overrated and urges Democratic donors to unite behind Hillary Clinton. Whats next?

title: Ben Affleck, Henry Cavill and Amy Adams at Batman v Superman Party
description: The films stars attend a superhero-size premiere at Radio City Music Hall, followed by a party at a make-believe Gotham.

title: Ben Affleck, Henry Cavill and Amy Adams at Batman v Superman Party
description: The films stars attend a superhero-size premiere at Radio City Music Hall, followed by a party at a make-believe Gotham.

title: The Brothers Grimsby Trots Out a Demeaning Racial Trope
description: Modern Problems is a lousy Chevy Chase movie from 1981. But I saw it on HBO when I was 7 or 8, and whenever it was on, I would watch it. So its lousiness is separate from its being memorable. What I remember especially well is the end.

title: North Koreas Nuclear Threats
description: To the Editor:

title: Elizabeth Warren Gives Donald Trump a Hostile Welcome to Washington
description: Senator Elizabeth Warren welcomed Donald J. Trump to Washington on Monday with a blistering assault on his character and business record while urging Democrats to unite against him.

title: Obama in Cuba
description: President Obama and President Ral Castro of Cuba had their third meeting since they announced plans to restore diplomatic relations in December 2014.

title: F.D.A. Proposes a Ban on Powdered Medical Gloves
description: WASHINGTON  The Food and Drug Administration proposed banning powdered medical gloves on Monday, saying the powder can inflame wounds and cause scars to form between organs and tissue after surgery.

title: Torture Is Against Americas Core Values and Security
description: To the Editor:

title: How Four Architects Envision the New SFMOMA  as Jewelry
description: For fans of the sort of jewelry thats best described as architectural, the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art has something better: It has commissioned four trained architects to translate the museums new building into wearable designs. In May, the museum opens a new expansion by the Norwegian architecture firm Snhetta. Who would match a Botta building with a Snhetta building? It really is a challenge. They are as crazy as me, laughs the Buenos Aires-based architect Diana Schimmel, of Mario Bottas original 1995 design for the museum. Schimmels pieces for the capsule collection similarly play on the merging of disparate elements; shes paired, in a mix of gold and silver, Bottas iconic round oculus and the striated lines of the new annex into a single entity.

title: Is the Media Unfairly Dismissive of Bernie Sanders?
description: To the Editor:

title: The Rise of Donald Trump, From Many Angles
description: To the Editor:

title: Enter Week 2, Exit the Have-Nots
description: ST. LOUIS  Middle Tennessee State Coach Kermit Davis wanted his team to be That Team in this years N.C.A.A. tournament, and on Friday, after the 15th-seeded Blue Raiders beat Michigan State, among the most accomplished basketball programs of the past decade, thats what it was.

title: After Conquering Europe, Eurovision Is Coming to Asia
description: The spectacle of the Eurovision Song Contest  which since 1956 has crowned the continents best amateur pop number in a flamboyant televised competition that reaches as many as 200 million viewers  is coming to Asia.

title: Judge Garland to Meet With More Senators This Week
description: While the fight over President Obamas nomination of Judge Merrick B. Garland to the Supreme Court has largely shifted from Washington to congressional districts, Judge Garland is still planning to meet with senators this week.

title: The Mideast Came to Idaho State. It Wasnt the Best Fit.
description: POCATELLO, Idaho  When the Rev. Jim Jones, pastor of the Blazing Grace Church here, approached the lectern at City Hall, he was holding a copy of the Quran.

title: Rihanna Is Back at Top Spot on Billboard
description: What makes a No. 1 album?

title: Judge Approves Orange County Register Sale to Digital First
description: SANTA ANA, Calif.  Last week, Tribune Publishing won an auction for a coveted asset  Freedom Communications, the parent company of The Orange County Register and The Press-Enterprise of Riverside, Calif. On Monday, however, the company could only watch as the sale of Freedom to Digital First Media was approved by a judge.

title: BP and Statoil Pull Employees From Algeria Gas Fields After Attack
description: BP and the Norwegian oil company Statoil announced on Monday that they were withdrawing their employees from two of Algerias largest natural gas fields after Islamic terrorists staged the second attack in three years on their installations.

title: Analysts Urge Citigroup Split
description: Analysts at Keefe Bruyette & Woods on Monday waded into the debate over breaking up the nations biggest banks, releasing a report that urges Citigroup to split up.

title: Selections from Of Rare Origins Aviary Collection
description: Leslie Tcheyan and Octavia Giovannini-Torelli debut their new pieces here.

title: Intricate Jewelry, From a Mother-Daughter Duo
description: Flicking through photographs on her smartphone, the jewelry designer Leslie Tcheyan lands on a nonpareil early 90s snapshot: Shes wearing a grayish, shoulder-padded blazer, with one arm around her 10-year-old daughter, Octavia Giovannini-Torelli (whos missing at least one of her front teeth). Both are dripping in diamonds. It was Take Your Daughter to Work Day and Mom arranged breakfast at Harry Winstons; I wore a turtleneck and Mom was devastated because I selected all of these huge necklaces, says Giovannini-Torelli, laughing. I remember, so vividly, her saying, I cant believe you wore that. Tcheyan, known to others as Che, is a jewelry-industry veteran: Over the last three decades, she worked at Fred Leighton and then began designing packaging and displays for the likes of Schlumberger, Verdura, Sothebys and numerous retail jewelers. This led to consulting for Verdura and other brands, all the while sourcing gems and antiques, and manufacturing contemporary pieces worldwide for private clients.

title: Only a Man Could Forget When Women Ruled Tennis
description: Of all the sports platforms from which to suggest that women go down every night on their knees and thank God for male counterparts to whom, they owe, in effect, their livelihoods, the last one we might have expected it from was tennis.

title: The House That Art, Fantasy and Mystery Built
description: Last week, the Santa Fe-based art collective Meow Wolf introduced The House of Eternal Return  an interactive, multimedia art experience that one of Meow Wolfs co-founders, Vince Kadlubek, refers to as immersive storytelling. And appropriately for the otherworldly space, created by a team of 135 artists, maestros-of-fantasy like George R. R. Martin and Neil Gaiman attended the opening.

title: Inside The House of Eternal Return
description: Take a tour of Meow Wolfs first permanent exhibition, located in Santa Fe and funded by George R. R. Martin.

title: Credit Default Swaps Make Restructuring More Difficult
description: Several years ago I wrote an article predicting that the growth of credit default swaps would make it increasingly difficult to restructure distressed companies. The drama surrounding a Norwegian paper maker shows that, if anything, I understated the potential problem.

title: For a New Rainbow, Donald McKayle Is Still Explaining
description: Ah haaa!

title: Review: Met Chamber Ensemble, Led by Levine, Explores Schoenberg and Mozart
description: A conductors most important contributions to a performance occur during rehearsals, long before an audience is present. So James Levine deserves much credit for the Met Chamber Ensembles winning performances of demanding serenades by Schoenberg and Mozart on Sunday afternoon at Weill Recital Hall. His effectiveness conducting the actual performance was harder to assess.

title: Review: The Year of the Runaways, About Fighting for Scraps in a New Country
description: Even as waves of refugees fleeing the war in Syria have created an urgent world crisis, many immigrants who have already made it to Europe have been grappling with prejudice, poverty and unemployment. No recent novel does a more powerful job of capturing the day-to-day lives of such immigrants than Sunjeev Sahotas second book, The Year of the Runaways, which was shortlisted for the 2015 Man Booker prize.

title: Holding Out in Harlem, but Not Holding a Grudge
description: The blog post should have been the least of Tracy Butlers worries, what with the demolition and excavation work going on on three sides of her familys 129-year-old brownstone on West 123rd Street. Yet four months later, it still bemused her.

title: Attack Reported on Mali Hotel Used by European Union Military
description: Unidentified assailants attacked a hotel on Monday that is used by European Union military officials in Bamako, the capital of Mali, an African nation that has struggled with recurrent instability and assaults by Islamist militants.

title: Leon Cooperman and Omega Advisors Receive S.E.C. Notice
description: The longtime Wall Street trader Leon G. Cooperman is preparing for a showdown with regulators.

title: Russian Judge Postpones Verdict in Trial of Ukrainian Pilot
description: DONETSK, Russia  A Russian judge on Monday adjourned the reading of the verdict in the politically charged case against Nadiya V. Savchenko, a captured Ukrainian military pilot, until Tuesday morning.

title: Parrots Are a Lot More Than Pretty Bird
description: Juan F. Masello never intended to study wild parrots. Twenty years ago, as a graduate student visiting the northernmost province of Patagonia in Argentina, he planned to write his dissertation on colony formation among seabirds.

title: An Australian Chef in Hong Kong, Serving Casual French Fare
description: Since the nomadic Australian chef James Henry abruptly closed his acclaimed Paris bistro Bones last August, he has been waiting for his next project to begin. And finally, it has  in Hong Kong. Beginning Monday, hes offering the city a taste of his new restaurant that just opened there, with a weeklong pop-up during Hong Kongs contemporary art fair.

title: MCC Theater to Kick Off Construction of Its New Home
description: It has been a long journey from start to sledgehammer.

title: Find Your Happy Place
description: The United Nations issues lots of important, if not exactly scintillating, reports. Then there is the annual World Happiness Report, released last week.

description: The kickoff of the music-festival style season happened in Austin, Tex.

title: Street Style at SXSW
description: The kickoff of the music-festival style season happened in Austin, Tex., at SXSW.
