description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: U.C.L.A. Center on Police-Community Ties Will Move to John Jay College
description: A national research center focused on interactions between the police and the communities they serve will open this summer at John Jay College of Criminal Justice, with the colleges first endowed professor as its director.

title: Review: Stormzy Delivers Grime Music From Britain
description: A couple of years ago, Stormzy was invited to be the first unsigned rapper to appear on Later  With Jools Holland, a British institution of televised live music. Hed been asked to perform Not That Deep, one of his tough early singles, and offered instead to do something a little more polished. I can soften it up, put on a shirt, he recalled in an interview leading up to that performance, and theyre like, Nah, nah, nah.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: N.F.L. Aims to Play Regular-Season Game in China
description: BOCA RATON, Fla.  Eager to expand its footprint internationally to generate more revenue, the N.F.L. plans to play a regular-season game in China as early as 2018.

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Operations Against ISIS
description: The Department of Defense has identified 12 American service members who have died supporting the operation to eliminate the Islamic State. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: Most Republicans Feel Embarrassed by Campaign, Poll Says
description: Alarmed by the harsh attacks and negative tone of their presidential contest, broad majorities of Republican primary voters view their party as divided and a source of embarrassment and think that the campaign is more negative than in the past, according to a New York Times/CBS News national poll released on Monday.

title: Why Sanders Trails Clinton Among Minority Voters
description: Asked during a January debate why he trailed Hillary Clinton so badly among minority voters, Senator Bernie Sanders said he would gain ground once those voters became familiar with his track record and agenda on the economy and criminal justice.

title: How the New York Times/CBS News Poll Was Conducted
description: The latest New York Times/CBS News Poll is based on telephone interviews conducted from March 17 to 20 with 1,252 adults throughout the United States. Of those, 1,058 said they were registered to vote.

title: A New York Times/CBS News Poll on What Voters Think About the Campaign
description: Broad majorities of Republican primary voters say they believe the party is divided, are embarrassed by the partys presidential campaign and consider a contested convention to be bad for the party. Democratic primary voters say their party is much more unified, but their race is tighter, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.

title: Chanel, Dior, Fendi and Kors Unveil Latest Offerings at Baselworld
description: BASEL, Switzerland  Each year, some 150,000 industry insiders and haute horlogerie fanatics descend upon this small town, near the German and French borders, for Baselworld, the biggest watch fair in the world.

title: Jury Tacks On $25 Million to Gawkers Bill in Hulk Hogan Case
description: A Florida jury assessed Gawker Media millions more in punitive damages on Monday for having invaded the privacy of the retired wrestler Hulk Hogan, adding to the $115 million it awarded in compensatory damages last week.

title: Roles of Race and Partisanship in Legislative Maps Argued at Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court wrestled on Monday with the role race may play in drawing legislative maps.

title: U.S. Says It May Not Need Apples Help to Unlock iPhone
description: RIVERSIDE, Calif.  The Justice Department said on Monday that it might no longer need Apples assistance in opening an iPhone used by a gunman in the San Bernardino, Calif., rampage last year.

title: After Oregon Standoff, Birding Is Back
description: In a lifetime of offbeat travel experiences, searching for mating sage grouse in a snow squall may rank as one of my oddest pursuits.

title: U.S. Ends Spying Case Against Former Envoy
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department has closed its espionage investigation into the former American diplomat Robin L. Raphel and will file no charges, her lawyer said on Monday, ending a case that had put her under a cloud of suspicion over her ties to Pakistan for more than a year.

title: Outfitting Hasidic Women With Stylish, Yet Modest, Fashions
description: Sifting through the crop tops and sheer blouses for sale at Junee, a boutique in Borough Park, Brooklyn, is an unexpected clientele: some of New York Citys most modest women.

title: North Carolina: State to Consider Blocking Charlotte Anti-Bias Law
description: The General Assembly will hold a special session on Wednesday to consider blocking a Charlotte ordinance that would broaden local protections for gay and transgender people. The measure  which officials in Charlotte, North Carolinas largest city, approved last month  is to take effect April 1 and forbids discrimination in public accommodations, like restrooms, because of a persons sexual orientation or gender expression. Opponents, including Gov. Pat McCrory, condemned the plan as a threat to public safety, and at least three-fifths of the Republican-controlled House and Senate agreed to the special session. In a statement on Monday, legislative leaders said, We aim to repeal this ordinance before it goes into effect to provide for the privacy and protection of the women and children of our state.

title: Donald Trump Calls Himself Lifelong Supporter of Israel
description: Donald J. Trump expressed his solidarity with Israel in passionate terms on Monday, promising a gathering of the American Israel Public Affairs Committee that as president he would always stand up forit against itsenemies in the Middle East.

title: Bob Adelman: From Civil Rights to Making a Difference
description: Bob Adelman, a chronicler of the civil rights era who died over the weekend, was convinced photography could change the world.

title: Bob Adelman: From Civil Rights to Making a Difference
description: Bob Adelman, a photographer known for his sweeping, dramatic and intimate coverage of the civil rights movement, was found dead in Miami Beach, Fla., over the weekend. The Miami Herald reported that a friend discovered him at his home Saturday with a head wound.

title: New Reality Looms: Only a Friendly Senate Will Confirm Justices
description: WASHINGTON  The bitter impasse over the nomination of Judge Merrick B. Garland is raising a once unthinkable possibility: Presidents may no longer be confident of filling a Supreme Court vacancy unless their party controls the Senate.

title: Deal Appears to Curb Migrant Flow, but Greece Still Faces Uphill Effort
description: MYTILENE, Greece  Standing on the southern coastline of the island of Lesbos, Molhim Zreiki peered through binoculars across the narrow strait of the Aegean Sea dividing Greece from Turkey. During the past nine months, hundreds of thousands of refugees had crossed these waters on smuggler rafts to reach Europe.

title: Reaction to Obama Trip Reflects Change in Cuban-Americans
description: HIALEAH, Fla.  As he took a final bite of his ham croqueta at Morro Castle cafeteria, Carlos Sanchez distilled the significance of President Obamas visit to Cuba into one word: hope.

title: Uncle Who Provided Gun Gets 100 Years in Chicago Shootings
description: CHICAGO  By 25, Donnell Flora was a regular in the court system here. He had been convicted of shoplifting, found guilty twice in stolen property cases and sentenced to prison for drugs.

title: Morocco Asks That U.N. Close Western Sahara Military Office
description: Morocco has asked the United Nations to close a military liaison office in Western Sahara, a spokesman for the organization said on Monday, an indication that an escalating dispute between the Moroccan authorities and Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon over the disputed territory is not abating.

title: Bob Adelman, Whose Vivid Photos Captured Civil Rights Struggle, Dies at 85
description: Bob Adelman, a freelance photographer whose vivid images of unspeakable brutality and despair brought segregation and the civil rights movement home to Americans in the 1960s, died on Saturday in Miami Beach. He was 85.

title: No Respite for Yahoo, Battling on 2 Fronts
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Its often hard to sell a company, particularly when that company has faced steady declines over the last decade, been surpassed by upstarts and is struggling in its latest turnaround plan.

title: Marine Base in Northern Iraq Is Confirmed by Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon acknowledged on Monday that it had established a small base in northern Iraq staffed solely by American Marines, a disclosure that followed an Islamic State rocket attack over the weekend that killed one Marine and wounded several others.

title: Hillary Clinton Criticizes Sheriff Joe Arpaio, Immigration Proxy for Donald Trump
description: PHOENIX  Hillary Clinton sharply denounced Sheriff Joe Arpaio, saying the Maricopa County sheriff, who became the face of hard-line anti-immigration policies because of his tactics here, had treated his fellow human beings with disrespect and contempt.

title: M.T.A., as Victim, Wants Transit Thiefs Profits From Hollywood Movie Deal
description: For more than three decades, Darius McCollums transit exploits have appeared in police reports and newspapers. Then came the news this month that his story might be turned into a movie starring Julia Roberts.

title: Andrew S. Grove Dies at 79; Intel Chief Spurred Semiconductor Revolution
description: Andrew S. Grove, the longtime chief executive and chairman of Intel Corporation who was one of the most acclaimed and influential personalities of the computer and Internet era, died on Monday at his home in Los Altos, Calif. He was 79.

title: Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump Vow to Protect Israel but Differ on Means
description: WASHINGTON  Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump on Monday presented sharply different views on how the United States should deal with the Middle East and its relationship with Israel, previewing for an influential pro-Israel audience a debate on foreign policy that could play out this fall if they face each other in the general election.

title: Leaks at Hudson Yards Station Frustrate M.T.A. Board
description: When the new Hudson Yards subway station opened last year, officials from the Metropolitan Transportation Authority gathered to celebrate New York Citys first new station in a quarter century.

title: Candidates Speak at AIPAC Conference
description: Hillary Clinton, Donald J. Trump and other presidential candidates addressed a conference for the American Israel Public Affairs Committee.

title: Bill Ackman Bets Again on Valeant, Taking a Seat on the Board
description: After reaping the best returns of any hedge fund manager in 2014, Bill Ackman appeared on the cover of Bloomberg Markets magazine, grinning, with the headline, How Do You Like Bill Ackman Now?

title: Big Tens Freshman Proposal Splits Universities
description: College hockey appears to be in great shape.

title: The Arrest of Salah Abdeslam, a Paris Suspect, Ends Manhunt, Not Questions
description: BRUSSELS  The attacks on the airport and a subway station in Brussels on Tuesday have intensified questions about the Belgian authorities ability to thwart terror in the city. This article, published on Monday, examines how the lone surviving suspect from the Paris terror attacks in November managed to elude capture for months afterward.

title: Building a Bridge of Bats and Balls Across a Divide
description: On the day he planned to make baseball history, Luke Salas got a ride in a 1950s-era clunker of a car to a field that was little more than a sandlot, in a small town outside Havana.

title: Donald Trump Pushes Serious Image in the Capital
description: WASHINGTON  Donald J. Trump came to Pennsylvania Avenue on Monday and offered a freewheeling, circuslike glimpse of what the nations capital might look like if he is successful in his quest to occupy that big, white house on the 1600 block of the street.

title: Clinton and CAFTA
description: Joel Benenson, Hillary Clintons number-cruncher/strategist, has an interesting note up about the implications of the Ohio primary. The rules of the game require, of course, both that he be totally positive about his candidate and that he profess a certainty about the meaning of every victory that Im fairly sure he does not, in fact, possess. The truth is that nobody can be sure exactly why Ohio was so different from Michigan; the big takeaway from the Ohio result was, instead, that the yuge Michigan polling miss was an outlier rather than a harbinger, and that  combined with the big HRC delegate gain on 3/15  moves a Clinton nomination from highly likely to overwhelmingly probable.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I actually welcome President Castro commenting on some of the areas where he feels that were falling short, because I think we should not be immune or afraid of criticism or discussion as well.

title: A Team Looking to Bounce Back Turns to a Pitcher With the Same Goal
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz.  The first basemans toss was high, but Jeff Samardzija was there, racing from the mound and gliding through the air by the bag at Scottsdale Stadium on Monday. He plucked the ball from the sky and landed with his foot in the right place.

title: The Kurds Push for Self-Rule in Syria
description: One important political outcome of the Syrian war could be a decision by Syrian Kurds to establish a semiautonomous region in the northern part of the country. The move entails risks and has been condemned by Turkey and even some Kurds, but could offer a model for decentralized governance in a federated Syria.

title: Admiration of Robinson Lingers for Fans in Cuba
description: For his historic trip to Cuba, President Obama took two guests sure to make a strong connection with baseball-crazed fans on the island: Rachel Robinson, the widow of Jackie Robinson, who broke the color barrier in the major leagues, and the Robinsons daughter, Sharon.

title: Jack Masey, Whose Exhibitions Showed American Culture to World, Dies at 91
description: Jack Masey, a designer for the United States Information Agency whose model American kitchen, part of an exhibition in Moscow in 1959, provided the stage for an argument about communism and capitalism between Nikita S. Khrushchev and Vice President Richard M. Nixon, one of the Cold Wars most memorable confrontations, died on March 13 in Manhattan. He was 91.

title: Randall Munroe of XKCD Explains the Human Body, Elevators and the Saturn 5
description: Houghton Mifflin Harcourt is collaborating with Mr. Munroe to incorporate parts of Thing Explainer into the next editions of high school science textbooks.

description: This fall, some high school students will flip the page of their science textbooks and see

title: Review: In Typhoid Mary, Showtime for a Dying Patient
description: Even in the isolation room, people come and go: a nurse, giving a sponge bath; a doctor, trailing a herd of students; an orderly, carting away the trash. Only the pale bald figure in the bed remains, dying of some horrid unnamed illness. This is Marty, and he has a simple plan for escaping the tedium and pain: Retreat into his own mind and put on one last cabaret show.

title: One Way of Ordering Things
description: Administrivial Win Valuable Prizes Alert! If you havent already done so, its not too late to sign up for the American Crossword Puzzle Tournament, running April 1-3 in Stamford, Conn. Click here to register, and click here to see the evil sadists, sorry, I meant top-shelf constructors who will contribute their talents to the tournament. See you there!

title: Review: Wolf in the River, Adam Rapps Latest Tale of the Dysfunctional and Dispossessed
description: A ripe mound of earth, festering with sickly flowers and garbage, rises from the upstairs stage of the Flea Theater these days. Audience members in the front row for Wolf in the River  which opened on Monday night in a highly intimate in-the-round production  could easily lean over and rub their faces in the muck, which may well be the symbolic intention of this plays creator, Adam Rapp.

title: Islanders, Listless in Loss, Allow Flyers to Close In
description: The Islanders surely needed a home-ice lift after a rough three-game trip that dropped them into a wild-card position. They have been strong at home all season, with 21 of their 38 wins at Barclays Center.

title: Better Call Saul Season 2, Episode 6: Is Kim Breaking Bad?
description: Is Kim Wexler breaking bad?

title: Rick Nashs First Goal in 82 Days Has Perfect Timing for Rangers
description: Rick Nash did not whoop, because he never does, but he exhaled as his shoulders drooped in relief Monday after his first goal since Dec. 30. He had missed 20 games with a bone bruise and had yet to rediscover the net since his return.

description: sepulcher  \se-pl-kr\  noun

title: Scientists Warn of Perilous Climate Shift Within Decades, Not Centuries
description: The nations of the world agreed years ago to try to limit global warming to a level they hoped would prove somewhat tolerable. But leading climate scientists warned on Tuesday that permitting a warming of that magnitude would actually be quite dangerous.

title: Prizes Awarded at Contemporary Jewelry Fair
description: An ice-like blue brooch, another pin inspired by cold fusion and a pendant meant to look a lot like a mobile phone were the winners of the top award at Schmuck, the contemporary jewelry worlds most important event, held in Munich in late February.

title: Indian Wells Official Quits Post Over His Coattails Remarks on Women
description: Raymond Moore stepped down late Monday as chief executive of the Indian Wells Tennis Garden in California and director of its tournament, the BNP Paribas Open, a day after making comments about female tennis players that drew strong rebukes from many in tennis, including Serena Williams, the runner-up at the tournament and the worlds No. 1 womens player.

title: What to Watch Tuesday
description: Natalie Dormer takes the dual lead as twin sisters in the moody horror film The Forest, available for digital rental. And watch out, Meredith Grey: Alexandra Panttiere is TVs latest drama-magnet doctor in NBCs Heartbeat.

title: Ted Cruz-Marco Rubio Ticket? Allies Say Yes; Rubio Says No
description: Allies of Senator Ted Cruz of Texas have aggressively lobbied for a presidential ticket that would make Senator Marco Rubio of Florida his running mate, but Mr. Rubio has rebuffed them, according to two people briefed on the closely guarded efforts.

title: Dilley, Tex., Home to the Nations Largest Immigration Detention Center
description: What happens to a town of 4,000 when the countrys largest detention center for immigrants opens its doors there? Thats the question we at Black Box traveled to Dilley, Tex., last year to try and answer.

title: CrowdSignals Aims to Create a Marketplace for Smartphone Sensor Data
description: Words and pictures, culled from across the web, have been the digital grist for remarkable gains in computing tasks like image recognition and speech translation. But another huge data resource  sensor data from smartphones  lags behind as a fuel source for major research advances.

title: Live Free or Trump
description: Gary Johnson has climbed Mount Everest before.

title: Shouldnt Congress Tell Us How Well Pay for Tax Cuts?
description: THE long-endangered Republican Deficit Hawk is now extinct.

title: The Middle-Age Surge
description: The phrase almost completes itself: Midlife  crisis. Its the stage in the middle of the journey when people feel youth vanishing, their prospects narrowing and death approaching. So they become undone. The red Corvette pops up in the driveway. Stupidity reigns.

title: What Are We Voting For?
description: Arthur Brooks: Hi, Gail. Well, Smackdown Tuesday went more or less as expected: a big night for Trump and Clinton, with both of them moving closer to becoming the nominees. Its not a done deal yet, though, on the Republican side, where some still hope for an open convention. Taking this idea head on, Trump told CNN that in that scenario, if he lost, I think youd have riots. Im representing a tremendous  many, many millions of people.

title: Elegant Bird Discovers Junk Food
description: A new study shows that the glorious annual migration of white storks from Europe to Africa is being disrupted by the birds growing addiction to junk food in the garbage dumps below their flight path. Thousands no longer make the crossing for the winter, preferring to build year-round nests at rubbish pits in Spain and Portugal where they conserve energy and have an easier time breeding and defending their nests.

title: A Partisan Prescription for Paralysis
description: The refusal by Senate Republicans to consider the nomination of Judge Merrick Garland for the Supreme Court vacancy has rightly prompted indignation. But it is only the most glaring example of unreasonable intransigence by lawmakers who have turned the process of appointing senior federal officials into a political game.

title: Our Water System: What a Waste
description: Austin, Tex.  AMERICA has a water problem. To put it simply, the national network for providing safe, clean water is falling apart.

title: Letting (Some of) Indias Women Own Land
description: This month, 600 women gathered under a huge blue-and-yellow-striped tent in Baripada, a small city in Odisha, a state in Indias east. They were among Indias most neglected people. Widowed, abandoned or divorced, many had ended up living like servants in the households of their fathers, brothers or in-laws.

title: Strikes Claimed by ISIS Shut Brussels and Shake European Security
description: BRUSSELS  Bombs packed with nails terrorized Brussels on Tuesday in the deadliest assault on the European heartland since the Islamic States attacks on Paris four months ago, hitting the airport and subway system in coordinated strikes that were also claimed by the militant extremist group.

title: Aung San Suu Kyi Nominated as Minister in Myanmars Government
description: NAYPYIDAW, Myanmar  Daw Aung San Suu Kyi will be a minister in Myanmars new government, according to a list of nominees for cabinet positions released on Tuesday by the countrys president-elect, U Htin Kyaw.

description: The following lesson activities are based on the article C.D.C. Painkiller Guidelines Aim to Reduce Addiction Risk.

title: Unsilenced
description: An activist is murdered on-air while hosting a radio show for fellow displaced residents of a rural town in Mexico.

title: Unsilenced
description: Conoc a Atilano Romn Tirado, de quien trata esta pelcula, cuando tena 19 aos. Yo estaba en su pueblo en Sinaloa para filmar mi documental Los reyes del pueblo que no existe, acerca de las familias que decidieron quedarse despus de que sus hogares fueron inundados a raz de la construccin de la presa Picachos al noroeste de Mxico.

title: Unsilenced
description: I met Atilano Romn Tirado, the subject of this film, in 2009, when I was 19 years old. I was in his small town in Sinaloa to make my documentary feature Kings of Nowhere (Los reyes del pueblo que no existe), about families who decided to remain after their homes were flooded to build the massive Picachos dam in northwestern Mexico.

title: American Hotels, Led by Starwood, Begin Descent Into Cuba
description: Dreary hotel rooms with no hot water. Or no hotel room at all. While Cuba has many lures, the quality and even availability of its accommodations are not among them.

title: What Tournament? N.C.A.A.s Biggest Event May Be at a Higher Court
description: I dont mean to be a skunk in the March Madness garden party, but did you notice that just before the tournament began last week, the plaintiffs in OBannon v. N.C.A.A. petitioned the Supreme Court to hear the case? Earlier, the defendant N.C.A.A. had asked for  and received  an extension to file its own petition. (Its due April 14.) Although the Supreme Court agrees to hear only a small fraction of petitioned cases, OBannon is worth its attention.

title: Shakespeares Globe Is Winding Up a Hamlet World Tour
description: SLIEMA, Malta  Minutes before the curtain was set to rise on a production of Hamlet at the Salesian Theater here, two buses carrying around 25 migrants in all pulled up in front of the century-old building. Mostly young men from Africa, wearing hoodies and baggy jeans, they hustled into the theater and took their seats to curious stares from some of the older Maltese audience members.

title: French Lit, Stripes and Cigarettes at Sonia Rykiel
description: Like procreating or planting flowers or even just exfoliating your skin with a washcloth, spring cleaning is a process of renewal that is available, in some form, to every human on earth.

title: Ithacas Anti-Heroin Plan: Open a Site to Shoot Heroin
description: ITHACA, N.Y.  Even Svante L. Myrick, the mayor of this city, thought the proposal sounded a little crazy, though it was put forth by a committee he had appointed. The plan called for establishing a site where people could legally shoot heroin  something that does not exist anywhere in the United States.

title: What Were Watching as Arizona, Idaho and Utah Vote
description: WASHINGTON  The presidential race shifts west on Tuesday, with voters in both parties deciding in Arizona and Utah, and Idaho Democrats holding caucuses. But political junkies following along from the Eastern time zone will have to stay up late: Polls do not close in Arizona until 10 p.m., and Utah Republicans can vote online until 1 a.m. Wednesday.

title: Student Question | If Teenagers Are Such Bad Drivers, Should They Be Allowed to Drive?
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports, Per mile driven, teen drivers ages 16 to 19 are nearly three times more likely than drivers aged 20 and older to be in a fatal crash.

title: Do College Students' Votes Really Matter in an Election?
Brussels Attacks: Live Updates
Arcadia, by Iain Pears
description: Nobody can tangle a text like Iain Pears. His best-known novel, An Instance of the Fingerpost, explored a 17th-century Oxford murder and its aftermath through the memoirs of four unreliable narrators, each hotly disputing the others versions of reality, science, religion and justice. After nearly 700 pages of deposition, when the guilty are finally sorted from the hard-to-call-innocent, many readers will understandably have already lost track of their scorecards. Now, almost 20 years later, Pearss latest novel presents a complexly interwoven series of narrative entanglements that stretch across time, alternate universes and at least several textual realities  from Elizabethan pastoral romance and multiple universe theory to a Narnia-like fantasy world and Cold War international intrigue. Whats the difference between all these systems of order, knowledge and storytelling? the attentive reader might ask. And the answer might well be: no difference at all. They are equally real and equally unreal  take your pick.

description: THE THROWBACK SPECIALBy Chris Bachelder213 pp. W. W. Norton & Company. $25.95.

title: Report Ties Coal Plants to Water Shortage in Northern China

title: R.B.S. Reimburses $1.7 Billion to British Government
description: LONDON  The Royal Bank of Scotland said on Tuesday that it had made a final payment of 1.19 billion pounds, or about $1.7 billion, to the British government, fulfilling a condition of its bailout package that gave the government priority for dividend payments.

title: The Scorpions Tale: Did Assad Take Putin for a Ride?
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  One admirer of President Bashar al-Assad of Syria compared him to Charles de Gaulle, the French leader stubborn and confident enough to defy a more powerful ally, the United States, even after its decisive help against Nazi Germany.

title: Chinese Demand for Ivory Alternative Threatens Rare Hornbill Bird
description: BEIJING  Even as China, the worlds leading market for illegal ivory, promises to help safeguard elephants in Africa, a rare bird in Southeast Asia is in danger because its skull is being sold in China as an ivory alternative, conservationists say.

title: Impossible Homework Assignment? Let Your Child Do It
description: I really didnt think my two fourth graders could complete their homework assignment on their own: Prepare a five-minute-long speech from a biography, to be delivered, not read, from notes on index cards, in costume and in character and with at least one prop. An impossible task for a 10-year-old, I thought, as I braced for the battle that would surely be involved in dragging them both through the project.

title: Weekly News Quiz | March 15-21, 2016
description: Have you been following the news?

title: CBS/New York Times Poll on Supreme Court Nominee
description: The latest poll from a collaboration between CBS News and The New York Times looks at public opinion on the nomination of Merrick B. Garland for the Supreme Court.

title: Poll Watch: Majority Says Supreme Court Nominee Deserves a Vote
description: Most Americans say the Senate should vote on whether to confirm Judge Merrick B. Garland to the Supreme Court, with the large majority of the public viewing Republican leaders refusal to do so as politically motivated, the latest CBS News/New York Times poll shows.

title: How Can Donald Trump and Bernie Sanders Both Be Populist?
description: Donald Trump and Bernie Sanders share an upbringing in New Yorks outer boroughs and a repugnance for trade deals, but the similarities pretty much end there. Sanders routinely inveighs against corporate America; Trump is an executive of almost 500 business entities, more than 200 of which are named after himself. Trump lends his name to a line of power ties and cuff links; the adjective most often applied to Sanderss wardrobe is rumpled. Yet journalists routinely refer to both men as populists. How can a word that purports to describe both a proud socialist and an arrogant billionaire have any meaning?

title: New Seattle Marketplaces Satisfy Appetites for Everything
description: Building on Seattles history of farmers markets and a strong food culture, new marketplaces are showcasing the local and unique, offering many choices for shopping, eating and connecting. For residents and tourists alike, these vibrant markets have become destinations all their own.

title: Should Parents of Children With Severe Disabilities Be Allowed to Stop Their Growth?
description: Ricky gazed up toward the pine trees as his mother, Cindy Preslar, pushed him along the village road in an orange jogging stroller. She was marking the route for the Summer 2014 Run Through the Clouds 10K, a fund-raiser for the public schools in Cloudcroft, N.M. Youll run with Dad and Max tomorrow, she said. Right, Ricky? She ruffled his fine blond hair. By run she meant ride  Ricky was 7, but his legs were unable to bear his full weight. As a result of a complication during pregnancy, Cindy says, he was born with a form of cerebral palsy known as spastic quadriplegia with static encephalopathy, which meant permanent brain damage and severely limited eyesight because of cortical vision impairment.

title: Hotels Gear Up for Cherry Blossom Season
description: Hotels are ready to celebrate cherry blossom season.

title: What Changes Minds About the Senate and Judge Garland?
description: Most of the survey respondents who registered an opinion said the Senate should vote on whether to confirm Judge Merrick Garland to the Supreme Court, a new online poll shows. And, as weve found before, the more historical context theyre given, the more likely people are to think the Senate should vote now.

title: Hillary Clintons Backers Prepare General Election Ad Blitz
description: The super PAC supporting Hillary Clinton is preparing to reserve roughly $70 million in television ads to begin after the Democratic National Convention and to run through the fall general election in important battleground states such as Ohio and Florida, the first large-scale mobilization that any group has made.

title: Brussels on Edge After Blasts at Airport and Subway Station
description: The city was virtually shut down on Tuesday after explosions rocked its main international airport and a subway station near the headquarters complex of the European Union.

title: Business to Play Key Role as Georgia Weighs Bill on Religion and Gay Rights
description: ATLANTA  The Georgia General Assemblys approval of a proposal to strengthen legal protections for opponents of same-sex marriage has set in motion a high-stakes showdown that has drawn some of the nations most influential companies into a battle between gay rights activists and religious conservatives.

title: Rivals Seize on Bill Clintons Remarks About Obamas Last Eight Years
description: Former President Bill Clinton faced criticism on Monday for telling voters that the country needed to put the awful legacy of the last eight years behind us, comments widely interpreted as being critical of President Obama.

title: A Lineup of Missteps
description: A note to readers: After this weeks installment, well be suspending publication of After Deadline for the time being.

title: Avery Fisher Career Grant Recipients Named for 2016
description: His name is no longer on the big concert hall at Lincoln Center, which was rechristened for David Geffen this season. But the name Avery Fisher continues to live on in classical music through the program he established to help young musicians, which is to announce on Tuesday that it is awarding Avery Fisher Career Grants worth $25,000 each to three violinists, a cellist and a pianist.

title: Nadiya Savchenko, Ukrainian Pilot, Given 22 Years in Russian Reporters Deaths
description: DONETSK, Russia  A Russian court sentenced a Ukrainian military pilot, Lt. Nadiya V. Savchenko, to 22 years in prison on Tuesday after finding her guilty of complicity in the deaths of two Russian journalists, in a politically charged case that highlighted the strained relations between Moscow and the West.

title: What Happened at Each Location in the Brussels Attacks
description: Maps and diagrams show the extent of the damage at the airport and subway station.

title: U.S. Commander in Afghanistan Apologizes for Bombing of Hospital
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The new commander of American and NATO forces in Afghanistan issued an unreserved apology on Tuesday to the families of victims of the United States bombing of a hospital in the city of Kunduz last year that killed 42 people.

title: Brussels Blasts at Airport and Subway Station
description: The city was virtually shut down on Tuesday after explosions at its main international airport and a subway station near the headquarters complex of the European Union.

title: 1941: U.S. Labeled as Enemy
description: ROME  Every city in Italy will celebrate tomorrow [March 23] the twenty-second anniversary of the founding of the Fascist party. There will be a display of flags, parades, oratory and other accompaniments of a national holiday. On the eve of the celebration, spokesmen of the party told the public today that the revolution of Fascism, originally purely Italian, had grown into a world-wide revolution in which the Anglo-Saxon pluto-democracies were the enemy. Editorials in the Relazioni Internazionali, a leading Italian weekly on foreign affairs, and in Il Giornale dItalia made it clear that the United States was now included in the Fascist list of foes.  New York Herald Tribune, March 23, 1941

title: As Obama Visits Cuba, Chinas News Media Weighs In Warily
description: BEIJING  If President Obama was looking for encouragement after his meeting with President Ral Castro of Cuba in Havana, the Chinese news media was not the place to find it.

title: Apple and Yahoo Each Struggle for Control of Their Futures
description: Like in no other industry, technology companies depend on their claim to the future. They have world-changing products like smartphones, social networks and Internet search, and exuberant bosses who pretend they know where all this is going.

title: Keeping Up With Android Security Patches
description: Q. When did Google start rolling out monthly security patches for Nexus tablets, and what do these fix?

title: The Globes Two-Year World Tour, With Visits to Malta, Botswana and Jordan
description: The tour started in 2014, on the 450th anniversary of Shakespeares birth, and included shows in about 200 countries.

title: Warning of U.S. Attacks, Donald Trump Advocates Allowing Torture
description: Donald J. Trump condemned the terrorist attacks in Belgium in television interviews on Tuesday, reiterating his call for a moratorium on foreign Muslim immigrants entering the United States, advocating expanding international laws to allow forms of torture and bluntly predicting, This is going to happen in the United States.

title: Jane the Virgin Season 2, Episode 15: The Curse of Pablo
description: As usual, the soap opera elements in Jane the Virgin are on full display in Chapter 37. But this time, theyre spilling out of the Marbella Hotel and out of Michaels detective work,. This week we find them instead in family-focused plots involving both Rogelio and Alba.

title: Brussels Attacks Underscore Vulnerability of an Open European Society
description: PARIS  Since the November attacks in Paris, the Belgian authorities have conducted dozens of raids, combed whole neighborhoods for well-known militants and even locked down the capital for days, all part of promises to step up efforts to root out jihadists.

title: Serena Williams: Why Tennis Needs the Miami Open
description: Editors note: The Miami Open, a joint ATP/WTA tournament that began this week, is subject to a legal battle over possible renovations to the site, which is a public park. The dispute has led to speculation that the event, one of the biggest tennis tournaments in the United States, will move.

title: Curious Incident to Close in September
description: The Tony-winning The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time will end its run this September after opening in fall 2014.

title: Midtown Landlords Trim Rents as Corporate Tenants Flee to Trendier Addresses
description: As businesses flock to new high-rises in of-the-moment New York City neighborhoods, older offices in more traditional business districts appear to be taking a hit.

title: A Spymaster Who Saw Cyberattacks as Israels Best Weapon Against Iran
description: A bit more than three years after Meir Dagan was forced to end his long tenure as director of Israels intelligence service, the Mossad, he showed up at a discussion of the Middle East filled with contempt for the Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, who he feared was on the cusp of bombing Irans nuclear facilities.

title: Hillary Clinton Vows to Defeat Terrorism but Cautions About Shutting Borders and Torture
description: SEATTLE  Hillary Clinton vowed to defeat terrorism and radical jihadism around the world Tuesday as she awoke on the West Coast to news of the terrorist attacks in Brussels.

title: FIFA Opens Ethics Case Against German Soccer Officials Including Beckenbauer
description: FIFA announced Tuesday that its ethics committee had opened formal proceedings against six high-ranking German soccer officials who led their countrys successful bid to host the 2006 World Cup.

title: Blindspot Season 1, Episode 14: Jane Takes a Back Seat
description: A week after an installment that was more mind game than action yarn, it was back to the run-and-gun style on Mondays episode of Blindspot. One of Janes tattoos led the F.B.I. team to a sex-trafficking ring and a race against the clock to keep an innocent man from being executed.

title: Low Gas Prices Create a Detour on the Road to Greater Fuel Economy
description: DETROIT  Since agreeing to tough new federal fuel economy standards five years ago, automakers have been methodically improving the gas mileage of their vehicles and reducing emissions harmful to the environment.

title: Lowlife Plays It Cool on the Lower East Side
description: What a gnarled knot of warring impulses I feel about Lowlife.

title: Rob Ford, Blustery Ex-Mayor of Toronto Whose Struggles Went Public, Dies at 46
description: Rob Ford, the combative former mayor of Toronto who gained international notoriety with his confession of crack cocaine use, his public drunkenness and his belligerent clashes with other public officials, died on Tuesday. He was 46.

title: Hundreds of Looted Ancient Artifacts Are Returned to Italy
description: ROME  Hundreds of looted archaeological artifacts that officials say were handled by the London dealer Robin Symes and destined for markets in the United States, Japan and Britain have been returned to Italy, Italian culture officials said Tuesday.

title: Obama, in Havana Speech, Says Cuba Has Nothing to Fear From U.S.
description: HAVANA  President Obama on Tuesday made a full-throated plea for Cubas autocratic government to change, calling on President Ral Castro to loosen his grip on the economy and political expression or risk squandering the fruits of a historic thaw.

title: The First Lady Wears Naeem Khan at the Cuba State Dinner
description: When President Obama, the first lady and their daughters arrived in Havana on Sunday, it was the first presidential visit to Cuba since Calvin Coolidge in 1928. Such an occasion demanded diplomacy, behind the scenes and publicly (Mr. Obama and Ral Castro, Cubas president, gave a lengthy news conference), sightseeing and a bit of celebration: a state dinner, held at the Palace of the Revolution.

title: 1966: Anglican Protests Over Talks
description: The Archbishop of Canterbury, Dr. Michael Ramsey, flew here today [Mar. 22] for history-making talks with Pope Paul VI amidst shouts of You traitor. A group of five Protestants, opposed to the historic meeting of the leaders of the Anglican and Roman Catholic Churches, arrived from London on the same plane as the Anglican primate. The five already had caused a scene at London Airport and tried to create another at Romes Leonardo da Vinci International Airport, wearing apronlike affairs saying Archbishop Ramsey is a traitor to Protestant Britain.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, March 23, 1966

title: Bernie Sanders Decries Barbarism of Brussels Attacks
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont, who is running for the Democratic presidential nomination, condemned the cowardly terrorist attacks in Brussels on Tuesday, saying in a statement:

title: Carnival Will Begin Cruises to Cuba in May
description: Cruising to Cuba from the United States is now a reality. Carnival Corporation announced Monday that it will offer cruises to Cuba starting May 1, after Cuba granted approval for the company to begin travel there; its the first time in more than 50 years that a cruise ship has permission to sail from the United States to Cuba.

title: Beetle Moms Send a Chemical Signal: Not Tonight, Honey
description: Its the bane of a new mothers life: Shes exhausted, but her male partner wants sex. And besides, she still has to get up for those middle of the night feedings.

title: Politics and Policy Favor a $15 Minimum Wage in New York
description: The Long Island Fight for $15  a coalition of low-wage workers, unions, immigration activists and other progressive groups  is arguably the most important right now of many groups fighting to raise chronically low pay.

title: A German Finds No Easy Answers as Refugee Influx Hits Home
description: HAMBURG, Germany  With refreshing frankness, a reporter for Der Spiegel has turned the spotlight on himself this week, chronicling his reactions since the authorities announced plans in August to settle 700 refugees in his quiet, family-friendly community in northern Hamburg.

title: Sourdough Starter, Americas Rising Pet
description: Twenty years ago, after leaving his job as the manager of an Albertsons Market bakery in Twin Falls, Idaho, Rick Hazen found himself missing the taste of fresh bread. He made a sourdough starter using flour and some unprocessed apple juice.

title: Sturm, Ruger, a Gun Maker, Under Pressure From New York Public Advocate
description: New Yorks public advocate is pushing regulators to investigate the gun maker Sturm, Ruger & Companys disclosures to investors about the risks it faces.

title: American Cut Brings a Downtown Steakhouse Uptown
description: American Cut Like the chef, the bar area wears downtown black. But this branch of Marc Forgione and LDV Hospitalitys TriBeCa steakhouse is an uptown affair, in the historic Lombardy hotel, steps from Park Avenue in Midtown, so glamour rules. The main dining room, with 132 seats, has the original leaded windows, echoed in the chevron-patterned glass dividers and warmed with rich gold and rosy tones. A wine room with tasting tables runs behind the bar. Steaks are the mainstays, with a 42-ounce tomahawk and a 52-ounce porterhouse thats flamed with marrow butter. There are grilled fish options, a Caesar salad tossed tableside and the chefs signature chile lobster in a sriracha and butter sauce served with toast. Aiming for a piece of power-lunch action, the midday menu offers a sandwich of pastrami cured in-house and a quick prix fixe menu with the option of dessert to go. (Opens Wednesday): 109 East 56th Street, 212-388-5277, americancutrestaurants.com.

So Ill just recommend his whole post, and quote fromthe part that addresses the arguments Ive heard from many people in the know explaining why prominent Republicans, from Paul Ryan on down, are wary of being too forthright about the depth of their opposition to Trump:

description: Camille A. Brown, the socially conscious dancer and choreographer, is this years winner of the Jacobs Pillow Dance Award, an honor that comes with a $25,000 cash prize and an engagement at the summer festival.

description: On Friday afternoon, the young Russian designer and photographer Gosha Rubchinskiy wandered through the new, five-floor Dover Street Market in Londons Haymarket, greeting friends, collaborators and a few of the Instagram-cast models from his recent mens wear show.

title: English National Operas Music Director Resigns
description: In another blow to a beleaguered institution, the English National Opera announced on Tuesday that Mark Wigglesworth would resign as its music director, just months after starting in the position in the fall. The company said in a news release that Mr. Wigglesworth feels unable to continue as music director despite the best efforts of the board and senior management to persuade him to remain.

title: F.D.A. Toughens Warning Labels for Some Opioid Painkillers
description: WASHINGTON  The Food and Drug Administration said Tuesday that it was requiring new warning labels for certain types of opioid painkillers, a step that it said would help ease an epidemic of abuse in the United States.

title: Ted Cruzs Call to Secure Muslim Neighborhoods Stirs a Backlash
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas angered American Muslims on Tuesday with a call to patrol and secure Muslim neighborhoods in the wake of the terrorist attacks in Brussels.

title: John Kasich Warns Against Singling Out Muslims for Monitoring
description: Gov. John Kasich of Ohio on Tuesday cautioned against monitoring Muslim-Americans after the attacks in Brussels, saying that such a step would create division and harm the countrys ability to gather intelligence.

title: Supreme Court Upholds Worker Class-Action Suit Against Tyson
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday sided with thousands of workers at an Iowa pork processing plant who had sought to band together in a single lawsuit to recover overtime pay from Tyson Foods.

title: The Fitness Store Challenging Lululemon With $400 Yoga Pants
description: On a recent Wednesday night, about 70 fitness devotees wearing in-the-know brands like Heroine Sport and Outdoor Voices were crammed into a studio in the Flatiron district, mastering their leg lifts while Pink Floyds Comfortably Numb blared overhead. Taryn Toomey, a founder of the workout program called the Class, led the group.

title: Donald Trump Dismisses Ad That Quotes Him Demeaning Women
description: Donald J. Trump this week dismissed questions about an advertisement that features women reciting some of his past words about female physical appearances, including insults, calling the remarks show business.

title: Living With One Parent
description: Children living with a single parent tend to do worse in life than those who grow up in a stable two-parent family. The United States has one of the highest percentage of children living without a father among advanced countries, as well as one of the highest shares of children living in poverty.

title: Review: Seven Brief Lessons on Physics Is Long on Knowledge
description: The short and resonant essays in Carlo Rovellis Seven Brief Lessons on Physics began as columns in Il Sole 24 Ore, the Italian newspaper. Even better, they appeared in that papers culture section, its editors sensing that its arty readers could use a bit of stretching.

description: Name Matt FX

title: Mind-Based Therapies May Ease Lower Back Pain
description: Sixty-five million Americans suffer from chronic lower back pain, and many feel they have tried it all: physical therapy, painkillers, shots. Now a new study reports many people may find relief with a form of meditation that harnesses the power of the mind to manage pain.

title: In Criminal Rulings, Garland Has Usually Sided With Law Enforcement
description: WASHINGTON  After a jury found a man guilty of several gun and drug offenses, he took his case to the Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit. In the spring of 1998, two of the judges on a panel that heard his case agreed to vacate two of his convictions, saying that the evidence was too thin to support one, and the trial judge had made a mistake that tainted the other.

title: Chip-Card Payment System Delays Frustrate Retailers
description: Avi Kaner, a co-owner of the Morton Williams supermarket chain in New York, has spent about $700,000 to update the payment terminals at his stores.

title: David Changs Next Restaurant, Ando, Will Be Delivery Only
description: David Chang doesnt want you to know the location of his next restaurant. In a new article in Fast Company magazine, the chef says that this spring he plans to open a place called Ando, devoted exclusively to food thats delivered to customers.

title: The Voluntourists Dilemma
description: Several years ago, when I was working as a reporter based in Haiti, I came upon a group of older Christian missionaries in the mountains above Port-au-Prince, struggling with heavy shovels to stir a pile of cement and sand. They were there to build a school alongside a Methodist church. Muscular Haitian masons stood by watching, perplexed and a bit amused at the sight of men and women who had come all the way from the United States to do a mundane construction job.

title: Review: Anthony Cheungs Elective Memory, a Response to Beethoven
description: When the violinist Jennifer Koh asked Anthony Cheung to write a piece for her, responding to Beethoven, he happened to be already working on Lyra, a commission from the New York Philharmonic partly inspired by that composers Fourth Piano Concerto.

title: The Filler Effect
description: When patients land in a dermatologists office, frustrated with a line or fold, they often want to plump the offending crease with filler. See a wrinkle, fill a wrinkle.

title: In Brussels, Europe Is Struck at Its Heart
description: BARCELONA, SPAIN  It is not working. President Obamas slow-but-steady strategy to defeat the Islamic State is clawing back a little territory in Syria and Iraq but is doing nothing to dent the charismatic appeal of the militant group, disrupt its propaganda or prevent it from killing Europeans.

title: Review: Heartbeat, a Hospital Drama, Goes Above and Beyond Credulity
description: The situation is growing desperate in Americas fake hospitals. Not from a financial crisis or a nursing shortage. Its a desperation of plotting. The medical-drama genre is now so exhausted that hospital shows have to go to absurd lengths to make viewers pay attention, and that has never been more evident than in Heartbeat, which begins on Wednesday on NBC.

title: With Brussels Airport Shut Down, What Travelers Need to Know
description: Brussels Airport shut down following the terrorist attacks in the city on Tuesday morning and will remain closed through tomorrow, Friday, according to a statement on the airports site.

title: The Death of the Latin American Left
description: The Latin American left has had a miserable few months. In Argentina, Venezuela and Bolivia, it was decisively defeated in three different kinds of elections. The president of Ecuador, Rafael Correa, most likely seeing the trends around him, decided to abandon his attempts to remain in power. In Chile, corruption scandals are tightening around previously respected leaders. Most recently, the web of graft has caught one of the most revered figures among Latin Americas 21st-century leftists: the former president of Brazil, Luiz Incio Lula da Silva.

title: Review: Joshua Bell Plays Tchaikovsky at David Geffen Hall
description: Joshua Bell and the Academy of St. Martin in the Fields gave a crisp, accomplished rendition of Tchaikovskys Violin Concerto on Monday evening at David Geffen Hall. But during the performance my mind kept drifting to a version of that work thats been surging out of my headphones in recent days.

title: Mr. Obamas Honest Message in Cuba
description: President Obama began his speech to the Cuban people on Tuesday with humility and grace. Cultivo una rosa blanca, he said, reciting the opening line of one of the most famous poems by Jos Mart, the islands national hero. I plant a white rose.

title: A Furniture Makers Quest: Create Everything From Scratch
description: M. Crow & Company, a new boutique at 16 Howard Street in SoHo, is filled with lust-worthy, whimsical wares you probably never knew you needed.

title: Political Substance Abuse: Donald Trumps Washington Press Conference
description: This installment of Political Substance Abuse is set in the Old Post Office, in Washington, D.C., a historic building that The Trump Organization is converting into a hotel. Donald Trump held a press conference there on Monday as part of a day trip to the nations capital that many media commentators called trying to look presidential. Mr. Trump met with legislators on Capitol Hill and visited the editorial board of the Washington Post, where he revealed that rather than solely advising himself on foreign affairs, he sometimes relies on a collection of mostly-unknown advisers, who help him advise himself. He sat down to an on-camera, in-person interview on CNN, instead of phoning it in, as he usually does, then capped his day by speaking at the American Israel Public Affairs Committees conference. Mr. Trump had an actual speech written for his AIPAC appearance, and he used a teleprompter, despite saying, in Florida last week, verbatim: No teleprompters. Do you notice? Im not reading speeches. No reading speeches. No reading speeches. Speak from the heart, and from the head. But speak from the heart. We gotta do it. We gotta do it. We speak from the heart. And from the head! You know? Lets not forget that. But weve gotta do it.

title: Sophia Webster Wins British Fashion Award
description: LONDON  Sophia Webster, the London-based accessories designer best known for her eye for color and playfully eccentric statement footwear, won the 2016 British Fashion Council/Vogue Designer Fashion Fund prize Tuesday night.

title: Brussels Attacks Fuel Debate Over Migrants in a Fractured Europe
description: LONDON  It did not take long. Almost as soon as the bombs went off in Brussels on Tuesday morning, the new act of terrorism in the heart of Europe was employed in the bitter debate about the influx of migrants from the Middle East and North Africa.

title: Flamenco Shows of Intimacy, Passion and Spectacle
description: For dance fans in New York, the madness this March has been the flood of flamenco. After the four-day Festival Ay! Mas Flamenco at Symphony Space at the start of the month, three weeks of Flamenco Festival New York followed, bigger than ever. Productions at City Center and Carnegie Hall were augmented by a series of intimate shows at Joes Pub. As soon as those ended, on Saturday, the beloved local troupe Noche Flamenca moved right in to Joes Pub to extend the madness for another week.

title: The Unsettling Acquisitiveness of Anbang, a Chinese Insurer, in the U.S.
description: A buying spree by a Chinese insurance company that has emerged seemingly overnight is flashing a warning sign.

title: A Cult Hotel Opens in New Orleans
description: Despite their distinctly local designs, stepping into any of the Ace Hotels eight international locations  where moody interiors attract familiar crowds of 30-something hipster types  triggers a bit of dj vu. Such is the case at the chains ninth hotel in New Orleans, which opened last week in a 100-year-old Art Deco high-rise on the outskirts of the French Quarter.

description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Beach Houses Installation Show
description: The musical duo has created a series of concert experiences with immersive multimedia elements, for several stops interspersed with their regular tour.

title: Beach Houses New Transportive Performances Double as Art
description: The members of the dream-pop duo Beach House tend to spend their time onstage swathed in brilliant hues, or backlit by stars. When Victoria Legrand and Alex Scally take to their instruments (keyboards and guitar, respectively), theyre washed in shades of fuchsia and violet; the outlines of their bodies and the flourish of their movements are the only things that keep them from melting into the saturated field of color behind them. Their backdrop recalls the fluorescent lightscapes of James Turrell  gradual, simple spreads of brilliance that serve as a perfect foil to the ethereal music theyve been crafting since they met and began to work together in 2004.

title: Deirdre OConnell, Theaters Master of the Melancholy Mom
description: The actress Deirdre OConnell wants all you writers to know how much fun shes had playing your characters. If you would just stop killing her children, that would be super.

description: Demonstrations in other major cities honored those lost in the terror attacks in Belgium.

title: Brussels Survivors Say Blasts Instantly Evoked Paris Attacks
description: BRUSSELS  Simon OConnor, a European Commission official, had parked his car and was about to walk toward the departure terminal, en route to Rome for work. Salom Corbo, an actress from Montreal, was at the Air Canada counter, about to check her luggage. Elouan Preaud and his wife, Angelina Centeno, were having breakfast, waiting to board an American Airlines flight to her native Colombia.

title: New Directors/New Films Features Weiner, Tikkun and Other Works
description: The annual New Directors/New Films festival, jointly presented by the Film Society of Lincoln Center and the Museum of Modern Art, continues through Sunday with a diverse selection of features, shorts and documentaries. Here are highlights from the programs second week, selected by A. O. Scott and Manohla Dargis.

title: Straight Talk From Bernie Sanders on the Israeli-Palestinian Conflict
description: The only presidential candidate who spoke any real truth about the Israeli-Palestinian conflict on Monday was the one who did not attend the annual conference of the American Israel Public Affairs Committee, the countrys largest pro-Israel group.
