And despite legions of doubters east of its time zone, the league entered the N.C.A.A. tournament with seven invitees and a No. 2 ranking in the respected rating percentage index, or R.P.I.

title: What to Watch Friday
description: Jurassic Park, the textbook blockbuster from Steven Spielberg that gave birth to a seemingly endless franchise, provides small-screen entertainment for a Friday night. And last years remake of Point Break, which has the look of X Games fan fiction, is streaming on iTunes.

title: The Week In Pictures
description: Photos from The New York Times and photographers from around the world.

title: Corrections: March 25, 2016
description: NEW YORK

title: 1905: Jules Verne Succumbs to Paralysis
description: The New York Herald, March 24, 1905

title: The Week in Pictures: March 25
description: Photos from The New York Times and photographers from around the world.

title: Crazy About Money
description: In this year of Trump, the land is loud with the wails of political commentators, rending their garments and crying out, How can this be happening? But a few brave souls are willing to whisper the awful truth: Many voters support Donald Trump because they actually agree with his ideas.

title: The Post-Trump Era
description: This is a wonderful moment to be a conservative. For decades now the Republican Party has been groaning under the Reagan orthodoxy, which was right for the 1980s but has become increasingly obsolete. The Reagan worldview was based on the idea that a rising economic tide would lift all boats. But thats clearly no longer true.

title: Trumps Terror Dependency
description: Among the volley of lies spit out of the coarse mouth of Donald Trump on a daily basis is his claim that hes leading Hillary Clinton in the general election matchup for president. I beat Hillary in many of the polls that have been taken, and each week I get better and better, he said earlier this month.

title: Transgender Law Makes North Carolina Pioneer in Bigotry
description: Officials in Charlotte, N.C., spent more than a year carefully considering and debating an antidiscrimination ordinance that was passed in February to promote the citys culture of inclusiveness. State lawmakers quashed it on Wednesday by passing an appalling, unconstitutional bill that bars transgender people from using public restrooms that match their gender identity and prohibits cities from passing antidiscrimination ordinances that protect gay and transgender people.

title: The Racism at the Heart of Flints Crisis
description: An important new report makes clear the principal cause of the water crisis in Flint, Mich.: the state governments blatant disregard for the lives and health of poor and black residents of a distressed city.

title: Philippines Releases Ship Linked to North Korea
description: MANILA  The Philippines has released a cargo ship linked to North Korea that it had seized as part of tough new United Nations sanctions imposed on the reclusive country, an official said on Friday.

title: News Qs | In N.F.L., Deeply Flawed Concussion Research and Ties to Big Tobacco
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article In N.F.L., Deeply Flawed Concussion Research and Ties to Big Tobacco.

title: Leaving New York City
description: Three couples detail their moves to find more space in the areas surrounding New York.

title: From the City to the Burbs, Step by Step
description: For some buyers confronted with the high cost of New York City real estate, moving to the suburbs is a no-brainer. The prospect of more space for the money, a grassy yard and a less crowded public school outweighs the longer commute, the need for a car (or two) and the limited food-delivery options. Other buyers, however, would rather squeeze their growing family into a studio than abandon city life.

title: Should Mother Teresa Be Canonized?
A Field Guide to Male Intimacy
description: When my cars battery died on a bitterly cold January day, my father refused to come to my apartment in south Minneapolis to give me a jump.

title: Recognizing Spring, Scientifically
description: We turned to scientists and asked them to decode the seasonal changes all around us, and reveal some that might not be as easy to detect.

title: A Mailman Handcuffed in Brooklyn, Caught on Video
description: Late in the afternoon on St. Patricks Day, Glen Grays, a 27-year-old African-American mail carrier, was making his rounds in Crown Heights, in Brooklyn, about to leave a package at 999 President Street. Mr. Grays prides himself on getting to know the community he serves, he told me on Wednesday. He figures out who is sick, or old, or enfeebled, and makes sure that their parcels, especially if they contain medication  I can shake a box and usually figure that out, he said  land directly at the doors of the people waiting for them, even if they live in fourth- or fifth-floor apartments, in walk-up buildings.

title: When Washington Met Hollywood: At Lunch With Cory Booker and Susan Sarandon
description: Susan Sarandon hobbled into the restaurant in a cast boot and shiny Teamsters jacket emblazoned with the name Sue. But Senator Cory Bookers first question for the actress was about a tattoo that runs down her back. (Its my kids initials  and my granddaughters, she replied.)

title: Soft and Cuddly? John Kasichs Old Colleagues Dont Recognize Him
description: As he tries to halt the momentum of Donald J. Trump, Gov. John Kasich of Ohio tells people they are made special by the Lord. He urges them to invite lonely widows out to dinner. He freely dispenses hugs.

title: Love at a Distance
description: Tired of the New York dating scene, Linnea Sanderson decided to search for eligible men near her parents in New Hampshire. Thats where she found Robert Davidson.

title: Two Weddings Are Better Than One
description: As a child, Linnea Sanderson always had a basketball in her hand. When at age 14, her steady rise as a player was cut short by a serious back injury suffered during a pickup game, she bounced back, becoming a competitive tennis player and swimmer.

title: Student Question | Should Transgender People Be Allowed to Use the Bathroom of Their Choice?
description: North Carolina legislators just passed a wide-ranging bill barring transgender people from bathrooms and locker rooms that do not match the gender on their birth certificates.

title: Film Club | A Conversation With Latinos on Race
description: In this short documentary, Latinos grapple with defining their ethnic and racial identities.

title: Friday morning briefing
description: Friday morning briefing

title: Resort News: Downton Abbey Stay; Wine Country Offer
description: LAS VEGAS ADDS A PARK (WITH A SHAKE SHACK)

title: Your Friday Briefing: Brussels, Rolling Stones, Garry Shandling
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Iranian Sweets Fit for a Cleric or King
description: YAZD, Iran  This desert provincial capital in central Iran is known for its honesty, generosity, high clay walls, fine woven silk textiles, a pre-Islamic Zoroastrian fire temple and soaring wind towers that naturally cool rooms below.

title: The Humor of Garry Shandling: Keenly Aware, With Hair Jokes
description: It didnt take long for Garry Shandling, who died Thursday at the age of 66, to ask the audience what they thought of his hair. As a stand-up comic, he led with his neuroses, telling dark and cuttingly self-deprecating jokes in between wide, needy grins. Im dating a homeless woman, goes the setup to one joke. It was easier talking her into staying over.

title: Look Out for the Trump Pivot!
description: So now were all just sitting around waiting for Donald Trump to pivot. As in, change. We demand and expect that of party front-runners at this stage of a primary campaign.

title: San Francisco, the Silicon Valley of Recycling
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Robert Reed, who is enjoying a surprising career turn as a busy tour guide at the latest hot spot here, stood smiling one recent sunny morning before 10 foreign dignitaries and journalists. They included the mayor of Genoa, Italy, and the general consuls from Italy, Canada and Switzerland.

title: Small-Business Lobbying Group Steps Into Supreme Court Fight
description: Senator Mitch McConnell, in making his case against Judge Merrick B. Garland, has noted that Judge Garland is opposed by the National Federation of Independent Business and that the small-business lobbying group has never before inserted itself in a high-profile court fight.

title: New York Today: An Egg-Decorating Tradition
description: Updated, 1:21 p.m.

title: Man Detained in North Korea Confesses to Spying for South
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A man claiming to be a naturalized American citizen held in North Korea since October confessed to committing crimes against the country and pleaded for mercy on Friday, news agencies reported from Pyongyang, the North Korean capital.

title: A New Spin on Senior Living
description: Ram and Geeta Chandran had always planned to move into a senior community after they retired. The couple had no children, and we knew we had to move to a retirement community so we wouldnt be lonely in a huge house, said Geeta Chandran, 72, a family physician.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz: Chocolate and the Secret to Happiness
description: Take the Quiz

title: When Friends Are Like Family
description: My friends are the sisters I was meant to have, a woman told me. Another said that her friends are more precious than her sisters because they remember things from her past that her sisters dont and cant, since they werent there. And a man commented that he didnt enjoy a particular friends company all that much, but it was beside the point: Hes family.

title: Hong Kong Bookseller Is Said to Return to Chinese Mainland
description: HONG KONG  The appearance of a missing Hong Kong bookseller who returned on Thursday from mainland China has done little to quell public doubts about his case. One day after he spoke to the police and immigration officers in Hong Kong, local news media reported that the bookseller, Lee Bo, had returned to mainland China.

title: The 3.13.16 Issue
description: RE: THE MUSIC ISSUE

title: A Risky Kiss in Karachi
description: There are few things more sobering for two young people than trying to outrun the police in Karachi, Pakistan, after they catch you drunkenly making out in the middle of the night.

title: Whats Your Pleasure?
description: Most bartenders are familiar with this situation: A customer says he wants a drink with tequila  but not a margarita. Maybe something kind of fruity  but not too sweet. And, oh, bitters. He is crazy about bitters. And cider. Ciders great.

title: How to Ford a River
description: Even relatively shallow water can knock you off your feet, says George Spearing, a retired firefighter from New Zealand who has crossed hundreds of rivers on solo wilderness treks, including a five-month, 2,650-mile hike from the Mexican border to British Columbia and a six-week journey along Waless coastline. Each time I cross a river, the power of water amazes me, he says.

title: Exit Strategies
description: Selected by Matthew Zapruder.

title: Best Time to Visit Luxor? An Egyptologist Says Now
description: The story sounds more like the plot of a riveting suspense movie than real life: Does the tomb of Tutankhamen in the Valley of the Kings in Egypt have hidden rooms with the never-found tomb of the powerful Queen Nefertiti?

title: Tricia Clarke-Stone: Putting Passion Ahead of Pedigree
description: This interview with Tricia Clarke-Stone, C.E.O. of Narrative, a marketing and technology firm, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Bill Waltons Long, Strange Tale of N.B.A. Survival
description: Bill Walton arrived at the San Diego Natural History Museum carrying a large black chair. I watched him walk with it, a little stiffly, past the Moreton Bay fig tree outside. The tree is one of the citys grand natural treasures: more than 100 years old, nearly 100 feet tall, hugely spread, still standing despite a century of weather and air pollution and climbing children. Its so large that it made even Walton, one of basketballs dominating giants, look small.

title: Arguments Get Personal Between Donald Trump and Ted Cruz
description: From his home at Mar-a-Lago, Donald J. Trump stirred up new controversy this week in the Republican presidential primary  and new alarm among party leaders that the front-runner for the nomination will drive away women from candidates running farther down the ballot in the fall.

title: The Only Girl at Her Science Camp
description: My 7-year-old daughter has pretend space launches in our living room. She loves Tinkerbell not because she has sparkly wings, but because she is a tinker fairy that can fix anything. Signing her up for summer camp should be a chance to simply let her grow and explore her interests as a budding scientist or engineer. Yet we are aware that as a Latina girl who dreams of being a NASA inventor, her path is unlikely to be smooth, and the deck remains stacked against her.

title: Market for Chinese Art Is Increasingly in China
description: The art market is feeling under pressure from the outside world.

title: John Kerry, in Brussels, Says ISIS Is Faltering in Mideast
description: The Islamic State is desperately lashing out in Europe because its base in the Middle East is rapidly eroding, Secretary of State John Kerry said on Friday in Brussels, where he traveled to demonstrate the United States support for Belgium three days after bombs killed 31 people, including at least two Americans.

title: Health Savings Accounts: Unloved, but Worthwhile
description: Health savings accounts offer a rare, triple-tax benefit to those who are able to contribute and who qualify to save for future medical needs  which, among other things, means having a health insurance plan with a deductible of at least $1,300. Money goes into an H.S.A. tax-free, grows tax-free and is withdrawn tax-free, if spent on eligible medical costs.

title: Credit Cards Encourage Extra Spending as the Cash Habit Fades Away
description: Nina Falcone has given up on cash.

title: Finding a Job That Works for You
description: Sunil Yapa was bouncing from college to college, searching for a career, when he decided to return to a familiar place: his hometown, State College, Pa. There, he found himself in the building where he had often visited his father, Lakshman, a geography professor at Penn State. He took his dads classes, helped him write a draft of a book about the social construction of poverty and earned a bachelors degree in geography in 2003.

title: New Hampshire Drug Data
description: The latest drug data from New Hampshire.

title: Heroin Epidemic Is Yielding to a Deadlier Cousin: Fentanyl
description: LAWRENCE, Mass.  When Eddie Frasca was shooting up heroin, he occasionally sought out its more potent, lethal cousin, fentanyl.

title: California Chromes Global Fan Club Spreads to Dubai
description: After Art Sherman, the 79-year-old trainer of the 2014 Kentucky Derby and Preakness Stakes winner California Chrome, arrived in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, from Southern California on Monday, he tried his best to sleep, but it was of no use.

title: Je Suis Sick of This
description: PARIS  WHEN I moved to Europe 12 years ago, my biggest concern was whether Id ever speak decent French. Practically every American I knew came to visit, many saying they dreamed of living here, too. I didnt worry much about far-right political parties, or the European Union. I certainly didnt fret about terrorism.

title: Family of Elita Borbor Weah, Brussels Victim, Mourns One Loss, Then Another
description: AMSTERDAM  Before Elita Borbor Weah set foot in Brussels Airport on Tuesday, her family was already in mourning.

title: Death of a Little Student
description: Dear Diary:

title: Whats on This Week Around the World
description: Tallinn, Estonia

title: David Dixon, Despite a Reassuring Text Message, Dies in Brussels Attacks
description: David Dixon had not heard about the explosion at Brussels Airport until a concerned aunt  in Britain sent a text message asking if he was safe. He told her he was, and then he made his way to the Maelbeek subway station.

title: Online Music Calls the Tune, With Less Pay for the Piper
description: Some say that on the Internet, content is king, because that is what draws audiences. Maybe  but if so, its crown is not very golden.

title: How to Live Without Windows 10
description: Q. My computer is not compatible with Windows 10. What will happen in the future? I do not want to get a new computer.

title: Getting Workers to Save More for Retirement
description: Saving for retirement should be simple arithmetic  the longer your money has to grow, the more money you should have when you stop working. But saving today for a distant tomorrow isnt so simple, and has a great deal to do with how people think about money.

title: Suite Dreams: What You Get for $75,000 a Night
description: If youre the sort of traveler who desires a private pool, a grand piano or seating for 24 in your hotel room, look no further

title: Apps That Make Saving as Effortless as Spending
description: A new crop of electronic financial tools is trying to help Americans save.

title: Batman v Superman Battles the Critics
description: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice has been ripped apart by critics. The movie had sunk to a 31 percent on Rotten Tomatoes as of this writing, joining other critically disparaged superhero films like the Fantastic Four reboot of 2015 (9 percent) and Green Lantern, from 2011 (26 percent).

title: Are Luxury Suites Worth the Splurge? Hotels Are Banking on It
description: Le Dme,  a nearly 900-square-foot suite in Le Cinq Codet in the heart of Paris, is named for its striking views of the golden Dme des Invalides, under which Napoleon is entombed. But if that vista doesnt grab you, wander over to the other end of the private terrace, past a half-dozen deck chairs (all yours) and gaze at the Eiffel Tower. And should you grow tired of that, there is always the Jacuzzi, from which you can look out over the mansard rooftops of the Seventh Arrondissement and polish off the Champagne and chocolates that were left while you were out. Inside theres a couch shaped like a croissant, a curved OLED television, two bathrooms, a dressing room and a tub ringed with white rose petals.

title: The Art of Saying No as a Philanthropist
description: SOMETIMES the hardest part of being a philanthropist is saying no  particularly if the request comes from worthy organizations or equally well-heeled friends.

title: Going to New Heights to Please Buyers
description: Until recently, if you were looking to buy a condominium with high ceilings, your choice was limited to prewar apartments, lofts or penthouse units. Now several developers are offering new condo projects that have soaring ceilings in more than half the building, giving buyers the option of taking a unit on a lower floor with ceilings 11 feet or higher.

title: Ebola, Ruthless to Families, Leaves Liberian Man Alive and Alone
description: DOLOS TOWN, Liberia  As Gaye Dumbai came trudging up the dirt road, heading toward the overgrown cemetery where his mother is buried, villagers came out of their houses despite the pouring rain to get a closer look at him.

title: Tweetness of Life
description: Just a notice: Ive run into several people recently who didnt know that I am now doing some direct postings to my Twitter account, in addition to the automatic posting of links to this blog. Some of the tweets are even substantive. So if you are a blog follower, you might want to check that account too  no need to join Twitter yourself!

title: Medical, Dental, 401(k)? Now Add School Loan Aid to Job Benefits
description: Every month, Amanda Danner and her husband make what feels like a mortgage payment. But they dont yet own a home.

title: What Reagan Didnt Do
description: I suppose I shouldnt add to the woes of the reformocons, the people who wanted to move the GOP forward with new ideas  but have learned that they have no constituency. (Marco Rubio betrayed their hopes even before he imploded.) Still, one thing I have been seeing lately is statements along the lines of When Reagan cut taxes and regulation, it created a rising tide that raised all boats  but times have changed, and now we need policies that address the needs of working families.

title: In Yahoo, Another Example of the Buyback Mirage
description: It is one of the great investment conundrums of our time: Why do so many stockholders cheer when a company announces that its buying back shares?

title: Q. and A.: Bryshere Y. Gray on Empire and Navigating Hollywood
description: In Season 2 of the Fox smash Empire, Hakeem Lyon was kidnapped and later betrayed his father, Lucious, plotting to become head of the family music business himself. And when the show returns on March 30, Hakeem may just be a father, too  with his dads former fiance.

title: Human Trafficking on Trial in Thailand
description: The first witness in the largest human-trafficking trial in Thai history was called to testify last week in a court in Bangkok. The witness, a Rohingya Muslim from Myanmar, told of being beaten and starved by gun-toting captors on the boat that ferried him and more than 200 others to a trafficking camp in Thailand.

title: Obama Family Vacations: Highlights From 2009-2015
description: A look at some of the first family's trips together over the first seven years of the president's tenure in office.

title: 1916: Ship Survivors Land at Dover
description: LONDON  Latest reports received indicate that eighty persons lost their lives on board the Sussex when she was torpedoed or struck a mine in the Channel yesterday [Mar. 24] afternoon. There were 386 passengers on board and the crew numbered 50.

title: Obama Family Spring Break: Making History and Doing the Tango
description: BARILOCHE, Argentina  The presidential motorcade wove down winding roads flanked by steep grass-covered hills and a deep-blue alpine lake, delivering President Obama and his family to the trailhead of a hike through the lush woods of one of Argentinas most spectacular regions.

title: China Said to Detain Several Over Letter Criticizing Xi
description: BEIJING  Chinese security officers appear to have detained several people in their investigation of a mysterious, fiery letter posted online this month that strongly criticized President Xi Jinping and demanded that he resign.

title: Sweep Leads to 5 Arrests, a Foiled Plot and a Paris-Brussels Connection
description: BRUSSELS  Counterterrorism officials widened a sweep targeting suspected Islamic State operatives to several European countries on Friday, reporting newly uncovered links between the Brussels and Paris massacres, at least five arrests and the foiling of what France described as an advanced plan for another attack.

title: Water Is Her Element
description: Krystal Laras parents thought she should learn to swim. Now a senior at Stuyvesant High School, shes backstroking toward the Olympics.

title: A Top ISIS Leader Is Killed in an Airstrike, the Pentagon Says
description: WASHINGTON  American Special Operations forces in eastern Syria killed a top Islamic State commander this week, Pentagon officials saidFriday, part of a monthslong campaign the Obama administration boasts is eviscerating the Islamic State even as the group continues to demonstrate the power to sow violence in Western Europe.

title: Her Parents Thought Swimming Lessons Were a Good Idea
description: Somewhere in the middle of the pool, Krystal Lara began to wonder when her hand would brush tile. She knew she was winning her race, but like most backstrokers in unfamiliar waters, she had only a vague sense of how far she had left to go. With her face cocked upward, she discerned her progress by the overhead lights retreating out of sight in a fluorescent blur.

title: Paperback Row
description: BEYOND: Our Future in Space, by Chris Impey. (Norton, $16.95.) Though advances in space exploration may have stalled in recent decades (the most recent manned lunar expedition was more than 40 years ago), an innate desire to explore seems to be coded into human DNA. Impey, an astronomer, outlines the array of innovative developments that may render forays into space routine.

title: Editors Choice
description: IMBECILES: The Supreme Court, American Eugenics and the Sterilization of Carrie Buck, by Adam Cohen. (Penguin Press, $28.) A superb history of eugenics in America, organized around a 1927 case about forced sterilization.

title: Inside the List
description: Fast Fiction: Private Paris, the latest thriller in James Pattersons series about the global private eye Jack Morgan, enters the hardcover fiction list at No.1. The book (written with Mark Sullivan) is Pattersons 13th to spend time on the best-seller lists in 2016  an astounding number by any measure, but evidently not enough for the restless Patterson, who recently announced plans to entice new readers with a series of shorter, more plot-based books. You can race through these; theyre like reading movies, Patterson said in an interview with Alexandra Alter of The Times. Its true that Pattersons novels, although famous for their fast-moving chapters, arent especially terse  Private Paris runs almost 450 pages. But more plot-based? Thats like McDonalds expanding its market through intravenous injections of salt, sugar and fat. It will probably work like a dream.

title: Growing Up in a Bad Neighborhood Does More Harm Than We Thought
description: The neighborhood in which you grow up is a major determinant of your economic success as an adult. Thats been known for a while, but new research suggests that the effects may be much larger than social scientists previously understood.

title: Posthumous Novel With a Beat
description: Ali Eskandarians deeply autobiographical first novel, Golden Years, is about an Iranian-American musician and his group of friends in New York, living for the classic cocktail of sex, drugs and possible fame. Its a book that arrives with an unusual  and unusually tragic  back story.

title: Comic Fiction
description: THE NESTBy Cynthia DAprix Sweeney353 pp. Ecco/HarperCollins, $26.99.

title: Thomas the Tank Engines Expanding World
description: Thomass friends are finally getting a little more diverse.

title: Millennial Days
description: By definition, younger memoirists (those under the age of 40) have a deficit in perspective, Noelle Howey wrote in the Book Review last year. Wait 10 or 20 years, the wisdom goes, and reap insights that would elude your younger self. Countless life stories have been told brilliantly through this long-range lens: Lidia Yuknavitchs The Chronology of Water, Kathryn Harrisons The Kiss, Mary Karrs The Liars Club. Karr even echoes Howey in her new book, The Art of Memoir: If youre young, you might wanna wait.

title: Bruce Wagners I Met Someone
description: I MET SOMEONEBy Bruce Wagner369 pp. Blue Rider Press. $27.95.

title: John Jodzios Knockout
description: KNOCKOUTStoriesBy John Jodzio196 pp. Soft Skull Press. Paper, $15.95.

title: The Best Place on Earth, by Ayelet Tsabari
description: THE BEST PLACE ON EARTHStoriesBy Ayelet Tsabari256 pp. Random House. $26.

title: As Close to Us as Breathing, by Elizabeth Poliner
description: AS CLOSE TO US AS BREATHINGBy Elizabeth Poliner358 pp. A Lee Boudreaux Book/Little, Brown & Company. $27.

title: Smarter Faster Better, by Charles Duhigg
description: SMARTER FASTER BETTERThe Secrets of Being Productive in Life and BusinessBy Charles DuhiggIllustrated. 380 pp. Random House. $28.

title: Gone With the Mind, by Mark Leyner
description: GONE WITH THE MINDBy Mark Leyner250 pp. Little, Brown & Company. $25.

title: American Girls, by Nancy Jo Sales
description: AMERICAN GIRLSSocial Media and the Secret Lives of TeenagersBy Nancy Jo Sales404 pp. Alfred A. Knopf. $26.95.

title: A $22.2 Million Penthouse Atop a Landmark
description: An immense, full-floor penthouse at the top of the Manhattan House, a condominium conversion of a white-brick landmark building with a private garden on the Upper East Side, sold for $22,168,630 and was the most expensive closed sale of the week, according to city records.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Why We Think Were Better Investors Than We Are
description: From their earliest days, the loosely confederated research efforts that came to be known as behavioral economics spawned a large quantity of studies centered on securities investment. This was not because the fields pioneers were especially interested in stocks and bonds, nor was the early research commonly underwritten by financial services firms.

title: Investing for Your Future Health Care
description: Ken Dychtwald, who is 65 and is the chief executive officer of Age Wave, a consulting and research company focused on aging, decided in his 50s that he and his wife should buy long-term care insurance so they wouldnt be a burden on each other or their children if they became ill or disabled.

title: When Not Paying Attention Pays Off
description: Pay attention to your teacher. Pay attention to detail. Pay attention, pay attention, pay attention! Our entire lives were warned: Pay attention, or. Well, you know. The worst will happen.

title: A Nearly Foolproof Method for Golden, Crunchy Chicken Breast
description: Pity the poor skinless, boneless chicken breast, so often heartbreakingly overcooked. Dry, stringy, bland, sad. Whats doubly sad is that it really doesnt have to be that way.

title: 1966: France Pledges to Aid India
description: PARIS  President Charles de Gaulle, in talks with Indian Prime Minister Mrs. Indira Gandhi, today pledged France to help India industrialize, diplomatic sources said.

title: The Times on the Air: Brussels Attackers Motives, Trump as Daddy Warbucks, Indias New Generation
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights from The New York Times. Below are highlights from television and radio interviews featuring Times reporters, columnists and executives.

title: Baby Boomers Are Finding a Second Career in Politics
description: STEVEN PONTO was a senior lawyer at a financial services technology company when it was sold in 2009. Some colleagues were relocating to Jacksonville, Fla., the headquarters of the new parent, but he didnt want to leave the small city outside Milwaukee where he had lived since 1990.

title: Seeking Painkillers in the Emergency Room
description: A couple of months ago, a patient well known to the emergency room where I work came in requesting his usual cocktail of narcotic pain medications. It was early Saturday morning, before the usual bustle of patients had begun, and I had some time.

title: Fruits and Vegetables to Fight Cataracts
description: Heres another reason to eat your fruits and veggies: You may reduce your risk of vision loss from cataracts.

title: In a Florentine Palazzo, History with a Dash of Playfulness
description: Rooms from 140 euros (about $156); from 250 euros in high season.

title: This Design Firm Fights Bad Taste From Within
description: After a few minutes with the Flemish designer Job Smeets, you start to feel sorry for the water jug at his elbow. Sleek and minimal, it seems a perfectly normal pitcher from, say, Umbra or Ikea, but Mr. Smeets prods it like something rotten. He holds it up, literally and figuratively, as a symbol of whats wrong with design.

title: How Many People Have Been Killed in ISIS Attacks Around the World
description: More than 1,200 people outside of Iraq and Syria have been killed in attacks inspired or coordinated by the Islamic State.

title: Turkey Abruptly Closes Espionage Trial of 2 Journalists to Public
description: ISTANBUL  A long-awaited trial of two Turkish journalists facing potential life sentences on espionage charges began Friday, but was quickly closed to the public and news media, prompting outrage and concerns over whether the proceedings could be free and fair. A subsequent postponement, until April 1, did little to stanch the criticism.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Girls and Sex
description: This week, Peggy Orenstein talks about Girls and Sex; Alexandra Alter has news from the publishing world; John Williams discusses The Throwback Special; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

title: In The Larry Sanders Show, Larry, Garry and the Audience Made a Comic Love Triangle
description: The first thing you hear in The Larry Sanders Show is Hank Kingsley (Jeffrey Tambor), the sidekick to the late-night host Larry Sanders (Garry Shandling), preparing the members of the studio audience of the show within the show. The host, he tells them, needs their help  their applause, their affirmation. The better you are, he says, the better Larry is.

title: Call It What It Is: A Rabble
description: AMERICANS dont have a vocabulary to describe the pernicious behavior of political crowds, but our forefathers did. John Adams favored a strong executive to guard against the mob. He thought that partisans of popular democracy like Thomas Jefferson or Tom Paine ignored the dangers of populist passion. The people, he wrote, can be as tyrannical as any king. That division contributed to the formation of the first parties  Adamss Federalists and Jeffersons Democrats.

title: For a Better Memory
description: To the Editor:

title: 1910s | Easter Colors for the Gray Lady
description: Forget that parade on the avenue, Fifth Avenue.

title: Products and Competition Stretch Market for Athleisure Clothing
description: The beams are still bare in Yogasmogas first Manhattan store, juice bar and fitness studio. But Rishi Bali raves that he is building the next Lululemon  only better.

title: The Imprint of Racism
description: To the Editor:

title: Alexander and Sascha Pinczowski, Siblings on Way to New York, Killed at Brussels Airport
description: Alexander and Sascha Pinczowski were siblings living in Belgium, but they never lingered in one place for long. The children of a hotel manager, they had lived in Turkey, Greece and Germany, and were on their way back to New York, a city they both loved, when they arrived at the departures hall at Brussels Airport on Tuesday.

title: My 10 Favorite Books: Simon Critchley
description: For his bookshop and website One Grand Books, the editor Aaron Hicklin asked people to name the 10 books theyd take with them if they were marooned on a desert island. The next in the series is the philosopher Simon Critchley, whose many books include "Faith of the Faithless and "Bowie, an excursion through the songs of David Bowie. He shares his list exclusively with T.

title: Donald Trumps Trail of Comments About Women
description: Donald J. Trump says regularly that he cherishes women and that he would be their greatest advocate as president, but his latest feud with Ted Cruz  in which he threatened the Texas senators wife, Heidi, and reposted an unflattering picture of her on Twitter  has resurfaced questions about his history of making comments that some find to be sexist. Over the years, Mr. Trump has said several things that his critics have called offensive. This is a sampling of such comments.

title: Fighting Debtors Prisons
description: To the Editor:

title: Can North Carolina Get Away With Rolling Back L.G.B.T. Rights?
description: In a bill that zoomed through with head-spinning speed, the North Carolina legislature rushed Wednesday to strip rights from L.G.B.T. people. The excuse for the bill was to restrict transgender people to using the public restroom that matches the gender on their birth certificates. But the Republican-led Legislature went far beyond bathrooms. Lawmakers also blocked cities and counties from protecting people from discrimination, based on sexual orientation or gender identity, in restaurants, hotels, taxis or any form of public accommodation. Its a sweeping law  and it represents a backlash against the strides L.G.B.T. people have made in other arenas this year, one that yanks North Carolina back in time.

title: Chief Justice John Robertss Duty
description: To the Editor:

title: Republicans Continue Their Attacks on Fetal Tissue Research
description: Republicans in the House launched a politically-motivated attack on fetal tissue research and abortion rights when they created the Select Investigative Panel on Infant Lives, which held its first hearing earlier this month. Now they plan to continue their campaign by issuing 17 subpoenas seeking the names of researchers, students and others.

title: Bound for U.S. and His Georgia Peach, He Died in Brussels
description: Bart Migom was on his way from Brussels to Atlanta on Tuesday to see the woman he called his Georgia peach and partner in Christ.

title: How Buyers React When Prices Rise and Fall
description: When gasoline prices spike, do you go in search of the station with the lowest price or wait in a long line to save 5 cents a gallon? When prices fall, do you splurge and pay 10 cents more for brand-name gasoline that promises to make your engine run more smoothly?

title: The Fashion News to Know This Week
description: Fuzzy was he

title: Why I Dont Make Financial Decisions on My Smartphone
description: According to a recent survey by the Federal Reserve, 52 percent of adult smartphone owners use mobile banking services. Its easy to understand the appeal of these financial apps, as they give us the ability to get real-time updates on our account balances and spending. Research I conducted with Yaron Levi has shown that such updates can deliver real benefits, helping people cut their spending by 15.7 percent.

title: Discovery of Navy Shipwreck Solves 95-Year-Old Mystery
description: A Navy tugboat that disappeared after it sailed from San Francisco in 1921 has been found by National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration researchers in shark-infested waters about 30 miles west of San Francisco, putting an end to a 95-year-old mystery.

title: Lawyer Defending Russian Soldier in Ukraine Is Found Dead
description: MOSCOW  A Ukrainian lawyer who was defending one of the Russian servicemen currently on trial in Ukraine was found dead on Friday, a government official said during a news conference in Kiev, Ukraines capital.

title: Life Insurance Tries to Lighten Up
description: A new television commercial features babies learning to walk. Some manage a few steps before plopping to the ground. You see them through all of lifes ups and downs, a womans voice says as the ad ends.

title: David Peraltas Relentless Push From Independent Ball to the Majors
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz.  David Peralta had a dream and a problem. His dream was to play baseball again. His problem was that he could not afford it.

title: Three Headaches for the Recycling Industry
description: The most advanced recycling operations in the world divert 75 percent or more of community waste away from landfills. In their efforts to achieve 100 percent recycling, or so-called Zero Waste, three products have proved particularly stubborn:

title: Whats Ailing the United Nations?
description: To the Editor:

title: Victims Neighbor Sought in Deadly Staten Island Shooting
description: The animosity between the two men on Staten Island festered for years. Anthony Morales believed that Anthony Rivera, his neighbor in the Mariners Harbor Houses, owed him $15,000, and he would not let the 21-year-old forget about it, law enforcement officials said.

title: The Race Is On to Control Artificial Intelligence, and Techs Future
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The resounding win by a Google artificial intelligence program over a champion in the complex board game Go this month was a statement  not so much to professional game players as to Googles competitors.

title: Review: Greek Leanings, With an Element of Surprise, at 251 Lex
description: On a recent visit to the new 251 Lex in Mount Kisco we ordered several starters, and were surprised when a plate of small dumplings was placed in front of us. We hadnt requested the sheep-cheese gnudi spanakopita, but Ive rarely been so happy about a kitchen error. Delicate and creamy, with just a hint of crunch from phyllo crumble, the dish had a subtle undercurrent of truffle pesto and scallion butter.

title: Ted Cruzs Terrifying Approach to Religious Liberty
description: Despite his hundreds of rallies, his many interviews and his hyperactive Twitter feed, its still really hard to tell the difference between what Donald Trump actually believes, what he says to whip up his crowds, and what he says merely because it popped into his head one afternoon.

title: When Obama Came to Town
description: Havana  On Monday, the first full day of President Obamas historic visit to Cuba, the professor of my class on Cuban-United States relations, a woman in her 40s, wheeled a TV into our classroom in the Jos Mart building at the University of Havana, the set looking like it dated from the 1970s.

title: What I Love | Chris Grabenstein
description: The Upper West Side apartment of the best-selling childrens book author Chris Grabenstein is filled with whimsy.

title: A New Breed of Opera Diva: Sheep
description: The unlikeliest stars of New Yorks spring opera season were raised humbly in rural Pennsylvania on pop and country-western music, but they are already showing prima donna tendencies. Not only did a whole new dressing room have to be built for them backstage, but it also had to be soundproofed and kept fully stocked with their favorite snacks: grain and a hay mixture of timothy, orchard grass and red clover.

title: Chris Grabenstein at Home on the Upper West Side
description: Visitors to the Upper West Side apartment of the author Chris Grabenstein are greeted by a retro-futuristic robot that the artist Steve Heller assembled from vintage found pieces: a stainless-steel pool filter torso, a stereo amplifier head and shock-absorber legs. Its a cross between the Tin Man from The Wizard of Oz and Rosie, the maid from The Jetsons, and a suitably wacky welcome to the world of Mr. Grabenstein.

title: Tribune Chief Discusses Transforming a Mature Media Company
description: Peter Liguori, the longtime television executive, was appointed the new chief executive of the Tribune Company in 2013, just two and a half weeks after the newspaper and TV company emerged from an agonizing four-year bankruptcy process.

title: ISIS Suicide Bomber in Iraq Kills Dozens at Soccer Game
description: BAGHDAD  A suicide bomber detonated his explosive belt at a soccer game in a town south of Baghdad on Friday, killing at least 31 people, including the towns mayor, provincial police officials said.

title: Home Sales Around the New York Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Review: From Scratch, in Ridgewood, Focuses on Italys Simple Pleasures
description: A pool of creamy mozzarella spilled out of the grilled zucchini wrapped around the thick round of cheese. With every pleasurable bite, I had to remind myself that I was in Ridgewood and not Campania, Italy.

title: Teacher at Islamic School Torn From Her Family by Cowards in Brussels
description: A gym teacher at an Islamic school in Brussels, Loubna Lafquiri was dedicated to teaching children respect for others, self-confidence, perseverance and forgiveness, all with a love and appreciation for Islam.

title: Face Masks for the Morning  That You Leave on All Day
description: The masking hour is, traditionally, a period of required sequestration  a nighttime ritual designed to rebalance your skin in privacy. But a new breed of no-rinse masks can be applied in the morning and left on all day, providing benefits when theyll actually be visible: the waking hours. Stronger than daily-use creams, and easier to walk around in than sheet masks, the new leave-on-all-day variety is about skin preparation  not restoration. When you rinse a mask off, that ends your skins absorption, says Tata Harper, whose popular all-natural skin-care line features several no-rinse options. Leave-on masks extend the time your skin has to absorb benefits. These formulas are translucent and porous enough to work well with other products, offering a lifted, protected and smoothed-out base for further skin care and makeup. What keeps them within the realm of masks is their potency  most require a brief period to fully absorb and typically arent recommended for daily use.

title: Syrian Army Said to Be Closer to Retaking Palmyra
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  After days of raging battles with Islamic State militants, Syrian Army units and allied government militias backed by intensive Russian airstrikes on Friday recaptured the strategically important citadel in Palmyra, Syrian state television reported, citing a military source.

title: Review: Schout Bay Tavern in Long Island, a Pub With an Irreverent Side
description: Schout Bay Tavern, named after the colonial Dutch term for Manhasset Bay, opened quietly on the villages main street just before Labor Day in 2015. Since then, positive word of mouth has brought much of the neighborhood to its chic, modern doorstep.

title: Louisville Is a Grumpy N.C.A.A. Host as Its Team Sits One Out
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  The Monkey Wrench, a bar in the Highlands neighborhood here, hosted a March Sadness event Friday night. Fans gathered to watch taped broadcasts of the three games in which the Louisville mens basketball team won national championships, in 1980, 1986 and 2013. Wearing red was required, and, per tradition, the song Mahgeetah by the Louisville band My Morning Jacket was played after victory was secured.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are in the Seaport Area and East Village in Manhattan, and Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

title: Bernie Sanders Consistent Over Decades in His Call for Revolution
description: BURLINGTON, Vt.  On the night of the New Hampshire primary, the high-water mark of his presidential campaign, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont called his rout of Hillary Clinton nothing short of the beginning of a political revolution and vowed to stop the billionaire class from buying elections.

title: How to Stop Overprescribing Antibiotics
description: ANTIBIOTICS are an indispensable weapon in every physicians arsenal, but when prescribed unnecessarily for nonbacterial infections like the common cold, as they too often are, they provide no benefit and create problems. They wipe out healthy bacteria and can cause side effects like yeast infections and allergic reactions. Worse still, they contribute to the rise of superbugs that resist antibiotic treatment.

title: Four Museums Most Ephemeral Artworks: the Flowers in the Lobby
description: At several New York museums, lobby flower arrangements can be as meticulously tended as the art on display. Here, the stories behind four of them.

title: Shuffle Along Schedule Adjusted for Illness and Tweaks
description: Shuffle Along,among the more anticipated shows of the spring season on Broadway, canceled four preview performances this week, citing the illness of its star Audra McDonald, and is taking an unusual, but long-scheduled, four-day hiatus next week to make revisions.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties are in Sea Cliff, N.Y., and Fairfield, Conn.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review Podcast: Girls and Sex
description: Listen to this weeks podcast | Subscribe: iTunes | Stitcher

title: The South Fails Again at Fair Pay
description: The state minimum wage in North Carolina is $7.25 an hour, the same as the federal minimum wage. No localities in North Carolina have their own higher minimums. Nor is it likely that they could enact higher minimums even if they wanted to because in North Carolina, the state  not the city or county  generally calls the shots on important matters of local concern.

title: Homes for Sale in Manhattan and Brooklyn
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in New York City:

title: Homes for Sale in New York and Connecticut
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in the New York region:

title: Urby Staten Island
description: The developers of a new rental complex now opening in Stapleton hope to prove that the North Shore of the forgotten borough can have broad appeal.

title: Staten Island Mini City
description: The developers of Urby Staten Island, a new rental complex now opening in Stapleton, hope to prove that the North Shore of the forgotten borough can have broad appeal, and maybe even be the citys next hip enclave.

title: Review: Beyond First Impressions at Bantams Mockingbird Kitchen
description: A sign out front of Mockingbird Kitchen and Bar in Bantam reads The Bantam Inn, creating the impression that passers-by might be able to stop in for the night. Inside, on the ground floor of the two-story colonial-style house, the prominence of the bar, which anchors a dining space split between two rooms, and a menu heavy with burgers and pub-grub appetizers, suggest more of an elbows-on-the-counter sort of burger joint than fine dining.

title: Lose With Cruz: A Love Story
description: IT was clear to me weeks ago, even before Marco Rubio threw in the towel, that the G.O.P. was getting ready to cuddle with Ted Cruz.

title: Queens Man Accused of Making Over 30 False Calls to 911
description: There was a call to 911 reporting an elderly person had fallen and suffered a head injury, and a call that a pregnant woman had gone into labor. There were calls complaining of gas leaks and the smell of smoke.

title: Sally Field on the Newest Stage of Her Life
description: If Sally Field nursed a hope of dodging notice at the Whitney Museum of American Art this month, that hope was crushed when she stretched her 5-foot-3-inch frame on an outsize banquette, its cushioned surface an apparent invitation to relax.

title: At Exhibitions in Peekskill, Art in Plain English
description: Visitors entering the Hudson Valley Center for Contemporary Art in Peekskill will find themselves standing beneath a cluster of shiny silver umbrellas that seem to be tumbling in the wind. Looking up, they will notice that lines of text have been cut into each umbrella. On the wall below, as if raining from above, silver letters are arranged vertically to form words: kindness, dream and others.

title: The Directors Director: Chantal Akerman
description: Has any director used the kitchen to such devastating effect as Chantal Akerman?

title: American Missionarys Account of Attack
description: Mason Wells, a 19-year-old Mormon missionary in Belgium, describes how he survived the terrorist attack at the Brussels Airport.

title: Bill Cunningham | Pink!
description: The color is a fashion statement during these first weeks of spring, most noticeably on coats. Although the formal Easter parade (and its requisite flower-laden hats and orchid corsages) has long disappeared, fashion has rejuvenated the color for today. An interesting note is the orchid blossom: Originally the orchid was plucked from a plant and worn on Easter on its own, but in the 1920s, florists started adding ribbons, and by the late 30s and 40s, the single blossom got mucked up with pink tulle and glitter. Today, the beautiful orchid has returned to its natural state. The plants shown here at the Union Square Saturday Greenmarket are from Silva Orchids, which has been passed down through three generations of growers, who have grown many of the same plants for decades.

title: Ted Cruz Blames Donald Trump and Henchmen for Tabloid Report of Affairs
description: Senator Ted Cruz on Friday accused Donald J. Trump and his henchmen of peddling an article in a supermarket tabloid alleging that Mr. Cruz had engaged in extramarital affairs.

title: Wind Power Transmission Project in Plains Earns U.S. Approval
description: A major transmission project aimed at bringing wind energy out of the Texas and Oklahoma panhandle cleared a significant hurdle on Friday as the Energy Department announced it would allow the project to go forward.

title: In For Worse, an Affair Doesnt Wreck a 30-Year Marriage
description: A husband and wife are shaken and stirred when their 30-year marriage hits the rocks of infidelity in For Worse, a new play presented by the New Jersey Repertory Company, which lately seems to be absorbed with the topic of marital discord.

title: Evening Hours | The Young Fellows Ball at the Frick and More
description: Bill Cunningham covers events in March.

title: Knicks Show Some Life, but Focus Is on Teams Next Incarnation
description: Carmelo Anthony isolates on Derrick Rose, ready to do the bump-and-shimmy that is his career-long groove. Another Chicago player drops off to help defend him, and a stork-thin Latvian cuts beyond the top of the key.

title: In The Path, on Hulu, Losing Faith Means Losing Love
description: UPPER NYACK, N.Y.  On an idyllic hilltop that slopes down to the Hudson River, about 40 minutes northwest of New York City, a rustic retreat owned by the Sisters of Our Lady of Christian Doctrine has been transformed into the Meyerist Movement compound.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week.

title: From Relationships to Murder and Mayhem
description: Louis Begley sat at the dining room table in his light-filled Sagaponack house, carefully comparing the text of his newest book, Kill and Be Killed, with the German translation on the screen of his laptop, making sure it was all correct.

title: C.D.C. Offers Guidelines for Delaying Pregnancy After Zika Exposure
description: Federal health authorities said for the first time on Friday how long couples who have been exposed to the Zika virus should wait before trying to get pregnant.

title: Jon Bernthal: From Walking Dead to Plain Deadly
description: It takes almost the entire first episode of the second season of Daredevil, the Netflix series about the Marvel crime fighter, before a new nemesis named Frank Castle utters a single line of dialogue.

title: In Sex With Strangers, Reconciling Lust With Literary Values
description: It was, of course, only a matter of time, and that time has arrived: In Sex With Strangers, Laura Easons delightful two-person play at TheaterWorks in Hartford, a laptop, clunky and antiquated, has gone from being a signifier of the newest technology to a sight gag. Its one of many sly, charming jokes in this disarmingly up-to-the-minute examination of a peculiarly modern odd-couple relationship. But Olivia and Ethan are not as odd as all that, and thanks to the appealing actors who play them under Rob Ruggieros unerring direction, Courtney Rackley and Patrick Ball, you just cant help rooting for them to get together  even with all the obstacles Ms. Eason has quite deliberately put in their way.

title: After Brussels Attacks, a Slow Process to Confirm Families Worst Fears
description: BRUSSELS  From his home in Tennessee, Levi Sutton has spent three days trying to figure out what happened to his half brother and sister-in-law, Justin and Stephanie Shults, who were at the Brussels international airport when the bombs went off.

title: Roberto Devereux at the Met, and a Sopranos Triple Crown
description: The applause and bravos for the soprano Sondra Radvanovsky were so frenzied at the end of Donizettis Roberto Devereux at the Metropolitan Opera on Thursday night that she looked overwhelmed, almost a little frightened.The audience members knew, it seemed, that they had just witnessed an emotionally vulnerable and vocally daring performance, a milestone in the career of an essential artist.

title: Edna OBrien Is Still Gripped by Dark Moral Questions
description: LONDON  One day in the late 1960s, the novelist Edna OBrien was strolling around London with Marlon Brando, with whom she had just spent a (chaste) night. Are you a great writer? Brando asked.

title: For Gonzaga Guard, Speed Bumps on the Road Back
description: CHICAGO  As a high school senior in Austin, Tex., Eric McClellan knew very little about Gonzaga.

title: Shakespeare, the Book Tour
description: VERMILLION, S.D.  Visitors to this town of about 11,000 on a bluff near the Missouri River have long been surprised to learn that its home to a set of rare Stradivari stringed instruments, which are housed in a museum here along with the worlds oldest playable harpsichord, the oldest surviving cello and some 15,000 other historic instruments.

title: Review: The Necks and Alvin Curran Play at the Whitney Museum
description: The Necks created an hour of exquisite, constantly evolving tintinnabulation on Thursday night at the Whitney Museum of American Art, sharing a bill with a solo performance by the composer Alvin Curran. It was a rare United States appearance by this Australian trio, which has been collaborating for 30 years on music that defines a particular, meditative intersection of Minimalism, with its systematic repetition, and jazz, with its improvisatory openness. The Necks explore motion within stasis and freedom within boundaries, applying detailed, subtle virtuosity and the stamina of nonstop playing to summon a rapturous concentration.

title: Review: Bajillion Dollar Propertie$: Flip, Flop or Flee?
description: Real-estate reality shows seem to have reached some kind of parody tipping point. Theyre Watching, a mildly amusing horror movie released on Friday, is about a reality TV crew that goes to Moldova to film an expatriates fixer-upper story and stumbles into the occult. But if you want to see this annoying genre lampooned especially mercilessly, the caustic new Bajillion Dollar Propertie$, on the Seeso streaming service, is the destination for you.

title: Guatemala Stuns the U.S. in a Qualifier
description: GUATEMALA CITY  The United States traveled here to face a fragile opponent, intent on using its two games against Guatemala in a five-day span to quickly clinch a berth in the next round of World Cup qualifying.

title: Friday Not Music: Prologue to The Canterbury Tales
description: A really springlike day, and my freshman-year poetry class came back into my head:

title: Review: Ensemble Signal Returns to Winter With Schnee
description: Just in time for the start of spring, an icy blast poured from the stage at the Miller Theater on Thursday evening: Schnee had returned to New York.

title: Banging Pots and Beating Dogs in a Polarized Brazil
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  IF youre in Brazil these days, you shouldnt wear red. Or grow a beard. In the current political climate, youll risk being tagged as a Communist and a supporter of the leftist Workers Party. You could be bullied and called mortadela (a sausage commonly regarded as a poor mans food).

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: The Hundred We Are Explores Aging and Delusion
description: In the annals of the show must go on stories, the New York production of the Swedish drama The Hundred We Are stands out for its gallantry. Jonas Hassen Khemiris original script, a portrait of a woman at war with her various selves, calls for a cast of three.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing: Brussels, Ted Cruz, Donald Trump
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: A Dam, Small and Unsung, Is Caught Up in an Iranian Hacking Case
description: RYE BROOK, N.Y.  The United States has many colossal dams, hydroelectric power generators like Hoover and Grand Coulee so monumental in scale and purpose that they have been celebrated in song by Woody Guthrie and others.

title: Thinking Big and Bigger About New York
description: In November 2014, the Sunday Metropolitan section published an article about a man named Jim Venturi and his audacious plan to overhaul transit in New York. His ideas were big stuff: close Rikers Island and use the land for runways for La Guardia Airport; connect them to subways and railroads by a huge new station and convention center in the Port Morris section of the Bronx; create another transit hub and business district in Sunnyside, Queens; add a light-rail line from Red Hook up through Williamsburg and Greenpoint in Brooklyn to western Queens.

title: Najim Laachraoui, 24, Bomb Maker for Paris and Brussels Attacks
description: One of the bombers who blew himself up in Brussels this week was also the bomb maker who assembled the suicide vests for two of the terrorists who carried out the Paris attacks.

title: Unbroken Vows
description: The nuns of the Franciscan Handmaids of the Most Pure Heart of Mary, based in a brick house in Harlem, make up one of only three predominantly black orders in the country.

title: The Nuns of Harlem
description: Sometimes, people who do not know our life feel that we are magic people, said Sister Precilla Takuh. We are just normal people, like any other person, but because we have that call, we responded to it and became who we are.

title: How the Novelist Douglas Kennedy Spends His Sundays
description: Douglas Kennedy, a novelist from New York who is very popular in France, was back in town recently after some time away, and he took note of the things that made him feel at home. Its such a vocal, loud place, he said. Coming out of the subway the other day, I heard a cabdriver having an argument with someone, and he said, Are you dumb or just stupid? I hear that and feel Im home. Mr. Kennedy, 61, spends much of the year in Europe and Maine, or commuting to Montreal, where his wife, Christine Ury, a psychoanalyst, lives and works. His home in New York is an apartment in Koreatown. His latest book, The Blue Hour, is a smash you know where.

title: Deaf and Hard of Hearing Fight to Be Heard
description: Lydia Callis wanted to get her mother a gym membership for Christmas last year. When she called to arrange a consultation, she mentioned that her mom (who lives in Arizona) is deaf and would need a sign-language interpreter for the session. The health club said it would not provide a signer. Ms. Callis  who became an Internet sensation during Hurricane Sandy as Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs exuberant sign-language interpreter  told the club that it was actually required by law to do so. Still it refused, and Ms. Callis, who was calling from Manhattan, gave up.

title: The Mayor Does the Town, His Way
description: Yes, he has seen Hamilton.

title: Peter Brown, Star in TV Westerns and Soap Opera, Dies at 80
description: Peter Brown, who had starring roles in two television westerns in the 1950s and 60s and later acted in soap operas, died on Monday in Phoenix. He was 80.

title: Martyrs With Guns and the Easter Rising
description: HE was very old, in his 90s, but looking sturdy, like the truck driver he once was. He was a distant cousin by marriage, on the branch of the family that had stayed in Ireland. When I visited him there last summer, in a nursing home in Kilrush, County Clare, I was not sure he knew who I was, but we connected over an old rebel song we both remembered.

title: Democrats See Gains as Donald Trump Targets a Wife
description: Senator Ted Cruz may have urged Donald J. Trump to leave his wife, Heidi, the hell alone, but there is one group that is quietly hoping Mr. Trumps attacks on his rivals spouse and other women will continue indefinitely: Democrats.

title: Israel Begins Murder Investigation of Soldier Who Shot Palestinian
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli military said on Friday that a soldier who shot a Palestinian assailant in the head as he lay motionless on the ground was being investigated on suspicion of murder. The announcement was highly unusual and underscored the seriousness of the case, which was filmed and quickly spread over social media.

title: Backlash as Senator Breaks Ranks on Supreme Court Hearings
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Jerry Moran, Republican of Kansas, faced a barrage of criticism from conservative groups on Friday after he broke with his partys leadership by saying he favored holding hearings on President Obamas nominee for the Supreme Court.

title: A Revived Challenge to Islam as Bangladeshs State Religion Goes to Court
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  It came as a surprise to Serajul Islam Choudhury, a retired English professor, to learn that his petition to drop Islam as Bangladeshs state religion would finally be heard in court on Sunday.

title: Wrong Man Convicted of 1957 Murder in Illinois, Prosecutor Says
description: It was hailed as a victory for the persistence of justice. Some five and a half decades after a 7-year-old girl was kidnapped, strangled and stabbed in rural northern Illinois, Jack McCullough, a military veteran and former police officer, was convicted of the killing in 2012 in what was believed to be one of the oldest American cold cases to result in an arrest.

title: Earl Hamner Jr., Who Created The Waltons, Dies at 92
description: Earl Hamner Jr., who drew on warm memories of his Depression childhood in the Blue Ridge Mountains of Virginia to create the enormously popular 1970s television series The Waltons, died on Thursday in Los Angeles. He was 92.

title: Robert De Niro Defends Screening of Anti-Vaccine Film at Tribeca Festival
description: In a decision that has dredged up the widely debunked link between vaccines and autism, the Tribeca Film Festival plans to screen a film by a discredited former doctor whose research caused widespread alarm about the issue.

title: Exemptions May Color Deal to Lift New York States Minimum Wage
description: ALBANY  Over the last several years, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has repeatedly invoked a mantra of New York as one state, a place where all people, upstate and downstate, are treated equally.

title: In Ruben Tejadas Presence, Curse on Mets Continues
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Ruben Tejada ranged over to field a high-bouncing ground ball, but he took his eye off the ball for an instant, and it bounced around his glove. Rather than boo, some Mets fans at Tradition Field chuckled.

title: Florida Governor Signs Law to Cut Funding for Abortion Clinics
description: Gov. Rick Scott of Florida signed a law on Friday that cut state funding to clinics that perform abortions.

title: Long Denied Pensions, Pioneers of the Womens Game Are Seeing Reasons for Hope
description: At the BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells, Calif., before the debate over equal prize money in tennis was renewed and the tournament director resigned over disparaging comments about the womens game, a behind-the-scenes meeting took place that aimed to close another gap in compensation for female players.

title: A Mysterious Killing on the Upper East Side Unsettles Residents
description: While Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson filmed their 94th episode of Elementary, the CBS detective series, on the Upper East Side in Manhattan on Friday, a real-life homicide mystery took a new turn just one block away.

title: Poor Outing Puts Ivan Nova in Bind With Yankees
description: SARASOTA, Fla.  Ivan Nova walked off the mound Friday, a lonely trudge toward the dugout after an exasperating four and two-thirds innings that might have lost him the last spot in the Yankees starting rotation to C. C. Sabathia.

title: Roger Federer, Citing Illness, Withdraws From Miami Open
description: Roger Federers comeback from knee surgery will have to wait until the Monte Carlo Masters in two weeks. Federer, the former world No. 1, withdrew Friday from the Miami Open in Key Biscayne, Fla., because of a stomach virus.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I just wanted animals to do what they do. Its very poetic, and unpredictable. You never know what theyre doing next.

title: Belgium Fears Nuclear Plants Are Vulnerable
description: BRUSSELS  As a dragnet aimed at Islamic State operatives spiraled across Brussels and into at least five European countries on Friday, the authorities were also focusing on a narrower but increasingly alarming threat: the vulnerability of Belgiums nuclear installations.

title: Guatemalan Soccer Scandals Drain Fans Interest in Game
description: GUATEMALA CITY  Consider what representing the Guatemalan national soccer team entails at the moment. Three former top officials of the countrys soccer federation are under indictment in the United States, including one who FIFA is claiming defrauded it of several million dollars. The reigning Guatemalan champion, Antigua, has eight players facing suspension for failed drug tests; the players blame supplements that they say were provided by the clubs owner. Another league owner, also recently the interim president of the soccer federation, is the brother of an accused drug kingpin who is in jail in the United States.

title: Trump, Cruz, Kasich and the Ladies
description: Lets talk about the Republican presidential candidates  and women.

title: Obama: The Anti-Anti-Nuke President
description: NEXT week President Obama will welcome world leaders to Washington for his fourth Nuclear Security Summit, a biennial event he initiated to mobilize global action to prevent terrorists from acquiring atomic bombs.

title: Clusters of Mountains
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  If youre a visual person, you might take a look at the empty crossword grid before you solve and notice the pattern of black and white squares. I always wonder why constructors choose the patterns they do. Sometimes it plays into a puzzle theme, sometimes it doesnt.

title: Robert Ebeling, Challenger Engineer Who Warned of Disaster, Dies at 89
description: Thirty years ago, Bob Ebeling drove to the headquarters of the aerospace contractor Morton Thiokol in Brigham City, Utah, to watch the launch of the space shuttle Challenger. On the way, he leaned over to his daughter Leslie and said: The Challenger is going to blow up. Everyones going to die.

title: Santiago Erevia, Once Denied Medal of Honor Over Ethnicity, Dies at 69
description: Santiago Erevia, a Vietnam War veteran and retired mail carrier who had been denied the nations highest military honor for 45 years because he was Hispanic, died on Tuesday in San Antonio. He was 69.

title: The N.C.A.A.s Women Problem
description: Northampton, Mass.  AS they enter the third round of the N.C.A.A. basketball tournament this weekend, the University of Connecticut Huskies have won 71 consecutive games. Seventy-one! And they won national championships in 1995, 2000, 2002, 2003, 2004, 2009, 2010, 2013, 2014 and 2015  thats 10 times in the last 21 years, and nine times in the last 15. Now, thats major news. Only it isnt  because this is the UConn womens team.

title: Time to Rethink U.S. Relationship With Egypt
description: Since the Egyptian military took power in a coup in the summer of 2013, the Obama administrations policy toward Egypt has been moored in a series of faulty assumptions. The time has come to challenge them and to reassess whether an alliance that has long been considered a cornerstone of American national security policy is doing more harm than good.

title: At N.C.A.A. Tournament, One Motto Fits Many Teams
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  The members of the Oklahoma mens basketball team have a motto, Play for each other. The Sooners took the saying to heart in their round-of-16 victory over Texas A&M on Thursday, producing their most concerted effort of the season. But the Oklahoma players will not have Play for each other emblazoned across their chests Saturday when they take the court against the Oregon Ducks in the West Regional final.

title: Holding On to New Voters in November
description: The nation has reached the halfway mark in the 2016 presidential primaries. Its difficult to draw big conclusions from the small slice of Americans who vote in primaries, but turnout among Democratic voters has been  less enthusiastic than among Republicans, with roughly five million more votes cast in Republican primaries than in Democratic ones. That suggests Democrats will need to do more to motivate their constituencies to vote in November.

title: Andy Groves Warning to Silicon Valley
description: The praise this week for Andy Grove, who died on Monday at age 79, has been wrapped up in praise for Silicon Valley, where he was a towering figure in the semiconductor revolution and the longtime leader of Intel, the worlds biggest supplier of microprocessors.

title: Pentagon Chief Used Personal Email After White House Query
description: WASHINGTON  Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter continued to use a personal email account for government work for at least four months last year after the White House questioned the Pentagon about why he was using it, according to copies of Mr. Carters emails released by the Defense Department on Friday.

title: A Mess Left by Occupiers at the Malheur Wildlife Refuge in Oregon
description: At first, it can be unclear what you are seeing. The photographs on the federal Fish and Wildlife Services Flickr page resemble, by turns, a trashed office, a seriously disorganized farm, possibly an abandoned construction site or an especially messy recreation room in someones home.

title: With I-95 Edge, Irish Show Badgers the Exit
description: PHILADELPHIA  A peculiar smell greeted the Notre Dame basketball team Thursday when it got off its bus. The scent, an industrial bouquet of exhaust and grime, offended the noses of players hailing from the Midwest and farther afield. To which guard Matt Farrell, a proud New Jersey native, retorted: Were right by the interstate. Get used to it.

title: Headed to U.S. for a Belated Celebration, Jennifer Scintu-Waetzmann Dies in Brussels Attacks
description: After almost a year, Jennifer Scintu-Waetzmann and her husband were overdue for a honeymoon.

title: Even With the Crowd Behind It, Iowa State Trails From Start to Finish
description: CHICAGO  A typical road game in the Atlantic Coast Conference can build a steely resilience for teams that regularly travel that circuit. A good squad must weather raucous arenas in places like Durham and Chapel Hill, in North Carolina, in order to prosper. Virginia has certainly done that.

title: Teenager Shot in Head Outside Harlem Housing Project, Police Say
description: A 17-year-old boy was in critical condition on Friday night after he was shot in the head outside a Harlem housing project, the police said.

title: Geneseo Falls to Wisconsin-Stevens Point in Semifinals
description: The State University of New York at Geneseos pursuit of its first N.C.A.A. Division III title came to a halt with a 5-1 drubbing by Wisconsin-Stevens Point in the semifinals in Lake Placid, N.Y. Stevens Point, ranked No. 3 in the West, will play St. Norbert inSaturdays championship game.

title: North Carolina Prevails Over Indiana With History in the Air
description: PHILADELPHIA  It might well be the most fearsome college basketball team in the country, but in the vulnerable moments before tipoff, North Carolina relies on a routine of flying elbows and gyroscopic hips.

title: What to Watch Saturday
description: Its Easter weekend, and broadcasters have planned accordingly. On ABC the old-Hollywood epic The Ten Commandments tells the story of Moses and the parting of the Red Sea, which figures in Easter Vigil services. And Medici.tv live-streams Bachs timeless St. Matthew Passion oratorio.

title: Corrections: March 26, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Big Boasts Against Huskies Lead to Hard Falls Before Them
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn.  Before Duquesnes round-of-32 game against Connecticut in the N.C.A.A. womens basketball tournament, the Dukes bluntly said they would not be distracted by the illustriousUConnaura. They believed that the Huskies, then 33-0 and winners of 70 games in a row, were in fact beatable.

title: I Miss the Innocence of a Pre-9/11 World: Our Top 10 Comments
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment.

title: The Tinder Dating Pool Isnt Completely Shallow
description: Shana Claudio left the bar on the Upper East Side of Manhattan for her third Tinder date of the day. She had already met a finance type for brunch that Sunday in October 2013 through the dating app (he was a bit superficial), and she found the second guy, whom she met for a drink, forgettable.

title: Humans of New York Founder Takes On Donald Trump
description: Brandon Stanton, the nimble shutterbug behind the immensely popular photo blog Humans of New York, has worked hard to filter politics and moral judgments out of his posts, intent on maintaining objectivity as he captures his subjects in words and on film, letting them speak for themselves.

title: Holdouts of the Social Media Age
description: When Ottessa Moshfegh published her debut novel, Eileen, last August, she did so without an online publicity apparatus.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took Instagram followers from Brussels to Cuba.

title: The N.R.A. Reimagines Classic Fairy Tales, With Guns
description: The world of make-believe can be a scary place, but never fear: Thanks to a series of reimagined fairy tales published online by the National Rifle Association, classic characters like Hansel and Gretel are now packing heat.

title: North Korean Propaganda Video Depicts Nuclear Strike on Washington
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea released a propaganda video on Saturday that depicts a nuclear strike on Washington, along with a warning to American imperialists not to provoke the North.

title: 1916: Rebels Rise Up in Dublin
description: One hundred years ago, a group of Irish nationalists in Dublin took up arms against British rule and proclaimed the establishment of an Irish republic.

title: Fighting a Cage Match to Turn UFC Into a National Phenomenon
description: It has been a while since Frank and Lorenzo Fertitta tried to choke each other into submission. The brothers took private jujitsu lessons in the early 2000s, and at the end of each they were given the chance to try new moves in a dojo in Las Vegas. But you reach a certain age (Frank is now 54, Lorenzo is 47) and turn up in Forbes (which estimates each brother is worth $1.6 billion), and brawling starts to seem like a bad idea.

title: Schools Nationwide Still Grapple With Lead in Water
description: JERSEY CITY  Anxious parents may wonder how a major school system like Newarks could overlook lead in the drinking water of 30 schools and 17,000 students. The answer: It was easy. They had to look only a few miles away, at the century-old classrooms of the schools here, across the Hackensack River.

title: Digging Further Into a Water Problem
description: While the water crisis in Flint, Mich., has focused attention on water safety, many of the countrys 13,500 public school districts take the purity of their water for granted, experts say. Yet lead contamination has been found in schools nationwide.

title: Forget the New iPhone. For Apple, Its All About the Dollar.
description: Dont obsess about the svelte new iPhone or the price cut for the Apple Watch.

title: A Little Variety
