title: Instead of Coating a Pan, a Textured Finish
description: All-Clad, the cookware company, is introducing a new line of triple-ply stainless steel skillets and saut pans that are reasonably nonstick without using special coatings. The inside bottom surface of the pans is textured like Bubble Wrap with a patented pattern of little bumps that allow for better release than smooth stainless steel. The pan has an aluminum core for conductivity. I abused a skillet with eggs and potatoes, and found it quite easy to clean. Besides skillets, there is a saut pan and a fish pan, most of which are compatible with induction burners: All-Clad d3 Armor cookware, $110 to $255 at Williams-Sonoma, williams-sonoma.com.

title: And You Thought the Line Was Long for Cronuts
description: What does it take to turn a standard French dip sandwich into a Korean French dip or KFD, as Deuki Hong, the chef at Kang Ho Dong Baekjeong, and the pastry chef Dominique Ansel call it? Start by baking a long roll, a soft potato bread studded with black garlic. Then spread kimchi on one side and garlic butter on the other. Generously fill it with Mr. Hongs slow-roasted beef. For dipping, choose either mushroom or serrano chile kalbi jus. The two chefs are turning out 300 sandwiches a day and selling them this weekend only first come first served on Friday, starting at 6 p.m., and Saturday and Sunday starting at noon: KFD Sandwich, $22, Dominique Ansel Kitchen, 137 Seventh Avenue South (Charles Street), dominiqueanselkitchen.com.

title: ScienceTake | Itching to Be Popular
description: Researchers interested in the costs and benefits of social behavior studied Japanese macaques, looking for ties between social contacts and lice.

title: Japanese Monkeys Like to Socialize, Even With Nits to Pick
description: Social life is good for you, even when your friends have lice  if youre a Japanese macaque.

title: How to Spot and Treat a Childs Hernia
description: When my twin sons were 2, their pediatrician detected a hernia in the right groin of one of the boys. The doctor minced no words: The hernia would not repair itself and surgery was necessary to avoid a serious, potentially life-threatening complication. But he added reassuringly that the operation was routine and the patient nearly always goes home the same day.

title: A Snack Endorsed by the Walrus and the Carpenter
description: Canadian oysters, east and west coast at $1 each, are the happy-hour and late-night snack at the Upholstery Store, Kurt Gutenbrunners wine bar. Pay more and you can have them elaborately garnished with raw tuna and caviar, sea urchin with pickled cabbage, cucumber and mint or passion fruit with seaweed. Alongside, consider wines suggested by Leo Schneemann, the sommelier and manager: Oysters, $1 each; garnished, two for $7, from 5 to 7 p.m. and after 10:30 p.m., Upholstery Store, 713 Washington Street (11th Street), 212-929-6384, upholsterystore-ny.com.

title: Smoked Fish and Brisket in Brooklyn
description: The brothers Zach and Alex Frankel were reared on the Upper West Side of Manhattan but live in Brooklyn now and missed the local smoked fish emporiums of their childhood. So they are doing something about it: opening on Saturday on the border between Williamsburg and Greenpoint their own version of the appetizing shops they love. Zach Frankel has been in the restaurant business as a manager and chef; his brothers career has been in music. Together, as they put it, theyre paying homage to Barney Greengrass, Murrays and Russ & Daughters, with the usual white glazed tiles and old family photos. In addition to selling smoked fish, pastrami, bagels and bialys, they have a chef, Ashley Berman, chopping chicken livers, making matzo ball soup and braising brisket based on a recipe from Anita Frankel, the brothers grandmother, for fork-tender beef, a tad sweet in the older generation tradition: Frankels Delicatessen & Appetizing, 631 Manhattan Avenue (Bedford Avenue), Williamsburg, Brooklyn, 718-389-2302, frankelsdelicatessen.com.

title: In the Aftermath of a Smokehouse Fire, a Small Happy Result
description: When a fire in January destroyed the smokehouse at S. Wallace Edwards & Sons in Virginia, many heritage pork producers were left with an oversupply. Chefs and ham and sausage makers jumped in to buy and use the pork, including Cesare Casella, the Tuscan chef. Currently without a restaurant, he has expanded a line of salamis made for him by Giorgios Salami and Sausage, and hes working on cured ham. For now, there is a meaty, peppery Salametto Dolce, a Salametto Piccante with persistent heat, and a coarser, sweetly herbaceous Finocchiella: Cesare Casella Salamis, $39 for two one-pound pieces, $59 for a sampler of all three from Heritage Foods, 718-389-0985, heritagefoodsusa.com.

title: Morning Agenda: Ethereum Challenges Bitcoin
description: ETHEREUM CHALLENGES BITCOIN | A new virtual gold rush is under way. Ethereum, a rival to Bitcoin, has soared in value and climbed 1,000 percent over the last three months,Nathaniel Popper reports in DealBook. Ethereums rise has attracted attention from giants like JPMorgan Chase, Microsoft and IBM.

title: New York Today: Magic in Midtown
description: Updated, 1:38 p.m.

title: Malaysias Immigrant Worker Debate
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  On a recent weekend excursion out of the city, I stopped for coffee at a cluster of roadside shops selling refreshments for travelers heading to the jungle-shrouded highlands that form the spine of Malaysia. A young man was sweeping the small yard outside the outbuilding that housed the restrooms; he was the janitor and handyman, he said, but he was wary when I tried to strike up a conversation.

title: Man Arrested as Third Bomber in Brussels Attack Is Freed; Hunt Is Renewed
description: BRUSSELS  A noisy citizen journalist who reveled in verbal and physical fights in public spaces, Fayal Cheffou never quite fit the profile of a furtive underground operative for the Islamic State. Yet that was the role assigned to him when the Belgian authorities announced that he had been charged with terrorism and the Belgian news media identified him as the third bomber at Brussels Airport in last Tuesdays attacks.

title: Trump's New World Disorder
description: Goodbye to all that. Now we know that Donald Trump would rip up the post-1945 world order, trash an obsolete NATO, lean toward a Japan with nukes rather than the one-sided agreement that leaves the United States responsible for Japanese defense, tell Saudi Arabia that it wouldnt be around for very long without American protection, and generally make clear that we cannot be the policeman of the world.

title: The Benefits of Spicing Up a Breast-Feeding Mothers Diet
description: When I had my children I felt that there was a tendency by experts, including those in my own pediatric profession, to push certain principles that took all the fun out of life. This played out for me, in particular, after I gave birth to my first child, and was told as part of my breast-feeding support that I should avoid all spicy foods, because they would upset the baby. Like any good Cambridge, Mass., mother, I turned this into an argument about multiculturalism (What about the mothers in Sichuan?), but what I really thought was that it harked back to some old ideas about spices heating up the blood, and generally making life too interesting for the nursing mother.

title: Bracing for Further Side Effects of an Increasingly Toxic Mix
description: In the past week, the Republican presidential primary has gone from the sober to the surreal. There is now a little over a week before a pivotal contest in Wisconsin, and the candidates will be focusing more and more attention on the state governed by Scott Walker, one of their former rivals.

title: Schools Are Slow to Learn That Sleep Deprivation Hits Teenagers Hardest
description: As a pediatrician, I find that there are few topics that parents want to discuss more than sleep. Parents worry about their own sleep deprivation when babies arrive. Later, they worry about their childrens. I almost never encounter patients who are convinced that theyre getting the recommended amount of sleep.

title: Why Your Perfume No Longer Reeks
description: Q. Why do we become desensitized to a perfume we are wearing while others can still smell it?

title: Dell to Sell Perot Systems to NTT Data of Japan for About $3.1 Billion
description: TOKYO  Dell has agreed to sell its Perot Systems subsidiary, which provides information technology services to hospitals and governments, to the Japanese technology company NTT Data for almost $3.1 billion, NTT Data said in a regulatory filing on Monday.

title: Q. and A.: Duncan Clark on Alibaba: The House Jack Ma Built
description: Duncan Clark is known in Beijing as a savvy commentator on Chinas rapidly morphing tech world. A British citizen who first came to China in 1994, he learned the language and stayed for two decades. His background as an investment banker specializing in telecommunications at Morgan Stanley in London and Hong Kong helped him understand in the mid-1990s that the China market was about to take off.

title: Israel Changes Tack After Standoff With Brazil Over Dani Dayan
description: JERUSALEM  After a monthslong diplomatic standoff with Brazil over plans to install a former settler leader as its ambassador there, Israel pulled back on Monday  reassigning him to a post in the United States after the government in Braslia refused to approve his appointment.

title: Kale-Romaine Caesar Salad
description: Kale gives this tangy Caesar salad staying power.

title: For a Better Caesar, Get Kale Into the Mix
description: The Caesar, done right, is a multiplatform salad. Beyond the taste of the thing  which is spectacular  it is experienced across all the senses, a riot of contrasts, cold and crunch.

title: Keen Pain in Pakistan Over Lives Shattered Into Pieces
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  Riaz Masih and Nasreen Riasat had been married for four years, with their first child on the way in just a month, when they decided a slow walk in the park would be just the thing to enjoy a pleasant Sunday evening in Lahore.

title: 1916: French Shatter German Attack
description: PARIS  Though the Germans have not entirely given up the struggle in the Verdun theatre, their attacks have lost the bite which they once had. The Crown Prince yesterday flung his troops against the French Haucourt-Malancourt lines west of the Meuse, but the French communiqu states that the successive waves of the assault were repulsed at every point. If the Crown Prince is seeking to bolster up the German peoples illusion that there is yet hope for the success of his Verdun offensive, he must attempt something much bigger and more serious than yesterdays half-hearted attack. The New York Herald, European Edition, March 29, 1916

title: Dealers Report Strong Sales at Art Basel Hong Kong
description: Read in Chinese |

title: Republican Rivals Talk Tough, but Even Presidents Have Limits
description: Senator Ted Cruz, a candidate for the Republican presidential nomination, has proposed surveilling Muslim neighborhoods. His chief rival, Donald J. Trump, says he would deport millions of undocumented immigrants and allow the use of torture. The campaign has also produced calls for carpet bombing in Syria and steps to rein in the press at home.

title: A Strategic Prize
description: The Syrian Army said on Sunday that it had captured Palmyra, routing Islamic State fighters who had occupied the city with its ancient ruins.

title: Comments by Donald Trump Draw Fears of an Arms Race in Asia
description: HONG KONG  Donald J. Trumps suggestion that Japan and South Korea should take more responsibility for their defense, including possibly developing their own nuclear weapons, has provoked worries in Asia about the potential for a regional arms race.

title: For Ivanka Trump, Its a Boy  Donalds Eighth Grandchild
description: Donald J. Trump now has a Ted in his life  a Ted he actually likes.

title: Trade Deficits: These Times are Different
description: Neil Irwin has a good think piece on Trumpism and the trade deficit; but as Dean Baker rightly suggests, it arguably suffers a bit from being a discussion of the effects of trade deficits in normal times. And these times arent normal.

title: Making the Technology of the Future Work Today
description: I stood alone in an empty room beside a ferocious dinosaur, writes Brian X. Chen. He isnt happy about it. Yet.

title: Oculus Rift Review: A Clunky Portal to a Promising Virtual Reality
description: A dream of science fiction, which is how Facebooks Mark Zuckerberg describes virtual reality, is about to come true.

title: Starwood Bidding War Escalates With Higher Offer
description: After a Chinese-led group raised its bid for Starwood Hotels to $14 billion, the hotel chains other suitor must now decide whether it will prolong the bidding war.

title: Chinese Writer in Germany Says 3 Siblings Are Detained Over Xi Letter
description: BEIJING  A liberal Chinese writer living in Germany has said security officers in China detained three members of his family in connection with a mysterious online letter that denounced the iron-fisted rule of President Xi Jinping.

title: Happily Ever After, Locked and Loaded: N.R.A. Fairy Tales
description: Standing your ground just got much easier for Hansel and Gretel. The National Rifle Associations rewritten version of the childrens fairy tale has the two young innocents packing rifles as they come upon the witchs gingerbread house. (The tale doesnt say whether the rifles are rapid-fire Bushmasters with 30-shot banana clips of ammunition, as at the real-life Sandy Hook school massacre where 20 children were murdered.) Gretel stood at the ready with her firearm just in case, for she was a better shot than her brother, reports the reworked account, which ends happily with no gun play.

title: Mlanie Defize, Brussels Victim, Was a Music Lover With a Candid Smile
description: Mlanie Defize lived for music.

title: Georgia Governor Rejects Bill Shielding Critics of Gay Marriage
description: ATLANTA  In a striking defeat to religious conservatives, Gov. Nathan Deal of Georgia said Monday that he would veto a bill intended to protect critics of same-sex marriage.

title: Review: Rihanna on Tour, Part Preacher, Part Dominatrix, All Human
description: There wasnt much to look at in terms of set design during Rihannas Sunday-night concert at Barclays Center in Brooklyn. Oversized plastic cocoons throbbed with pulsing air on either side of the stage. About two-thirds into the show, a huge shower curtain dropped from the ceiling; for a while, it displayed multicolored psychedelic swirls, and shortly after, foam came tumbling down it from the top, as if Rihanna had let the worlds largest washing machine overflow.

title: How Often Terror Attacks Strike Pakistan
description: The suicide bombing in Lahore, Pakistan, on Sunday is only one of dozens of attacks that have killed hundreds of civilians in Pakistan in recent years, with the Taliban or its splinter groups claiming responsibility for many.

title: 1966: Soviet Congress Bars Critic
description: MOSCOW  Alexander T. Tvardovsky, the most important spokesman for liberal Soviet artists and writers, apparently has lost his influence in the inner circles of the Communist party, according to indications on the eve of the opening of the 23d congress.

title: A Monogram as Skillfully Made as the Suitcase It Adorns
description: To create the first carry-on in their new luggage line, Away Travel, Jen Rubio and Steph Korey remember going through 20 different wheel designs before choosing the almost-silent Japanese Hinomoto 360-degree spinners. And the suitcases other features (among them: a built-in battery for iPhone charging, waterproof zippers, a removable laundry bag and an embedded TSA-approved lock) are as carefully considered. For the next month, three NYC-based illustrators  Scott Biersack, Alaina Sullivan and Jen Mussari  are on hand to customize the design with hand-painted initials. Monogramming to me, as a kid, was L.L. Bean, says Mussari, whose lettering typically takes cues from sign-painting and 50s automotive racing. She and the other artists made fonts specifically for the project. The style represents both my interests and the brands connection to speed.

title: Scientists Find a Way to Predict U.S. Heat Waves Weeks in Advance
description: Deadly summer heat waves in the eastern United States may be predictable nearly two months before they occur, giving emergency planners and farmers more time to prepare, scientists reported on Monday.

title: Jill Abramson, Former New York Times Editor, to Write Guardian Column
description: Jill Abramson, the former executive editor of The New York Times, will formally join The Guardian as a political columnist, the newspaper said Monday.

title: 13 Great Recipes for Right Now
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Violence Surges in Chicago Even as Policing Debate Rages On
description: CHICAGO  Late at night this month, the pastors phone beeped with a text message from an anguished parishioner. Andre Taylor, the church members great-nephew, had been shot and killed.

title: Sprawling Mural Pays Homage to Cairos Garbage Collectors
description: CAIRO  The intricate mural took shape over the past few weeks, little noticed at first, spreading across a harried quarter of Cairo where Egypts garbage collectors live, amid overflowing bundles of this overcrowded citys trash.

title: As Valeant Struggles, Its Tally Sheet of Scandals Grows
description: The old saying when it rains, it pours would seem to apply to Valeant Pharmaceuticals International as it deals with a torrent of government investigations and private lawsuits.

title: Yana Gilbuena Goes Around the World on a Sharp Blade
description: Yana Gilbuena is dreaming of banana leaves in Antarctica, heaped with a feast of chicken feet, pork intestines and crab-fat rice.

title: Martin Gardners Favorite Funny Quickies
description: Happy April Fools Week! Lets celebratethis ancient traditionwith a sampling of favorite foolish puzzles by the late recreational mathematician Martin Gardner. The series was originally featured in Issue 28 (April 1983) of the The Four Star Puzzler and is used with generous permission of the publisher. (Check out Games World of Puzzles at their website here.)

title: Alex Lee, Former Chef at Daniel, Joins Starr Restaurants
description: When Alex Lee resigned his pressure-cooker position as executive chef at Daniel in 2003 to become the executive chef at Glen Oaks country club in Old Westbury, N.Y., he may as well have gone to Mars. A high-profile star seemed to have left the picture.

title: Sherpa: They Die, We Go Home
description: The morning of the avalanche was quiet. It was still unseasonably cold at base camp but the stiff winds had loosened, and for the first time in a week I felt healthy. I knocked the frost off of my sleeping bag and headed to the mess tent for a cup of instant coffee. It was April 18, 2014. Our team was scheduled to set off from base camp at first light for an acclimatization climb through the Khumbu Icefall, but we were still recovering from a dhal bhat-induced gastrointestinal disaster of the variety that makes you miss your mom. We decided to stay put another day.

title: Tough Re-election for G.O.P. Moderate Is Getting Tougher
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  When Senator Kelly Ayotte is in Washington, she plows through the halls of the Capitol, her face pinched into an expression somewhere between suspicion and agitation, a human tuning fork of intensity.

title: A Literary House Keeps the Village Spirit Alive
description: Light radiated from the large, leaded front window of 58 West 10th Street on Thursday night, as it does most Thursdays and Fridays. Books and journals spanned the windowsill, and a soft yellow garland of stained glass framed the back of a mans head. Up the stoop and inside, under another rope of vines sculpted into the ceiling, the voice of Major Jackson filled the parlor as he read poems from his collection Roll Deep.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Nuclear Power

title: A Final Four Cheat Sheet
description: What got Oklahoma, Villanova, Syracuse and North Carolina to the Final Four in Houston? Reporters who spent the past week with them pull back the curtain to show what makes them tick.

title: Overlooked Tool to Fight Climate Change: A Tweak in Fuel Standards
description: One of the best new opportunities to reduce greenhouse gas emissions might be to tweak a bureaucratic regulation weve had around for close to four decades.

title: Fraud Charges for Financial Executive
description: The S.E.C. said that Andrew Caspersen, a partner at Park Hill, solicited $95 million to invest in a shell company.

title: Suit Challenges North Carolina Law Overturning Anti-Discrimination Measures
description: Gay rights advocates in North Carolina filed a federal lawsuit on Monday, challenging a new state law that overturns local protections for gay and transgender people, and bars transgender people from using public bathrooms that do not match the sexes stated on their birth certificates.

title: How Would an All Out War Stop Such Atrocities? Readers on the Brussels Attacks
description: As officials in Europe and North America considered responses to the attacks in Brussels, most readers said they were skeptical that military action would make the West more secure.

title: Sandals for the Modern Man, Straight From the Runway
description: This spring, strap on a pair of the seasons Teva-like footwear.

title: Wall Street Scion Is Accused of Faking Investments
description: A 39-year-old Wall Street executive, Andrew Caspersen came from a life of privilege and opportunity: Groton, Princeton and then Harvard Law School, where the student center is named after his family because of a generous gift from his father.

title: In 2 Minutes, Bangladesh Rejects 28-Year-Old Challenge to Islams Role
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  It took Bangladeshs High Court less than two minutes on Monday to dismiss a petition aiming to remove the designation of Islam as the countrys state religion, a challenge that had wended its way through the court system for 28 years.

title: Learning to Take Responsibility When Things Go Wrong
description: Its that time again, everybody. The one weve all been waiting for.

title: A Singer-Songwriter Changes His Name  and His Perspective
description: The Danish singer-songwriter Soren Juul isnt afraid to mix things up. After scoring a solo hit in 2013 with the album Somewhere Else, recorded under the pseudonym Indians, Juul returns this summer with his first album under his own name, This Moment, out June 17. With a moniker, its kind of like youre protecting yourself, says Juul, whose spare yet evocative songs have garnered comparisons to Bon Iver and M83. I dont really need the safety net anymore.

title: Let Them Make Noise: A Dining Club Invites Toddlers
description: There are many things to love about my toddler daughters (ages 20 months and almost 4 years), but dining out together is not one of them. My husband and I take them to the local diner or Mexican restaurant every Saturday night because I need a break from cooking, and the girls have to learn how to dine out.

title: Using Apps to Ease the Headache of Navigating Airports
description: For Brett Fox, just getting around an airport could be difficult enough. From check-in to security lines to finding a meal that he actually wants, it added stress to the journey.

title: U.S. Anti-Gang Sweep Yields Over 1,100 Arrests
description: Federal authorities have arrested more than 1,100 people since February as part of an enforcement campaign against gangs that traffic guns, drugs and people across United States borders, officials said.

title: In the Major Leagues, Female Scouts Are Few. Their Skills Arent.
description: When the Seattle Mariners hired 22-year-old Amanda Hopkins in December, it was widely reported that she was the first full-time female scout employed by a Major League Baseball team since the 1950s  which seems to be true.

title: Lauriane Visart, 27, Belgian Lawyer, Dies in Brussels Attacks
description: Lauriane Visart was intent on using her law degree for the public good.

title: At 84, an Artist Tries Something New: Displaying His Work
description: NEW ORLEANS  One of the benefits when people think that you are dead is that you do not have to attend social occasions. This is how Arthur Kern sees it, though he has been so detached from local art circles for so long that he was unaware that some of his former colleagues had assumed the worst.

title: Wisconsin Radio Hosts Combative Interview Surprises Donald Trump
description: Charlie Sykes, a popular radio host in Milwaukee, welcomed Donald J. Trump to his state in a phone interview on his program on Monday, explaining that here in Wisconsin we value things like civility, decency and actual conservative principles.

title: Chicago Teenager in Video Against Gun Violence Is Shot and Wounded
description: A 13-year-old Chicago boy who appeared in an award-winning public service video about the effect of gun violence on the citys black youth was shot in the back and critically wounded, officials said Monday.

title: Barbara Cook: Then and Now Is Postponed Off Broadway
description: Barbara Cook: Then and Now, the Broadway stars one-woman show that was scheduled to begin performances on April 12, has been postponed.

title: Gilding the Croissant With Nutella, or Olives and Rosemary
description: Dont call Franois Brunet, Daniel Bouluds baker, a purist when it comes to croissants. His flaky, buttery standard-bearer, which has long been sold plain or with almonds, now comes filled and iced with Nutella (ramping up the classic pain au chocolat) and in a savory Provenal version, with black olives and rosemary, perfect alongside some good yogurt or goat cheese for breakfast or lunch. Theres also a raspberry-chocolate version: Croissants, $3.25 to $4.25 at picerie Boulud, 1900 Broadway (64th Street) and Plaza Food Hall, 1 West 59th Street, epicerieboulud.com.

title: A Challenge to Soccers Version of Solitary Confinement
description: TIRANA, Albania  Sebino Plaku, a player for the Polish professional soccer team Slask Wroclaw, sat across a small desk from the clubs president and vice president.

title: Visiting the World of Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen: On The Rows Instagram
description: Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen have been famous since before they could talk. In the three decades since, theyve never identified as any one thing, choosing instead to market themselves as two golden girls who might, under the right circumstances, show up at your slumber party.

title: Sean Combs to Open Charter School in Harlem
description: Sean Combs, the hip-hop mogul known as Diddy, steered the creation of the Capital Prep Harlem school, scheduled to open in fall 2016, he said on Monday.

title: Drilling Is Making Oklahoma as Quake Prone as California
description: Californians have lived with the risk of a damaging earthquake for centuries. Now Oklahomans, and some Kansans, face the same threat, federal seismologists said on Monday.

title: Raghavendran Ganesan, Father Saving to Return to India, Dies in Brussels Attack
description: A photograph of Raghavendran Ganesan, 30, on Facebook shows the software engineer at his wedding in 2014, embracing his bride, his neck adorned with garlands as flower petals filled the air surrounding the couple.

title: Police at U.S. Capitol Shoot Man With Gun at Screening Point
description: WASHINGTON  The police on Monday shot a man who pointed a gun at them in a screening area just outside the United States Capitol, briefly unnerving the city a week after the bombings in Brussels.

title: Saudis Announce Prisoner Swap With Houthis in Yemen Conflict
description: Saudi Arabia announced a large prisoner swap on Monday with its Houthi rebel adversaries in the Yemen war  109 Yemenis for nine Saudis  in what appeared to be meant as a signal that the two sides would honor a cease-fire planned for April 10.

title: Pandoras Worrisome Sign: Return of the Founder as C.E.O.
description: Pandora sent a bad signal Monday when it said Brian McAndrews, its chief executive, had been replaced by Tim Westergren, its co-founder, in a worrisome sign amid news that the streaming-music service might be for sale. Technology companies that turn back to their creators later in life also have a mixed track record.

title: Using a Hardware Keyboard With an Android Device
description: Q. How do you make an external keyboard work with an Android tablet?

title: Selling More Cars in China
description: Automakers have been expanding manufacturing in China as the market there has been booming. Although car sales are projected to rise again this year, the Chinese economy has been slowing down, which could extend to a slowdown in the car market.

title: Automakers Expanding in China May Soon Face Weakening Demand
description: SHANGHAI  The new $1.3 billion Cadillac factory on the outskirts of Shanghai is a shrine to modern manufacturing, the kind of facility that automakers all over the world dream of building but can seldom afford.

title: Study of Theranos Medical Tests Finds Irregular Results
description: Finger blood tests from Theranos, the medical start-up, produced more irregular results than conventional tests offered by the nations two largest clinical laboratories, researchers reported Monday in the first published independent assessment of the companys tests.

title: After Fatal Bombing in Pakistan Park
description: Residents and government officials weighed in on a suicide bombing in the Gulshan-e-Iqbal Park in Lahore, Pakistan, on Easter that killed 69 people.

title: Vietnams Battle With Tuberculosis
description: HANOI, VIETNAM  Dr. Bui Xuan Hiep, the head of tuberculosis control in this citys Hoang Mai district, paged proudly through a large handwritten patient log.

title: The Story Behind Petra Collinss Most Beloved (and Strange-Looking) Possession
description: In this series for T, the writer and author of Worn Stories, Emily Spivack, interviews creative types about their most prized possessions.

title: Dinosaurs Among Us Retraces an Evolutionary Path
description: At a preview of the new American Museum of Natural History exhibition Dinosaurs Among Us, scientists gave a tip of the hat to Thomas Henry Huxley, the man who proposed in the 1860s that dinosaurs never really vanished from Earth. Most did go extinct, but their evolutionary legacy lives all around us. They are birds, all 18,000 species of them.

title: Broadway Enjoys a Spring Fling at the Box Office
description: Spring has arrived on Broadway, financially as well as seasonally.

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Puerto Ricos Debt Crisis
description: To the Editor:

title: Former Head of Honduran Federation Pleads Guilty in FIFA Case
description: Rafael Callejas, a former president of Honduras who was accused of taking bribes in his role as president of that countrys soccer federation, pleaded guilty on Monday in the United States world-soccer corruption case.

title: Valeants Accounting Error a Warning Sign of Bigger Problems
description: Valeant Pharmaceuticals Internationals accounting confession may have sounded like a rounding error.

title: Zika Study Could Help Overcome an Obstacle to Vaccine Research
description: The first new mouse model in which the Zika virus can be tested was described in a medical journal on Monday.

title: Affymetrix to Stick With Thermo Fishers Takeover Proposal
description: SAN FRANCISCO  What briefly appeared to be a potential bidding war for Affymetrix, a genetics analysis technology maker, fizzled out on Monday after the company chose to stick with a takeover bid from Thermo Fisher Scientific over a higher bid from a Chinese-backed suitor.

title: Intrigue Surrounds Absence of Mets Matt Harvey
description: JUPITER, Fla.  The Mets had everyone on their major league roster take the 40-mile trip here on Monday for the teams final Florida road game of spring training. It was a tradition, designed to be a bonding experience with opening day less than a week away.

title: Review: Pioneers!#goforth, Presented From the Ceiling
description: Outside, the daffodils have blossomed, and new leaves are unfurling from the trees. But inside the performance space Jack in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, blizzard conditions prevail. During William Burkes sometimes interesting and sometimes exasperating Pioneers!#goforth, swirling snowflakes coat the hair, bags and sweaters of the assembled crowd.

title: Serena Williams and Andy Murray Fall at Miami Open
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  Not even the hometown favorite and three-time defending champion, Serena Williams, or the mens No. 2 player, Andy Murray, is immune to the spate of bad luck that has befallen players at this years Miami Open.

title: Review: Four Days of Luigi Nono in Utopian Listening
description: MEDFORD, Mass.  Even in contemporary music circles, Luigi Nono remains a peripheral presence. Rectifying that was the aim of Utopian Listening, a fruitful conference held from Wednesday to Saturday at the Granoff Music Center at Tufts University here, with cosponsorship from Harvard.

title: CNN Hires David Gregory as Political Analyst as 2016 Campaign Heats Up
description: David Gregory, who endured a long and difficult exit from his perch as the host of NBCs Meet the Press, is returning to a regular role on television as a political analyst on CNN, the network announced on Monday.

title: Review: Solos Features Four Women in Works Reflecting the Arab World
description: The very news of a program of four female soloists in various ways linked to, or deriving from, Egypt, Syria and Tunisia was tantalizing. How many here know much about the dance of those countries? How many here have experienced the creativity of the women there?

title: 1954 | In Harms Way on Capitol Hill
description: Times Insider shares historic insights from The New York Times. In this piece, David W. Dunlap, a metro reporter, looks back at The Timess coverage of  and involvement in  a shooting on Capitol Hill in 1954.

title: Caucuses, the Media and America First
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: Lab Girl, Hope Jahrens Road Map to the Secret Life of Plants
description: Vladimir Nabokov once observed that a writer should have the precision of a poet and the imagination of a scientist. The geobiologist Hope Jahren possesses both in spades. Her engrossing new memoir, Lab Girl, is at once a thrilling account of her discovery of her vocation and a gifted teachers road map to the secret lives of plants  a book that, at its best, does for botany what Oliver Sackss essays did for neurology, what Stephen Jay Goulds writings did for paleontology.

title: An Appraisal: Taking Big Bites of Jim Harrisons Voracious Life
description: You didnt read the fiction of Jim Harrison, who died on Saturday at 78, for plot. You read it for its appetites. Mr. Harrison was our poet laureate of lumbering desire. His books declared: If you arent taking big bites out of whatever life is on offer to you, you are doing it wrong.

title: LCD Soundsystem, Split Up in 2011, Joins the Reunion Circuit
description: With all the right fanfare, the celebrated dance-rock act LCD Soundsystem called it quits in 2011. There was the momentous farewell announcement; a run of sold-out shows, including a three-hour-plus spectacle at Madison Square Garden; and a documentary, Shut Up and Play the Hits, chronicling the heartache with which the frontman, James Murphy, decided to step away from the stage, seemingly forever.

title: For Syracuse, Four Victories but Little Vindication
description: Tenth-seeded Syracuses rise from a team that many thought did not merit a spot in the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament to a surprise Final Four participant  the result of its 68-62 upset of top-seeded Virginia on Sunday night  deserves every ounce of marvel being thrown its way.

title: U.S. Says It Has Unlocked iPhone Without Apple
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The Justice Department said on Monday that it had found a way to unlock an iPhone without help from Apple, allowing the agency to withdraw its legal effort to compel the tech company to assist in a mass-shooting investigation.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Supreme Court Skeptical on a Speedy Trial Argument
description: WASHINGTON  Brandon T. Betterman pleaded guilty to jumping bail in the spring of 2012. He spent the next 14 months in a Montana jail waiting to hear what his punishment would be.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing: Lahore, Donald Trump, Oculus Rift
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Plants Remember You if You Mess With Them Enough
description: Plants are reviving after a long winter, helped along by warming temperatures and increased light.

title: Fidel Castro Criticizes Barack Obamas Efforts to Change Cuba
description: MEXICO CITY  Fidel Castro, the former president of Cuba, offered a critical response on Monday to President Obamas recent visit to his country, declaring that despite the warming relations between the two Cold War enemies, we do not need the empire to give us anything.

title: Donald Trump Hires Paul Manafort to Lead Delegate Effort
description: Donald J. Trump, girding for a long battle over presidential delegates and a potential floor fight at the Cleveland convention, has enlisted the veteran Republican strategist Paul J. Manafort to lead his delegate-corralling efforts, according to people briefed on Mr. Trumps plans.

title: Filing to Drop Case Against Apple
description: The Justice Department said that it had found a way to unlock an iPhone without help from Apple, allowing the agency to withdraw its legal effort to compel the company to assist in a mass-shooting investigation.

title: Peter Stanford, Steward of New Yorks Maritime History, Dies at 89
description: Peter Stanford, who turned a boyhood obsession with boats into a commitment to preserve the South Street Seaport and commemorate New York Citys maritime history with a museum and a parade of tall ships celebrating the nations bicentennial, died on Thursday in Croton-on-Hudson, N.Y. He was 89.

title: Arizona Election Official Apologizes for Long Wait at Polls
description: PHOENIX  A protester was led off in handcuffs from the visitors gallery of the Arizona Legislature on Monday amid a fractious debate over Primary Day last week, when a drastic cutback in polling locations left tens of thousands of Arizonans unable to vote, forced to cast provisional ballots or made to wait in long lines for hours in the high heat.

title: ESPN Steps Back From Authenticity of 1966 Texas Western Broadcast
description: ESPN backed away on Monday from its definitive claim that the version of the 1966 N.C.A.A. mens basketball championship game it is showing Wednesday night is the actual television broadcast of Texas Westerns historic 72-65 victory over Kentucky.

title: Lula, Ex-President of Brazil, Lashes Out at Judge Overseeing Corruption Inquiry
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Brazils former president Luiz Incio Lula da Silva on Monday accused the judge overseeing the investigation into the countrys colossal graft scandal of trying to ruin him by releasing intercepts of his telephone conversations.

title: Pandora Replaces Chief, Aiming to Reinvent Itself Midstream
description: Pandora Media became a powerhouse in online music primarily by doing one thing: tailoring song after song to the tastes of its listeners, along with the occasional ad. For a decade, it worked well, as Pandora came to dominate Internet radio.

title: Central African Republic: More Peacekeepers Accused
description: The United Nations is investigating two new suspected cases of sexual abuse committed by peacekeepers in the Central African Republic, one involving the possible rape of a 14-year-old girl by Burundian soldiers, a spokesman for Secretary General Ban Ki-moon said Monday. The spokesman, Stphane Dujarric, told reporters at a daily briefing that the peacekeeping mission in the country had received the allegations on Friday. The other case, he said, involved a Moroccan peacekeepers relationship with a woman. None of the suspects were identified. The Central African Republic, one of the worlds most dysfunctional countries, has become an epicenter of sexual abuse allegations against United Nations peacekeepers, an issue that has tarnished their image as protectors of the helpless. The latest allegations came to light two weeks after the United Nations Security Council passed a resolution endorsing toughened discipline proposed by Mr. Ban against violators, including repatriation of entire contingents implicated in systematic abuse.

title: Argentina: President Wont Fund Leftist TV Network
description: The pro-business administration of Argentinas president, Mauricio Macri, will cut its funding of a regional television network started by the Venezuelan government in 2005. The country is pulling out of Telesur, a self-styled leftist alternative to mainstream media, because of a lack of pluralism and being shut out of financial decisions, the Communications Ministry in Argentina said. Argentina was a partner prohibited from sharing our view, Hermann Lombardi, the communications minister, said in a radio interview. Telesur was a pet project of Hugo Chvez, the former Venezuelan president, who envisioned a strong socialist voice to counteract what he perceived as unbalanced news coverage from major broadcasters like CNNs Spanish service. In addition to Venezuela, sponsor countries include Bolivia, Cuba, Ecuador and Nicaragua. Relations between Argentina and Venezuela have deteriorated since Mr. Macris center-right government took office in December 2015. His predecessor, Cristina Fernndez de Kirchner, had maintained strong bonds with Mr. Chavez.

title: In Emails, N.H.L. Officials Conceded Concussion Risks of Fights
description: The N.H.L.s top officials have privately acknowledged that fighting could lead to concussions and long-term health problems, including depression, and that so-called enforcers frequently use pills to ease the pain, according to emails unsealed during a continuing court battle with former players.

title: Federal Judge in Puerto Rico Calls Walmart Tax Unlawful
description: A federal judge in San Juan on Monday threw out a new tax that Puerto Rico had tried to impose on the American retailing giant Walmart, calling it unlawful.

title: Scenes From Palmyra Indicate ISIS Slowed Assault on Treasures
description: CAIRO  As photographs and video footage emerged on Monday from the ancient Syrian city of Palmyra, antiquities experts were relieved and horrified at what Islamic State militants had wrought in the months they had controlled the city.

title: Donald Trumps Success Upends Battle for Control of Congress
description: Donald J. Trumps dominance in the Republican primary is upending the campaign for control of Congress, as Republican lawmakers seek to distance themselves from him while Democrats seize on the chance to run against a candidate who has offended huge sections of the American electorate.

title: If You Want to Make a Hamlet, You Have to Break Some Rules
description: At any given moment in New York, Shakespeare is being reimagined somewhere, whether on a big stage or in a black box. Now, for instance, you can sample 11 alternative Hamlets for the price of two.

title: Mr. Trumps Dangerous Babble on Foreign Policy
description: Donald Trump might use nuclear weapons to go after Islamic State terrorists. Or maybe not. In a recent spate of interviews, including with The Times, he was unable or unwilling to clarify his disturbing views on this and other critical national security issues, which sometimes shift from one minute to the next.

title: Another Bombing, This Time in Pakistan
description: Pakistans Taliban has struck again. The group Jamaat-e-Ahrar has claimed responsibility for a suicide bombing on Sunday in a park in Lahore crowded with families, including many Christians enjoying an Easter outing. The bomber set off his explosives near a swing set, killing at least 69 people and injuring more than 300 others.

title: ValueAct Pays a Price for Its Supporting Role at Valeant
description: Bill Ackman gets a lot of ink and a lot of criticism as one of the largest investors behind the crisis-ridden Valeant Pharmaceuticals.

title: A 16-Year-Old Boy Killed, and an East Harlem Neighborhoods Grief
description: Juwan Tavarez was sitting in the kitchen with his family in their East Harlem apartment on Friday afternoon when his mother sent him to the market. She was cooking a Good Friday feast of fish and rice but had run out of sugar for the habichuelas con dulce.

title: $15-an-Hour Minimum Wage in California? Plan Has Some Worried
description: California is on the verge of making itself a guinea pig in a bold economics experiment.

title: John Kasich Enlists Two Operatives to Wrangle Delegates
description: MADISON, Wis.  Gov. John Kasichs only hope for the Republican presidential nomination rests on an extraordinary turn of events at the partys convention. To that end, his campaign has enlisted two experienced political hands to lead its work.

title: Hillary Clinton Attacks G.O.P. for Not Acting on Obamas Supreme Court Pick
description: MADISON, Wis.  Hillary Clinton seized on the struggle over the Supreme Court vacancy on Monday, issuing a scathing indictment of congressional Republicans and blaming their extremist tactics in opposing President Obama for Donald J. Trumps rise as the leading Republican candidate.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Unless something radical takes place, its going to be a blood bath this summer.

title: The Artist Behind the Three-Eyed Fish and Selfie Rat, and Other Hoaxes
description: One afternoon last fall, an actor named Greg Boz got a phone call.

title: Tired of Being Defined by Others, G.O.P. Women Speak for Themselves
description: WASHINGTON  When Representative Cathy McMorris Rodgers took a position in the House Republican leadership after the 2012 elections, she knew she had a lot of work to do. Her party had just lost multiple key constituencies, and she was particularly bothered by the partys poor standing with women.

title: If All Else Fails, 3D Models and Robots Might Rebuild Palmyra
description: Cultural organizations have been working to create precise three-dimensional digital models of the threatened heritage monuments in Palmyra, Syria, in case the originals are damaged beyond repair.

title: Hacker Says He Printed Anti-Semitic and Racist Fliers at Colleges Across U.S.
description: PRINCETON, N.J.  A well-known computer hacker who goes by the name of Weev said he was behind a wave of anti-Semitic, racist fliers that appeared on printers at more than a dozen college campuses last week.

title: Eddie Johnson, New Chicago Police Leader, Has Deep Roots in a City Adrift in Turmoil
description: CHICAGO  Eddie Johnson grew up in Cabrini-Green, perhaps this citys most notorious public housing project. At 9, his family moved to the South Side, where he still lives. And during the last three decades, he has held just about every rank at the Chicago Police Department, from ordinary cop to chief of patrol.

title: Transgender Woman Says She Was Sexually Assaulted at Stonewall Inn
description: New York City police detectives are looking for a man who they say sexually assaulted a transgender woman at the Stonewall Inn, the Greenwich Village bar with a central role in starting the gay rights movement, the authorities said on Monday.

title: James Noble, Absent-Minded Governor on Benson, Dies at 94
description: James Noble, the actor best known for his role as the absent-minded governor on the hit 1980s sitcom Benson, died on Monday in Norwalk, Conn. He was 94.

title: Winning by Merely 21, UConn Makes 9th Straight Final Four
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn.  Late in the first quarter, Breanna Stewarts face was red, her forehead glistening with sweat. So were her arms and shoulders. Long gone was the smile she had carried throughout warm-ups for Connecticuts game against Texas on Monday in the Bridgeport Regional final.

title: At Quinnipiac, Brothers May Add an N.C.A.A. Title to Their Bond
description: ALBANY  When Tim and Connor Clifton, brothers from Matawan, N.J., decided to attend Quinnipiac University to major in mechanical engineering and play hockey together, they took one more bold step.

title: Some Links Holes
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Todays puzzle by Peter A. Collins solved almost like a Schrdingers experiment: Before you solve, even as you solve, youre not quite sure whether this is a puzzle about golf or a puzzle about dogs. It turns out that its a little of both.

title: Review: Stupid _____ Bird Is Chekhov for the 21st Century
description: The expletive smack in the middle of the title of Aaron Posners sort of adaptation of The Seagull is not there for decoration, or even provocation. It is wholly emblematic of Mr. Posners raw, theatrically audacious version of this Chekhov classic, which is being presented in New York in a viscerally well-acted production from the Pearl Theater Company.

title: Review: In Head of Passes, Phylicia Rashad Is a Matriarch With Worries
description: Accomplished actress though she indisputably is, Phylicia Rashad is not someone who comes to mind when you think of Shakespeares King Lear. Ms. Rashad, after all, reigns in the American imagination as one of the ultimate wholesome maternal figures, a source of bottomless reassurance. Lear, even at his least unhinged, is anything but comforting.

title: In Trial of Rikers Officers, Focus Turns to Cover-Up of an Inmates Beating
description: Dwayne Maynard was not one of the five correction officers accused of mercilessly beating Jahmal Lightfoot, an inmate at Rikers Island, to teach him a lesson.

title: Donald Trumps Campaign to Protest Delegate Selection in Louisiana
description: Donald J. Trumps campaign team plans to file a complaint with the Republican National Committee over the way delegates were chosen in Louisiana, where Mr. Trump won the primary but may emerge with fewer delegates than one of his rivals, Senator Ted Cruz of Texas.

title: Home Field Offers U.S. a Crucial Jolt of Optimism
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  For the United States mens national soccer team, this seems like a good time to be back in Columbus. The team has performed well in the hospitable confines of Mapfre Stadium over the years, and it will be desperate for a victory on Tuesday against Guatemala.

title: Better Call Saul Season 2, Episode 7: The Clothes Make the Man
description: There ought to be a word for the opposite of a strip tease. It would be defined as an act that teases, but not because of what is taken off. The tease comes from what is put on.

title: Obama Urges Journalists to Cover the Substance of the Campaign
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama delivered a forceful critique on Monday of politicians and the journalists who cover them, lamenting the circuslike atmosphere of the presidential campaign and declaring, A job well done is about more than just handing someone a microphone.

title: In Apple Debate on Digital Privacy and the iPhone, Questions Still Remain
description: WASHINGTON  A furious legal battle over digital privacy in the age of the iPhone ended on Monday with no clear winner  only lingering questions over what will happen the next time the government tries to force Apple to help break into one of its own phones.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | perimeter
description: perimeter  \p-ri-m-tr\  noun

title: Regaining Focus After the Unthinkable
description: The flyweight boxer Anthony Taylor is now 2-0.

title: What to Watch Tuesday
description: Ed Helms plays an adult Rusty Griswold in Vacation, a sequel to the same-titled 1980s road-trip comedy that starred Chevy Chase as Rustys hapless father, Clark. And on Secrets of the Dead scientists investigate the possibility of an escape from Alcatraz.

description: SPORTS

title: Photographing Wildlife Without a Photographer

description: Question:

title: A Familys Loss, Mexicos Tragedy

title: Editor Says He Is Resigning Over Media Controls in China
description: HONG KONG  An editor at a prominent Chinese newspaper said he was stepping down from his job because he could no longer withstand the pressures of strict control of the countrys media, according to a resignation note posted online.

title: Indonesian Sailors Kidnapped by Pirates in Philippines
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Hijackers are holding 10 Indonesian crew members from a tugboat that they seized in waters off the Philippines, in the latest high-profile case of piracy in the region, officials from both countries said on Tuesday.

title: A Familys Loss, Mexicos Tragedy
description: This week Lens is featuring photographers from around the world who have been chosen to attend the fourth annual New York portfolio review.

description: The day he left Syria with instructions to carry out a terrorist attack in France, Reda Hame, a 29-year-old computer technician from Paris, had been a member of the Islamic State for just over a week.

title: No One Hurt as EgyptAir Flight Is Forced to Cyprus in a Hijacking From the Heart
description: CAIRO  Getting out of Egypt was never going to be easy for Seif Eldin Mustafa, a fugitive Egyptian convict who has been on the run since he escaped from prison five years ago. But on Tuesday, he resorted to extraordinary measures.

title: Bernie Sanders Faces Tougher Terrain After a Big Week
description: Bernie Sanders had a great week. He won big in five Western caucuses: Washington, Alaska, Idaho, Utah and Hawaii. It was enough to whittle Hillary Clintons pledged-delegate lead to around 230, despite her own solid win in Arizona.

title: The Sexual Politics of 2016
description: In the middle of the Civil War a colonel named Robert McAllister from the 11th Regiment of New Jersey tried to improve the moral fiber of his men. A Presbyterian railroad contractor in private life, he lobbied and preached against profanity, drinking, prostitution and gambling. Some of the line officers in the regiment, from less genteel backgrounds, rebelled.

title: The League of Men Voters
description: All campaigns want to know the way to the heart of the crucial female voter.

title: The B.D.S. Movement and Anti-Semitism on Campus
description: THE casual consumer of campus-related news might be forgiven for assuming that anti-Semitic intimidation is breaking out all over. Where I teach, at Brooklyn College of the City University of New York, arguments over a proposed event or demonstration regarding Israel and Palestine appear every few months, and sometimes turn ugly.

title: The Sullen Strategy
description: Gail Collins: Arthur, I dont usually spend time worrying about the mental health of prominent Republicans, but Ive actually found it painful to watch these Ted Cruz endorsements. I (gasp, choke, gag) am going to vote (retch) for  the jerk who isnt Donald Trump.

title: Georgias Governor Sets a Wise Example for Tolerance
description: Despite strong opposition from both Georgias citizens and its large and influential business community, the states lawmakers have tried repeatedly in recent years to write gay discrimination into the books.

title: Keeping My Fossil Fuel in the Ground
description: Castle Valley, Utah  MY husband, Brooke Williams, and I recently bought leasing rights to 1,120 acres of federal public lands near our home in Utah. The lease gives us the right to drill for oil or natural gas. We paid $1,680 for it, plus a $820 processing fee.

title: How Britains Soda Tax Plan Could Spur New Low-Sugar Drinks
description: Public health advocates who push for taxes on soda say any reduction in sugary drinks can help fight obesity, diabetes and tooth decay. Yet most soda taxes treat all sugary drinks as if they have the same amount of sugar.

title: News Qs | Parrots Are a Lot More Than Pretty Bird
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article Parrots Are a Lot More Than Pretty Bird.

title: $2.4 Billion Subway Stop Was Leaking Before It Opened
description: It was New York Citys first new subway station in a quarter century, and officials and riders marked the opening of the Hudson Yards station in September with much fanfare.

title: The Golden State Warriors Superhero, Back When They Needed One
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Once upon a time, Sadiki Fuller made his living by dressing up in a skintight bodysuit. Foam-enhanced muscles formed mountain peaks on his arms, and he wore a blue mask framed by a lightning bolt that swept toward the heavens.

title: With the New York Presidential Primary, the Circus Is Coming Home
description: New York City has long fancied itself the center of the universe. The 2016 election has only stockpiled the evidence.

description: PRIVATE EQUITY EXECUTIVE ACCUSED OF FAKING INVESTMENTS | Federal prosecutors working for Preet Bharara, the United States attorney for Manhattan, have charged Andrew Caspersen, a former Blackstone Group managing principal, with securities and wire fraud in what was labeled a brazen scheme to defraud investors of up to $95 million,

title: Hard Line on Immigration Resonates Less With Young Republicans, Survey Shows
description: Young Republicans are much more likely to have favorable views of immigration and to support a path to citizenship for immigrants in the United States illegally than are older Republican voters, according to a survey  published on Tuesday by the Public Religion Research Institute, a nonpartisan research group. The divide could mean trouble in the general election for either of the two leading Republican candidates, Donald J. Trump and Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, who have called for mass deportation of 11 million undocumented immigrants.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: EgyptAir, Pakistan, iPhone
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Today: The Tourist in You
description: Updated, 12:07 p.m.

title: Reinventing Yourself: Stories From Our Readers
description: In a recent column, Jane E. Brody wrote about several people who had reinvented themselves. Some had changed their lives because they were no longer happy in their chosen careers, while others simply needed a change or were driven by a new-found passion.

title: Republicans to Take Their Latest Fight Inside
description: The three remaining Republican candidates will gather in Wisconsin for a town-hall-style event on CNN tonight, one of the final chances for voters to see them face-to-face before the states primary on April 5.

title: In France, Impressions of Pissarro on a River Journey
description: I found Eldorado with an unlikely 19th-century guide, an Impressionist landscape by Camille Pissarro that is alive with a flowing river of brush strokes and thick knife-points of silver green paint.

title: Travel Rewards Programs You May Not Know About  but Should
description: Practically every major airline and hotel loyalty program has recently changed or is on the road to being upended, be it the new American Airlines award chart, which went into effect on March 22, or a potential merger of the Starwood Preferred Guest and Marriott Rewards programs.

title: Prosecutor in Bear Stearns Case to Leave U.S. Attorneys Office
description: A senior federal prosecutor who led one of the few criminal cases against Wall Street executives in the aftermath of the financial crisis announced on Tuesday that he was stepping down from his role in the government.

title: Whos They?
description: We are witnessing a great explosion in the way that human beings are allowed to express their gender identities. We are also hearing a lot of awkward conversations. What are we supposed to ... call everyone? A recent scene on HBOs Girls riffed on this problem, drawing a linguistic fault line down a Brooklyn street. On one side is a no-frills coffee joint run by Ray Ploshansky, the shows resident grumpy old man. (Hes, like, 38.) Across the street, a hip new cafe springs up and instantly hoovers up Rays clientele.

title: The Fall of Chinas Hedge-Fund King
description: At 10:33 a.m. on Sunday, Nov. 1 of last year, the highway police in Ningbo, an industrial city on Chinas eastern coast, posted a seemingly innocuous message to their official microblog. Due to sudden traffic control, the message read, all the entrances and exits of the G15 Expressway at Hangzhou Bay Bridge have been closed.

title: Nafta May Have Saved Many Autoworkers Jobs
description: When Donald Trump threatened to break the North American Free Trade Agreement, auto industry workers offered up some of the loudest cheers.

title: Weekly News Quiz | March 22-28, 2016
description: Have you been following the news?

title: Colleges Spending Millions to Deal With Sexual Misconduct Complaints
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  In a brightly lit classroom here at Harvard, Mia Karvonides was trying to explain to a group of bemused student leaders the difference between a romantic encounter and unwelcome conduct of a sexual nature, as the universitys relatively new code of sexual misconduct defines it.

title: Beijing Seeks to Tighten Reins on Websites in China
description: HONG KONG  Chinas government said on Monday that it would take steps to more strictly manage websites in the country, its latest push to set boundaries in the wider Internet.

title: Which Authors Did You Have to Grow Into?
description: In Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Liesl Schillinger and Dana Stevens discuss the authors they didnt fully appreciate on first reading.

title: Robo-Adviser Betterment Gets $100 Million in Venture Capital
description: Despite a turbulent market and dwindling investor appetite for stakes in private start-ups, the robo-adviser firm Betterment has received $100 million from venture capital investors, pushing its valuation to $700 million, nearly double its value this time last year.

title: Alaskan Volcano Eases After Eruption
description: A volcanic eruption in Alaska that sent a cloud of ash more than seven miles into the atmosphere and forced the cancellation of more than 40 flights appeared to ease late Monday, officials said.

title: A Brief Millennial Affair
description: Dear Diary:

title: Why Airline Hijackings Became Relatively Rare
description: PARIS  The first airplane hijackings occurred not long after international air travel became commonplace. In those days, most hijackers were seeking refuge or riches, not mass murder or global attention for a radical cause. Terrorist hijackings were a later development, but after reaching a grim apex on Sept. 11, 2001, they have become less and less common.

title: India Lets Pakistani Team Examine Site of January Attack by Militants
description: NEW DELHI  In a rare show of cooperation, the Indian government on Tuesday permitted a team of Pakistani security officials to examine the scene of a militant attack at an air base in India that claimed the lives of six fighters and seven Indian soldiers in January.

title: G.O.P. Gave Voters a Greater Say, and They Said Donald Trump
description: The closer Donald J. Trump draws to winning the Republican presidential nomination over opposition from party leaders, the more his detractors ask: How can this happen?

title: China to Survey Children Left Behind by Migrant Workers
description: BEIJING  The Chinese government plans to conduct the countrys first comprehensive survey of rural children left behind by parents who have migrated to cities in search of work, the China Youth Daily has reported.

title: Yemens President: A Path to Peace
description: Aden, Yemen  One year into the intervention here by the Arab coalition led by Saudi Arabia, and backed by the Yemeni National Army, I can tell my people with confidence that we are working hard to restore peace. The Houthi rebels military position has been weakened, and peace talks will resume next month. A cease-fire is to begin on April 10, leading up to the talks. The Houthis must respect it.

title: 1916: Torpedo To Be Used As Evidence
description: LONDON  Proof that the Sussex was attacked by a German submarine will be offered to the United States by the British Admiralty in the shape of parts of the torpedo which exploded in the bows of the Channel steamer. Enough of the projectile has been found in the Sussex, which has been towed to Boulogne, to refute absolutely the theory that a floating mine did the damage. Beside this tangible evidence the Admiralty asserts that the British destroyer which picked up the survivors from the Channel steamer in the lifeboats at three oclock on the morning after the attack, was twice fired on by the German submarine.  The New York Herald, European Edition, March 30, 1916

title: Children Pay Highest Price as Yemen Falls Apart, U.N. Says
description: GENEVA  A yearlong conflict is threatening to cause a humanitarian catastrophe in Yemen, one of the worlds poorest countries, the United Nations reported on Tuesday, saying that children are paying the highest price.

title: Russia Shows What Happens When Terrorists Families Are Targeted
description: MOSCOW  Donald J. Trump, the leading Republican presidential candidate, was widely condemned when he called for the United States to take out the families of terrorists.

title: Apple iPhone Standoff Ends, for Now
description: The Feds solved one mystery, and may have left the rest of us with several more.

title: Saving Notes and Highlights in iBooks
description: Q. How do I save and print the selections and notes Ive taken in iBooks?

title: Donald Blankenship Prosecutors Urge Jail in Mine Safety Case
description: A federal prosecutor has urged a judge in West Virginia to sentence Donald L. Blankenship, who was chief executive of Massey Energy Company when 29 workers were killed in a mine explosion, to the maximum of a year in jail for conspiring to violate safety standards.

title: Mets Matt Harvey Is Treated for Blood Clot in Bladder
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Matt Harvey walked into the Mets clubhouse on Tuesday morning, his head held high, as if nothing were wrong. The Mets had announced the day prior that he was dealing with an unspecified, nonbaseball-related ailment, and now the only physical sign that something had been amiss was the red hospital band around his wrist.

title: Jane the Virgin Season 2, Episode 16: Petra and Janes Growing Friendship
description: Last week, Jane the Virgin introduced the viewers to a brand new dramatic element: the Curse of Pablo Alonso Segura. Cursed characters are a staple in soap operas (and maybe even doubly so in telenovelas) because they are a fun, simple way to wreak a little havoc on the main cast without worrying about finding down-to-earth explanations for all the strange occurrences. This week, Pablo and Alba quickly rekindle their fiery relationship decades after they last saw each other, but are the flames worth all the bad luck that follows Pablo around?

title: Gov. Scott Walker, a Week Before Wisconsin Votes, Endorses Ted Cruz
description: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin threw his support behind Senator Ted Cruzs presidential campaign on Tuesday, calling him the strongest conservative to represent the Republican Party in the general election and defeat Hillary Clinton if she is the Democratic nominee.

title: Obama Steps Up U.S. Effort to Fight Abuse of Heroin and Painkillers
description: ATLANTA  President Obama, confronting a national epidemic of heroin and prescription drug abuse, met here Tuesday with recovering addicts, doctors and law enforcement officials to underscore his determination to tackle a problem some critics say he left until too late in his administration.

title: A Red Carpet for Amazon in Fall River, Mass., and Hopes for More
description: FALL RIVER, Mass.  For this former mill town, the deal to secure a large Amazon distribution center means much more than the $3.78 million coming from the land sale and the successful culmination of three years worth of negotiations.

title: Victory for Unions as Supreme Court, Scalia Gone, Ties 4-4
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court handed organized labor a major victory on Tuesday, deadlocking 4 to 4 in a case that had threatened to cripple the ability of public-sector unions to collect fees from workers who chose not to join and did not want to pay for the unions collective bargaining activities.

title: 1966: Red Nations Said To Be Equal
description: PARIS  The Soviet Unions leaders today proclaimed a doctrine of equality for Communist nations as the 23d congress of the nations Communist party opened in the Kremlin. Soviet party chief Leonid I. Brezhnev, in a speech running more than four hours, said each country should decide its own course without interference by other Communist countries or parties. The policy was aimed immediately at Communist China but also took note of the situation within the Communist bloc that has been developing steadily ever since Yugoslavia, then Albania and China, and finally Romania drew out from under the long shadow of the Kremlin.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, March 30, 1966

title: Caf Society, New Woody Allen Movie, Will Open Cannes Festival
description: LONDON  Caf Society, a new Woody Allen movie starring Kristen Stewart and Jesse Eisenberg, will open this years Cannes Film Festival on May 11, organizers announced on Tuesday.

title: Lilia
description: Pasta is among the many delights at the chef Missy Robbinss restaurant in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

title: At Lilia in Brooklyn, Missy Robbins Is Cooking Pasta Again
description: My one-sentence review of Lilia for the too-long-didnt-read crowd: Missy Robbins is cooking pasta again.

title: Review: In The Path, a Cult Is Only as Strong as Its Following
description: Before Aaron Paul was Jesse Pinkman, Walter Whites meth-making pupil in Breaking Bad, he was a regular on HBOs Big Love  a drama about a polygamist sect, which explored abuse in the name of religion and the solace of an unorthodox faith.

title: Shaping Health Policy for Millions, and Still Treating Some on the Side
description: WASHINGTON  On weekdays, Dr. Patrick H. Conway is one of the most powerful doctors in America, steering federal health programs that spend nearly $1 trillion a year while shaping health policies that affect tens of millions of citizens.

title: The Chinese Club Is Reborn in Brooklyn
description: The Chinese Club The family history that has inspired this Chinese-Indian restaurant goes back to the days of the Raj. Stacey Mehta Lo, who owns it with her husband, the chef Salil Mehta, was born in Darjeeling, India, where her great-grandfather ran the Chinese Club, a refuge for Chinese expats, as she put it. He served Chinese food, especially the cuisine of his Hakka heritage, a culture concentrated on the southern coast of China. Local Indians who came to the club to gamble also liked the food but wanted more Indian flavors, Ms. Mehta Lo said. Mr. Mehtas menu is long, with dishes like Darjeeling Hakka lo mein, Chinese Club beef short rib with daikon, beer-battered General Tsos chicken and Indian-Chinese vegetable fritters. The couple also owns the Malaysian restaurant Laut, near Union Square: 208 Grand Street (Driggs Avenue), Williamsburg, Brooklyn, 718-487-4576, thechineseclubnyc.com.

title: No Guns Allowed at Republican Convention, Secret Service Says
description: The Secret Service said it would forbid attendees to carry firearms at the Republican National Convention in Cleveland in July, neutralizing a debate that had put pressure on the candidates to take a side on the issue.

title: Starwood Bidder Is a Reclusive Chinese Insurer With Opaque Backing
description: He is often compared in the media to Warren E. Buffett. Like the American billionaire, he is leveraging his control of an insurance company to become one of the biggest names in global finance. Like Mr. Buffett, he looks to be acquiring an immense personal fortune.

title: Is Color Correcting Makeup Your New Best Friend?
description: New color correcting makeup, in highly pigmented shades like canary yellow and pistachio green, seems better suited to an afternoon of decorating Easter eggs than a morning in front of the bathroom mirror.

title: Avicii Retires From Performing Live
description: Avicii, the reigning Swedish prince of electronic dance music, is done for now with the extravagant, vagabond life of an international touring D.J.

title: Yacht Vacations: Not Just for the Rich
description: A vacation on a yacht may conjure up images of billionaires and celebrities, but its not just for the rich and famous. Several companies offer seven-day yacht charters for $10,000 or less; most of the boats have multiple bedrooms and are suited for families and groups. Travelers can either hire a captain or sail the vessel themselves.

title: Obama Faces a Tough Balancing Act Over South China Sea
description: BEIJING  When dozens of world leaders gather for a summit meeting in Washington on Thursday, President Obama will meet privately with only one of them: President Xi Jinping of China.

title: Introducing the Gallery Restaurant
description: Most art museums boast a stylish eatery or two but, until recently, it was rare to find a gallery that offered anything more than wine and cheese. Now, smaller spaces are playing a bigger game. In 2014, Hauser & Wirth opened Roth Bar & Grill in Bruton, England, with an on-site garden and meat-salting room. The gallery groups second restaurant, Manuela, in Los Angeles, debuts this summer. At Gagosian in New York, Kappo Masas omakase draws the power-lunch crowd. And the artist Damien Hirst and the restaurateur Mark Hix have recently opened Pharmacy 2 in London at Hirsts Newport Street Gallery, serving creative spins on traditional British and European fare.

title: Corey Lewandowski, Donald Trumps Campaign Manager, Is Charged With Battery
description: Donald J. Trumps presidential campaign manager, Corey Lewandowski, was charged with battery Tuesday by the police in Jupiter, Fla., who said he had grabbed a reporter this month as she tried to ask Mr. Trump a question.

title: Spin-Splaining, Lindsey Graham Edition
description: Politicians and the consultants who get rich off them devote enormous time and energy to spin: the effort to convince reporters and sometimes the general public that they should believe a fabricated version of events rather than their own eyes and ears.

title: SoundCloud Starts Subscription Plan, Taking On Spotify and Apple
description: Two weeks after signing its final licensing deal with a major record company, the online music service SoundCloud has introduced its long-awaited subscription plan. The new program gives customers access to a much wider range of music than is available on competing services like Spotify and Apple, and it offers artists and their labels the promise of royalties.

title: Staten Island Murder Suspect Is Shot During Capture in Pennsylvania
description: The suspect in a fatal shooting on Staten Island that left a mother and her son dead was critically injured when he was captured on Monday night in Pennsylvania, the police said on Tuesday.

title: Technology to Make Clean Energy From Coal Is Stumbling in Practice
description: OTTAWA  An electrical plant on the Saskatchewan prairie was the great hope for industries that burn coal.

title: Janet Yellen Says Fed Still Plans to Raise Interest Rates but Carefully
description: Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, said on Tuesday that the United States economy remained on track despite a rough start to the year because the drag from weak growth in other countries was being offset by lower borrowing costs.

title: Bank of England to Raise Bank Capital Buffer as Safeguard
description: LONDON  The Bank of England said on Tuesday that it would increase the size of a capital buffer it requires banks to hold to ensure they can provide lending and other essential banking services in times of financial stress.

title: Edison International Starts Energy Consultancy
description: ROSEMEAD, Calif.  Betting that the future of the power industry lies in selling far more than just energy, Edison International, parent to one of the nations largest electric utilities, is starting a business to offer energy consulting and management services to commercial and industrial customers.

title: F.T.C. Sues Volkswagen Over Deceptive Diesel Car Ads
description: For years, Volkswagen ran ads that emphasized how efficient, fun and, above all, clean its diesel cars were. A series of online ads last year featured three sisters debunking old wives tales about diesel, including that it was dirty and that it smelled bad.

title: Donald Trump Is Bringing Message of Jobs and Trade to Paul Ryans Hometown
description: JANESVILLE, Wis.  Donald J. Trump, who has risen to front-runner status in part by channeling anti-establishment rage against Republicans, is kicking off his quest for the support of Wisconsin voters at a rally on Tuesday afternoon in Janesville, House Speaker Paul D. Ryans hometown.

title: Jessica Knoll Reveals the Rape Behind Her Novel, Luckiest Girl Alive
description: By every conventional measure, Jessica Knolls thriller, Luckiest Girl Alive, was a wildly successful literary debut. It sold more than 450,000 copies and spent four months on the best-seller lists. Foreign rights sold in more than 30 countries. The actress Reese Witherspoon optioned the film rights, and Ms. Knoll wrote the screenplay.

title: Police Report Related to Corey Lewandowski
description: According to this report from the Jupiter, Fla., police department, Mr. Lewandowski, Donald J. Trump's campaign manager, was charged with one count of simple battery after the police took statements from a reporter for Breitbart News, Michelle Fields, and a Washington Post reporter, Ben Terris, who said he witnessed the grabbing incident.

title: Sitting Increases the Risk of Dying Early
description: Sitting too much may increase the risk of dying prematurely, while replacing sitting time with just standing or moderate physical activity could counteract the effect.

title: Patty Duke, Child Star and Oscar Winner, Dies at 69
description: Patty Duke, an Oscar-winning actress renowned at midcentury as a child star of stage, film and television, who, amid public struggles with bipolar disorder, went on to cultivate a respected career in adulthood as an actress and mental-health advocate, died on Tuesday at a hospital near her home in Coeur dAlene, Idaho. She was 69.

title: N.H.L. This Week: Clearing Up the Playoff Picture
description: Every Tuesday, The New York Times will look at the week ahead in the N.H.L., highlighting hot  or not so hot  teams and players. (All times Eastern.)

title: Trump Comes to City With  History of Job Losses  and Racial Tension
description: Janesville, Wis., where Donald J. Trumps campaign will be holding a rally, has been the site of political and economic upheaval in recent decades. Here is a bit of background.
