title: Hillary Clinton Focuses on Gun Violence in Courting Wisconsin Blacks
description: MILWAUKEE  With the Wisconsin primary approaching, Hillary Clinton reached out to one of her most loyal constituencies on Tuesday, speaking passionately to African-American parents about the gun violence and clashes with the police that have plagued their communities.

title: Atonement
description: There is an interminable discussion going on about tone.

title: Donald Trump vs. Ted Cruz Creates a Headache for Talk Radio Hosts
description: Even Michael Savage had had enough.

title: Montenegro Expels Foreigners Linked With Japanese Cult
description: The government of Montenegro has expelled 58 foreigners suspected of being associated with Aum Shinrikyo, the Japanese doomsday cult that staged a deadly nerve gas attack on Tokyos subway in 1995.

title: Ibizas Idyllic Off-Season
description: Summer in Ibiza has become synonymous with E.D.M. superclubs and celebrity debauchery. But in springtime, the island proves a haven for travelers seeking holistic relaxation, an oasis of flowering almond trees and red dirt hills evocative of Tuscany. Rustic yet luxurious resorts, or agroturismos, like Atzar offer thermal spas and quiet, understated rooms. Restaurants like La Paloma (above and at right) and the stylish new Aubergine serve local produce in sight of where it was grown. And CoCoq, a new homewares market in an airy former warehouse, facilitates the most soothing kind of shopping.

title: Joe Bradleys Krasdale
description: The artists new paintings go on view this week at Gagosians 980 Madison Ave. gallery.

title: For an Anticipated New Show, a Shape-Shifting Artist Reinvents His Practice  Again
description: Two weeks before his first Gagosian show, the artist Joe Bradley is still in the thick of things. On the walls of his Brooklyn Navy Yard studio, wet canvases face off amid the organized chaos of paint buckets, unstretched linen and a lonesome espresso machine. These ones are mostly finished, Bradley says, motioning to a triptych of large abstract compositions. Others need radical surgery. The eight or so works in progress that ring the room represent six months of development  an ongoing self-editing process that wont stop until the paintings are on their way to the gallery. Just knowing the deadline is looming, some kind of performative thing kicks in, Bradley explains. Otherwise you could play with something indefinitely.

title: #NeverReformConservatism at the Wall Street Journal
description: I see that the Wall Street Journal editorial page has risento the defense ofHouse Speaker Paul Ryans relatively muted response to Trumpism, and what theyve come up with is quite  revealing. In my deliberately tartcritique of Ryan and the rest of the G.O.P. leadership, I suggested that he and other prominent conservatives were taking a first, change nothing; second, do nothing approach to the challenge of Trumpism, and essentially lying still and hoping the danger would pass over. The Journals counter-argument is a straightforward endorsement of exactly that approach: Trumpism too shall pass, the editorial avers, and in the mean time the important thing is to maintain the purity of Journal-approved conservatism, and to refuse any aid and comfort to all those deviationists and splittists who think that the party might not have exactly the right economic agenda for the voters and the times.

title: Review: In Everybody Wants Some!!, Casual Sex and Casual Philosophizing
description: Everybody Wants Some!! is many things  a baseball caper, a sex farce, a campus romance, a campus bromance  but the films real claim to distinction may be that its the least suspenseful ticking-clock movie ever. We start out counting down the days and hours over the last long weekend before the beginning of the fall semester at a Texas college, and at the end of the movie (spoiler alert? are you kidding me?) its time for class.

title: Starwoods Takeover Offer From Anbang Is Risky, but Worth It
description: Call it the $4.64 question. Thats how much more per share the Anbang Insurance Group of China has offered to entice Starwood Hotels and Resorts Worldwide away from a deal with Marriott International. Anbangs new $14 billion bid is about 6 percent sweeter, but it also comes with uncertainties. Heavy interest from rival hoteliers means Starwood can afford the risk and accept.

title: Considering Earthquake Threats in California and Oklahoma
description: Oklahoma and neighboring states have been grappling with an increase in earthquakes tied to the boom in oil and gas production over the past 15 years. Adam Nagourney, the Los Angeles bureau chief for The New York Times, and Michael Wines, who has covered this subject,  discussed Mondays report that because of these man-made quakes, Oklahoma is as much at risk for a damaging quake as California. Here is an excerpt from their conversation:

title: Gwen Stefani Skips Spotify and Still Opens at No. 1
description: For months now, the music industry has been conducting a test. The latest guinea pig is Gwen Stefani, and she has passed with flying colors.

title: Yves Cibuabua, Husband and a Father First, Dies in Brussels Attacks
description: LONDON  Yves Cibuabua, a Congolese business school graduate living in Brussels, was known among family and friends for his gumption and determination: By age 27, he had progressed from doing stints as a cleaner and a supermarket cashier to working in the financial securities department of Banque Eni, part of the Italian energy giant.

title: A Cecil Taylor Retrospective at Whitney Museum
description: Cecil Taylor is the latest jazz great to take over a museum space. The Whitney Museum of American Art will turn over its fifth floor to his work next month for a 10-day retrospective, Open Plan: Cecil Taylor, that will include concerts, listening sessions, archival videos, scores and poetry. Mr. Taylor will kick things off with a mixed music and dance performance with Min Tanaka and Tony Oxley on April 14.

title: The Playgrounds of Pakistan
description: Not far from the house where I grew up in Karachi, Pakistan, there was a childrens amusement park. It sat on top of a hill, its slides and swings beckoning children from the houses below. As summer vacations dragged on, my brother and I would hear the gleeful screams of other children, and we begged my mother to take us. It wasnt an easy sell. The swings are so rickety, she would say one day. Arent you afraid you will fall out of the spinning wheel? she would say on another. We were a little afraid, but we ached to go. That park was the only one we knew, and if it was shabby, its toy horses and pretend cars worn and weary, it still held the promise of exhilaration.

title: Japanese Chefs, French Cuisine: Six Restaurants to Visit in Paris
description: Where to go to find some of the most exquisite and celebrated French food in Paris.

title: Japanese Perfection in Paris
description: A new generation of Japanese chefs now run some of the most acclaimed French restaurants in Paris.

title: Japanese Chefs Make Their Mark in Paris
description: PARIS  The pithiviers de canard at Clown Bar, a historic restaurant in Paris with circus-themed glazed tiles from the 1920s, is an exquisite rendering of a classic dish. Duck breast surrounded by minced duck meat, topped with duck foie gras and baked inside a pastry shell the color of varnished teak, it is a flaky, tender, succulent argument for why we still worship traditional French cuisine.

title: An Indian Spice Mix, Sambhar Masala, for All Seasons
description: ATLANTA  Like a friendly drill sergeant, Raghavan Iyer was not going to pretend that making the spice mix he was about to teach 13 Emory University cafeteria cooks how to prepare was easy.

title: The Sock Queen of Alabama
description: In Alabama, New Life for the Fading Sock Business.

title: Climate Policys Advocates Take Page From Same-Sex Marriage Playbook
description: WASHINGTON  Two months ahead of a federal court hearing on President Obamas signature climate change rule, a coordinated public relations offensive has begun  modeled after the same-sex marriage campaign  to influence the outcome of the case.

title: Exxon Mobil Climate Change Inquiry in New York Gains Allies
description: More government officials are asking what Exxon Mobil knew about climate change.

title: Aline Bastin, Who Loved to See and Photograph the World, Dies in Brussels Attacks
description: LONDON  Aline Bastin loved to travel, but on March 22, she was taking a train simply to go to work.

title: Louis Bacons Charity Says It Was Victim of Executive Accused of Fraud
description: The hedge fund billionaire Louis M. Bacons charitable foundation was a victim of a fraudulent scheme by the 39-year-old Wall Street executive Andrew Caspersen, the foundation said on Tuesday.

title: How Well Do You Know Your Partner? Readers Offer Still More Pre-Marriage Questions
description: Readers respond to '13 Questions to Ask Before Getting Married' with more of their own.

title: Nic Coopman, Unflappable Belgian Working for U.S. Company, Dies in Brussels Attack
description: Nic Coopman, a Belgian who worked for an American manufacturing company, often passed through Brussels Airport to catch flights around Europe. He was on his way to Zurich when he was dropped off outside the departure hall last Tuesday, according to an executive at his company.

title: Damage After Man Climbs and Camps in Seattle Tree? $7,800
description: For more than 24 hours last week, Cody Lee Miller perched in a giant sequoia tree in downtown Seattle, pelting people and cars with pine cones and tearing off branches to throw like spears into the street below.

title: Ukraine Ousts Viktor Shokin, Top Prosecutor, and Political Stability Hangs in the Balance
description: MOSCOW  Bowing to pressure from international donors, the Ukrainian Parliament voted on Tuesday to remove a prosecutor general who had clung to power for months despite visible signs of corruption.

title: The Sock Queen of Alabama
description: FORT PAYNE, Ala.  Nine years ago, when she was 27 and unhappily selling real estate, Gina Locklear went to her parents with a proposition. She wanted to make socks. Not the basic white socks the family had specialized in, but fashionable socks, with organic cotton and dyes.

title: Spin-Splaining, Donald Trump Edition
description: When police charge a presidential front-runners campaign managerwith battery for manhandling a woman, he was not arrested might seem like an insufficient response from the campaign.

title: In Comic-Con v. Comic Con, Proceedings Are Opaque
description: LOS ANGELES  From Hollywoods court docket: Off the record, on the QT, and very hush-hush.

title: Dilma Rousseff Loses Support From Key Part of Brazilian Coalition
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  A crucial part of Brazils governing coalition withdrew support for President Dilma Rousseff on Tuesday, a move that could increase the likelihood of her impeachment and deepen Brazils political and economic crises.

title: Winter Sports Athletes Ask for the Doping Spotlight
description: OSLO  World sport resembles a failed state.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: G.O.P. Senators Intransigence on Court Nominee
description: To the Editor:

title: What Makes a Terrorist Isnt a Mystery
description: To the Editor:

title: Crystal Bridges Museum to Open New Space for Contemporary Art
description: In London, it was a hulking electric power station (now the Tate Modern). In North Adams, Mass., it was an electronics plant (whose buildings now house the Massachusetts Museum of Contemporary Art). In Beacon, N.Y., it was a Nabisco cracker-box factory (now home to Dia:Beacon, the mecca of Minimalist and Conceptual art). And next in the march of postindustrial artification, the Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art in Bentonville, Ark.  home to Walmart  has announced plans to transform a defunct Kraft cheese plant into a raw space for contemporary-art exhibitions, artists projects, music, theater and film.

title: Pakistan Releases Video of Indian Officer, Saying Hes a Spy
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Civilian and military leaders in Pakistan accused India on Tuesday of sponsoring and orchestrating terrorism and separatist movements, presenting what they said was clear evidence: a video confession.

title: Review: In George Lopezs Show, Lopez, He Mostly Plays Himself
description: George Lopezs new comedy, Lopez, fits in a saturated section of overlap in TVs current Venn diagram: Semi-Autobiographical Comedies, Curb Your Enthusiasm Homages and Shows That Overestimate How Interesting Show Business Is. Lopez, which debuts on Wednesday on TV Land, isnt a bad example of these kinds of series, but if you show up this late to the party, you have to do something pretty extraordinary to be the guest of honor.

title: Strange Fruits
description: In a world of very few absolutes, here is one: Nature has no more perfect offering than fruit, nothing that seems better engineered to delight and entice humankinds every sense. But of course, the real purpose of fruit is not to make humans happy, but to make more fruit: While it is the result of a relentless biological process that we happen to enjoy, the creation of fruit itself  from its larval stage (if you will) as a flower to its dropping from the tree or bush onto the ground and growing into a new tree or bush  would go on whether we were there to appreciate it or not.

title: Review: I Dont Belong Anywhere Explores the Life and Work of Chantal Akerman
description: Its challenging to make a movie about a filmmaker who was such a master at telling her own story. In I Dont Belong Anywhere: The Cinema of Chantal Akerman, Marianne Lambert makes a sensitive attempt at portraying Ms. Akerman, a groundbreaking director, and her work, displaying a comfort level perhaps born of working as a production manager for her subject.

title: Anonymous Call for Xi to Quit Rattles Party Leaders in China
description: BEIJING  An anonymous letter calling on President Xi Jinping to resign for the good of China and his own safety seemed to be digital rumor-mongering when it appeared on the Internet this month. It spread by email and lingered on a small domestic Chinese news site before it was removed.

title: Review: Sex and Broadcasting, With the Emphasis on the Latter
description: Hardly as salacious as its name suggests, the documentary Sex and Broadcasting  A Film About WFMU paints an affectionate portrait of this Jersey City radio station  (91.1 FM in the New York City area, and 90.1 in the Hudson Valley), which remains listener-supported at a time when corporate or umbrella funding is the norm. (The first half of the title comes from a book on community radio by Lorenzo W. Milam.)

title: 13 Detroit School Principals Charged in Vendor Kickback Scheme
description: In Detroits crumbling schools, where the threat of insolvency means that basic repairs, supplies and even teachers are in short supply, 13 principals conspired with a vendor to defraud the system, siphoning away millions of dollars, federal agents and prosecutors charged on Tuesday.

title: Review: Poetry by Lucia Perillo and Amit Majmudar
description: Everyone in the world seems to be writing poems, the poet Anne Sexton warned a fledgling versifier in 1965, but only a few climb into the sky.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing: Donald Trump, Bernie Sanders, EgyptAir
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: U.N. Panels Call for Transparency Highlights Limits of Oversight
description: UNITED NATIONS  Five months after a former president of the United Nations General Assembly was accused of accepting bribes to buy items like hand-tailored suits and Rolex watches, a task force appointed by the United Nations secretary general recommended greater transparency in the way money is raised and spent by that office.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Lester C. Thurow, Economist Who Seized the Spotlight, Is Dead at 77
description: Lester C. Thurow, a prominent and provocative economist who earned a dedicated following through his long writing and speaking career, and who was known for his prescient warnings about the growing income gap between rich and poor Americans, died on Friday in Westport, Mass. He was 77.

title: Supreme Court Hints at Way to Avert Tie on Birth Control Mandate
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday issued an unusual order indicating that the justices are trying to avoid a 4-to-4 deadlock in a case pitting religious freedom against access to contraception.

title: From Flank Steak to Saint Laurent
description: A look back at Lady Gagas style evolution.

title: On the Way to a Night at the Opera
description: A camera follows a new staging of Donizettis Roberto Devereux, from early rehearsals through the final curtain on opening night at the Metropolitan Opera.

title: A Night (and Many Days) Backstage at the Metropolitan Opera
description: Behind its facade of white travertine and auditorium of red velvet and gold leaf, the Metropolitan Opera is essentially a factory  one that is never busier than when it is building and staging a new production, like Donizettis Roberto Devereux, which opened last week.

title: Explaining Valeant: The Main Theories
description: Whether experiencing schadenfreude or finding insight, many think they know what is responsible for the turmoil at Valeant Pharmaceuticals International as it falls from a darling of Wall Street to its punching bag.

title: Rangers Apprentice to Be Adapted as Film, Financed by Chinese Firm
description: LOS ANGELES  A former chairman of Walt Disney Studios, Dick Cook, said on Tuesday that his long-planned solo entertainment company would adapt the best-selling Rangers Apprentice childrens book series as its first film after a deal with a Chinese company for at least $500 million in financing.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $6.2 million

title: The Best Sellers: Filed Under Sports
description: The best-selling sports books in February 2016, according to the New York Times best-seller list.

title: Omarosa Manigault Says Donald Trump Might Have to Tell Corey Lewandowski, Youre Fired
description: It was odd enough to see Omarosa Manigault, the reality television star known for her villainous turn on The Apprentice, dissecting the presidential race with Wolf Blitzer during a live interview on CNN on Tuesday.

title: A Clean, Simple Backpack  and Store  From a Cult Hat Label
description: I keep using the word intentional, but everything is very intentional, says the Los Angeles-based designer Janessa Leon, who launched her eponymous line of hats in the fall of 2012. Last season, she expanded her range to include bags  a traditional messenger and a cross-body that doubles as a clutch  and, now shes added a backpack. I wanted to ensure that it doesnt seem like an afterthought, that Im doing handbags, she says. I wanted everyone to know I spent a lot of time on them.

title: Simmering for Decades, Anger About Trade Boils Over in 16 Election
description: WASHINGTON  The United States is in the midst of one of the longest economic expansions in its history. Even American factories have lately added hundreds of thousands of jobs.

title: ISIS Fighters Laid Mines Around Palmyras Ancient Ruins Before Retreating, Syrians Say
description: The Syrian forces that recaptured the storied city of Palmyra from Islamic State occupiers this past weekend have encountered dozens of mines that the expelled militants laid as booby traps around treasured ancient ruins sites, Syrias state media reported Tuesday.

title: Bronx Babys Death in August Ruled a Homicide, Officials Say
description: The death of a 4-month-old Bronx boy from a head injury over the summer is being investigated as a homicide after a ruling by the New York City medical examiner, the authorities said.

title: Vince Boryla, an N.B.A. Jack of All Trades, Dies at 89
description: Vince Boryla, who buoyed two National Basketball Association franchises three decades apart  the Knicks as a player and coach in the 1950s and the Denver Nuggets as the general manager in the 1980s  died on Sunday at his home in Englewood, Colo. He was 89.

title: Latest Plan to Rescue Puerto Rico Is Met With Disdain on Island
description: House Republicans released a draft of a rescue plan for Puerto Rico on Tuesday that they hoped could quickly garner bipartisan support and win over skeptics on the island, on Wall Street and in Congress.

title: Lew Defends Sanctions, but Cautions on Overuse
description: WASHINGTON  With an eye to President Obamas legacy and his own, Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lew on Wednesday will hail the success of economic sanctions against Iran and other global offenders, but warn that their overuse could threaten the primacy of the United States and the dollar in the world economy.

title: Emergency Over Ebola Has Ended, W.H.O. Says
description: The Ebola epidemic that killed thousands of people in West Africa is no longer an international public health emergency, the World Health Organization announced on Tuesday.

title: That Spontaneous Buzzer-Beater Was Probably a Season in the Making
description: PHILADELPHIA  The crowd was standing, the clock was nearing all zeros, the light atop the basket was about to turn red, and one revolution after another, the 3-point attempt from Bronson Koenig of Wisconsin arced toward victory or overtime.

title: Masahiro Tanaka and C. C. Sabathia Soothe Yankees Doubts
description: CLEARWATER, Fla.  As if six weeks of spring training had not been enough to define who belongs where in the Yankees pitching hierarchy, a bit of drama was manufactured on Tuesday.

title: The Archdiocese of New York Raises Funds by Auctioning a Popemobile
description: The used hatchback up for auction comes with low mileage, a premium sound system and a glass roof. But because it once carried Pope Francis around New York City, bidders are willing to pay several times its Kelley Blue Book value.

title: Apples New Challenge: Learning How the U.S. Cracked Its iPhone
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Now that the United States government has cracked open an iPhone that belonged to a gunman in the San Bernardino, Calif., mass shooting without Apples help, the tech company is under pressure to find and fix the flaw.

title: Major Companies Press North Carolina on Law Curbing Protections From Bias
description: DURHAM, N.C.  The onslaught of criticism, economic sanctions and a lawsuit being leveled at Gov. Pat McCrory of North Carolina grew on Tuesday, as the largest corporation in his state joined the fight against a new law that eliminated anti-discrimination protections for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people.

title: FIFA Official Plans to Fight Conspiracy Charges
description: In the many hours of audio recordings that United States prosecutors have on defendants in their world-soccer corruption case, Juan ngel Napout, a FIFA executive arrested in December, speaks precious few words.

title: Republican Senator Meets With Garland, and Urges Colleagues to Follow
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Mark S. Kirk of Illinois on Tuesday became the first Republican to meet with Judge Merrick B. Garland and said he hoped the meeting would influence other Republicans to at least sit down with President Obamas choice to fill a Supreme Court vacancy despite pressure from party leaders not to consider his nomination.

title: Unions Win, but the Court Is Still Hobbled
description: In January, the Supreme Court heard arguments in a major labor case whose outcome could affect the lives of millions of Americans. On Tuesday, six weeks after the death of Justice Antonin Scalia, the courts eight members announced that they were deadlocked in a 4-to-4 vote.

title: How to Live (Well) in New York City on Less Than Zero
description: Perhaps you will be pleased to know that the number of New York City households reporting incomes of more than $1 million has climbed by 47 percent, from 14,795 in 2009 to 21,764 in 2013.

title: Spotify Expected to Sign $1 Billion Financing Deal
description: Spotify is about to close on a $1 billion deal that would double the amount of financing the music-streaming company has raised since its founding a decade ago, people briefed on the matter said Tuesday.

title: As Nuclear Security Summit Begins, Materials Remain Vulnerable to Theft
description: WASHINGTON  As President Obama gathers world leaders in Washington this week for his last Nuclear Security Summit, tons of materials that terrorists could use to make small nuclear devices or dirty bombs remain deeply vulnerable to theft. Still, Mr. Obamas six-year effort to rid the world of loose nuclear material has succeeded in pulling bomb-grade fuel out of countries from Ukraine to Chile, and has firmly put nuclear security on the global agenda.

title: Hillary Clinton Accuses Donald Trumps Campaign of Inciting Violent Behavior
description: Hillary Clinton carefully waded into the controversy engulfing Donald J. Trumps presidential campaign, telling reporters on Tuesday that an episode in which Mr. Trumps campaign manager, Corey Lewandowski, grabbed a reporter was part of a broader campaign that had been inciting violent behavior and aggressive behavior.

title: Medicaid Joins Minimum Wage as Complication in Budget Talks
description: ALBANY  Of this, everyone in the State Capitol seems certain: New York will eventually have a budget. The question is when.

title: United States Rolls in World Cup Qualifier
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  Peace of mind arrived early Tuesday night, with the sight of Clint Dempsey galloping at a full sprint across the striped grass at Mapfre Stadium, his arms spread out like airplane wings.

title: Video: Remembering Patty Duke
description: Patty Duke, who died on Tuesday at 69, overcame a painful childhood to become one of the best-known young actors in the world. After appearing in commercials and a few television shows as a child, she found fame on Broadway, starring with Anne Bancroft in William Gibsons The Miracle Worker. The play, about Helen Keller and her teacher, Anne Sullivan, ran from 1959 to 1961. Ms. Duke reprised the role in the 1962 film version of The Miracle Worker, which Bosley Crowther praised in The Times for retaining the plays absolutely tremendous and unforgettable display of physically powerful acting. Ms. Duke won an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for the performance  at 16, she was then the youngest actor to win that award.

title: New York City Housing Authority Faulted for Significant Flaws in Elevator Safety
description: The death of an 84-year-old man in December in an elevator at a Bronx housing project exposed significant flaws in how public housing officials complied with safety laws and responded to urgent complaints about elevator breakdowns from residents across the city, the Department of Investigation has found.

title: Environmentalists Concern
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Midweek is when you start to see the trickier themes and clue/entry pairings, for those of you who havent been solving that long. There are two schools of thought on this. You can either be intimidated and run away, or you can face your cruciverbal demons and benefit from the extra value these puzzles provide.

title: Living on the Lower East Side
description: The neighborhood, which started as a mix of impoverished immigrants, is becoming less gritty with new residential construction underway.

title: John Kasich Criticizes Donald Trumps Knowledge of Foreign Policy
description: WAUKESHA, Wis.  Gov. John Kasich ridiculed Donald J. Trumps knowledge of foreign policy on Tuesday, offering unusually acidic words in the wake of last weeks terrorist attacks in Brussels.

title: Female Artists Are (Finally) Getting Their Turn
description: At the peak of her career in 1976, Georgia OKeeffe refused to lend her work to a pivotal exhibition in Los Angeles, Women Artists: 1550 to 1950. It was one of a wave of all-female shows  some 150  that decade to spotlight artists largely ignored by major museums and galleries. But OKeeffe, the most famous female artist of her day, saw herself in a different category  one of the best painters, period.

title: Bratton Has Strong Concerns About Arrest of a Mailman in Brooklyn
description: New York Citys police commissioner expressed strong concerns on Tuesday about the arrest of an African-American mail carrier who was at work in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn when he was taken into custody amid an altercation with four police officers.

title: Donald Trump Starts Wisconsin Bid in Ryans Hometown
description: JANESVILLE, Wis.  Donald J. Trump, who has risen to front-runner status by giving voice to anti-establishment rage against the Republican Party, kicked off his quest for the support of Wisconsin voters at a rally on Tuesday afternoon in Janesville, the hometown of Speaker Paul D. Ryan  the button-down, clean-cut steward of the party.

title: Tribunal Releases Journalist Held 5 Days in a Prison for War Criminals
description: PARIS  The United Nations war crimes tribunal for Yugoslavia released a French journalist from its prison in The Hague on Tuesday amid a growing clamor for her freedom by Western news media and human rights activists from the Balkans.

title: The People v. O.J. Simpson Episode 9: The Mark Fuhrman Tapes
description: This is possibly my favorite episode of the season. All of the legal cartwheels, questionable courtroom politics and racial tension seem to have been building in a crescendo of angry outbursts, sadness and emotional violence.

title: Johanna Atlegrim, Swedish Illustrator, Dies in Brussels Attacks
description: Johanna Atlegrims illustrations were full of color, bold lines and playful figures.

title: Fabienne Vansteenkiste, Brussels Airport Worker, Died After Staying Late
description: BRUSSELS  Fabienne Vansteenkiste knew Brussels Airport well. She had worked there for many years, once as a receptionist for an aviation company, and more recently at the check-in counter for Aviapartner, a Belgian shipping service.

title: Donald Trump, Revoking a Vow, Says He Wont Support Another G.O.P. Nominee
description: Donald J. Trump said on Tuesday night that he no longer vowed to support the Republican nominee if it isnt him, despite a loyalty pledge that all Republican primary candidates signed last year.

title: David Baker, Who Helped Bring Jazz Studies Into the Academy, Dies at 84
description: David Baker, a performer, composer and educator who helped bring jazz studies into the academy at a time when the ivory tower considered the field infra dig, died on Saturday at his home in Bloomington, Ind. He was 84.

title: Harriet Mills, Scholar Held in Brainwashing Prison in China, Dies at 95
description: Harriet Mills, a Fulbright scholar from New York who was imprisoned as an American spy in Communist China for more than four years and was widely believed to have been a victim of brainwashing, died on March 5 in Mitchelville, Md. She was 95.

title: More Funding for Pacific Standard Time Art Exhibitions for 2017
description: LOS ANGELES  Known for funding other museums as well as running one, the J. Paul Getty Trust has just awarded $8.45 million in grants to 43 cultural institutions participating in the second edition of Pacific Standard Time, a regionwide set of exhibitions from San Diego to Santa Barbara, scheduled to open in the fall of 2017.

title: Newest Policyholders Under Health Law Are Sicker and Costlier to Insurers
description: WASHINGTON  People newly insured under the Affordable Care Act were sicker, used more medical care and had higher medical costs than those who already had coverage, the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association said Tuesday in a new study of its policyholders.

title: Report Finds Sharp Increase in Veterans Denied V.A. Benefits
description: Joshua Bunn was a rifleman in one of the bloodiest valleys in Afghanistan, where his infantry unit killed hundreds of enemy fighters and lost more comrades than any other battalion in the Marine Corps in 2008.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | junket
description: junket  \jN-kt\  noun and verb

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Its like trying to play the same level on Super Mario Brothers over and over again and just restoring from your saved game every time you kill Mario.

title: What to Watch Wednesday
description: A couple in a cult grapple with belief in The Path, a new Hulu series that comes with a Scientology disclaimer. Sam Shepards Buried Child, starring a splendid Ed Harris, is streamed live. And the sports-radio partners Mike and the Mad Dog reunite after eight years.

title: Corrections: March 30, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: China Air Quality Study Has Good News and Bad News
description: BEIJING  Youre moving to China with your family, and youre excited but also concerned: What might the countrys notorious smog do to your and your childrens lungs?

title: China Charges Tibetan Education Advocate With Inciting Separatism
description: BEIJING  A detained Tibetan entrepreneur who advocates bilingual education in schools across Tibetan regions of China has been charged with inciting separatism, according to an official police document.

title: Photographing Ikea, Some Assembly Required
description: This week Lens is featuring photographers from around the world who have been chosen to attend the fourth annual New York portfolio review.

title: Taking On Citizens United
description: SOMETHING is very wrong with the way we fund our elections. This has become especially clear since Citizens United, the 2010 Supreme Court decision that struck down campaign spending limits on corporations, ruling they were intrusions on free speech.

title: When the Necessary Is Impossible
description: Sulaimaniya, Iraq  Being back in Iraq after two years absence has helped me to put my finger on the central question bedeviling U.S. foreign policy in the Middle East today: What do you do when the necessary is impossible, but the impossible is impossible to ignore  and your key allies are also impossible?

title: College Admissions Shocker!
description: PALO ALTO, California  Cementing its standing as the most selective institution of higher education in the country, Stanford University announced this week that it had once again received a record-setting number of applications and that its acceptance rate  which had dropped to a previously uncharted low of 5 percent last year  plummeted all the way to its inevitable conclusion of 0 percent.

title: The Day Horror Invaded the Park
description: Lahore, Pakistan  A POLICE officer standing guard in front of Gulshan-e-Iqbal Park on Tuesday morning glared when I asked him to recount Sundays events. Ushering me into the park, he said to see for myself.

title: Labeling the Danger in Soda
description: How many teaspoons of sugar do you think are in a 16-ounce bottle of Coke?

title: Dont Let Albany Ethics Reform Slip Away
description: The more things change in Albany, the more they stay insane. Corruption remains the great, crippling defect of New York State government, tainting all that it does and fails to do.

title: America Needs Frank Talk on ISIS
description: With the military campaign against the Islamic State making some progress, American officials have begun to sharpen plans to expel the terrorist organization from two major cities it still controls.

title: Who Are the Angriest Republicans?
description: Conservatives who once derided upscale liberals as latte-sipping losers now burst with contempt for the lower-income followers of Donald J. Trump.

title: Should Hackers Help the F.B.I.?
News Qs | An Ancient and Proven Way to Improve Memorization
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article An Ancient and Proven Way to Improve Memorization; Go Ahead and Try It.

title: The Lower East Side, Where Gritty Meets Trendy
description: When Ian Fuller, 37, a managing director of WestFuller Advisors, a wealth management firm, first saw the 20-story midcentury Seward Park Cooperative on Grand Street, on the Lower East Side, the complex reminded him of very expensive public housing, he said. Then he and his wife, Ellen Wang, 43, a scientist at Pfizer, realized it was one of the better deals in the city.

title: Lady Gaga Defines a New Role: Fashion Enabler
description: What is going on with Lady Gaga?

title: Harlem Church Where Malcolm X Was Eulogized Faces Its Own Final Days
description: Here  at this final hour, in this quiet place  Harlem has come to bid farewell to one of its brightest hopes  extinguished now, and gone from us forever, the actor Ossie Davis said on Feb. 27, 1965, over the coffin of Malcolm X, a transcendent lightning rod among African-American leaders who had been assassinated by gunmen six days earlier.

title: In the South China Sea, a Near-Continuous State of Alert
description: In the hot azure waters off the Spratly and Paracel Islands, the United States and China are jockeying for dominance, including some 700 American Navy patrols in the past year.

title: Patrolling Disputed Waters, U.S. and China Jockey for Dominance
description: ABOARD THE U.S.S. CHANCELLORSVILLE, in the South China Sea  The Navy cruiser was in disputed waters off the Spratly Islands when the threat warning sounded over the ships intercom: Away the Snoopie team. ... Away the Snoopie team.

title: The Little We Know About the Jihadists in Our Midst
description: LONDON  What leads young European Muslims to blow themselves up on trains and at airports, to shoot down shoppers and concertgoers?

title: Student Question | What Skill Could You Teach in Two Minutes?
description: In  this series of videos, experts share with T Magazine tricks of the trade: how to cook, create, eat, shop, drum and wrap presents like the pros.

title: How New York Gets Its Water
description: Nine and a half million people consume what has been called the champagne of drinking water. We took a look at its journey from source to tap.

title: To Woo Apple, Foxconn Bets $3.5 Billion on Sharp
description: HONG KONG  The Apple iPhone transformed the technology industry by popularizing the smartphone and blazing a path to a mobile future. But to do it, the company needed an important ally: a penny-pinching Taiwan-based factory operator named Foxconn.

title: Metro Group of Germany to Split Into 2 Companies
description: LONDON  The German retailer Metro Group said on Wednesday that it would split into two publicly listed companies, with one focused on consumer electronics and the other on its wholesale and food operations.

title: Swedbank to Replace Chairman After He Lost Investor Support
description: LONDON  Swedbank said on Wednesday that it would reverse course and replace its chairman, Anders Sundstrom, after he lost the support of institutional investors, making him the latest official to leave the bank, which has been grappling with a corporate governance scandal.

title: Dont Let My Baby Do Rodeo, by Boris Fishman
description: DONT LET MY BABY DO RODEOBy Boris Fishman321 pp. Harper/HarperCollins Publishers. $26.99.

title: Kathryn Harrisons True Crimes: A Family Album
description: TRUE CRIMESA Family AlbumBy Kathryn Harrison222 pp. Random House. $28.

title: A Marred Election in the Republic of Congo
description: Opposition politicians are right to call the election on March 20 in the Republic of Congo an electoral holdup. President Denis Sassou-Nguesso, who has ruled the country for 32 of the past 37 years, did everything in his power to ensure he would be elected again, including ordering a cellphone and Internet blackout as voters headed to the polls  apparently an attempt to prevent information from circulating on voter turnout and possible fraud.

title: Hillary Clinton Turns to New York, a Friendly State and a Must-Win
description: Hillary Clinton heads to Harlem on Wednesday.

title: Exercise Makes Our Muscles Work Better With Age
description: To keep our muscles healthy deep into retirement, we may need to start working out more now, according to a new study of world-class octogenarian athletes. The study found substantial differences at a cellular level between the athletes muscles and those of less active people.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: EgyptAir, Corey Lewandowski, Janet Yellen
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Democrats See Split Supreme Court Decision as a New Tool to Fill Vacancy
description: Democrats will continue their push on Wednesday to fill the Supreme Court vacancy after being handed a new cudgel on Tuesday by the court itself.

title: New York Today: A Bigger Apple
description: Updated, 12:01 p.m.

title: Morning Agenda: Foxconn Strikes Deal for Sharp
description: FOXCONN STRIKES DEAL FOR SHARP | Foxconn is grappling with rising labor costs in China and a slowdown in the global smartphone market, but it managed to forestall its weakening relationship with Apple by striking a deal to acquire the screen maker Sharp of Japan for $3.5 billion,Paul Mozur reports in DealBook.

title: What You Get for  $830,000
description: An old gristmill in North Carolina, a modern house in Virginia and a foursquare in Illinois

title: Checking on Bullying at the Doctors Office
description: I let out a huge sigh as I picked up the next chart in clinic. Chief complaint: Behavioral concerns was typed out on the top of a thick packet of papers. My young patient was sitting on the exam table comfortably. His parents sat stoically with furrowed brows in the chairs next to him. They were nervous, rigid, clearly concerned.

title: An Eight-Bedroom Apartment in the Center of Bilbao
description: In the commercial and financial district called Ensanche, the apartment is on the market for $1.62 million.

title: Republican Loyalty Oaths Face Disavowals and Threats
description: The Republican National Committees loyalty pledge died on Tuesday night. It was nearly eight months old.

title: Judge John Hodgman on What to Call Night-Shift Meals
description: Rachel writes: My fianc, Ryan, works night shifts. When he wakes up at 3 p.m. and eats a turkey sandwich, he calls that breakfast; I think its lunch. When he gets home from work at 7 a.m., hell often have a beer with his dinner, which I insist is breakfast. Who is right?

title: Courtney B. Vance Knows What Made Johnnie Cochran Tick
description: You play the defense attorney Johnnie Cochran on the FX series American Crime Story. Youve said that you celebrated the O.J. verdict back in 1995: I cheered for Emmett Till. I cheered for all the strange fruit that had hung on the trees for three centuries. Do you think O.J. deserved to benefit from all of those tragedies? Whether or not he deserved to benefit from it, I dont know. I mean, is any of us deserving of grace?

title: What Do You Owe the Friends You Unwittingly Scammed?
description: Several years ago, a friend of mine encouraged her friends, including me, to buy what turned out to be fraudulent securities. This friend believed the securities were legal, but they were part of a large fraud enterprise resulting in a loss of millions to hundreds of investors. As an agent, she arranged for her friends to buy some $250,000 of these investments. The perpetrators of the fraud are being brought to trial this year, but it appears that about half the money is gone.

title: What Happened When Venture Capitalists Took Over the Golden State Warriors
description: It was still dark one morning early this year when Joe Lacob, the majority owner of the Golden State Warriors, drove his Mercedes station wagon through the Stanford University campus. He parked near the business school, then walked down a sidewalk through a drizzle to meet a group of Silicon Valley executives. The ex-C.E.O. of OpenTable, now a partner at Andreessen Horowitz, was coming. So were a founder of the online-learning start-up Curious and a managing director of Vanguard Ventures. On another morning, they all might have met at a charity event or a TED Talk. But it was a Tuesday, and that meant basketball.

title: Diving With Great White Sharks in Mexico
description: In Isla Guadalupe in Mexico, dives to see great white sharks have more of an eco-tourism focus than operations that may antagonize them.

title: A Too-Perfect Picture
description: You know a Steve McCurry picture when you see one. His portrait of an Afghan girl with vivid green eyes, printed on the cover of National Geographic in June 1985, is one of the iconic images of the 20th century. McCurrys work is stark and direct, with strong colors, a clear emotional appeal and crisp composition. His most recent volume of photographs, India, is a compendium of the pictures he took in that country between 1978 and 2014, and it also gives us the essential McCurry. There are Hindu festivals, men in turbans, women in saris, red-robed monks, long mustaches, large beards, preternaturally soulful children and people in rudimentary canoes against dramatic landscapes.

title: EgyptAir Hijacking Suspect Says He Acted Out of Desperation
description: LARNACA, Cyprus  Seif Eldin Mustafa, the Egyptian man who grabbed the worlds attention by hijacking an EgyptA ir   flight and diverting it to Cyprus, has admitted his crimes to Cypriot investigators but insisted that he acted out of desperation, prosecutors said on Wednesday during his first court appearance.

title: Frenchman Plotting Imminent Attack Is Charged With Terrorism
description: PARIS  A suspected Islamic State operative who was arrested last week had amassed a trove of guns and bomb-making equipment, including the type of explosive used in terrorist attacks in Paris and Brussels, the French authorities announced on Wednesday, reinforcing fears that militants are planning additional assaults on Europe.

title: Brooklyn Fire Engulfs Rowhouses; 11 Injured
description: A large fire that spread through five rowhouses in Brooklyn on Tuesday night left 11 people injured, one of them seriously, the Fire Department said.

title: Photographing Ikea, Some Assembly Required
description: Margeaux Walker re-enacts the performance of consumers as they lose their identities blending into Ikea products.

title: 1916: German Offensive Is Repelled
description: Apparently, the Crown Prince dares not admit the complete failure of his Verdun offensive. On Wednesday night the battle-worn German troops were hurled against the positions they had lost in the Bois dAvocourt. A series of desperate assaults was met by withering fire from the French artillery, machine-guns and rifles. The fighting was particularly furious in front of the rduit dAvocourt, and the French communiqu indicates the awful slaughter that took place by the brief statement that the German dead lay piled in heaps before this fortified work.  The New York Herald, European Edition, March 31, 1916

title: Team of Rival Scientists Comes Together to Fight Zika
description: With the Zika virus spreading largely unchecked in Latin America and the Caribbean by way of a now-notorious insect, some of the nations leading mosquito researchers are striving to assemble a state-of-the-art DNA map that they say will help them fight the disease with the mosquitos own genetic code.

title: President of Myanmar Urges Patience in Move Toward Democracy
description: NAYPYIDAW, Myanmar  Myanmars new president called for patience in the pursuit of full democracy after his inauguration on Wednesday ended more than half a century of rule by the military and its allies.

title: Instagram Is Changing Its Feed, but (Calm Down) Not Yet
description: Deep breaths, everyone.

title: U.N. Urges Countries to Take in 480,000 Syrian Refugees
description: GENEVA  The United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, on Wednesday exhorted countries around the world to step up to their responsibilities and take in half a million Syrian refugees, rebuking political leaders who he said had instead resorted to demonizing asylum seekers.

title: New Broadway-Worthy Songs for Your Head
description: Tired of those recycled show tunes that refuse to leave your head? Searching for a way to exorcise the hold that If I Were a Rich Man and Music of the Night have had on your brain ever since you took your cousins to see Fiddler on the Roof and Phantom of the Opera during spring break, yet still craving that kick of Broadway musical dopamine?

title: Romantic Fantasy on the C Train
description: Dear Diary:

title: Pop-Up Stores Thrive in a World of Failing Retailers
description: During trips to war-torn countries like Afghanistan, Jane Mosbacher Morris discovered, to her alarm, that women had little control over their finances. Some were forbidden to work or even touch money. The antidote, she decided, was starting an online market stocked with artisan works made by survivors of war, genocide, human trafficking and other abuses. The site To the Market would put much-needed money into their hands.

title: Resort and Tour News: Olive Oil in Tuscany; Palm Springs Retreat
description: A TUSCAN TOUR OF WINE AND OLIVE OIL

title: Franois Hollande Cancels Plan to Strip French Citizenship in Terrorism Cases
description: PARIS  President Franois Hollande of France announced on Wednesday that he was withdrawing a proposal to strip French citizenship from dual nationals convicted of terrorism, ending a monthslong debate that convulsed his governing Socialist Party, dominated political discussion after the November terrorist attacks, and led to the resignation of the justice minister.

title: $830,000 Houses in North Carolina, Virginia and Illinois
description: SNOW CAMP, N.C.

title: Irans Supreme Leader Backs Missile Program
description: TEHRAN  Irans supreme leader backed the countrys missile program on Wednesday, criticizing a prominent ayatollah who had suggested that in the future, negotiations were far more important.

title: Bushwick Fire Tears Through a Block of Rowhouses
description: A rapidly spreading fire tore through a half-dozen wooden rowhouses in Bushwick, Brooklyn, on Tuesday night, devastating a block in the rapidly gentrifying neighborhood and leaving dozens of people without a home.

title: House Hunting in ... Spain
description: AN EIGHT-BEDROOM APARTMENT IN THE CENTER OF BILBAO

title: Resurrected on Broadway: An Act of God, This Time with Sean Hayes
description: Cue the Second Coming puns. An Act of God is returning to Broadway.

title: Car-Pooling Helps Uber Go the Extra Mile
description: One day not long ago, an Uber driver picked up a passenger in San Franciscos gritty Tenderloin district. Lets call our passenger Abby, because her real name has been lost to database anonymization, an effort to keep her identity private.

title: The Quiet Research That Led to a Resounding Success in Diabetes Prevention
description: More than 86 million people, including 22 million people 65 or older, have pre-diabetes, which increases their risk of heart disease, strokes or diabetes. As weve watched that number grow, it has somehow felt that despite billions of dollars of research and intervention, theres little we can do.

title: State Street to Buy G.E.s Asset Management Business
description: LONDON  General Electric said on Wednesday that it had agreed to sell its asset management business to the State Street Corporation in a transaction worth up to $485 million.

title: UberPool and the Marvels of Measurement
description: William Hewlett, the Silicon Valley pioneer who was a co-founder of Hewlett-Packard, once said, You cannot manage what you cannot measure. Todays technology entrepreneurs seem out to prove that the better you measure something, the more you can manage is an equally powerful truth.

title: Taking Control of the Windows 10 Control Panel
description: Q. I miss having the Control Panel in an easy-to-reach spot on the new Windows Start Menu. Is there any way to get to it faster in Windows 10 besides running a search for it?

title: Relax, U.S. Soccer Fans. Making the World Cup Shouldnt Be a Problem.
description: American soccer fans breathed a sigh of relief after the mens national team drilled Guatemala, 4-0, on Tuesday night in Columbus, Ohio. A 2-0 loss in Guatemala City on Friday had seemed to put the United States in peril of not qualifying for the 2018 World Cup.

title: U.S. Dance Companies to Tour in Exchange Program
description: The choreographers Larry Keigwin, Stephen Petronio and Reggie Wilson will take their companies on tour to nine countries around the world for the sixth season of DanceMotion USA, a cultural exchange program presented by the State Department and the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: Q. and A.: Ashton Kutcher Talks About His New Netflix Comedy
description: Nearly a decade ago, Ashton Kutcher and Danny Masterson stepped out of that hazy circle of dope smoke as best bros in That 70s Show. Now theyre back together as brothers, stepping into parental tensions and barnyard detritus, on The Ranch, a new Netflix comedy created by Don Reo and Jim Patterson, executive producers on Two and a Half Men.

title: Peter Chernin Aims New Streaming Service at Social Media Users
description: LOS ANGELES  Peter Chernin, who has made a career of beating Hollywood at its own game, is moving deeper into a crowded corner of the entertainment industry: streaming services.

title: New Albums From Azealia Banks and Anoushka Shankar
description: SLAY-Z

title: Is It O.K. if Your Vote Is a Lie? Ask a Canadian
description: After an Upshot article about strategic voting  You Say You Loathe Ted Cruz? You Still Might Want to Vote for Him one reader had a question:

title: Jesse Tyler Ferguson Skewers Food Culture on Broadway
description: Securing a table at Gramercy Tavern, the abidingly debonair restaurant on East 20th Street, can, after 22 years, still feel a matter of tooth and claw. You might imagine that Jesse Tyler Ferguson, a star of ABCs Modern Family and five-time Emmy nominee, need barely lift a pinkie to claim one.

title: Late December
description: If you hang around long enough, youll start losing things. Youth, hair, money, your mind, your spouse, your keys, a parent, a sock, a child. Loss throws life out of balance. It demands a reaction.

title: Late December
description: After 63 years of marriage, a mans devotion to his wife is unbroken by Alzheimers.

title: 1966: France Invites Americans
description: While President Charles de Gaulle is inviting the American military out of France, his tourist officials are inviting Americans in  and, for the first time, right into the very private French home. Under its Welcome and Kindness Campaign, the government will also drop a unique invention, the famous smile checks. These were given to tourists last summer to reward especially pleasant and helpful citizens.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, March 31, 1966

title: What Should The New York Times Sound Like?
description: The New York Times is hiring an Executive Producer to help answer that question.

title: P-Funkers and Others Come Together to Help Bernie Worrell
description: Bernie Worrells 1978 debut solo album, All the Woo in the World, was both a declaration of independence and a pledge of allegiance, building on the same sonically intrepid, unsinkably grooving style he had honed as the influential keyboardist in Parliament-Funkadelic. The albums title has now been repurposed for an all-star benefit concert, presented by the Black Rock Coalition, a nonprofit artists collective, on Monday night, April 4, at Webster Hall. Proceeds will support Mr. Worrell, 71, who has Stage 4 lung cancer. George Clinton and Bootsy Collins, his P-Funk brethren, will be on deck. As will the singer Nona Hendryx, a driving force behind the event; Living Colour, the best-known Black Rock Coalition band; Jerry Harrison of Talking Heads; and the director Jonathan Demme and the actress Meryl Streep, who have both worked with Mr. Worrell on film. The many other performers include the bassist-producer Bill Laswell and the keyboardist Paul Shaffer. Whatever happens, it should be funky. (8 p.m., websterhall.com.)

title: On Catastrophe, a Monster-in-Law and More Chaos
description: When last we saw Sharon Horgan and Rob Delaney in Amazons Catastrophe, their unplanned pregnancy had led them beyond the altar to a honeymoon maelstrom  something about her gnarly toenails  that threatened to end things before theyd barely begun. Then her water broke. What calamities could Season 2 possibly bring?

title: Havana Arrives at the Joyce Theater
description: If tourism boards made dances instead of posters, Club Havana, by the Cuban-American choreographer Pedro Ruiz, would be a winning campaign. When Mr. Ruiz created this cheerful work in 2000 for Ballet Hispanico, his alma mater, few Americans had the opportunity to experience the city firsthand. A dance party with splashes of conga, rumba, mambo and cha-cha, Club Havana is the Technicolor version of Cuba  flouncy skirts in rainbow hues, swiveling hips and sly smiles that beckon audiences to visit, which might be possible soon. And now Club Havana returns to the Joyce for Ballet Hispanicos spring season (Tuesday, April 5, through April 10). Filling out the program are Gustavo Ramrez Sansanos boisterous Flabbergast and Ramn Ollers Bury Me Standing, a meditation on Gypsy life and culture set to traditional Eastern European and Spanish popular music. Saturdays family matinee program offers a sampling of additional repertory from this charismatic company, now marking its 45th anniversary. (joyce.org.)

title: 7 Great Midweek Recipes
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Kino! A Festival of German Films
description: Be careful what you wish for. In The Weather Inside, an ominous film about internal turmoil in an Arabian hot zone, the jaded main character, Dorothea, says, I wish a boy from the circus would suddenly appear and carry me off. But the relationship she falls into eventually morphs from diverting to ominous. Maria Furtwngler, who plays Dorothea, and the films director, Isabelle Stever, are scheduled to be on hand when The Weather Inside opens this years Kino! Festival of German films on Thursday, April 7, at Landmarks Sunshine Cinema in the East Village. The festival runs through April 14 and also features a restored The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari, which will be screened on April 11 with a live soundtrack by the D.J. Raphal Marionneau. Eleven feature films are on the schedule, including three others by female directors: The Spiderwebhouse by Mara Eibl-Eibesfeldt; Hedi Schneider Is Stuck, by Sonja Heiss; and The Fassbinder Story, a documentary by Annekatrin Hendel. For schedule and locations: kinofestivalnyc.com.

title: Pianists Alexandre Tharaud, Kirill Gerstein and Shai Wosner Hit Stage and Crypt
description: Three talented pianists take the stage in coming days. On Monday, April 4, the suave Frenchman Alexandre Tharaud, who recently released a recording of Bachs Goldberg Variations, goes down into the crypt at the Church of the Intercession, an intriguing performance space, to play that masterpiece. (8 p.m., deathofclassical.com.)

title: The Mapping Journey, Bouchra Khalilis Searing Refugee Project
description: In the Moroccan-French artist Bouchra Khalilis powerful video work The Mapping Journey Project, the formal elements are pared to necessities: a paper map of the world; a hand holding a marker, drawing lines on the map across oceans and borders; a voice of a man or a woman telling a first-person story, sometimes harrowing, always arduous, of immigrating illegally from the Middle East or Africa to Europe in search of a better life.

title: To Feed Hungry Minds, Afghans Seed a Ravaged Land With Books
description: PANJWAI, Afghanistan  At first glance, it is not much of a library: two shelves of about 1,600 books and magazines in a basement room deep into a dusty alley of adobe homes in rural Panjwai District, in southern Afghanistan. The mattresses and blankets stacked in the corner still give the vibe of the guest quarters the room once was.

title: Businessman and Dictator Face Off as Congo Lurches Toward Abyss
description: LUBUMBASHI, Democratic Republic of Congo  Sitting in his palatial living room amid lots of marble and white leather, Mose Katumbi gives off an unmistakable air of being content with his place in the world.

title: Hollande Withdraws Constitutional Change
description: President Franois Hollande of France decided not to push changing the country's constitution to add a clause allowing convicted terrorists to be stripped of their French nationality.

title: Reporters Notebook: Rushing to Brussels
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, feature and opinion items come together at The New York Times. In this piece, Dan Bilefsky, a Times reporter based in London, describes his coverage of the recent attacks in Brussels.

title: Foxconns Deal to Buy Sharp Is a Test for Japanese Reform
description: Theres nothing pretty about the details of Foxconns deal to take control of Sharp.

title: Is Europe Safe for Travelers? Yes, Experts Say, but Here Are Some Tips
description: When Corey Patterson heard about the terrorist attacks in Brussels last week, he had a clear-cut response to people who asked if he was going to cancel a coming trip to Belgium.

title: Michael Stipe Previews David Bowie Tribute Shows With Jimmy Fallon Performance
description: Big-name musical tributes to the late David Bowie just keep coming.

title: Donald Trump Continues to Stand by Corey Lewandowskis Side
description: Donald J. Trump continued to defend his campaign manager on Wednesday after the release of a videotape that showed he put a hand on a Breitbart News reporter he had previously denied touching.

title: The A Word Places Autism Front and Center
description: Early in the first episode of The A Word, a six-part BBC series that premiered on March 22, 5-year-old Joe Hughes has a meltdown at his birthday party. As his parents try to get him to blow out the candles on his cake and his classmates awkwardly stare, the pressure gets the best of Joe and he ends up facedown on the carpet, unable to move or interact with those around him.

title: Wim Wenders to Direct an Opera for Berlin Company
description: BERLIN  He has directed more than 30 films in a career spanning four decades, but Wim Wenders, now 70, will soon dip into unfamiliar waters. The Berlin Staatsoper, one of Germanys foremost opera houses, has announced a collaboration with the filmmaker as part of its 2016-17 season.

title: In Tourist-Heavy Maui, Finding Deals and Aha Moments
description: Occasionally you get those aha travel moments  epiphanic flashes when you see or experience something so enchanting that a thought occurs to you: Yep, that alone just made the entire trip worth it. On Maui, the tourist-heavy and second-largest Hawaiian island, I was lucky enough to experience one of those.

title: Expa Labs Will Nurture Tech Start-Ups a Few at a Time
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Throw a rock in any direction in Silicon Valley and it may strike a start-up incubator, one of the now-ubiquitous programs aimed at helping entrepreneurs nurture their ideas into full-fledged businesses with funding and advice.

title: New F.D.A. Guidelines Ease Access to Abortion Pill
description: The Food and Drug Administration has relaxed the guidelines for taking a pill that induces abortion, reviving one of the most contentious issues of the abortion debate. The change allows women to use the drug further into pregnancy and with fewer visits to the doctor.

title: As New York Debates $15 Minimum Wage, a Bronx Company Makes It a Reality
description: Whether or not New York States minimum wage is raised to $15, Steven Alvarado will still see that increase in his paycheck.

title: Minneapolis Officers in Jamar Clark Shooting Will Not Face Charges
description: MINNEAPOLIS  For more than 30 minutes on Wednesday, the prosecutor described in exacting detail the fatal shooting in November of an unarmed black man by the police and his reasons for not charging the two officers involved.

title: Archer Knocks at the Door of The Simpsons and South Park
description: Ponder the paradox: Televisions most acclaimed scripted series are praised for their ever-deepening characters, yet some of its longest-running shows feature characters who, by many measures, evolve barely, if at all. They are animated series, The Simpsons and South Park foremost, and they seem as if they could run forever.

title: MetLife Wins Battle to Remove Too Big to Fail Label
description: WASHINGTON  Opponents of the Dodd-Frank financial overhaul won an important battle on Wednesday as a federal judge here stripped the too big to fail label from the insurance company MetLife.

title: A Move Toward the Mainstream
description: The World Chess Candidates tournament in Moscow this month afforded the sport the opportunity to show a more glamorous side.

title: Masters of Chess, Not Self-Promotion
description: MOSCOW  In the chandeliered ballroom of Pashkov House, an 18th-century mansion on a hill overlooking the Kremlin, a chess grandmaster dressed in a jacket that seemed several sizes too big declined offerings of canaps, vodka and wine.

title: The Upside to Technology? Its Personal
description: As a longtime tech columnist, Ive seen the dark side of technology. Ive written about the privacy minefields of Facebook and other social networks. Ive looked at the hate and bullying that people inflict on Twitter. Ive seen how the front-facing camera on our smartphones can turn us into narcissists.

title: Puff Daddy Hosting Bad Boy Reunion Concert Celebrating the Notorious B.I.G.
description: Puff Daddy is getting the family back together again.

title: Corporations Grow Nervous About Participating in Republican Convention
description: Some of the countrys best-known corporations are nervously grappling with what role they should play at the Republican National Convention, given the likely nomination of Donald J. Trump, whose divisive candidacy has alienated many women, blacks and Hispanics.

title: Microsoft Trumpets Windows 10, and Pushes Into Sci-Fi Tech
description: SEATTLE  Microsoft continues to bank on its Windows operating system. But the software giant is also increasingly staking out new technology areas, including software that can have natural conversations with people.

title: The Secret Subway, by Shana Corey
description: THE SECRET SUBWAYBy Shana CoreyIllustrated by Red Nose Studio32 pp. Schwartz & Wade. $17.99. (Picture book; ages 4 to 8)

title: Vanishing Languages, Reincarnated as Music
description: The Unesco Atlas of the Worlds Languages in Danger is a melancholy document, charting the 3,000 or so languages that experts predict will vanish by the end of this century. For the most part, ethnographers and linguists are helpless in the face of the gradual erasure of collective memory that goes along with this loss of linguistic diversity.

title: Climate Model Predicts West Antarctic Ice Sheet Could Melt Rapidly
description: For half a century, climate scientists have seen the West Antarctic ice sheet, a remnant of the last ice age, as a sword of Damocles hanging over human civilization.

title: Israel Polarized Over Soldier Who Killed Wounded Palestinian
description: JERUSALEM  The case of the Israeli soldier who shot a Palestinian assailant in the head as he lay wounded and subdued on the ground is whipping up a public and political storm and posing a rare challenge to the militarys high command, usually the most popular body in the country.

title: Boyle Heights Gallery Scene in Los Angeles Is Still Growing
description: Downtown Los Angeles and the blocks to its east seem to be in the midst of a takeover by warehouse-size art spaces these days, but that doesnt mean there isnt room for more. Two young artists, Barnett Cohen and Jules Gimbrone, have announced plans to open an artist-directed, nonprofit gallery and artist residency in a 5,000-square-foot warehouse in the Boyle Heights neighborhood.

title: In Settlement, Newark Agrees to a Series of Police Department Reforms
description: NEWARK  Federal officials announced on Wednesday that a sweeping settlement had been reached to reform the Newark Police Department after a three-year investigation uncovered a pattern of unconstitutional practices, including improper searches and stops and excessive use of force.

title: What Does Donald Trump Want?
description: In a 1976 Saturday Night Live skit, Dan Aykroyd and Gilda Radner play a husband and wife who nearly come to blows over whether New Shimmer is a floor wax or a dessert topping. Fortunately, Chevy Chase intervenes. Calm down, you two, he says, New Shimmer is a floor wax and a dessert topping.

title: Tata Steel Plans to Sell British Plants, Threatening 15,000 Jobs
description: LONDON  Prime Minister David Cameron faced a new economic and political challenge on Wednesday after the Indian owner of much of Britains steel industry said it could no longer swallow the large losses being generated by its plants and would try to sell them.

title: Obama Commutes Sentences for 61 Convicted of Drug Crimes
description: WASHINGTON  Ismael Rosa, a salsa singer serving a lifetime prison sentence for drug crimes, had often promised his lawyers that he would sing for them if he ever won his freedom.

title: Pulled From Festival, Anti-Vaccination Film Will Run in Theater
description: A documentary about the widely discredited link between autism and vaccines, which was pulled from the Tribeca Film Festival, will now be released in a New York City theater on Friday, its distributors have said.

title: Facebooks Live Videos Get Lots of Looks but No Money Yet
description: When severe weather passed through the Atlanta area early this month, Brad Nitz, a meteorologist for a local television station, WSB-TV, fed viewers live video updates on the stations website, as he has done for years.

title: Sizing Up Apples New Downsized Devices
description: The iPhone SE and the 9.7-inch iPad Pro were the two headline-grabbing devices that Apple unveiled last week. The gadgets stand out because they go against a recent trend of larger screen sizes; both devices have smaller screens than their immediate predecessors.

title: Lead in Newark Schools
description: To the Editor:

title: Donald Trumps Comments on Foreign Affairs
description: To the Editor:

title: Kenneth Feinberg Named to Lead Terrorism Compensation Fund
description: The Justice Department has appointed Kenneth R. Feinberg, the lawyer who administered compensation for victims of the Sept. 11 attacks, as special master to oversee a new fund to compensate victims of state-sponsored terrorism.

title: Donald Trump Becomes Reflective During a Rocky Period
description: Between bashing Ted Cruz for lying and trashing the Republican Party for treating him unfairly, Donald J. Trump took some time to tone it down while in Wisconsin on Wednesday.

title: Irish Arts Center Says It Has Raised $47 Million for New Performance Space
description: The Irish Arts Center, seeking to build a new performing arts space in Hells Kitchen, says it has now raised $47 million toward the ambitious project.

title: Supreme Court Rules Against Freezing Assets Not Tied to Crimes
description: WASHINGTON  The government may not freeze assets needed to pay criminal defense lawyers if the assets are not linked to a crime, the Supreme Court ruled Wednesday in a 5-to-3 decision that scrambled the usual alliances.

title: 7 Fun Spring Fashion Looks
description: Looks with movement and color to brighten up your spring wardrobe.

title: How the Rest of the Delegate Race Could Unfold
description: An interactive delegate calculator that lets you simulate how the 2016 Republican nomination process could unfold.

title: Whats New in the Beauty Aisle
description: Glytone Enhance Brightening Complex, $70 at dermstore.com, a combination of glycolic and azelaic acids, gently lightens hyperpigmentation by breaking up pigment proteins. Whats nice is that it can be applied all over, unlike the often-prescribed skin-lightener hydroquinone, a spot treatment. That makes this cream ideal for larger areas like the hands and dcolletage (its mild enough for the thin skin there, too). Expect to see results in three months  a lengthy commitment, yes, but in the meantime youll get the radiance-boosting benefits of exfoliation. But dont forget the sunscreen: Glycolic acid increases sun sensitivity.

title: European Court Backs Britain in 2005 Subway Killing by Police
description: LONDON  The European Court of Human Rights ruled on Wednesday that British prosecutors were within their authority not to prosecute police officers who shot to death a Brazilian man in a subway station in 2005 after mistaking him for a suicide bomber. The case is likely to end the long fight by relatives of the man, Jean Charles de Menezes, 27, to have the British police charged with his killing.

title: South Africa to Fight Parole for Killer of Anti-Apartheid Activist
description: The South African government will appeal a judges decision to grant parole to the killer of Chris Hani, a leading anti-apartheid activist who was assassinated in 1993, a spokesman for Justice Minister Michael Masutha announced on Wednesday.

title: Family of South Carolina Teenager Shot by Officer Reaches $2.15 Million Settlement
description: The family of an unarmed teenager who was fatally shot by a police officer last year in Seneca, S.C., has agreed to a $2.15 million settlement to drop their lawsuit against the police, a lawyer for the family said Wednesday.

title: Election 2016: Our Teaching and Learning Homepage
description: Our  Civil Conversation Challenge for Teenagers is now open for submissions. Between now and Nov. 7, we invite teenagers to have productive, respectful conversations on our site about issues that divide us this election season.

title: Hamilton Producers Will Change Job Posting, but Not Commitment to Diverse Casting
description: The hit musical Hamilton has drawn widespread praise for its use of a diverse cast to explore American history. But a casting call seeking nonwhite men and women to audition for the show drew criticism from the union representing theater actors, prompting Hamilton to say Wednesday that it will amend its language to make clear that anyone is welcome to try out for the show.

title: The Watcher Makes Eerie Threats That Complicate a New Jersey Home Sale
description: A stately colonial home recently listed for sale in Westfield, N.J., comes with six bedrooms, wood flooring and a disturbing back story that left its last owners living in fear of a stalker who sent them a series of cryptic, threatening letters.

title: Shopping Guide: How to Choose Your Next Bed
description: A bedding designer offers tips on finding the one thats right for you.

title: Harris Theater in Chicago Names Brian Brooks as Its Choreographer
description: It is not unusual for dance companies to appoint choreographers in residence. But the program announced Wednesday by the Harris Theater for Music and Dance in Chicago is a bit different: The theater named Brian Brooks its first choreographer in residence, and will spend $600,000 over three years to allow him to create works for several different dance companies.

title: F.D.A. Clears Use of New Test to Screen Blood Donations for Zika
description: The Food and Drug Administration announced Wednesday that it would allow the use of an experimental test to screen blood donations for contamination with the Zika virus.

title: Erdogans Attempt to Suppress German Satire Has the Opposite Effect
description: BERLIN  If President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey had hoped that summoning the German ambassador would get a video poking fun at him by a German satire program removed from the Internet, he was wrong.

title: Cravath Law Firm Discloses a Data Attack
description: Federal authorities have warned for years that big law firms are ripe targets for computer hackers because they are information-rich repositories of corporate deals and other sensitive client information.

title: In a Digital Age, the Whiteboard Keeps Its Spot on the Bench
description: Of all the things that could distinguish the four teams remaining in the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament  record, size, talent, experience  one factor may be undervalued: penmanship.

title: Nick Waplingtons A Display of Panic at a Moment of Absolute Certainty
description: The artist, best known as a photographer, is showing a new series of paintings and drawings in Los Angeles.

title: A Legendary Photographer (and McQueen Collaborator) Debuts Paintings
description: The photographer Nick Waplington famously captured Alexander McQueen as he prepared his final winter collection, which became the basis for Working Process, a show held last year at the Tate. But Waplingtons latest exhibition, A Display of Panic in a Moment of Absolute Certainty, opening Saturday at the Los Angeles gallery These Days, contains no snapshots whatsoever  rather, it is comprised solely of paintings and drawings. Much like the McQueen series, which the designer wanted to be dirty and messy, Waplingtons new work reveals a constant concern of his 30-year career: an affinity for barely contained chaos, whether in garbage dumps, the hills above the West Bank city of Ramallah or the maelstrom of fashion shows. None of the paintings in the show, Waplingtons first stateside exhibition sans photography, have a single vantage point, a conscious choice to make it deliberately difficult to perceive order, he explains. My paintings deal with this inner world, whereas my photographic work deals with the world around me, says Waplington, who will appear Thursday in New York at the Rizzoli bookstore alongside Isaac Mizrahi, whose backstage scene he documented every season from 1989 to 1993. I guess the basic difference is with photography the canvas is full and with painting its empty. Both give me problems.

title: NBC to Produce A Few Good Men Live, Written by Aaron Sorkin
description: NBC said on Wednesday that in early 2017 it will broadcast a live version of A Few Good Men, Aaron Sorkins 1989 Broadway play that was later adapted into a popular 1992 film starring Jack Nicholson and Tom Cruise. Mr. Sorkin, who also wrote the films screenplay, before going on to greater renown as a creator of television series like Sports Night and The West Wing, will write the script.

title: Sheer, Gauzy Mens Wear for Spring
description: With see-through silks and translucent tops, fashion embraces a lightness of being.

title: Fighting the Scourge of Opioid Abuse
description: To the Editor:

title: Lipstick Columns in The New Yorker
description: Sample columns

title: Wisconsin Poll Shows Ted Cruz Ahead of Donald Trump
description: A new poll of likely Wisconsin voters on Wednesday puts Donald J. Trump 10 percentage points behind Senator Ted Cruz, suggesting trouble for the Manhattan businessman less than a week before the states primary on Tuesday.

title: Hillary Clinton Starts Big Push to Win New York
