description: Hillary Clinton presented herself as the quintessential hometown candidate on Wednesday afternoon as she kicked off her campaign for New Yorks presidential primary on April 19, a contest that Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont is also determined to win in their battle for the Democratic nomination.

title: An Artist's Tribute to Creatives Who Died From AIDS
description: A first look at some of Doug Meyer's 50 portraits, now on view, plus excerpts from the New York Times obituaries of those represented.

title: Donald Trump, Abortion Foe, Eyes Punishment for Women, Then Recants
description: Donald J. Trump said on Wednesday that women who seek abortions should be subject to some form of punishment if the procedure is banned in the United States, further elevating Republican concerns that his explosive remarks about women could doom the party in the fall.

title: Review: For Pennsylvania Ballet, Transitions Onstage and Off
description: All dance companies are, inevitably, in perpetual transition, but thats unusually pronounced just now at Pennsylvania Ballet, which opened a program of 21st-century choreography on Tuesday night at the Joyce Theater. Since Angel Corella became the companys artistic director in 2014, large numbers of dancers have come and gone. Some of those dancing in New York this week have arrived since Mr. Corella joined the company, while others are in their final season.

title: House Panel Issues Subpoenas in Fetal Tissue Research Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  A special House committee empaneled to investigate fetal tissue research issued subpoenas on Wednesday to eight medical organizations as part of an investigation that has led to charges of intimidation.

title: In an Unfortunate Final Four Matchup, No Lessons Learned
description: Secretly, perhaps even subconsciously, N.C.A.A. officials must have been rooting against a North Carolina-Syracuse matchup in the mens Final Four. Any two teams but those. Any.

title: Review: Terrace Martin, on Velvet Portraits, Shares a Mix of Sounds, and the Spotlight
description: Velvet Portraits

title: Publishing Unpublished Black History
description: Darcy Eveleigh looks back at The Timess Unpublished Black History series  and showcases six additional photos that have never before been published.

title: In the Flower District, Galleries Bloom
description: Slotted between the wholesalers, flower peddlers and midrange hotels, a new crop of galleries have sprung up in New Yorks flower district. Theyre in the area for various reasons, but they share one thing in common  a love for their neighborhood. We decided to move into the flower district and Tin Pan Alley because it has history and personality, like our gallery. Its a part of a New York that exemplifies what this city used to be like, says Galeria Nara Roeslers artistic director, Alexandra Garcia Waldman. Waldman oversees the Brazilian gallerys recently opened outpost on Tin Pan Alley  the stretch of 28th Street between Sixth Avenue and Broadway  but this is not the curators first time in the city; she went to school here and has been back and forth ever since. This April, Waldman promotes the films of Cao Guimares, one of Brazils most prolific artists of the 1980s. As Guimaraess first solo show in New York, the exhibition exemplifies the gap Nara Roesler hopes to fill in the cultural landscape.

title: Clinton and Sanders Hashing Out Whether Next Debate Will Be a New York One
description: The Clinton and Sanders campaigns are in discussions about when to hold a debate in April, but whether it is held before the critical April 19 New York presidential primary remains an open question.

title: Associated Press Denies Cooperating With Nazis
description: A German historian said in new research that The Associated Press, the international news organization based in New York, formally cooperated with Nazi Germany in the 1930s, including the employment of a photographer who worked for a Nazi propaganda division.

title: Newly Released Books, Including Works by Sara Majka and Pat Barker
description: By Sara Majka

title: Spring Hair Care Tips and Tricks From a French Colorist
description: If you take good care of your hair, the color should last six weeks no problem, says the French hair colorist Christophe Robin, whos opening a new salon in Paris soon. He also believes that springtime is when your locks grow  like vegetation, he says, attributing the correlation to the increased hours of daylight. In preparation of the season ahead, Robin shares with T his holistic tips and tricks to detox, soothe and lighten strands.

title: Review: The King and Queen of Malibu, a History of Paradise
description: On the map, its about 25 miles of shoreline sealed off by a chain of mountains. But a map cant convey the wildly divergent terrain of saw-toothed peaks and plunging canyons, of peaceable beaches and fast-encroaching tides, of sun and clear skies and floods and wildfires and mudslides.

title: James McBride on the Godfather of Soul and Getting His Innocence Back
description: The novelist and musician James McBride was recently teaching six eager but distractible children to play keyboards in the basement of a modest church in the Red Hook neighborhood of Brooklyn. With much patience, he got them to recognize and play a B flat. A few minutes later, a student announced that she was about to lose a tooth. The rest of the class goaded her to pull it out, and when she did, Mr. McBride dropped it into a plastic bag for safekeeping.

title: The National Jazz Museum in Harlem Finds a Permanent Home
description: The National Jazz Museum in Harlem has always been, like the music it honors, a study in adaptability. For the last 15 years, it has operated out of a modest fourth-floor space in East Harlem, while developing big plans for a permanent home. Now, after weathering a few disappointments, the museum has relocated to a new storefront on West 129th Street, in a move that signals not only an improvement to its public facilities but also a renewal of its mission.

title: Review: Very British Problems Keeps Calm and Carries On Through Discomfort
description: Very British Problems is a television show based on a Twitter account, which puts it in the noble lineage of  lets see  S#*! My Dad Says. Yup, thats about it.

title: MetLife Decision Could Torpedo Dodd-Frank Risk Protections
description: Ill admit that I am shocked by a federal judges order allowing MetLife to shed its too big to fail designation.

title: Mohawk, a 13-Year-Old Lion, Is Killed by Kenya Wildlife Rangers
description: Wildlife officers in Kenya fatally shot one of the countrys best-known lions on Wednesday after their attempt to capture it alive attracted a crowd, whose presence upset the animal and led it to injure a bystander, the Kenya Wildlife Service said.

title: Review: Frankie Cosmoss Next Thing Captures Teenage Mystery in Bursts
description: Next Thing

title: Stage Revolutions, Four Decades Apart
description: How 1776 and Hamilton make history musical  and musical history.

title: Donald Trumps Incoherent Abortion Stance
description: Of all the Republican candidates this election season, Donald Trump has been the most equivocal about reproductive rights. He says hes staunchly pro-life, but also acknowledges that millions of women are helped by Planned Parenthood  even as he pledges to take away the organizations federal funding.

title: What Does a Modern-Day Superheroine Wear?
description: Inspired by Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice, and a new Wonder Woman, we shopped for gear for everyday wonder women.

title: The 1095 Tax Form for Health Care Coverage: What You Need to Know
description: Millions of Americans who have health coverage through a big employer are receiving a new, unfamiliar tax form in the mail this year, thanks to the Affordable Care Act: the 1095-C.

title: Review: Figaro! (90210), a California Love Triangle
description: A loudmouthed real estate magnate complains of illegal immigrants sneaking into the country and showing no respect for the people who built it, talking endlessly of being a winner.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing: Donald Trump, Hillary Clinton, EgyptAir
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Tracking an Elusive Diary From Hitlers Inner Circle
description: For almost six decades, it was missing, all 400-plus revealing, handwritten pages. The diary of Alfred Rosenberg, a Nazi theorist whose views on race are thought to have helped incite Hitlers persecution of Jews, vanished after its author was convicted of war crimes and hanged at Nuremberg in 1946.

title: Review: Lukas Graham Lands Where Pop Meets R&B
description: Lukas Graham

title: Fintech Start-Up Boom Said to Threaten Bank Jobs
description: Up to 30 percent of the current employees in the banking industry may lose their jobs to new technologies in the next 10 years, according to new projections from Citigroup.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Libyas Unity Government Defies Air Blockade to Reach Tripoli
description: CAIRO  The Libyans who lead a United Nations-backed unity government traveled by sea early Wednesday to Libyas capital, Tripoli, as part of a bold if risky effort to break the countrys two-year political stalemate.

title: General Motors Ignition Switch Is Cleared in Trial Over a Crash
description: General Motors won a second consecutive case in litigation over its defective ignition switches, when a New York jury on Wednesday found that a faulty switch was not responsible for a 2014 accident that injured two people.

title: Play With Fashion This Spring
description: Madcap experiments with color, texture and form are a testament to the high spirits pervading fashion this spring.

title: 7 Spring Fashion Looks That Will Make You Want to Dance
description: In Diane von Furstenbergs spring fashion campaign video, Karlie Kloss wears a wrap dress in a clashing combination of miniature pink and green blossoms as she poses against an equally pattern-mad backdrop of hearts and flowers and cheetah spots. Its a giddy mix for sure, but Ms. Kloss, the model-slash-entrepreneur-slash-New York University student, pulls it off with aplomb.

title: Upstate Prosecutor Is Revisiting 2010 Death of Clinton Prison Inmate
description: The district attorney with jurisdiction over the Clinton Correctional Facility in Dannemora, N.Y., said on Wednesday that his office was reviewing the case of an inmate who died there in 2010 after a violent encounter with prison guards.

title: Apollo Theater and Opera Philadelphia to Continue Partnership
description: Their first collaboration, the New York premiere of the opera Charlie Parkers Yardbird, will not open until Friday, but the Apollo Theater and Opera Philadelphia are already making plans to get the band back together. They announced Wednesday that they would continue to team up to stage contemporary operas over the next few years.

title: The Pathos of Republican Reformers
description: Ross Douthat has a wonderfully written, heartfelt takedown of the WSJ editorial page, which is  surprise!  dead set against any deviation from the tax-cuts-for-the-rich agenda. Definitely worth reading. But my question is, did Republican reformers like Douthat really think there was any chance that their ideas would achieve headway within the party? If so, they were remarkably naive.

title: New Lures of Manhattan Night Life
description: The most buzzed-about clubs and bars are not in Brooklyn.

title: Bill Clinton Recalls How the Irish Were Key to His Success in New York
description: As Hillary Clinton courted African-Americans in Harlem on Wednesday, across Central Park, in the gilded ballroom at the Metropolitan Club, former President Bill Clinton sipped a pint of Guinness and addressed the Irish, another critical constituency as the Democratic contest descends on New York City.

title: Colombias Second-Largest Rebel Group Joins Peace Talks With Government
description: BOGOT, Colombia  The National Liberation Army, Colombias second-largest rebel group, said Wednesday that it would begin negotiations with the government, strengthening hopes that the end of a 50-year rebellion in Colombia could be at hand.

title: With Romance Novels Booming, Beefcake Sells, but It Doesnt Pay
description: SANTA CRUZ, Calif.  Jason Aaron Baca is good-looking, not handsome like the Ryans (Gosling and Reynolds) or rugged like Daniel Craig, who is fetching in a tailored Tom Ford suit. But when Mr. Baca, 42, slipped on a pair of dark aviator glasses recently, he looked remarkably like Tom Cruise in Top Gun.

title: Adrienne Corri, Actress Known for A Clockwork Orange, Dies at 84
description: Adrienne Corri, an actress whose movie career lasted nearly five decades and encompassed a wide range of roles, but who was probably best known as the victim in an infamous rape scene in Stanley Kubricks A Clockwork Orange, died on March 13 at her home in London. She was 84.

title: A Supreme Court Hijacking
description: There was lots of talk about hijacking the other day at the Supreme Court  not in a criminal case, but in the argument on how far the government must go to shield nonprofit religious organizations from the Affordable Care Acts requirement to include birth control in employer health care plans.

title: If Starwood Makes a Deal With Anbang, Can It Be Done?
description: Among the many issues Starwood Hotels & Resorts faces in negotiating a deal with Anbang Insurance Group, the secretive Chinese insurance giant, is a stark one: Any deal Starwood negotiates may not be worth the paper it is printed on.

title: In San Jose, Poor Find Doors to Library Closed
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.  When Damaris Triana, then 8, lost several Little Critter books that she had borrowed for her sister, the library here fined her $101  including $40 in processing fees  a bill that was eventually turned over to an agency to collect from her parents.

title: The Clemency Backlog Continues
description: On Wednesday, President Obama commuted the sentences of 61 people convicted of federal drug and firearm crimes, more than a third of them  serving life in prison.

title: An Austerity Plan That Would Punish the City
description: Negotiations in Albany over the New York State budget are hurtling toward an April 1 deadline with a cliffhanger question unanswered: How much damage will the budget do to New York City?

title: Marching Toward a $15 Minimum Wage
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomo clearly wants New York to be the first state to enact a statewide minimum wage of $15, but if so, he and the State Legislature will have to move fast to beat California, where on Monday state lawmakers and Gov. Jerry Brown reached a deal on a higher minimum. Mr. Cuomo has included a statewide minimum of $15 in his latest budget. But with an April 1 deadline for the budget, he has an uphill fight to sway Republicans who control the State Senate. His challenge now is to get them to go along without giving too much away.

title: Bernie Sanders, Buoyed by Poll, Sprints Through Wisconsin
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont spent Wednesday crisscrossing Wisconsin, hosting events in three cities and arguing that his stances on trade deals, campaign finance and foreign policy make him a stronger candidate than Hillary Clinton.

title: Key Quotes, in Wiradjuri
description: The world does not respect people who have no language. (Pronounced: Moon-im-bin-ah-lah nur-em-bung-gah wi-ray yin-duh-mah-lah wi-ray my-nee-yung-de-ray)
